Reviews.Title: “Nothing special. A solid 4-star property.”
Reviews.Author: OnlyFlyG650
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was fine. Nothing special. Definitely not like the Conrad in New York or London. Rooms are a bit dated, could be renovated or spruced up a bit. Although I booked my room through Hotwire, I expect the service to be the same. A curt-mannered front desk attendant shoved me in an ADA room and when I asked to change, he was no help at all. In short, glad I got a deal and the Hotwire 4.5 star rating is inaccurate - its a solid 4.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad - The best of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCritic
Reviews.Content: i am a seasoned business and pleasure traveler with very high expectations. The Conrad Chicago, year over year, always exceeds my expectations - a rarity in today's world of cut rate service. This is my fourth year staying at the Conrad for my annual business meeting and once again I am thrilled that I chose the Conrad. In fact, even if my meeting were moved to another city, I would still make my annual trek to Chicago just to stay at the Conrad. Service is absolutely outstanding, the hotel is always impeccable, the dining professional and delicious, superb concierge services and high speed internet, a wonderfully spacious fitness facility and an unbeatable location within the Nordtrom mall. In my honest opinion as a frequent traveler, the Conrad Chicago is one of the finest hotel experience I have enjoyed, comparable to any Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience from beginning to end”
Reviews.Author: beth s
Reviews.Content: Overall experience was great - very friendly and helpful staff. Nice rooms and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: HammadTor
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this hotel. It was easy to get to from the airport, but also it is right in the heart of Michigan avenue, and all the shopping and restaurants. Because we have little kids, it was also very helpful that the hotel was attached to a mall... The staff was excellent, from the doorman, to bellman to concierge who helped us throughout our stay. We needed a microwave for our baby's food, and one was brought up right away, we needed a crib and a fridge, and again everyone was very helpful. The room was spotless, and maids did a great job cleaning it up, after the kids made a mess on a daily basis. I love this hotel, and would definitely recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: ltcjoecruz
Reviews.Content: This was a brief, one night stay with my college senior son to take care of a number of things in Chicago. We chose the Conrad because it's location put us close to everywhere we needed to be and also because, being repeat guests, we've been very happy in the past and knew what to expect. Tasteful, spacious rooms, comfortable beds and bedding, attentive service. Kudos - well done - in a city with an overabundance of excellent hotels, the Conrad still impresses.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT GREAT AND GREAT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LouRosario
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 1 night celebrating my fiance's birthday. Everything was PERFECT!!! The location, the size of the room, the staff.... Everything was great! I couldn't have asked for a better stay! The room even had a BOSE surround sound system... P.S. Luis the bartender in the Lobby bar... AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Mike G
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a short business trip from London. When I arrived I found my room was a little noisy at close to street level and asked if I could go higher in the building. They moved me without question and I had a nice room on the sixteenth floor. Then my TV went on the blink. I called the front desk and they sent an engineer up. She tried to fix the problem but to no avail - even after changing my TV for a different one. They got it working in the end but gave me three free breakfast vouchers as compensation. The rooms were immaculate and spotless and the staff were thoroughly professional. The location is great too. All in all this hotel delivered with great efficiency. I would stay here again. It did just what it said on the tin.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Family3998
Reviews.Content: We stayed this past weekend at the Conrad Hilton and couldn't have been happier. We had a standard room. While it wasn't the largest, the size of the bathroom and the cleanliness more than made up for it. The bathroom had a separate soaking tub and shower as well as a private room for the toilet area. The bedroom had a 42" flat screen TV, Bose DVD system, and an empty mini fridge for storing personal food or beverages. The extra glasses and wine glasses were a nice touch. The hotel is connected to the Northbridge Mall, which is the location of Nordstrom. It was nice to leave our coats in the room and do some shopping while the snow flakes were flying outside. I gave sleep quality 4 circles because the bed was way too firm for me, but others may be fine with it. Pillows were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Every Year Is Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: GEA_SR
Reviews.Content: I decided to propose to my girlfriend February 29th, 2008. I started looking for a hotel that would be romantic and close to the heart of the city. Viola! I found the Conrad, when we arrived they had everything that I requested and the room was great. Flat panel TV, Bose surround sound, deep tub and separate shower. The staff was extremely helpful and had answers to all of my questions. I proposed and she said yes, fast forward to 2012. My wife and I have visited the Conrad every February since 2008 and they never disappoint. Reserve and a room and enjoy yourself. PS. We've already made reservations for our 2013 visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Chicago get-away”
Reviews.Author: nyc_aj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a weekend get-away. Despite booking a regular room, I was upgraded to one of the bigger suites (HH Diamond status helped - don't expect it to happen). The room had a nice view of Michigan Avenue from its many large windows. They did an excellent job of stocking the room with water bottles and toiletries (mouthwash, q-tips, even floss). I really liked having a Keurig in the room for coffee and tea. The bathroom was large in this particular suite with both a shower and a soaking tub. At night there was very slight street noise from cars at times, but otherwise it was perfectly silent. No noise at all from the heater. We were woken twice by firetrucks in the morning, but not much the hotel can do about that. It comes with staying right on Michigan Avenue. Breakfast was included for diamond members. It was the best hhonors breakfast I've had yet. The location can't be beat. Right on Michigan Ave, easy walk to Millenium Park, and only a two minute walk to a red line stop. Finding the entrance from Michigan Ave is a little tricky. That part of chicago is multi-level in a way. The entrance is tucked below the higher streets so it isn't the most glamorous entrance. Overall we were thrilled with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty eventually.”
Reviews.Author: mariessima
Reviews.Content: Background: My friend and I scored 2 FREE night's stay to any Hilton hotel when we joined a Twitter contest in San Francisco. I was part of the first 75 people to line up by 430pm on a September 2011 day and got a voucher for a FREE hotel stay! We wanted to go with Waldorf Astoria but it is far away from Downtown Chicago, so we opted for the CONRAD. I've never stayed in a fancy hotel such as this so, our expectations were really high. Before we booked anything, we've been communicating weeks before with management via e-mail. We made sure our vouchers would be honored and that we can upgrade and pay the difference. When we checked in at 6am (we flew red eye), we were just hoping to leave our luggage in the hotel and be given our promised upgrade to an executive suite. This is when we encountered a bit of difficulty with Ron at the front desk. There were 2 men at the check-in counter. The first man said that the upgrade would be honored. Then, Ron stepped in and said that it is NOT available given the type of payment we had and that because it is a busy weekend (we were there over President's Day Weekend), the room is (suddenly?) not available. We reminded him of the e-mail exchange with another manager and he said that he'd have to speak with them since maybe that person was misinformed. We then handed over our vouchers and he starts asking why our names aren't on the vouchers. This is when I started getting internally angry since he was making it very difficult for us despite the previous communications with management. We had to remind him of how promo works and that Hilton gave out these vouchers randomly. I started taking down notes such as what his name was and all the things he was saying. I think this is when Ron realized that he needs to fix things quickly because you do NOT want a BAD review or upset guests. With that said -- Ron made it up to my friends and I BIG TIME. As he should because, we have evidence of e-mail exchages and Twitter re-tweets to score this voucher. As such, we were treated like Royalty eventually. The first night was a Standard Room with 2 beds and a free of chage roll away bed. We were given tons of pillows and 5 free drink tickets which cost around $15 each. The next day, we were finally upgraded to an executive suite like we've been promised for free. The suite had a queen size bed and a bath tub. Both rooms had great views of the other buildings. I love that you can order endless bottled water and can request a Keurig coffee maker. The location was perfect -- within walking distance of the major sites. We didn't even get to ride the Metro since cabs were fairly reasonable when we split it amongst us. All in all, I would recommend this hotel despite the hassle at the beginning. I would however suggest that management be more accurate with giving out information so as not to upset guests. Thanks for everything, Conrad Hotel!! Best FREE hotel stay I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “A Special Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine B
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a special birthday/anniversary weekend here at the Conrad and our experience was exceptional. The staff provided attention to detail with an eye on service and our room was comfortable, roomy and bright. The hotel location is positioned well to take easy advantage of the best Chicago has to offer. Will definately stay again and recommend to anyone looking to enjoy a great downtown experience.

Reviews.Title: “Subtle, sophisticated and sublime”
Reviews.Author: Digimom
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I feel pampered and relaxed every time I stay here. The bathrooms and beds are grand. I live the bathroom amenities and the slippers. The tub is perfect. And the health club is great.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Location”
Reviews.Author: EO33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for one night in Feb. 2012. We arrived well before check in (around noon) and our room was ready for us. It appeared to have been recently renovated, and had tasteful and elegant furnishings. There were extra touches everywhere: robes and slippers to wear, a bose stereo system, turndown service, and even a complimentary "pillow menu" where you could order different kids of aromatherapy pillows, or pillows for special needs such as allergies, etc. The bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was also very nice with separate shower and tub areas, and a separate room for the toilet. Our room was also spotlessly clean, and service was very prompt when we requested our turn down. We had drinks in the hotel bar which were a little pricey (as expected) but delicious. The location could not have been more perfect for our purposes: we had tons of dining and shopping options right on our doorstep. We had taken the train into the city, so we did not use any of the parking options nearby. We booked through an internet site where we didn't know which hotel we would get until after purchasing, so the value for the price we paid was excellent. I definitely hope to be back to the Conrad in the near future! It was great!

Reviews.Title: “So convenient and great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: PeggyB1959
Reviews.Content: We loved being so close to the wonderful Nordstrom on Michigan Avenue. Service was excellent. The room was too warm and would not cool while we were out during the afternoon. We called and two lovely gentlemen came to fix it right away. Wonderful suggestions for dinner from the concierge. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Lobby & restaurant are great - room was OK”
Reviews.Author: mcacadian
Reviews.Content: I stayed here earlier this month and it was my first time. I think I have stayed at most of the Chicago Hiltons now, so I was looking forward to this hotel based on the reviews. This is the newer style hotel of putting a lobby on an upper floor and walking into elevators, which is fine. I really liked their lobby - great for getting work done and fairly quiet. The breakfast was definitely a cut above and the service was fantastic. The front desk experience was just OK and the room just OK as well. I liked the Bose stereo in the room, but the downside of a subwoofer in your room is that it is in the rooms next door as well. The bed was OK and bathroom was very nice. I would definitely pick the Wit or Palmer House over the Conrad but it would also depend on where I had meetings in the city. I was a little disappointed given the reviews, but would probably give it a second chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: michele d
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel over the weekend. We had a wonderful experience. Right upon check-in, we were greetly warmly by staff. It was very quick and prompt. Our room was a city-view and absolutely great. It was very clean and the amenities very nice as well. Our only complaint was how early housekeeping decided to clean our room. (Though I must add, they were extremely helpful and nice) We stepped out of the room for no more than 10 minutes (This was around 9:15 A.M.) and returning upon housekeeping in our room. The next morning, housekeeping was knocking at our door arond 10 A.M; despite the noon check out. Aside from this, we had a great stay. The hotel is in a wonderful location. I'd recommend this hotel to others and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a cut above”
Reviews.Author: Crito0
Reviews.Content: The Conrad lived up to its Trip Advisor reviews. My Executive King room was large; since I was on the sixth floor my view was not great, but because Exec Kings are on corners I did have a pretty good view. I found it very convenient to use the Northbridge Mall to get to Michigan Ave. And in general the Conrad's location is excellent. Free internet in the rooms is much appreciated. And you can print from your room to the business center, picking up your print job (with a personal code) whenever you like. Very happy with the "Any Weekend, Anywhere" deal I got, making this upscale and luxurious hotel quite affordable in the winter months. This is the first 5* review I have ever given on Trip Advisor. The quality of the room, especially the bathroom is what put my stay over the top. The service, too -- I had a very important, unexpected UPS delivery, which was addressed in a very confusing way, but when I got back to my room late in the evening there it was, on the desk. I'd agree that a coffee maker in the room would be better than having to go to the lobby. But that was a small detail. I've stayed in quite a few Chicago hotels... I'll return to the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Great birthday weekend in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: PSPcouple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in the Milwaukee area and it is always a treat to come down to Chicago a couple of times a year. My birthday happened to be this past weekend so spending a weekend here sounded like a great idea. We are Hilton Honors members and have stayed at several properties downtown including the Chicago Hilton and Palmer House. We decided to spend our time at the Conrad as it was something different and the ammenities seemed great. Also, how many hotel marketing managers respond to many of the Trip Advisor reviews on their hotels...not many...but this one does and is concerned about every review. To say the least, my wife and I will definetely be back! The hotel is 5 star in every sense of the word...large comfortable lobby and bar, attentive staff and terrific rooms. The executive king we were in was very large and overlooked Michigan Avenue. I wish I could have taken the bed home with us! With 5 large pillows, cloud top mattress, and down comforter, I was in heaven. The robes and slippers were also a very nice touch. The bathroom is very large with huge soaking tub and walk in shower. The person who turned down our room shaped a towel in the shape of a heart on our bed and placed several valentine chocolates around it...how many hotels do that. The technology in the room was amazing...large flat screen TV, Boze sound system and I-Pod player. The concierge has extremely helpful and personable and gave us some great suggestions. Please move her back to the main lobby upstairs though during the winter months as it is a pretty cold area being close to the street. Finally, this is the absolute best location to be in Chicago. You are close to the Miracle Mile, the Loop and all of the night life on Rush Street. This great hotel, dinner at Gibson's Steakhouse and dancing at Jilly's made for a memorable birthday weekend! Thank you once again to the great Conrad staff for making our stay so special!

Reviews.Title: “Great, central, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ms_scotsgirl
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is good, traditional elegance, with friendly, helpful staff. The lobby is bright and spacious with a popular-looking bar and nice outdoor area for summer. Our room was large and comfortable. Huge, cosy bed, armchair, desk, etc. Big windows. Both a bath (deep and nice) and a shower, and a separation door between toilet and the rest of the bathroom. Only disappointments were no in-room coffee/tea maker, and no swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: abbalish
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband for a winter weekend, and the hotel was perfect for our needs. The Conrad is in a great location, in easy walking distance to tons of shopping and dining options - including some that are attached, so you don't even need to go outside. Due to Diamond status, we were upgraded to a suite that overlooked Michigan avenue. The room was plush, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom (including the soaking tub!) was great as well. I can't speak to lunch or dinner, but the Hilton Honors breakfast was delicious. Nice workout facilities. I don't know about the summer rates, but the winter room rates were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “So sad to leave the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: Martyhoyt
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for a conference January 17-20 and had the opportunity to stay at the Conrad. Hands down the best hotel I have stayed at. From check in to check out everything was great. I got to the hotel around 11:00 in the morning and was fully anticipating to just drop my bags off because the posted check in was 3:00 pm and I wanted to go to the shedd aquarium that day. When I got to the check in desk I told them that I just wanted to drop off my bags because of the posted check in time. What a great surprise when the front desk associate checking me in said he could check me in right then. High marks for that. I got to my room and droped my bags off. The rooms have a large bathroom with a soaking tube (great to use after the workout room to soothe the sore muscles and sore knees after working out), glass enclosed shower, and separate room for the toilet. The only down side was the office building basically right outside my windows but not that big of a deal just close the drapes. Its really nice that the hotel is attached to the The Shops At Northbridge because there are about six restaurants in the mall so if you don't want to go out you can take the elevator down and get a bite to eat in the mall. Also there are other restaurants very close outside the hotel, very convenient. Try the italian restaurant that is basically right out the door of the hotel. You will get to use that fridge in the room because they serve huge portions. One other downside is the price of a drink in the hotel bar. It was ten dollars for a rum and coke.Pretty steep in my opinion. The other great thing is the gift shop stays open until 11:00 pm great for those late evening munchies. Also housekeeping was great because they organized my toothbrush, contact case, etc when they came to check the room. it was a nice gesture that they didnt have to do. Overall I would defiantly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “New favorite place to stay in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: charles m
Reviews.Content: This is our new favorite place to stay while in DT Chicago, we typically stay DT 4 times a year to shop and dine. We live in SW Indiana and Chicago is our fav. big city to visit. Beats Manhattan hands down! The staff and location of the Conrad our great! Already looking forward to our next trip in April!

Reviews.Title: “Faultless!!!”
Reviews.Author: rOjU_10
Reviews.Content: Not really much to add to the title really, everything you could want from a hotel from a warm welcome to a great room, nice bar food, everything very clean, complimentary tea and coffee in a morning, just all wonderful. We would without doubt be back to this hotel if we returned to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Appreciation...”
Reviews.Author: jmjkf
Reviews.Content: We came to appreciate the staff of the Conrad during our last stay. We've stayed at the Conrad on two occasions and have made a reservation for our next visit to Chicago. We appreciate its central location (Michigan Ave/Rush St). The Conrad's classy main lobby is on the 5th floor (above the 4 floors of the Shops at North Bridge). We found the rooms to have a good view, very clean, the bathroom very spacious, and the beds comfortable. During our last day of our 4 night stay, we woke up to having no running water. The staff advised that it was an electrical issue with the water system and that it should be back on in 2 hours, then another 2 hours, and... it didn't come back on until 6pm. It was snowing all day, so without showers, we camped out in the room watching movies. Each time I called for an update, the staff responded to our requests by providing first bottled water, then a Keurig coffee maker, and in the evening a complimentary meal via room service. When we checked out the next day, they responded to our request and removed the charge for the final night's stay. So, while we wish we didn't have to experience this situation, we did appreciate the staff's professionalism and willingness to help us and thus keep us as customers.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: alforj
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here and had no complaints -- we got a special weekend promo rate which made it all the better. The rooms were pretty big and the bathroom had a separate tub and shower which was nice. Only complaint was that we were unable to rent a movie on the TV due to some technical glitch on our floor. I could see it being down one night, but by the second night it should have been fixed -- and wasn't. Other than that, it is in a great location just a few blocks from Michigan Ave and the staff we very friendly and accommodating. Would definitely stay here again for the price we got.

Reviews.Title: “Best Property North of the Chicago River”
Reviews.Author: Federico C
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, excellent service-oriented staff, nicely appointed luxurious rooms with no match in the area, and no better value for the price. Once I stayed there, I was rapidly convinced that there's no better property to stay in Chicago. Connected to The Shops at North Bridge but conveniently isolated for quiet comfort and safety.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad - Not so rad”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBeautifully
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad hotel in downtown Chicago, selected for its 5 star rating and attractive low rates. In comparison to most other 5 star hotels in Chicago, this is one of the best properties for the money, which is why I booked here. The location is good, especially in winter months. It is located right across from a mall, so you can enjoy nearby shopping and dining. From the time I stepped out of the cab, I was greeted by a friendly and professional doorman, leading me to the elevator for the reception area. The reception area is neat and informal. This wasnâ€™t the opulent, grand experience like most 5 star places, but it is simple, efficient, and worked well. I would say the dÃ©cor is modest and uneventful. Although nice, you wonâ€™t find much of a WOW factor here. (Until you see their breakfast pricesâ€¦I will get to that.) My check in went smoothly, and I informed the hotel that I had 2 separate reservations that needed to be merged together. I informed them I would be staying 2 nights, not one. The friendly check in reception gentleman told me that this would be no problem, and the following day, to just come down to reception to have my keys recoded so that they would still work. No problem. I made my way up to the rooms where on my way, I found the elevator areas adorned with beautiful potted orchids; the look was very beautiful and elegant. Once inside my room, I noticed 2 things. (1) The bathrooms are really beautiful, big, and full of amenities. They are marble, gorgeous and complete with matching bathrobes. (2) The TV is huge. The not so great thing was that my view was directly into an office building. I literally could see what they were eating for lunch, etc, so it wasnâ€™t just barely visible. It was like I was in there with them. No bother. I drew my blinds and moved on. (When you check in, ask for a view of NOT into an office building.) A small perk of this hotel is that they do a complimentary tea service each morning until 10 AM, which we used and enjoyed. At night, they put out hot coco and marshmellows for guests, which is cute and a nice touch. We did like that. What sort of struck me as funny at this hotel is that they pride themselves on having a pillow menu, where I think you can pick between 4 different kinds of pillows delivered free to your room, plus others at an additional cost. The irony in this is after waking up, I had concluded that the Conrad pillows were the least comfortable I had ever experienced in a hotel. Funny. (Maybe I should have ordered up a special pillow?) Downside to the room â€“ I didnâ€™t like that the once stocked mini bars are all empty now. The only use for them now is to put your leftovers in. Me? I like to be able to grab a snack or a drink from the mini bar. I found it strange that this was a 5 star hotel with a little, pathetic, empty fridge. Despite this, however, all in all, the room is quite suitable, I think most people wouldnâ€™t have much an issue. Here is where you may take issue with this hotelâ€¦breakfast prices. Wow. For a complete breakfast in the dining room ,it is $24-$32, depending on which â€œbreakfast mealâ€� you get. It is very pricy on this, (but delicious and well prepared / served.) However, as good as it was, it just wasnâ€™t â€œ$60 for breakfast for 2â€� good. My opinion is, there are nearby places that you can find that are a nice walk for $28 for 2. We asked the front desk for a recommendation and he said that Yolk was good. (Most Nordstromâ€™s have a cafÃ©, and had I thought of it, you probably could have gotten something awesome and cheap there, inside, right across the street from the Conrad.) All and all, I simply found the breakfast menu to be a turn off all together. Breakfast at the Park Hyatt, arguably a nicer and more upscale hotel, is less at $16 for room service complete breakfast, just for perspective. My opinion is that the Conrad should consider their cost of stay vs their cost of breakfast and maybe consider reducing. Hereâ€™s where my stay got kind of annoying. The housekeeping belted on the door at 8 AM on a Friday morning. A little early, donâ€™t you think? We told them to come back later, and we got out of bed and hung the DND sign on the door. Fine. Jet lagged and needing a nap, we retired back to the bed, only for the bellman to WALK IN to our room at 2 PM WITH THE DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door. Have you ever even heard of such a thing? We yelled out, â€œWe are staying another day,â€� from the bed and he left. We drifted back to sleep whenâ€¦RING RING. Are you kidding me? We are being woken up again. It is the front desk, now calling to apologize for the bellman walking in. They caught the error in the computer now, where the hotel room bookings had not been merged like I had asked them to at check in. Now, I am really pissed. It was just all the getting woken up. The only point of booking the room was to have a luxurious sleep after a 16 hour nonstop flight. This rather ruined it. I wished this hotel could have been a little more organized and perhaps have housekeeping come by at 10 AM instead of 8 AM on the dot. Just too early for folks that are here to relax and unwind. I would describe this hotel as quiet, tranquil, spacious, unfussy, unpretentious, classic, non-trendy, simple, elegant, and calm. It really just depends on what you are looking for. This property competes in price point with the Sofitel and overall, I would stay at the Sofitel over this hotel for the money. This is a decent property, but didnâ€™t blow me away. I would describe it as luxury on a budget. Affordable rooms, but you can probably do better if you are patient and look.

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica Y
Reviews.Content: First time traveler to Chicago last Spring - Conrad Hotel was the place to stay! It was right in the heart of everything, we were just walking distance to some great restaurants and stores. The hotel itself was SO nice, rooms were beautiful and clean, everyone who worked there was extremely helpful and made our experience so great! The doormen in particular were AMAZING! Always gave advice about where to go and what to see. Could not have asked for anything better! One doorman in particular (We think his name was Carlos?) was above-and-beyond helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise and sooo nice”
Reviews.Author: coleson
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the conrad in Chicago. I was not sure as someone else booked it but it was very, very nice. I am pretty fussy when it comes to staying in nice hotels but this was truly very comfortable and nicely appointed. The bed was crisp with white linens and the decor was new and very appealing. the bathroom was extremely nice and the room had everything we needed. They even emptied the mini bar so you could put your own things in it (which I loved). the location was perfect only a block away from the M. mile and attached to a mall. We didn't eat there but I bet the food was good. Staff were friendly and very helpful. I will definitely go back to a Conrad. It was certainly a step above your regular nice hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel overview”
Reviews.Author: Rose C
Reviews.Content: I love the Conrad Hotel. it is a very nice hotel to stay in away from home. The staff is very, very nice. It is equipped with a very nice flat screen TV, a nice Bose radio, I can watch DVD's. The bathroom is very roomy and I really like the Bath tub and the shower which is separate. I love the way the room is set-up You are in walking distance to many stores I really love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: michalmm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located. About a block and a half away from the Grand (Red line) stop and connected to shops that empty right out in the middle of the Magnificent Mile. The staff was wonderful, even making sure my friend's name was added to the reservation on the off chance my plane didn't make it to Chicago that night. The room was enormous and there were wonderful little perks that you just don't see very often. Free tea and coffee every morning, free water in the room, even free hot chocolate in the late afternoon. I wouldn't hesitate to reccomend this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, classy & great location!”
Reviews.Author: DestyB
Reviews.Content: We love the Conrad (and we are picky hotel goers). Just stayed there for the 3rd time! The sheets are so luscious, white and clean. The room was very quiet. Everything was clean, classy and up to date. Â The heater in the room was so nice and quiet that I got a great night's sleep (and I don't usually sleep well in hotels). Our view was great, right down Michigan Avenue. Everything was lovely! They also delivered chocolates to our room in honor of my husband's 40th birthday. Â That was a very nice touch! Â It's such a great location. Attached to shopping and so close to awesome high-end restaurants (we LOVE Joe's and Mastro's--both within 3 blocks) In winter we love being able to walk through Northbridge mall to get to the Conrad--it's one less block walking in the cold! It's awesome having parking connected to it too!Â HIGHLY recommend the Conrad. Great value too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Executchef
Reviews.Content: Traveled from Phoenix to Chicago and spent our New Year Eve in Chicago, we had decided to stay at the Conrad Chicago, the location was perfect accessible to great shopping, restaurants and theater. Our first experience was at the arrival the door man was pleasant and helpful, took care of our luggages with a great inviting smile. We stopped at the bar to get something to eat, the server made some great menu suggestions decided on the Kobe Slider which were delicious. The housekeeping staff was smiling and greated us with a good morning every day as we were walking the hallway. Everyone made us feel such at home. We are planning another visit to Chicago to visit some friends in April and will definitely stay at the Conrad Chicago, our new home away from home :) Thank you to all trip advisor reviews that made such an impact in our choice to pick the Conrad Chicago over the many choices in Downtown Chicago. Happy New Year!!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bobpioneer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is professionally staffed, very clean and well decorated rooms. Hotel is perfect for if traveling for business.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: scott k
Reviews.Content: The Conrad, is the perfect place for couples and Familys. Located right behind the Nordstroms on Michigan Ave. The rooms are large and the staff is so nice. I tell everyone I know if they can stay at the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Very good alternative to big hotels in the area!”
Reviews.Author: Iikka
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights at the beginning of January. From the check-in to check-out everything went smoothly and I really enjoyed my stay. I had reserved king bed executive room, and I was upgraded to a slightly larger room in that category (half of a suite). Pleasantly surprised by the large bathroom! Comfortable bed, good TV and audio systems. But nothing in the mini-bar! My rate included American breakfast in the restaurant (this hotel has no Executive Lounge). I had the first one around 7 am, when I was almost the only customer, and the second one at 10 am (on Saturday), when I had to wait a few minutes for a table. In both cases the service was quick and friendly, and for me the breakfast was enough until dinner... Fitness center is open 24 hrs, good equipment, almost empty when I was there. The staff was very friendly and helpful, I asked for a late check-out and received it without any problems. Would I stay there again? Most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “One of Chicago's Best Hotels”
Reviews.Author: JD-ourtravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for an extended weekend with a group of business associates for a fun non-business gathering. The room is what you would expect out of a nicely appointed city hotel. The beds are heavenly. The room was spotless. The bathroom was incredible. It was very spacious with a separate tub and shower as well as a private toilet room. The counter space was quite large; plenty of room to get ready to hit the town. The shower seemed a bit small given the size of the bathroom, but nothing too confining. We ordered room service for breakfast twice. Pricey as one would expect. Food was fine, not quite worth the price but paid for the convenience. It is situated in a great location, with close proximity to some of Chicagoâ€™s best places. There is a mall right next door including a Nordstromâ€™s, Weberâ€™s Grill is right around the corner, Buca Di Beppoâ€™s is on the corner at street level, Chicagoâ€™s Field Museum is a short cab ride away, the list goes on. You canâ€™t go wrong staying at the Conrad. (note: unsure of true "value" rating as we did not pay for the room it was paid by an associate).

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels!”
Reviews.Author: ScooterRed71
Reviews.Content: On my first stay, I found the Conrad a bit too stuffy. I switched to theWit for a while, dazzled by its newness and trendy style. But once you stripped away the newness, theWit lost its appeal and we went back to the Conrad and absolutely love it. It's professional without being stuffy. On my most recent, they apologized that they had no Hilton Diamond upgrade for me. No big deal. I could live without it but they then sent several bottles of very good wine to our room to make up for it. They didn't have to do anything but they did. I liked that. Rooms are decent sized and the bathrooms are huge. Love the showers at the Conrad. Valet is always quick to bring our car around and room service has never blinked an eye at any request, no matter how bizarre. The Conrad has become our "go to" hotel when staying in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet sophistication”
Reviews.Author: Chick2323
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is a comfortable, simply sophisticated place in Chicago. The staff is attentive. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. Location was great for shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Kate K
Reviews.Content: This hotel was super clean..service was awesome..i could live here!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: han1974
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Conrad for 5 nights during a wedding planning trip. It's hard to beat the central, convenient location of the hotel - 1 block off the Magnificent Mile, above the Shops at North Bridge (which includes Nordstrom). Easy walk to many of the great River North restaurants and bars, as well as the CTA Red Line (at Grand). Our king room on the 12th floor had a nice skyline view up Michigan Ave. towards the John Hancock Tower. The room was very clean, spacious, and nicely appointed. More than adequate closet and drawer space to unpack the suitcases for a week and leave them in the closet so they're not in the way. Bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows. Didn't take advantage of the pillow menu, but may if we have a return stay. The recessed lighting over the headboard is a really nice plus if all you need is an overhead reading light at night. Very large bathroom w/ separate water closet. Plenty of sink space and very large, plush bath towels. The deep soaking tub w/ shower is spacious, although it's more conducive to a relaxing bath than a quick shower (water tends to gather & stand on the tub's ledge, so be careful). Check-in and check-out was seamless, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The lobby bar is a nice, quiet place to gather for an evening or late-night cocktail. The restaurant definitely met our breakfast needs, although it's a tad pricey and rather bland for a restaurant in a 4.5-star hotel. Even though the restaurant fell a bit short for our wants, everything else about the hotel met or exceeded our needs. The Conrad is one of the best Chicago hotels given its location, and amenities for the business and vacation traveler. I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: Josh528
Reviews.Content: Top Notch Service! The staff was very friendly and professional. Great room - we stayed in the Executive King. I make it a point NEVER to order room service (I am always dissapointed) unless I am strapped for time on a business trip. However, my wife was with me and 8 months pregnant and was craving some early morning pancakes - I have to admit....they were AWESOME! And regarding my #1-Prime-Most Important-Key aspect of a good hotel....VERY VERY CLEAN!! Christian (the GM) obviously runs a tight ship and it shows! Great job and THANK YOU!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay - as usual!”
Reviews.Author: lillystu
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is our usual choice when staying in Chicago. Comfortable beds, nice modern rooms - corner suites always the best for nice views of Michagen Ave - Fantastic location - especially for shopping. Staff are always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on New Year's Eve and could not be more satisfied with our King Deluxe Suite. nice big flat screen TV, Bose sound system, comfy bed and pillows, and the bathroom was huge. Inside elevator access to nordstrom was very nice for shopping and grabbing lunch without having to face the cold weather outside. I definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay downtown. It's location is prime for anywhere you want to go including CTA train access or Metra.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: LGTraveler953
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights and upgraded to a high floor upon arrival. The room was absolutely wonderful, the chairs were very comfortable. Also the bed was so dreamy. We ordered two additional pillows from the pillow menu the last night of our stay. I wish we would have done so sooner. Also, enjoyed the garden tub and separate shower in the room. The Bose surround sound was a nice touch for watching movies and listening to music in the room. The hotel staff was always courteous and quick to help in any way. I definitely highly recommend this luxury hotel. The only thing I did not understand was the need to take two separate elevators from the ground level up to the room. Not something that is necessarily bad, just different.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - met/ exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: smikolay
Reviews.Content: We were in the Conrad over new years eve, and had a greattime in Chicago. The hotel is centrally located, making it easy to get everywhere we wanted to go (Red Line was just a block away). The room was large, with a very comfortable bed. Bathroom had a seperate room for the toilet, and a full tub and shower (I wished that the bathroom had been a tad smaller and the bedroom a tad bigger). Big screen flat panel TV with a good selection of stations (although the feed was choppy at times). The staff was very friendly, and helped with all of our needs - I was particularly pleased with the concierge emailing me back on pre-arrival questions.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: dexxa11
Reviews.Content: Went on a business trip to Chicago - stayed 4 nights, very comfortable hotel, well taken care of hotel that will be an excellent business trip suggestion. Front Desk staff were well informed and could make decisions. Rooms were nice / clean and fitness area was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: C S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for a few days before Christmas for our 20th wedding anniversary. I cannot say enough about this hotel, and I HIGHLY recommend it. It was beautiful, it was luxurious, and the staff couldn't be more attentive if they tried. Every day we came back to our room there was a treat - one day a bottle of champagne, once a plate of amazing chocolates; the restaurant (we ate breakfast there everyday) was terrific, and they had coffee in french press which DH and I were very happy to find. The bellmen always knew our names, secured cabs for us, and gave us directions when needed - they were so friendly, helpful and professional. And the location couldn't be better - we easily walked to about 80% of the places we wanted to go. We will definitely stay at the Conrad when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money with great service in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Haramkhor
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels we have stayed in during our US trip, this stay has been the best yet. The service was outstanding. We arrived from a long 16 hour flight to Chicago at 8.30 in the morning and our room wasn't ready then since check in time was 3 pm. We thought we might have to leave our luggage in the lobby and go on a walkabout or rest up on the lobby couches. The staff at front desk took initiative and gave us a temporary room so we could rest up a bit, have a shower if needed etc till our room was ready. That was beyond what I expected and it really set the tone. First impressions are so important! We did not have coffee making facilities in the room we were in but front desk sent a coffee maker without a fuss. The service was hospitable and efficient. Everyone we met in the hotel was in good spirits and since the holiday season can be stressful for staff, it certainly did not show. The location of the hotel is great. A short walk to magnificient mile (in fact you can go straight to the mile if you walk through the mall) we got a great "Xmas in July" deal and hope to get lucky again the next time we visit Chicago. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “First time at Conrad - would definetly go back”
Reviews.Author: Mary2273
Reviews.Content: Right downtown near restaurants and shopping. bed was AMAZING,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Room!!”
Reviews.Author: KatJames
Reviews.Content: My partner and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The rooms were extremely clean and well maintained. After a long international flight we found the bed to be extremely comfortable. The hotel is in the perfect location for shopping, eating out and public transport. The staff were friendly and helpful and a special thank you needs to be noted for the friendly maids that do an amazing job. My only criticism is that although I booked and paid for our accommodation on Expedia prior to our stay I was charged again by Conrad and only realised when I checked my credit card statement days later. As we were on holidays and travelling to other cities it was stressful trying to sort out the mistake and ensure that the amount was refunded.This was such a shame as our stay had been amazing and prior to this we couldn't fault the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “World Class”
Reviews.Author: LVHotelGuy
Reviews.Content: Location is Great, service is great, people were great. Only downside parking $51 a day

Reviews.Title: “Really good, could be great, but...”
Reviews.Author: KLoveToronto
Reviews.Content: Overall a very pleasant stay. Rooms are beautiful, well-designed and have a lot of thoughtful amenities. Got a good deal during the holidays, and would definitely stay again. Two things I don't understand though; First - they have removed their minibars, leaving an unplugged fridge behind? Why? No cold sodas for this guest unless I order them from room service or go to the bar I guess. A very strange choice for an upscale hotel. Second - a couple of days before my arrival I tried to add some nights, and all three ended up on separate reservations. They couldn't or wouldn't combine them, so I had to re-check-in every afternoon. Otherwise nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Conrad!”
Reviews.Author: Dale H
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Conrad. We got a great deal with their Dec. special. The breakfast was great (a special thanks to Luis!) and the location couldn't be better. The service (bell staff, front desk, housekeeping, servers at the restaurant) were especially polite and service-oriented. Couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice in the area”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler941
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Conrad. It is conveniently located and has quiet, comfortable, and spacious rooms. The staff were uniformly friendly and helpful. One slight negative: the restaurant and bar area off the lobby are not particularly inviting (and appeared to be relatively deserted). While the hotel offers very good value, it has a fairly generic feel and is not particularly luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: BmacSpringfield_Il
Reviews.Content: Went to Chicago for the Donny and Marie concert and stayed at the Conrad. Very friendly staff, comfortable room, and a super location for restaurants, the theaters, and shopping. I would certainly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “excelent the best choice for chicago”
Reviews.Author: charis p
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at the conrad chicago hotel 7 days very clean high level of service very friendly and kind personal everywhere i also highly recommend this hotel with pleasure i will stay again and again very important that you have access from nordstrom shoping center and you have acess to a lot of shops

Reviews.Title: “Large & well appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: kbharvey
Reviews.Content: My biggest take away from this hotel was just how large and well-appointed the rooms were. The bathrooms were HUGE, with a separate shower and bathtub, as well as a separate water closet. The bathroom had everything I could need on my trip (including floss and mouth wash), and even some things I didn't really need but loved (like a scale). The TV was a very nice flat screen with a great Bose sound system, DVD player, etc. And the hotel had free wi-fi in the rooms, which is a huge plus in my book. I didn' t hear anyone in the hallway or adjacent rooms, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The staff was very attentive and the location is fabulous. My only small gripe was that my room didn't seem to want to get as cold as I like - but in full disclosure, I tend to keep the room around 67 degrees at night, which is much lower than normal. I highly recommend this hotel and would undoubtedly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway Weekend”
Reviews.Author: AnnaLizzie
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Conrad. Room was beautiful. Great views of Michigan Ave. not to mention the snow flurries and Christmas lights made for a postcard view. Room was nicely appointed. Large tv, comfy bed and large bathroom area. I can't wait to come back. Hot chocolate was a nice tough for a long day of shopping in the cold weather. Staff members were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: IHRMiami
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively around the world and I found the Conrad Chicago to be one of the best run hotel I've experienced. They were extremly pet friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: tdcptrm
Reviews.Content: Close to shopping and excellent restaurants. Hotel staff is very attentive top guest needs.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelly N
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Conrad. The staff was extremely friendly and the accommodations were very clean. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Almost a "5"”
Reviews.Author: jocesweet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Conrad so we could celebrate our anniversary in Chicago. We arrived quite early and I wasn't expecting to be able to check in, which was fine. We left our bags and went shopping. The hotel was going to call when our room was ready. What I didn't expect, though, was that our room wouldn't be ready until after 3PM. It was only just after 3:00 when we got the call, but I was quite surprised that we didn't get the call earlier. Aside from that, all of the staff were nice and very friendly. The hotel even sent up some chocolates for us, which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property for business or leisure travel”
Reviews.Author: Rumbera1967
Reviews.Content: I am an admitted hotel snob. I love the Conrad Chicago! I stayed here for business five times in 2011. The rooms are warm, spacious and well-appointed. It was also quiet and offers free wi-fi in the guest rooms. It is close to shopping --right next to Nordstrom and Michigan Avenue. The only constructive criticism I have is the need to have sufficient staffing for breakfast at the restaurant. My most recent trip, December 2011, was for five nights. This is my hotel of choice when I visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityJayhawk
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Wonderful room with Bose sound system. Very attentive and courteous staff and a terrific location. I highly recommend the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Would be marked excellent but for the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Charleshutton
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for six days, from 27 November 2011, on business and could not fault the service, nor the very spacious room, nor the very spacious bathroom, but I have to say that I was very disappointed by the buffet breakfast. Even in the most modest hotels this is usually a feature which is good with a large selection of different foods ranging through cereals, fruits, meats, cheese, cooked food and various breads and pastries, but The Conrad had very little in the way of breads and did not have a facility to make toast. The choice of the other dishes inculding the hot ones was fairly limited and all in all it seemed to me to let down what was otherwise an excellent hotel with a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great property; perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bluemaggie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business but was able to get in a little shopping because of the great location next to Nordstrom. The room was spotlessly clean, very spacious and had a great desk for working. Free internet was very useful. Loved the pillow menu! Staff was very friendly and helpful. Great stay - made my business trip enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Mag Mile Location”
Reviews.Author: Dennis M
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at several hotels in the area, we found it to be one of the quietest ones with a very comfortable bed. The king-bedded room with crisp linens was average in size for a big city hotel. The in-room, flat screen TV even had a Bose sound system! The bathroom was very luxurious and spacious, however, the shower ran out of hot water both mornings during our stay. The front desk was very apologetic and reduced a portion of our bill. The staff was friendly and service in the restaurant for breakfast was great. It's location next to Nordstrom's, the Chicago River, Michigan Avenue and across from the Chicago Tribune and NBC makes walking along the Magnificent Mile easy.

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: arminator1124
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and staff!!!!love the hotel, everybody really cares making suremy stay was comfortable, would definitively go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, beautiful room, great city!”
Reviews.Author: RobinCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay in this hotel. We had come to Illinois for a family funeral and decided to stay at The Conrad for a couple days at the end of the trip for some relaxation (and to celebrate my birthday). We were treated so well from the minute we got there. I mentioned it was going to be my birthday the next day and I was offered a special treat (in this case a chocolate sampling that was so delicious). Every time we asked for something the staff went out of their way to accommodate our request. The room was large, clean and beautiful. The bed was very comfortable. The location was great for shopping, although we didn't take advantage of that (the lobby is attached to a mall with Nordstrom's). We spent a day enjoying a trolley tour. The pick up is just a few blocks away and you can hop off and on at 14 different stops. We had the best breakfast at The Yolk (however on a Sunday morning we waited in line for some time). The only complaint I could make is that there aren't many rooms with amazing city views. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would plan to return on any visit to Chicago in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Unprepossessing gem, great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: MBFW
Reviews.Content: My wife, teenage son and I recently spent a delightful weekend at the Conrad. Other than charm, it has everything I would hope for in a big city hotel. The location is terrific. The staff was very helpful and gracious. Having already consumed the (excellent) pod coffee in our room, I went down to the lobby for more. Seeing the pot empty, the hostess instantly refilled it. Need a croissant? No problem.... there in seconds... I went to the front desk...need a newspaper? Don't like this one? No problem...Financial Times there in seconds...how about a Wall Street Journal and a NY Times too? And so it went through the weekend. The rooms were a bit plain but well thought out, unusually large and blissfully quiet. The superb heating and cooling system kept the room temp almost eerily constant. The beds were perfect, housekeeping superb. And back to the staff: They seemed happy to be there, happy to see you...as if you were doing them a favor by asking for their gracious help.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago for fun or business”
Reviews.Author: Dogwood50
Reviews.Content: From the large spotless rooms that are both comfortable and functional to a superb location on N Rush St everything at this Conrad seems designed to get you situated quickly so that you can get on with business or start enjoying what this city has to offer. In particular I liked the fact that the electronics are simple enough for a non teenager to manage. Electrical plugs are easily accessible and the lighting is ample and glare free. Large nicely appointed bathrooms with high end toiletries round out the rooms which are quiet, chic in design and lovingly cared for by an efficient staff. Elevators are spacious and move quickly. The Terrace Restaurant and Bar offer a wide variety of food and drink at competitive prices. The Magnificent Mile shopping opportunities and major attractions like the Art Institute, Lyric Opera, Orchestra Hall, the many stages for theater and music spectacles are minutes away making this a prime location for family members while business may be being conducted equally near by. Restaurants of every description and price range are widely available throughout the city but particularly near this hotel. Train service on the blue line from O'Hare airport is available to within blocks of the l obby but even faster service is one detrains at Clark & Lake and takes a 5 minute taxi ride to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ErichWBuffalo
Reviews.Content: We came to the city in October for a family getaway and chose the Conrad based on the wonderful reviews. We were not at all disappointed. This is a wonderful hotel and the staff will go out of there way to make your stay comfortable. Mary Claire from the restaurant waited on us many times and she was extremely helpful. We will definitely be back to the hotel when in Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy at the Conrad Chicago”
Reviews.Author: OpenSky
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Conrad Chicago. The hotel and our room were very clean. The beds were super comfortable and the bathroom was large. We stayed on the 14th floor and it was very quiet. We enjoyed drinks in the bar, and also had a very tasty breakfast at the restaurant. They do not have vending machines or a coffee maker in the room, but offer complementary coffee and tea in the mornings. The hotel connects to the North Bridge Mall which is right on Michigan Avenue, so that is very convenient. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Earned Every One of its Five Stars”
Reviews.Author: Shane D
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Chicago in October of 2011 to celebrate an anniversary with my girlfriend. I had previously never been to Chicago, and since anniversaries only come once per year, I decided that we could splurge a little bit and stay at a high-end hotel. After doing some research online, I chose the Conrad, and I have not questioned my decision since. The hotel itself has a great location near the magnificent mile and is within walking distance of many of Chicago's best restaurants and stores. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a very friendly bellman who offered to take our bags and directed us to the check-in desk. The check-in staff was very friendly and helpful, and greeted us by name throughout the duration of our stay. Common courtesies such as the personal greeting can really go a long way in making one feel comfortable and I felt that it was a very nice touch. As it was our anniversary, I spent a few extra dollars to purchase the Allure package which came with a free room upgrade, champagne toast upon arrival, and a complimentary breakfast-in-bed. The room itself was incredible. It had a large flat screen TV, an ergonomic chair, a large desk with a nice, leather desk chair, and quite possibly the most comfortable king-size bed that I have ever slept on. The bathroom was also very luxurious, containing his and hers sinks, deep soaking tub, unattached shower, and a separate room in which the toilet was located. Among the bathroom amenities were 2 bathrobes, cotton swabs, floss picks, mouthwash, face and body lotion, shampoo, and conditioner. As I mentioned before, we were to receive a champagne toast upon arrival as part of a package that I had purchased. My initial thought was that two filled champagne flutes would be waiting for us in the room, so it was a pleasant surprise when we discovered an entire bottle of champagne resting in the ice bucket. I am no champagne connoisseur, but I can confidently say that it was not your average $10 drug store variety. After taking down the bottle, we left to go experience the town. Although we did not try it, I have heard that the restaurant inside the hotel is very good, offering dinner options in the $30-50 range from what I saw. There was also a rooftop bar that was very highly recommended, but since it was late October, drinking outside wasn't really in the cards. In the morning, we were greeted with a breakfast for two in bed by a member of the hotel staff. The eggs and potatoes were excellently prepared, and the coffee and juice were also of very high quality. Overall, this was one of the best hotel stays that I have ever experienced. I usually like to include some cons in my reviews, but there really weren't any. If i had to name one, I would point to the $45 per night parking expense, but that is pretty standard anywhere in a big city so it wasn't anything out of the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: mattcoats
Reviews.Content: As usual the Conrad represents the best in quality and service. It's the only place I will stay in Chicago and you'd be crazy to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Spottyonetwo
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at this hotel a few weeks ago. Upon arrival a bellman quickly appeared and unloaded our luggage, and then directed us into the hotel and upstairs to the lobby. Check in was quick and efficient. The lobby is a good sized one, with adequate seating. There is a bar just to the side of the lobby as well as the restaurant which we did not try. Coffee is provided in the lobby each morning (there is no machine in the room) and hot apple cider was provided late afternoon which was a lovely touch - and most welcome after coming in from the cold!!! The room (2 double beds) was a good sized one - with large bathroom and separate toilet. Really appreciated the two bottles of water placed beside the bed each day! The hotel is attached to the shopping center by a walkway which means no going outside to access it. The center has a decent food court as well as lots of shops and this kept us occupied and well fed as well! I would highly recommend this hotel based on the location (heart of Miracle Mile), and comfort of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Budster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Conrad Chicago back in July and had a wonderful time. We've stayed at a Conrad once before in Hong Kong, so we know to expect high end accomodations and service and the Conrad Chicago did not disappoint. The hotel is at a great location, close the the Magnificent Mile and walking distance to great restaurants and shopping (I needed to make sure I could be close enough for an evening walk to Uno Pizzeria for a deep dish!). We got a decent price on the room (I can't recall exactly what it was, but I thought it was around US$225 per night). I picked the Conrad over some of the other nearby hotels because they had free wi-fi. It still surprises me how the lower end hotel chains can offer free wi-fi, but the higher end ones will still charge exhorbitant prices. Well, refreshingly, the Conrad is not one of those. I loved the rooftop patio - we had a nightcap there on a warm July evening and took in the view of being surrounded by Chicago skyscapers. The only disappointment, and it was a minor one, was not receiving the pillow we ordered off their Pillow Menu. They had a number of different scented pillows that you could order for the evening and we called in the order before we left the room in the morning and when we got back in the evening, we didn't receive it. I guess we could have called again, but we were tired and just wanted to go to sleep. We didn't try out their pool but their exercise facilities were good and we didn't have to wait for equipment.

Reviews.Title: “I believed the hype...”
Reviews.Author: P C
Reviews.Content: So, I read all the reviews and was so looking forward to staying at this hotel. The room was on par with that of a Holiday Inn and was certainly not worth the amount of money I paid. The TV was fuzzy and the volume was broken, the toilet lever was broken, there was rust in the shower, and the sink was stopped up. I had expected to stay there a week but after one night's stay, I went to the Holiday Inn. Not much more to say than I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge bathroom & free wifi”
Reviews.Author: BartFargo
Reviews.Content: Those are the highlights. The bathroom was unusually spacious, even compared to other 4-star+ hotels and free wifi was a pleasant surprise. Otherwise, it's a standard business-class experience; no complaints but also nothing to rave about. Recommended for a quiet and uneventful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: wjdh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times when traveling to Chicago on business. I love the large bathrooms with separate bathtub( that fill up really really fast!) and shower. The hotel staff is courteous and helpful. I really enjoy the fact that the hotel does skimp on extras--like others in this price class-- wifi is free, there are wat bottles in the room when you arrive, free coffee/tea in the morning, complimentary extra toiletries like toothpaste. The room also have a Bose cd player with a connection for iPod-- all of these details really to make the stay more enjoyable and help the Corad distinguish itself from competitors. Location is also great!

Reviews.Title: “No frills but solid especially for business travel.”
Reviews.Author: MJCarroll
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the action on Michigan Avenue, Rush Street, and the loop. It isn't like some of the higher end properties with multiple bell and valet staff waiting to assist, though I am sure they can be found with little effort. The lobby is several floors up from street level, which isn't unusual for some Chicago hotels. Front desk staff is friendly and helpful. They bailed me out of a jam needing to print an attachment to an email. Here is a gripe: business center charges for printing one page? there just ha to be a better way. I am sure the hotel chains have done the research, and monitizing this aspect of business center needs of travelers must make sense, but for the life of me, i can't figure it out. The rooms are spacious and very nice. The propery feels new and the rooms give that flavor. The restaurant prices reminded me of New York City; apparently Chicago aspires to those prices. If you are on an expense account it won't bother you. A solid and safe stay. I picked up the room off a booking website; it was a great value and deserves the 4 star ranking.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Way more then expected.”
Reviews.Author: cathyfromillinois
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night this past October. We had two rooms through priceline. Check in was easy and staff helpful & kind. Both rooms were huge with one of them having an extra large bathroom with separate tub, shower and stool with it's own door. Bed was comfortable and room dark and quiet. Desk and chair as well as an additonal comfy chair and ottoman. I loved all the extras: water, slippers, robes, multiple real glasses(wine,etc), extra pillows & blankets and a extra nice shampoo, conditioner, sewing kit, shoe kit... The makeup mirror was top notch. Parking was right accross the street and the location was perfect in River North- a two minute walk to the Trump (go to the lounge on the 16th floor, amazing) and everything else is so close.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great city!”
Reviews.Author: drdc1971
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights on business. Great central location with easy access to all Chicago has to offer. The hotel layout is slightly unusual with access from the street 5 floors below reception and a change of lift required to get to the rooms. Reception has direct access to Northbridge shopping mall which leads out to the Magnificent Mile shopping strip. Staff were very welcoming and helpful. Rooms were very spacious and well equiped but lacked tea / coffee facilities, to compensate very good coffee was laid on in the lobby in the morning. Only had breakfast in the hotel but it was very good with a good variety served up quickly. Smallish bar area but would be much bigger "in season" when the terrace area is open. Overall excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: Jen M
Reviews.Content: After seeing the glowing reviews, I was really looking forward to my first Conrad stay. My first impression was not stellar - there was no one at the front door to help w/luggage, offer a "welcome to the Conrad," or hold the door. The front desk staff was, if not warm, at least very efficient/capable. The room was great - very well appointed & spacious. Lots of nice little touches & the bathroom w/free standing glassed in shower was lovely. Bonus points for a very nice fitness center (but please add more treadmills!). The biggest reason I consider this a disappointing stay was the bed...for a hotel positioning itself w/a â€œsleep menuâ€� incl 6-8 different types of pillows & Kindle rentals, you'd think they would invest in comfy beds. Mine was rock hard (Westin, Marriott, heck even Doubletree by Hilton beds are so much better!) & while Frette linens are advertised, I can't imagine that was what was on my bed - they were so scratchy! The shower had no water pressure & TV worked only intermittently. The location is very good, but there are so many other nice hotels on the same few blocks; I'd save your money & reserve a room at one of those. I don't think I'll be trying out any more Conrads. A shame â€“ I have a ton of HHonors points to use!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, location, and service”
Reviews.Author: Robert H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights following a four day stay at the nearby hyatt regency. I'm so glad we switched hotels! This has to be one of the best hotels we've stayed at in a big city. The location is perfect and close to shopping, restaurants, and public transportation. The hotel, lobby, and rooms are immaculate. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We opted for a standby upgrade for an Executive King Room. We had a corner room with an awesome view of the street. My girlfriend greatly enjoyed the amenities, including the robe, slippers, turn down service, and pillow menu. We paid about $270 (with taxes) per night which was very reasonable and a good value for a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has seen better days..”
Reviews.Author: LHinOC
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before but this time around was a marked difference in quality and service - the staff wasnâ€™t rude, just incompetent. For example, we ordered wine glasses for the room because the hotel no longer services a mini bar in the room, which seemed like a really cheap way to go for this type of hotel. Nonetheless, the staff brought us 4 coffee mugs... The list of issues goes on unfortunately, including the low grade in-room movie options - our audio and video did not sync on our rental; we eventually had to stop watching after 20 minutes. And the room itself was not clean; the bathroom sink vent holes were black with mold. Clearly the hotel has pulled back on not only amenities, but training or sufficient staff... oh, but the price point for this hotel has stayed the same. Find a newer hotel, there are many in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sschmitz01
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several wonderful places in downtown Chicago, but this is our new favorite! It is in a great location close to all the shopping and excitement of Michigan Avenue and only 2 blocks from the El station. The room was beautiful and the service was exceptional. They had a really nice complimentary coffee service in the lobby every morning. We ate breakfast once in the restaurant and it was delicious, though a bit pricey for breakfast (but similar to other hotel restaurants of the same class). The staff were completely accommodating and pleasant, always greeting us and asking if we needed anything. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again. We paid about $270 per night which is pretty reasonable when looking at comparable hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Our first choice in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mls7217
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth visit to the Conrad and we continue to be impressed. We arrived several hours early and not only were we offered an upgrade, but were given immediate access to our room which was a suite on an upper floor. The view was outstanding and the room was huge. We took advantage of the pillow menu and slept quite well. Housekeeping was quite attentive to our needs and the concierge again gave us some great recommendations about places to eat. The lounge was a great place to end our day. Overall, we had a very relaxing stay. The service is outstanding in every respect. We certainly will be staying there again when we next visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kimf
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Conrad last week and thought the hotel was very nice. The rooms are well decorated and of decent size. I especially liked the nice big bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and a nice big screen flat panel TV to watch. I also thought the hotel was very quiet, which was nice. My room was near the elevator, which had me a bit nervous, but I did not hear any noise during the night. The staff was very friendly. The fitness center is open 24/7, which is nice, but could have been a little bigger - that is my only complaint. I would definitely stay here again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: chilly_h2o
Reviews.Content: This hotel is up to Conrad standards for sure. We were able to check in early after taking train from ORD (45 min). Hotel allowed us to check in, stored out bags and took a walk for about an hour before receiving a call from front desk saying "room was ready". Returned to hotel around 3:30 pm (even though room was ready much earlier). Room was great: nice bed, huge bathroom, good features in room (tv, stereo, alarm clock, etc). Did not have much of a view from 9th floor, but nothing to complain about here, you don't go to Chicago to say in the room and stare out the window. However, when you need to be in room it was extremely comfortable. Like others have said: expensive, but very nice. Only minor complaint was double elevator to get to your room, but who really cares about that for 2-3 days?. notes: -very central location for downtown Chicago -nicely appointed, clean rooms, huge bath, upgrade to executive rm (no lounge) for HH Gold status -breakfast vouchers -was able to check in early- by 12:30/1pm. -good, free wi-fi

Reviews.Title: “Very classy with exceptional customer service!”
Reviews.Author: ageebabe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our honeymoon. The location was great! Close to shopping (the shops at northbrook) was an elevator ride away. Many restaurants within walking distance as well. Top notch hotel in a great location! If you want to treat yourself to an exceptional time in Chicago stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: J F
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic. The facility is very well maintained. The service was amazing - everyone we interacted with went out of their way to help and ensure we were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel_11224
Reviews.Content: Great location at the heart of the Magnificent Mile with access to wonderful restaurants and shops. Boutique type hotel, great decor and quiet. Everyone, from the front desk, the restaurant, as well as housekeeping is so professional. They are friendly and eager to accommodate any request. Whether traveling for work or for pleasure I would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: venuskon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past Saturday since my husband's holiday party was at the Signature Room in the Hancock. We had a wonderful, elegant suite on the 14th floor with our own private terrace and a great view - we could even see the lake! We had a cocktail in the lounge before going out for the evening. Service was great even though the place was crowded. We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet before heading out in the morning. This was our 2nd stay here and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mariafromnz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad Hotel in October 2011 for business purposes. The location is excellent - right above a shopping arcade and Nordstrom's department store, and it's right on the Magnificant Mile, so great if you have time to squeeze in some shopping and have the money to do so! The rooms are excellent - spacious, clean, light and airy and very comfortable. Room service was good although, like most room service at hotels, expensive.
