The staff were very friendly and welcoming and helpful in giving me directions to where I needed to go. If I have just one complaint it is the fact that there is no in-room coffee maker. I wake up early when I'm traveling Statside, and the first thing I need is a cup of coffee. I don't want to pay exhorbitant room service prices for just a coffee and it's a drag to have to leave the room just for that. The hotel provides free coffee to take away in the hotel lobby - but the point of a coffee to start the day is being able to sit in bed drinking it while watching the news. For the amount of the room rate, I would have thought it possible to have a coffee maker in the room. Otherwise, I would definitely stay there again when I next visit Chicago for business.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, spacious bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Knowlesitall
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great location near good shopping within walking distance. The staff is welcoming and friendly. Everything you'd expect from the Conrad brand is present here. Rooms are spacious and well laid out. This will definitely be our go-to hotel when we're in the Chicago area. Pros: Super-comfy beds, well-appointed bathrooms, Free Wi-Fi, Great Room Service Cons: Slow elevators

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for business and anniversary”
Reviews.Author: r2cook
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the room, the pillow menu, the finish level of the decor and the staff. The gentleman cleaning the lobby restroom was pleasant and encouraged me to fill out a comment card. The only poor thing I encountered was a coffe bar attendant that took the drip tray and dumped it back into the coffee urn that was setting out for the morning rush!! I brought it up with the front desk. I have to say the front desk staff was great the whole time. They had a nice gift in our room from the front desk for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Conrad”
Reviews.Author: Tammy043
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful and pleasant stay in Chicago at the Conrad. The reception was wonderful, as we checked in at 10am and our room was ready! When our door had trouble closing one morning and I wanted to make sure maintenance knew, the manager immediately took care of it, apologized, and offered us a drink coupon. The bed was very comfortable, and the turn down service, extra pillows and water, a welcome surprise. In the dining room our breakfast was served with very polite expertise. Thanks again, it was a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Akshay S
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at Homewood Suites and then one night at the Conrad and got a chance to compare both. The Conrad was definitely a great experience, with a friendly staff. We were there during Halloween and everybody had a costume and the staff seemed genuinely happy! Too bad the breakfast is not included though but not an issue since there are plenty of choices around. I suggest going to the Corner Bakery on Michigan street (take the stairs up from Illinois street which is the street next to the hotel). Would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: What a terrific experience! I travel frequently for business but this was a pleasure trip with two other couples. I was most impressed with the quality of service at the hotel; the two gentlemen at street level greeted me by name every time I entered the hotel and also offered bottles of water for our trip home. A woman in our group left a dress in a closet after check-out and it was fedexed to us the same day. Iâ€™ve been doing business travel at 4 and 5 star hotels for the last 20 years and no other hotel has paid such attention to the details that make difference . Thanks for a terrific weekend

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet, elegant, comfortable, and classy!”
Reviews.Author: CBASmith
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here on business for 2 nights for the first time. Great stay- amazing free breakfast for HHonors Gold members, comfy bed, very spacious bathroom (although water pressure in shower wasn't great) and friendly people at the front desk. Conrad's are always SO quiet, which I love. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic (nearly) everything!”
Reviews.Author: WhereRSandH2day
Reviews.Content: We booked this property using Hhonors points for a last-minute getaway, and stayed one night. I am a Diamond member with Hilton and stay about 50 nights per year, mostly short business stays at different properties. In short, the Conrad Chicago is tied with the Waldorf Park City for the best Hilton property I've experienced (No small feat, this particular Waldorf is also phenomenal). Staff that was friendly, accomodating, and professional but not stuffy; room fittings and finishings that are quite obviously well-maintained, smiles and quick execution for several small requests (luggage storage, turn-down service, etc). Things that should be routine but just aren't at so many properties.... Special thanks to Asea at the concierge desk for expertly handling a last-minute request for flowers due to short-sighted planning on my part. Only one tiny gripe: the fruit served with the Hhonors breakfast is out of season and mostly freezer-burned. Not nearly enough to detract what was otherwise a flawless stay. This is now by far our property of choice in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TacomaLv2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for 4 nights. The rooms are large, very quiet and extremely clean. The only thing I would tell travelers is that some of the rooms face a large office building. The Conrad is close to everything. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: arcarojb
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Conrad and it won't be my last. My friend & I were in Chicago for a conference Oct. 26-29. While the conference was held at the Intercontinental, we decided to stay at the Conrad. Check in was a breeze. Staff was very friendly & helpful. The room was large, beds comfy with plenty of pillows, bathroom roomy, bath amenities nice & comprehensive - incluging extra toothbrush & paste, q-tips, dental floss, etc. Bottled water was aplenty and at no charge. How refreshing to have bottled water without "yours for $5 a bottle". Coffee is available at no charge in the lobby, however we requested a coffee maker in the room & were pleasantly surprised to have a Keurig placed in the room (again, no charge). Wi-fi in the rooms, again included...and a nice fitness room with machines, weights, and treadmills/bikes/elliptical. Water & towels provided...again included. This was an overall great experience. Particularly nice were all the extras (bottled water, keurig, fitness, wifi) without being nickle & dimed to death. Add to this, the location, and you can't go wrong! Thanks, Conrad, for an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “This is great large hotel in one of the finest cities in the world.”
Reviews.Author: Jgossetttx
Reviews.Content: The staff bend over backwards to help the guests at this world-class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug0506
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad on September 2010. It was me, my husband, my mother and my 11-months-old daughter. Our room was very good, spacious, very clean, nice amenities, free coffee as a plus. Hotel is enar a lot of interesting places, restaurants, and shops. Magnificent mile is steps away and it was very nice to go for a walk and be able to return to the hotel to change diapers or nappy time. But the most important for us was the great staff that work at the hotel. They went miles away of their way to make us comfortable and to suit our needs. Room was ready for early check-in after a very long flight, crib was at the room, ready for my baby, with fresh delicate white sheets, a comfy blanket. My daughter received as a gift a cute stuffed cow that relates to the history of the great fire of Chicago, and that little cow was her travel companion all the time. They were all very nice to us, making a remarkable stay at Chicago. We recomend the Conrad to everyone, and will stay there always when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: johndoe13
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel merits a 4.5 stars, but since I can only give whole numbers, it gets a 4. Amenities wise, the hotel is easily a 5, and it's location is so close to I-90 that it is rather convenient for leaving Chicago. In addition, there is a grocery store a few blocks away, Dominick's. The most impressive part of the room was the wired internet speed, excess of 50 Mbps when I measured it. The shower had decent water pressure, and hot water was actually. And added extra is that there is an empty fridge, which you can stock with your items or have the hotel fill it for you. So why didn't I give it 5 stars? I had requested a high floor with a city view, I got a 10th floor with a view of the roof tops, and other buildings towering over me. I also don't like having to switch elevators when entering and leaving my room from the street, I have to take one to the lobby on the fifth floor, and then walk to the other side to take the elevator to your floor. The last oddity was when I was checking out, I was charged for five nights of valet parking for my three night stay- a phone call cleared it up.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hibiscus99
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay here last week and thought the hotel was great. The location, the TV in the room and the free coffee made it worth the money! We were placed in a room on the 5th floor and were told upon check-in that we were being placed in an "accessible" room as all the other king rooms were taken. We were told to expect bars in the shower and around the toilet, but the room had no bars at all, so I don't know if there was some confusion at check-in or not. Regardless the room was great. Large room, large bathroom (with a separate room for the toilet), executive shower, massive flat screen TV, comfy bed and pillows. Large closet with lots of hangers (real hangers, not the ones with flat tops that prevent theft, that slip into a bracket locked on the rod). The room also had a great sound system (Bose) that included a huge sub-woofer on the floor. This system could either be used to play CD or connect and iPod or as surround sound for the TV. I've never stayed in a room with a system like this. We could have happily spent our entire time in the room it was so comfy and quiet. The 5th floor also has the hotel lobby and the bars and restaurants for the hotel, so we could not have been more conveniently located. While we were there there was free cider in the afternoons outside the restaurant and free coffee in the morning (no in-room coffee machine that I could see). The 5th floor also contains an elevator for the adjoining mall, with 4 floors of shopping and access to the Magnificent Mile - Very convenient! This place also had the highest end laundry bags I've ever encountered in a hotel. Usually they are plastic with a rope string at the top. This place had paper shopping bags for your laundry - high end indeed. We'll stay here the next time we are in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: DDatYVR
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad Chicago for four nights in a King room. Check-in was efficient with Amelia. It's amazing that she remembered my name and greeted me every night when I walked by. Housekeeping was very efficient and observant - I drink a lot of water, and in one night, they caught on and provided me with extra bottles of complimentary bottled water. I'm hesitant to recommend the Concierge as she was unable to provide good restaurant suggestions and seemed to just read off the descriptions from a restaurant reservations website. I ended up researching and making reservations myself. The doormen were generally unhelpful as most times, I ended up getting my own luggage and packages out of the car and opening the hotel doors myself. They seemed more engaged chatting with each other. The room was very clean and comes with complimentary wireless internet access. Slippers were provided along with two complimentary bottles of water. Unfortunately, my room faced a high-rise office building; the offices were about 10 feet away, so we could watch each other. This was very uncomfortable as I prefer natural light and like to keep my curtains open. I tried to switch rooms, but the hotel was sold out. The marble bathroom was spacious with separate tub and shower. The Acca Kappa bath products were a nice touch. I took a shower at 7:00 a.m. and that must be prime time for showers, as water pressure suffered greatly and the temperature was only warm. Hotel location was excellent, as it's connected to The Shops at North Bridge (Nordstrom is an elevator ride away). The hotel ground floor lobby is off Rush Street, though you can cut through to Michigan Ave. by exiting through the mall. All the major stores are nearby and the hotel is well-positioned so you're within 10 minutes walking distance from the Art Institute to the south, and Water Tower Place to the north. There are many nice restaurants nearby - i.e. Volare, The Purple Pig - and others such as Spiaggia are within walking distance. I was able to obtain a corporate group rate, so didn't mind the hiccups with the Conrad Chicago. However, if I were to pay full price at over $400 a night, I will likely look elsewhere. Overall, quite a nice stay; the great service I received from certain members compensated for the other shortfalls.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise in Windy City”
Reviews.Author: wiscomilker
Reviews.Content: Popped in for weekend get-away. Room obtained via hotwire. Very impressed with size of the room & bath. Well appointed, big flat screen TV plus bose stereo, comfy bed. In the past have stayed on Michigan Ave (Intercon, Drake), this location puts you in the heart of the shopping district with lots of amenities nearby. Public garage across the street, valadation gives you $40 per day rate (vs. $42) with in/out privliges. They, like many, have gone to the free coffee in the lobby vs in-room machines - which I like as the joe is usually of better quality. Only negative is no-pool, the Intercon may get the nod as they have a great one!

Reviews.Title: “My new home in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Rick N
Reviews.Content: The layout--check in on the fifth floor -- creates an exclusiveness and the superb staffing provides the support that maintains that standard. The rooms and the bathrooms provide a special retreat feel. It makes it easy to declare this hotel my new Chicago home.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad 10/2011”
Reviews.Author: Ron M
Reviews.Content: This hotel always amazes me, either with great views from the room, massive rooms or just great service with staff going above an beyond. I had an issue with the key to my room not working so went back to front desk to get it resolved and was almost forced to take, in a good way!, an amenity to make up for the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago with my wife for the ASA annual meeting. We have been to Chicago numerous times and we have stayed at many different hotels. This was by far one of our best experiences. The rooms are large and clean. The location is excellent as you are within walking distance of exceptional shopping and restaurants. The self parking garage is very conventient and easy to use. The entire staff was very friendly and attentive. The fitness room was well equipped, spacious, and very clean. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VC88
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is excellent, located in the middle of all of the shops, even connected to Nordstrom's. Not only that, the rooms were spacious and beautiful, very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and more than helpful. Overall, my stay was just delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago In Style”
Reviews.Author: ljpebble
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad Chicago for the first time and plan on staying there again for our next visit. The location is central to resturants, shopping and city attractions. The hotel staff was friendly and provided prompt service. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of our room and how quite, as we were never disturbed by noise from other guests conversations or televisions. While there is a lot of noise from the city streets, as expected in any large city, it was very quite at night.

Reviews.Title: “you will like it”
Reviews.Author: ives
Reviews.Content: You will enjoy your stay at the Conrad in Chicago. Compares nicely with the four seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location; Excellent Frontdesk staff”
Reviews.Author: monato
Reviews.Content: hotel location was excellent; just right on the magnificient mile. the rooms were clean and so was the bathroom bed was comfortable room service was excellent and prompt very nice conceierge lady (Meg), helpful and friendly HOwever, the price was a bit over the top especially after adding all the taxes

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect appointments”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan F
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on two different occasions recently for business. Hotel staff is very friendly/helpful, rooms are clean and comfortable, and the location is central to everything downtown. If you need your shoes shinned, go across the street to the InterContinental ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Chicago - nice upscale option”
Reviews.Author: fortwaynemom
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to the Conrad Chicago. We were there for the Chicago marathon...a 3 night stay. The hotel is modern and clean and in a great central location. It is attached to a shopping area that includes Nordstrom. We had a large corner room that was fairly quiet even though it faced Michigan Avenue. There is a large pillow menu available. We used it to get foam pillows due to allergies. The bed seemed much softer than we remembered from past visits...probably time to replace the mattresses. The bathroom was large and bright. Acca kappa bath products are provided. When our faucet handle broke, housekeeping had it taken care of right away without us having to request the service...nice that they were on top of it. The Hilton honors breakfast in the restaurant was delicious and included with our voucher. I also ordered room service very early on the morning of the marathon. It arrived late and was missing part of the order. It would be nice if the restaurant could open early on marathon morning to accommodate the many runners who were staying there that weekend. I recommend a 5:00 am opening. Due to the unseasonably warm weather, the outside terrace was open. We enjoyed drinks and lunch outside and it was fabulous....so glad they opened it up to guests that late in the season. If you are a Starbucks person, there is one next door at the Marriott or across Michigan Avenue in the intercontinental. All in all a great stay. I recommend it, but would like firmer mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: drtcoghlan167
Reviews.Content: great hotel--central--good for shopping and restr., room v comfortable--good pillows and beds' 16th floor v quiet and good lift service staff super.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarioNaples
Reviews.Content: Have been at Conrad last week for a Corporate meeting. Everything was fabulous, from the room (the exact word would be "flat", a 5 people family would have been confortably accomodated in my room), the food was of excellent quality, portions not exceeding the size a normal person would be able to eat, prepared in excellent way. The staff was professional and polite, the cleanininess excellent, the terrace offered the chance for a cocktail looking at the marvellus Chicago skyline. The Hotel is located in the center of Chicago. Nothing more to demand from life!

Reviews.Title: “treated poorly, noisy room”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller038
Reviews.Content: I travel to chicago quite often, and have stayed at a bunch of hotels. I stayed at Conrad a couple of times. My impression was not too good. Both times the receptionist was quite cold and I didn't feel welcome at all. The room was noisy. Thin walls, and you could hear exactly what the next room is talking about. One time the tv was broken too, and a guy came in and took like an hour to fix it... Anyway, given that this is a 4.5 star hotel, it really didnt live up to my expectations. After the 1st time at this hotel, I thought I might give it a second try. After the 2nd time, I decided I am really not coming back, especially given that there are so many other hotels close by. The other attendees of our conferences were also complaining about the hotel. So I guess I am not alone in this...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: suee9999
Reviews.Content: I've been travelling to Chicago quite a lot for business and I really enjoy staying at the Conrad. The rooms are great very spacious and comfortable. The beds are amazing. I especially love all the littlle perks like free bottled water and bose surround system.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Chicago 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: evergreenjoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight on Oct 16, 2011. This is a fine business hotel. My overall hotel experience was very good to excellent. The staff is excellent, was able to check-in at noon. My king bed room was average in size but well appointed. Clean with upper-end appointments including plush towels, great bedding, and large HD thin screen TV. Excercise room was relatively large with standard, modern equipment including free weights, balls, and treadmills. Restaurant looked nice but did not visit. Bar is relatively small but centrally positioned on the reception floor with a modern feel. The location is very good as the hotel is accessible elevator to 5th floor reception area via (North) Michagan Ave through a mall that houses Nordstrom. Intercontiental Hotel is across the street and Marriott hotel is a few buildings north up Michigan Avenue. I used honors points. I would stay again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: We stayed three times at the Conrad Chicago in July, August, and September 2011 and have generally been very satisfied with our experiences there. We also anticipate that we will stay at the Conrad Chicago for future visits to Chicago. Our rooms were all spacious. The TVs have Bose sound systems. The beds are comfortable. Conrad Chicago bathrooms are usually quite generous (although one room we were assigned had a significantly smaller bathroom about one half the size of other rooms we had been assigned). The bathrooms have a separate deep tub and shower and a separate room for the toilet. Service at the Conrad is quite good, and the staff is friendly, helpful, and very well trained. Internet access is free and fast as compared with most hotels where we have stayed. Although we had a problem during one stay with Internet access, we did not have any other major problems during our stays. Breakfast service at the Conrad Chicago could be improved because it is often quite variable. At times breakfast comes quickly, but at other times service is quite slow. We saw more than one customer actually walk out after being seated for extended periods without being served. As it may be difficult to predict the speed of breakfast service, we suggest leaving plenty of time for breakfast. The Conrad location is excellent. It is just north of the river and is in a complex that includes Nordstrom. It is centrally located in terms of transportation options (on Michigan Avenue near multiple bus lines and the Red Line) and is near a multitude of good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfort at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: ElviraCL
Reviews.Content: Great location at the Conrad to take a good walk around the Shopping and Restaurants areas enjoying the good city air and smell. The service at the hotel is impecable from front desk till room service; although a little expensive. There was an emergency with a broken water pipe at a room next to mine and the maintenance crew reacted inmediatelly to fix the problem so next morning nobody knew there had been a problem. I really recommend it if you want to have a good memory of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: busymomtraveller
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Chicago on business September 24-27th. This is the fourth time I've stayed at this hotel. Once again, the service was excellent. Elroy on the front desk was extremely helpful as well as the concierges--I can't remember the two ladies names. Normally I travel with my husband, but this time I took my 22 year old son. He thought the hotel was nice, great decor, and fabulous location. It is my hotel of choice when I travel to 'the Windy City'!

Reviews.Title: “great service + great view”
Reviews.Author: allstaranna
Reviews.Content: We came into the city looking for a girls night out. The Conrad staff were extremely helpful right from the start and never ceased. We wanted to be central to all of our fun that evening and the Conrad was it. We were able to walk to dinner and enjoy the sights and sounds of the city. Our room was unbelieveable and surpassed all of our eexpectations. We had a terrace that overlooked the magnificent mile that of course was a great photo op. THe taste and style of the rooms were impecable--very crisp and clean, modern and very comfortable. I did not want to leave and have been wanting to go back ever since I left.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheAgeofAquarius
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago about four times a year for work, and I usually stick to Hiltons while I am there. I stayed in this hotel last winter, when it was 20 below with the wind chill. The good thing about this hotel above and beyond other hotels is that it is connected to a mall, which has several restaurants in it. You don't have to actually go outside to get food, which is nice during the Chicago winter. The breakfast is very very good, any hotel that gives me coffee from a French press will win five stars. Finally, the workout room is spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good, and Loved the Pillows!”
Reviews.Author: Travelathon
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel and we stayed here after looking for a good deal on a 5 star hotel on Priceline. We had never heard of the Conrad. LOCATION: We were surprised at this hotel's location-- right in the heart of the Gold Coast, you can walk to *everything* good. Especially for the shoppers among us. ROOMS: Yes, very good, comfortable. And we loved the pillow menu-- what a nice touch. STAFF: Unobsequious and very attentive. True to the Chicago style of friendly and professional. OTHER: This place is a find and we liked it almost as well as the Ritz or the Four Seasons. The rooms are slightly less sophisticated but you're also getting a price break. It's comparable to the Westin on the Chicago River (River North), and I'd choose the Conrad over the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: timminn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently on a one-night business trip to Chicago; this was my second time at the Conrad. Though I didn't spend much time at the hotel the experience was excellent. The room was large, modern and nicely decorated. The TV was large and there was a hook-up for my I-pod for both the room stereo and the bedside radio. Check-in and check-out was quick, efficient and friendly. There are many restaurants within short walking distance. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great time staying at the Conrad Hilton in Chicago with our dogs”
Reviews.Author: timbenimble
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really dog freindly ! Upon our arrival they came up with a dog bed, leashes, and stainless steel dog dishes. Staff was really freindly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “One of Chicago's finest”
Reviews.Author: jremke
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Conrad and the first with my family. I travel to Chicago many times a year for business, family and pleasure and have stayed at several downtown hotels. The Conrad is optimally located for shopping, dining and getting around town. The staff is helpful and friendly and service is excellent. I plan to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, comfort, location”
Reviews.Author: Pryvate27
Reviews.Content: Great gem in the heart of Michigan Ave. Just park the car and the rest is easy. Eating, shopping, shows, museums are walkin distance or maybe a cab ride away. Only complaint is the cost of valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “One among many...”
Reviews.Author: higham
Reviews.Content: ...perfectly acceptable places to stay in the heart of Chicago, although an outstanding feature is that it's located atop a mall with Nordstrom's as the anchor store. Good bedding, friendly staff. Caters to a business crowd so the bar is usually loud and crowded. Only had breakfast in their restaurant; food was fine but service can be slow due to business groups. Even though the windows didn't open, the A/C (yes, we needed it in September in Chicago!) was quiet. It was our first time in Chicago and we will go back but choose another hotel just because we like variety. Again, the Conrad was perfectly OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flowergirl20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad this past weekend. This was my first visit to Chicago (I loved the city!!). The Conrad is in an excellent location for shopping, eating, and tourist sites. It's connected to a shopping mall with Nordstrom. We walked to most places and only drove to Navy Pier and Wriggly Field. The hotel was beautiful and the rooms were clean and spacious. The only bad thing with the hotel was the size of our beds - we had 4 adults in the room and had to share 2 double beds (they don't offer bigger beds with 2 beds/room). That was tough when you're use to a king bed. However, the beds and sheets were absolutely dreamy! Parking was expensive, but expected in a big city. We valeted the car for $51/nt. Self parking across the street in a large garage for $41/24hrs. We figured the convenience of valeting was worth the extra $10 (+ tip). Would def recommend this hotel to everyone. I plan to stay here again when I go back to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property!!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin D
Reviews.Content: First time visitor to the Conrad Chicago and what a GREAT experience it was. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was fabulous and what a view of the Chicago skyline. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice in the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Soonipi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was impeccably clean EVERY day; the elevator, restaurant, our room, the lobby. We loved the bed, very comfy. The desk was spacious, the chair and ottoman were comfortable for reading, the TV was more than adequate and we enjoyed listening to the radio on the Bose sound system. Every member of the staff was extremely cordial and helpful: the front doormen, the front desk, the chambermaids and wait staff. Everyone sought to make us feel welcome, comfortable and at home. Breakfast was served hot with delicious fresh squeezed juice, and fresh bread. The omelettes and scrambled eggs were a bit dry for our taste but our over-easy eggs were just right, and the sides were very good. The coffee was excellent - hot, full bodied, but in no way acidic -excellent. The hotel is well located, but its location is also its single (small) short-coming. To be specific: 1) there is no pool, 2) the entrance is understated (if you're looking to impress someone when they drive up this isn't the place), 3) avoid walking East Illinois one block east or west of the hotel. The road goes undergrade in these areas and it is not inviting. We avoided it by going 1/2 a block north or south to Grand or Hubbard before going east or west for any of our walks. Great proximity to wonderful restaurants, walking, and shopping. Combined with the cleanliness and superior customer service we received, we will definitely look to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel in a very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: spetron
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is in a great spot, a quick walk to shopping, restaurants, the river and much more. It's quite nice, updated and xtremely clean. The lobby area (on the 5th floor) is open and has a good size lounge, terrace rooftop (in nice weather) and a restaurant. Everything you need if you don't have time to venture out too far. The hotel is also attached to the mall across the street. I had a corner room that had windows on two walls. The room was huge, especially for a downtown location. Ample space to spread out plus a comfy chair and ottoman, and a good size work desk. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the choice of pillows make a huge difference when trying to get a perfect night's sleep. The bathroom was also huge and they thought of everything in case you forgot something. On my last morning, I wanted to print my boarding pass and found they have a computer kiosk near the ATM. Icons for all the major airlines ready to go. They really pay attention to the little details that make things convenient and extra simple for their guests. I will definitely stay at the Conrad again.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: travelmavenNewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 wonderful nights at the Conrad Chicago recently. What a terrific experience! The hotel is centrally located near plenty of shopping and dining. The service was friendly without being pretentious. The hotel is extremely clean. As I was walking to our room, I saw the maid taking apart and cleaning the vents in another room! The waitress Meridith was a delight each morning when we ate in the restaurant. She was so welcoming and friendly. The creme brulee french toast is out of this world. The concierge. Asia, was also very helpful. She made the reservations for the Architectural Boat Tour - a must see, and made reservations for a local restaurant. Everything about this hotel is perfect. My husband and I are planning our next trip to the Conrad Chicago. Although a little pricey, it is well worth the money for the location and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “CONRAD PILLOW SERVICE.... WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: diamondflowers
Reviews.Content: Well everything about the Conrad was superb! Super location in downtown Chicago, super professional staff, very accomodating! Loved the bathrobe and OH !! THOSE WARM SCENTED PILLOWS! lovely!! I would definitely recommend the Conrad in downtown Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “First rate experience... service to ambience”
Reviews.Author: Bevert
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler who depends on a reliable brand such as a Ritz Carlton or Fairmount property, I was extremely impressed with the Chicago Conrad. The service was professional and friendly without being false. The appointments are comfortable and handsome. While the rooms aren't large, the layout is commodious. The bathroom is lovely, modern and quite spacious with a separate closed off toilet, allowing 2 people plenty of room for morning and evening ablutions. Two names I must give honorable mention to... Pooja at the front desk and Asya as concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for a reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexander L
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed. The cost of this hotel was very reasonable and customer service was better than that at much more expensive hotels (e.g., the Mandarin Oriental in Manhattan). I received several non-intrusive emails prior to my stay which allowed synthetic pillows to be there upon check-in (I am allergic to down). The room was modern, large, quiet and clean and the common areas were nice. Very nice views. A very reasonable lunch special topped off the experience. I would and have recommended this to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Stephen H
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is exactly what you would expect it to be. Good sized rooms, well fitted out in a traditional Corporate style. Well positioned for walking to both ends of the Shopping areas. Very friendly and helpful concierge, who cannot do enough to help your stay. Nice bar area both inside and out. Good value for money overall with no shocks in quality of delivery.

Reviews.Title: “Business Meeting at the Chicago Hilton Conrad”
Reviews.Author: Gerri A
Reviews.Content: Our group held a 2-day business meeting at the Conrad Hilton in Chicago and was very pleased with the service, the rooms and meeting space. The hotel's accommodations were larger than you would expect, nicely decorated and beds were very comfortable. Everything was top-notch from the Meeting Coordinator's expert help to the food and catering. Highly recommend this hotel to host your meetings or events.

Reviews.Title: “Soft water and pillows”
Reviews.Author: rosielovestravel
Reviews.Content: This was a great night away without the kids. This hotel has a mature feel to it, although I saw some families around. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The rooms were wonderful. This hotel obviously is interested in details. The fixtures and decor were very tasteful and higher end. I was surprised when I washed my face to find that the water was soft. Chicago tap water isn't the most tasty (although I've definitely had worse). It's one of those luxuries that can easily go unappreciated, but when noticed makes a big difference. Our view left something to be desired since it faced a solid wall of another hotel. However, we could still catch the tops of the Mag Mile buildings and enjoyed the lightening storm view. Having direct access to the mall downstairs was fun and the gelato cafe is not to be skipped. The hotel's outdoor lounge was packed with professionals dressed in business clothes, until the rain started to come down pretty hard. There is not a shortage of things to do within walking distance or a quick cab ride. In the morning, complimentary hot coffee and tea service was set up in the lobby. Thank you, Conrad hotel for offering nice loose leaf teas from Harney & Sons!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service and location”
Reviews.Author: Angela k
Reviews.Content: This is truly 5 star hotel I would recommend. Rooms were much bigger and cheaper than in New York (Wrote this after my New York trip). I arrived early morning at 10am and was able to check in. Staff was friendly and they cared to ask us how was our long flight (20 hours) and told us to have a good rest since we had the room earlier. It was indeed very thoughtful indeed. Location is great right at Magnificient Mile. The hotel is directly connected to Nordstrom. Plenty of restaurants nearby too. We had a good 3 nights stay with the pillow menu. Plenty to choose and the bed is heavenly. Breakfast was included in the room rate. It was not a buffet except on Sat but its was pretty flexible. Had the American breakfast which was more than enough and I could change it to something lighter too which I had the 2nd day, just continental breakfast. Will definitely recommend and would stay back again. Checkout was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all the way around”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisTraveler425
Reviews.Content: First time here, changing from the Allerton. It was a great experience. The room was extremely nice with great amenities. The staff is outstanding and goes out of the way to take care of the customer. Valet parking is quick, but if you choose to park your own vehicle, the garage is directly across the (covered) street. So, even if raining, you never get wet and your car is close. On a return visit to Chicago, we will be staying at the Conrad again. It was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pillow menu-HELLO!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerca
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on a week-end getaway and had an awesome time from beginning to end. Pillow menu folks...order and slumber your worries away....sigh. The bed was too heavenly, we even asked the front desk what kind of mattress they use. We were told Serta. Just Serta. If you're lucky to be there during the summer, order a pitcher of white sangria on the patio. I think it was around $48.00 USD, but for two people it was nearly 3 glasses each. A great way to end a day of sightseeing. And to top it off, the amenities were Acca Kappa-a great surprise for a beauty junkie! (It's a major step up from the generic brands and drugstore varities). So do yourself a good thing and book this hotel. Take a bubble bath with Acca Kappa, order a body pillow, and fall asleep with Serta.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME ROOFTOP”
Reviews.Author: lil_msbeautiful
Reviews.Content: My friends and I visit the rooftop every summer for girls night. We absolutely love it! Good food, drinks, ambiance and the staff is extremly helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: newrock
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Conrad during a recent business trip. My overall stay was excellent from check in to check out. I was able to check in early and was given a room on the same floor as the lobby, which was very convenient, yet quiet since it was well removed from the common areas. The room was not huge, but it was larger than standard hotel rooms, and well laid out and decorated, including a nice bathroom and a large flat screen TV. The room was very quiet during my entire stay. While the hotel itself is quite nice and recommended, it's location is fantastic. It's connected to a mall anchored by large Nordstrom's, and it is in the heart of the Miracle Mile, steps to State and Michigan.

Reviews.Title: “I was on vacation while working!”
Reviews.Author: Lois V
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Chicago hotel is a winner! I was in Chicago on business, but my stay at the Conrad created a since of being on vacation. The services and staff were outstanding. My next trip to Chicago will be a trip to the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “30th Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: Angela B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Chicago for my 30th birthday and really enjoyed staying at the Conrad. The rooms were very nice and the bathrooms are huge and so wonderful! The bed is by far one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in while traveling. The rooftop bar had good selections for wine. The only downside was having to take 2 sets of elevators to get to your room, one elevator from the ground floor to lobby and then another elevator up to the rooms from lobby. We never had to wait long for either elevator however. The location was also fantastic and very convenient to Michigan Ave shopping/restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A FANTASTIC STAY!”
Reviews.Author: SCOTT C
Reviews.Content: some of the nicest employees--bell desk, concierge, front desk, restaurant--you'll ever meet. a big city hotel--and a very nice one, but not a "big city" feel from the employees. beautiful rooms, close to everything, helpful employees--it's all you could ask. and, if you're eating breakfast there, you've gotta try the creme brulee french toast--it's the best french toast i've ever eaten!

Reviews.Title: “Condrad Experience”
Reviews.Author: MrLy
Reviews.Content: Got a chance to stay at Conrad twice. In Aug 13-2. We had a great view of the street and the last week Sept 8-11, i had a different view which is an office bldg. Very nice hotel and excellent location! Staff are very accommodating and helpful. It could have been 5 star...if they had a pool :) but no big deal as you can use the pool from another facility which is a block away..Please tell Hilton to heat there pool, it was freezing. Water in the lake is warmer :) Will not hesitate to stay here again. In fact, i am coming back in October.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Hilton Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Kathy B
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a lot of extras to make the stay comfortable. Everyone there was very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a girls weekend!”
Reviews.Author: kozamel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom for a girls weekend. We booked a two queen room and loved it. Great customer service at the front desk - I booked through expedia as a hh member so didn't get my usual perks (read the fine print before you book!) so the front desk gave me drink coupons. We had room service for breakfast both mornings that was wonderful and wonderfully served by the nicest gentlemen! The hotel is a great base for exploring the magnificent mile. The room was laid out very well with a huge bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad was elegant”
Reviews.Author: Roxelle44
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the Conrad and the room was lovely. I did find the lobby to be much more simple than I expected. It bordered on austere and had no warmth to it. But the staff and location made it a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DaveA10
Reviews.Content: Very sharp hotel. Upon check in, we were greeted with smiles, pleasant conversation, and cold bottles of water (it was 100 degrees out). Our room was very clean and well appointed. Bed was very comfortable and the pillow menu was fun. My girlfriend and I found the room to have a nice view, ample space, and plenty of towels. If you require a workout room, which we do, the Conrad has a great space on the 11th floor. Lastly, the concierge was great and made all of our reservations The location is the best attribute. Connected to Nordstroms, on the Mag Mile, and walking distance to ever bar, restaurant, and shop you can imagine. It is also just a short walk to all parks and waterfront places. Very close to subway. We will be returning or staying at Conrad's should we find ourselves in a city with one.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfy Bed”
Reviews.Author: KariG2011
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a really nice hotel, but not really extravagent. Convenient location (anything on the loop is). We got the morning breakfast, which was an extra $20 per night ($10/person), which was a pretty good deal for what you get (about half the cost if you purchased the same food without the promotion). Great coffee. The best thing about the hotel is the bed - super comfortable. I want to live in that bed. The decor is a bit worn - art deco style that needs to shine to look good. But still overall very nice. I'd recommend it. If you stay here, walk over to Purple Pig and have dinner - very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from a Conrad”
Reviews.Author: Maurizio_and_Jill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad in Indianapolis last year, and expected the same level of luxury and opulence at the Conrad in Chicago. While the service and personnel where helpful and kind, the room (a suite, of all things) didn't feel quite as grand and luxurious as I had come to expect from a hotel in this class. I can't find fault with anything specific, but I just found this Conrad to be wanting in terms of the guest experience, the decor of its rooms, and that "step above" touch that distinguishes nice from superb. Bottom line, I would probably stay at the Sofitel in Chicago rather than the Conrad, even if i'm a Hilton Honor member.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the City”
Reviews.Author: mzqb
Reviews.Content: We used to live in Chicago, but had no idea which hotel to stay at for a Labor Day Weekend trip. After reading the reviews on trip advisor, we chose the Conrad. We had an absolutely fantastic stay. The hotel is incredibly affordable and comes with all of the extras that you would normally pay for at other hotels. Free internet, water, fridge, robes, slippers, huge bathroom, Bose DVD player. When we wanted to heat up leftovers, they brought up a microwave and utensils. The beds are comfortable and the location is central to everything. Parking is pretty expensive, but good luck finding parking for less than $35 a day anywhere downtown. Would recommend to anyone wanting a peaceful oasis in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been Better!”
Reviews.Author: indianatraveler33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Labor Day weekend. We did not have one single complaint with the hotel and will definitely be booking here again the next time we are lucky enough to spend a few nights in the great city of Chicago. The location was perfect. The staff was perfectly friendly and helpful. The room was large, clean and equipped with everything we needed plus more. The bed was probably the most comfortable hotel bed we have ever had. The bathroom was amazing - especially the large, deep soaking tub that was just what I needed after a long day of walking in the city. Just absolutely LOVED this hotel and can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: roadsnottaken
Reviews.Content: Visiting Chicago for six days last week of August into early September. Chose the Conrad for its location at the south end of "Miracle Mile" and near the Chicago River. Hotel is connected to a small upscale mall with its main entrance on Rush St and an additional entrance through the mall onto Michigan Ave. Lobby is located on the floor 5 accessed via an elevator from street level. Don't know what all the fuss is about with some reviewers - extra three minutes to get into the lobby of the hotel - not a major inconvience. In fact it offered a sense of greater security coming in off the street. There was never more than a 2 minute wait to get to the front desk - often service was available immediately. Outdoor and indoor restaurant located on this level as well. Only ate at the hotel for breakfast at the interior/indoor location - so I can only comment on this area. At all 5 breakfasts, food was fresh and promptly prepared. The non-ala carte waitered breakfast menu included eggs any style, toast with jams/butter, sausage, selection of cereals, fruit, OJ, coffee and a selection of teas. I had insisted on a number of items 3 weeks prior to arriving at the hotel when making my reservation - quiet area of the hotel limiting noise from external and internal sources; having the use of a mini fridge and a coffee maker during our stay. All were waiting for us upon our arrival on the 16th floor. As the hotel is only 17 floors, the street noise is not entirely eliminated - you'd probably have to at least be double the height- but the location of our room away from internal noise sources and not facing Michigan Ave was most likely the best the hotel could offer. Room had one king bed - pillows a little soft for our liking - otherwise fine. Quiet A/C. Well appointed with flat screen TV, sound system, ipod charger/radio, reading pot lights, seperate toilet room, shower and bath, makeup magnifying mirror. During our six days, we were offered or asked no less than a dozen times, if we needed anything or how our stay was going. It was always unsolicited and offered by the front desk, the concierge, the maintenance staff or the restaurant staff. It added to the enjoyment of the vacation knowing that the hotel was genuinely concerned about our well-being. Only downside, no pool. Although I was aware of this when booking, that combined with a spa, would have put the hotel teetering on a five-star rating. We did utilize the pool once at the Homewood Suites, a block away, but it wasn't worth the effort. Would I stay again - yes - for the value and service, but I would look elsewhere if I wanted a pool/spa and a higher, somewhat quieter street/river location.

Reviews.Title: “Number One Choice for Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Publius28
Reviews.Content: The hotel, formerly the Le Meridien, is conveniently connected to the Shops at North Bridge mall, easily accessible from the hotel's fifth floor lobby and a short elevator trip. As such, despite the main lobby being on Rush St. the shopping drag of North Michigan Avenue is easily accessible from the hotel. Despite arriving at a busy period of the day, check-in was handled swiftly and politely and key cards were handed out in no time. We reserved a junior suite for our two night stay and as you can see from the pictures, it was more space than we actually needed. Bottles of water were provided and were replenished daily, there was a jogging map provided with the different recommended routes depending on the distance run, wired and wireless internet was available and it was complimentary for our stay. Despite the boring interior design, the room was comfortable and airy. The bed was certainly the highlight of our stay and it easily ranked as one of the best hotel beds I have every slept on. The bathroom had separate shower and bathtub which I truly appreciate, and the toilet was in a separate room within the bathroom, something my wife truly appreciates. Toothbrush, toothpaste, combs and mouthwash were provided, a rarity in the age of cost-cutting. Something which I think is lacking from a hotel such as the Conrad is the in-room coffee maker. Instead, the hotel has replaced it with a limited self-service table of coffee, tea, water and newspapers, located just outside the restaurant in the lobby. They quickly run out especially on days with high occupancy. For a more detailed review, please go to http://playingforpici.com

Reviews.Title: “Had a vacation within a vacation at the Concrad.”
Reviews.Author: wlkderricott
Reviews.Content: I came over to Chicago for a mother/daughter week-end with my daughter. My husband is a Diamond Hilton member, and staying at a Hilton property is a high priority when I choose a hotel property. The Conrad appeared to meet all my requirements prior to staying there, such as location, breakfast, work out facitilty, and parking. We parked directly across the street which saved a money. I fell in love with the location of the Conrad being on North Michigan, mere steps away from Nordstrom, plus other shopping retailers. We had a incredible amount of resturants to choose from for dinner. Upon check-in we were upgraded into a Junior Suite with a view. The living room was large including a dining room table. The bathroom was unbelievable. I think my daughter took three baths in two days. The hotel will bring up special oils and salts to make your bath more relaxing. There is a menu of services provided for taking a bath. The bed was comfortable and the bedding was inviting. The best part of bed time was being able to order a special pillow that would allow your night's sleep to be the comfortable as possible. My daughter ordered the body pillow and still would like one to this day. We did not bring our dogs to the Conrad; we loved the fact the Conrad allows dogs. The Conrad makes your dog's stay at the Conrad as memorable as his or her owners. Offering services such as dog walking, dog day care, dog beds, dog "special" food, dog spa. Since we ate a late lunch we opted for room service later in the evening. It took about 45 minutes, which I thought was slow. We were not hungry and time was not an issue. The cruisine looked as if a pastry chef had made it and sent it right up to our room. It was expensive, but I was excepting a high tab. For one coffee, one hot tea, and two cheesecakes the tab was $87.00. I didn't mind the expensive room service bill since I was able to look out and see excitment of the city, the beauty of Lake Michigan and grandure of Navy Pier. We wanted to enjoy the luxury of our suite, the view, the relaxing baths, and a perfect night sleep with our "special" pillows. It was like we had a vacation within our vacation at the Conrad. I would strongly encourage if staying in the city over the week end or a period of time to spend the extra money and upgrade into a suite. I stayed at the Hilton on South Michigan and would choose the Conrad not for the locations, but the amenties, and the staff. The only down side, which happens at every hotel you stay at downtown if it be in Chicago or New York is the noise of the city. I have found no matter the price of a room, it is unavoidable that one will hear the noise from the city below. The Conrad exceeded my expectation from the staff treating us like royalty, to the extra touches of the pillows to the best location on Michigan Avenue. Without a doubt or hestitation I will stay at the Conrad again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, superfriendly staff, nice room. Would like to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Maria_Ture
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel with the perfect location!!! The TV in my double room broke down so they moved me to a suite at the 17th floor. The suite was amazing with a spectacular view of the busy city-life outside. The staff was really helpful and friendly, however it took a while for us to get our luggage from the bell-boy when we were leaving. I really liked this hotel and i would love to return here!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: rich527
Reviews.Content: Just had an amazing 4 days and 3 nights at this wonderful property. As someone who is in the business, their team is AMAZING. So attentive to details. The front desk has an amazing team led by Ioannis V., front desk team members Ron, Eloy, Mary Elise all go above and beyond to exceed your expectations. Meg, the concierge, is always so personable, friendly and welcoming back to the property. The doorman, Slav, is quick to assist. Housekeeping Team Member Cecilia for turndown was so efficient and her follow up was great! All in all, this is the must place to stay when visiting Chicago! I can't say enough positive things in regards to the rooms, location, and overall service!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad for 3 nights in April. Overall, had a good stay. I was traveling with family and they found two rooms beside each other. The rooms were comfortable and the bathrooms are quite large, with a separate toilet closet. The TV's even have a surround sound system. The Conrad is well located and walkable to many of the sights and restaurants. The connection to the mall is also convenient. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Only kink in my stay was the neighbouring room - as they seem to be having a "party" late in the night.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Pammie15802
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. Great ammenities and the service was outstanding. Everyone was very friendly. The doorman Jose especially was very helpful and provided a great level of service. Would stay there again if my travels take me to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: silvirub
Reviews.Content: Over the years, I have stayed at several hotels in my travels. I have to admit that the Conrad Chicago rates close to the top of the list. Other than my room could have had a better view, the room itself was spacious, the bed and pillows very, very comfortable, and the bathroom amenities just delightful. Every time I came back in, concierge and the front desk staff always welcomed me and customer service, in general, was exceptional. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: RobS2030
Reviews.Content: My partner and I made last minute plans to stay at the Conrad due Hurricane Irene threatening to visit Miami where we had a room booked. It was a thoroughly enjoyable stay in Chicago thanks in large part to the Conrad! We have traveled extensively and stayed in many luxury hotels and this one was by far one of our best experiences. We made reservations through the hotels website and chose the option for an upgrade ($10/night) to a room with a balcony. The check-in process went smoothy and efficiently and we were given a room on the 16th floor with a huge balcony that was shared with the suite next door. The views of Michigan Ave were awesome!! We could even see the lake from two angles. The room was large and very clean, the bed and bedding very comfortable and luxurious. Location was perfect. The entire Conrad staff was very friendly and accomodating and helpful with every detail...from the doormen to the front desk to the housekeepers. The only minor issue involved parking. We chose to self-park ($40/night) directly across the street in Nordstroms ramp. When we went to retrieve the car we were charged an extra $31 because the 24 hour period had expired since we originally parked. The hotel staff promptly credited our account for this. Just keep this in mind when parking...it is based on 24 hour time periods. I would highly recommend the Conrad for an excellent stay in Chicago! P.S. I rarely write reviews but thought this was well deserved!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Catherine Q
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel in perfect location in Chiago (Magnificent Mile). Hotel room very big - not easy to get a family of 4 into one room without having inter-connecting so this was perfect for us. You can check out from the room too. Aside from generously-sized rooms, the customer service was fantastic - staff couldn't do enough for us, amazing customer service. Other great things:- you can get a lift from hotel straight into fantastic mall, then straight onto Michigan Avenue and the rooftop terrace was lovely at the hotel. Beautiful and comfortable seating, very relaxing. Visiting Chicago again, I won't even consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: ahornaday
Reviews.Content: Very overrated hotel. We usually stay at the Peninsula but wanted to try something new...will definitely return to the Peninsula!! Stayed in other Conrad hotels which are far beyond the level of this hotel. Rooms need renovated, light bulbs out in the room, no coffee pot in room, and just overall looked run down. Bed was very comfortable. Good water pressure in shower. Only a single sink in bathroom (would expect double sink in a hotel such as the Conrad). Booked our room on Conrad's site and prepaid prior to our arrival due to the rate rules. When we arrived at 2:45ish (checkin is 3:00) and our rooms were not available and were placed in a room below the category booked and paid for. No change in rate was offered. Brought a bottle of wine from our cellar to enjoy prior to dinner one night. We took the bottle down to the lobby and were given glasses from the bar without any issue. Opened the bottle and took it outside to enjoy on the terrace and was approached by hotel staff that said they would charge a corking fee if we were going to sit on the terrace and drink it!! So we moved into the lobby!! Incredible!! Very disappointing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “City pleasures”
Reviews.Author: WJW52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad Hilton in downtown Chicago while visiting to see the U2 concert. The location of the hotel, while not the best for the concert, was great for restaurants and shopping, albeit pricey! We did not even have to venture outside to get to Nordstrom's, which was an added bonus. The bed was wonderful, the people very helpful and pleasant, and the location the best. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, but beware of package deals from Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: Infaith07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while visiting Chicago. The Conrad is a nice hotel and moderately priced for the area, but beware of package deals from Hilton. Let me start out by saying, overall we enjoyed our stay at the Conrad. Our room was very clean, the beds were appointed nicely and we had a nice large flat screen TV in our room. The hotel is in a very good location. Close and within walking distance to many attractions, but far enough away from everything that it is quiet and peaceful at night. We only had two main issues with the hotelâ€¦one moderate and one major issue. Moderate first, the air conditioning. Although, the air conditioner was on 65, our room was warm. After calling the front desk, a maintenance technician came to our room. He informed us that the hotel had installed energy efficient motion sensors in each room. The sensor recognizes when someone has entered the room. When this occurs the air conditioner then comes onâ€¦great for saving the hotel moneyâ€¦bad if you are out all day and enter into a room that takes forever to cool down. The maintenance technician â€œfixedâ€� it so that we could have cooler air all the time. Problem solved. Our biggest issue was our package deal. When we booked the Conrad through Hilton, we bought their package that included parking. The representative over the phone told us that the parking would include onsite self-parking. Sadly this was not the case. Although the hotel does have self-parking which is attached to the hotel and shared with Nordstromâ€™s, we were made to park two and a half blocks from the hotel. Upon check in we were told that the parking package was for a parking garage off-site. WHAT! Needless to say, this morning when we went to get the car at 5am it was extremely scary. Please be forewarned, if you are driving, do not get this package. Not to mention, the parking that is attached to the hotel, was only a couple dollars more than the package. Other than the aforementioned, the hotel was nice AND if you stay over on a Sunday night, I highly recommend eating at the hotel restaurant located on the roof top. Every Sunday night, they show a movie while you are eating dinner. Very nice! Please feel free to email me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 4merCheezHed
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Conrad. I stay here mainly because it is familiar to me. Location is good, parking is easy (expensive), and the rooftop lounge is nice. No major problems, but nothing unforgettable either.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JimAndDora
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and it's in a great location. We asked the concierge for a dinner sugestion the moment we arrived and she was great. Although this hotel is perfect for shopping, all we wanted was great restaurants and sight seeing. Our room was perfectly comfortable and the gym was great. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places I ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: Gail P
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago and we had no idea where to stay. I did a lot of research and decided on the Conrad Chicago. My daughter and I have stayed at many hotels throughout the country but this was one of the nicest. This is the only time I have ever written about a hotel. The room was clean, the bed was really comfortable and all the facilities were excellent. Most of all, the staff was exceptional! Everyone was helpful, friendly, and efficient. It was an absolute pleasure staying there. When I go back to Chicago, I plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: TCKFallsChurch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love to stay at good hotels right in the center of downtown, and the Conrad was perfectly located a very short walk from Michigan Ave (around the corner and up the stairs to upper Michigan), then a short stroll to the river (for an architectural cruise), and a little longer down the avenue to Millenium Park and the weirdly fascinating Bean. Only a couple of long blocks to Navy Pier. We arrived just after noon on a Saturday but had no problem moving directly to the room. Desk staff was wonderfully helpful, giving us our preferred room on a high floor with a city view (although we laughed that every room had a view of the city). The concierge gave us a map, recommended walking to a couple of sites nearby and suggested restaurants. We met our son at The Purple Pig, which was less then 2 minutes away. The Conrad was perfect: bright room, comfortable big bed, lots of pillow selections, lush robes, a big tub with separate shower, free wireless, and very quiet for sleeping. It was our first trip to the Second City, and I hope not our last visit to Chi-town or the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: RSW777
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of hotels around the country (Hilton Diamond), and this one ranks near the top, if not #1 on my list. Great location and very sophisticated. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star stay in every respect.”
Reviews.Author: barrogers
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to chicago so as with any first time visit we did not know what to expect. It's safe to say that aside from a really uncomfortable cab ride in this is now our favourite city in the states. A big part of this was our stay at the Conrad. From the moment we arrived to the day we checked out we were greeted everywhere with smiles. As we were celebrating an anniversary I applied for the discounted upgrade on booking, whereby if the room is available on check in you can avail of an upgrade for a better deal than booking outright. We managed to get the upgrade to the terrace suite 1609. Words can't describe how perfect this room was. It was a corner suite with a large terrace overlooking the mag mile and John Hancock on one side and the tribune building on the other. The room itself was very spacious with a living area and a separate large bed/en suite. Both rooms equipped with 42 inch tvs. Everything was finished to a very high standard. Anytime we needed help with anything the concierge was more than helpful. We went to see a NFL game and our tickets were arranged for us. We even got a 50% discount on a special offer that was on for the game which I know we would not have got on our own. Our dinner reservations were made on request all with no issues. I think the ladies name was annaleese that looked after us so a special thank to her. Apoogies if the spellings off ;). If you're a shopper then this hotel is definitely for you. It is actually attached to a shopping centre. When you walk out the door of that centre you are on the mag mile. Everything is within walking distance including navy pier, the oak street and north avenue beaches. All in all we would highly recommend the Conrad for your stay in Chicago really no fault to be found.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great service.”
Reviews.Author: Ella_4610
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great service and great location. I will stay here on my next visit to Chicago. We walked to most attractions in the area.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoGir1
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful time in Chicago in part by our stay at the Conrad. From the maintenance guy to the maid, to the front desk staff we were consistently greeted and told to have a nice day with a smile. Our room was PERFECT...quiet, great bed and pillows, and really appreciated the huge sunken tub and separate glassed in shower stall. Great service by the concierge who booked us at Benny's for a most memorable meal to celebrate husband's 50th birthday. I HIGHLY recommend the Conrad for all the reasons mentioned but also for its perfect location that's walking distance to pretty much anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and enthusiatically recommended.”
Reviews.Author: mchoi19V
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, roomy and tastefully decorated room with luxurious bathroom. Cordial and professional staff. Excellent inclusive breakfast with french press coffee. Easy walking distance to Millennium Park, Navy Pier, and Magnificent Mile shopping. Grand train station just 2 blocks away. Truly one of the best hotel experiences we've had.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Theresa H
Reviews.Content: It was elegant, clean, and the staff was so incredibily courteous. We frequent Chicago for pleasure trips and plan to make the Conrad our regular lodging. What is really cool is that it is attached to a five story mall. The work out facility is clean, roomy, and filled with well-working equipment. The bed is extremely comfortable, room well appointed - huge flat screen, up-graded sound system, decent bathroom amenities, robes & slippers. One down fall - the fire station is close by and I was awoken a couple of times at night, but I think if I up-grade to a room facing the lake the noise maybe reduced if not totally eliminated. I'm going to give it a try next visit.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it and are looking forward to returning!”
Reviews.Author: Chad S
Reviews.Content: We could not have picked a better hotel to spend our anniversary. The staff was very friendly and took care of our every need. The room was as nice as the image on the website(not always the case with most hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nashbill
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the heart of down town Chicago. Extremely impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms and the quality of the service. The food at the restaurant was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: Janet B
Reviews.Content: Our room was large and very clean. The staff paid special attention to the asthma and allergies issues we mentioned when we booked. The hotel is in an excellent location for shopping, sightseeing and just walking around. The concierge, Meg was fantastic. She got us last minute tickets to a play, 2 ball games and Paul McCartney, with no extra charges on the ticket price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: AandNL
Reviews.Content: I am definitely not the type of person who typically enjoys hotels, however I would advise anyone going to Chicago to stay here! I have huge issues with cleanliness, Our room was spotlessly clean and enormous for the price we paid. Although it was located on a busy street we were high enough that we didn't hear any noise. Both nights of our stay I had a peaceful nights sleep. All the staff were really helpful ensuring that our stay was enjoyable. I highly recommend the Conrad and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very well done; excellent trained staff”
Reviews.Author: boiseidaho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for a couple of nights whilst traversing across the USA. We were very happy with the excellent staff and service. If you have a lot of luggage, please utilize the Rush Street entrance and allow the bell staff to take your luggage to the room. We parked first in the hotel parking garage and had to make multiple trips up two elevators with our luggage. Parking is expensive at $40 per night. Pets are allowed, welcomed, and are no additional charge. The closest pet park is about 1 block away on Rush next to the river. Navy Pier is about 5 blocks away. Michigan Ave. is one block away. The gym is first-rate. There is no pool. If you would like to swim, you may use the facilities at the Homewood Suites, around the corner. BTW, we took three cab rides during our stay. Each cab was clean and the drivers were polite and got us to our destinations post-haste. Bravo Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here anytime.”
Reviews.Author: travelindan
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the rooms are very nice and quiet. Rates are a bit pricey but for downtown Chicago they are fair especially if you get the "parking package". Rooms are ample size. The bathrooms are spacious. We used to stay at another downtown hotel, that was very nice, but their bathrooms were tiny. At 6 ft 2 inch and 240 lbs, at 60 yrs old it was getting harder to navigate the toilet paper holder, shower/tub combo while taking a seat. Not so at the Conrad. Separate throne room, separate tub and separate shower. Beds are very nice with huge down pillows. Staff was always helpful and polite. The Terrace Bar & Grill is a nice place for cocktails and appitizers (could make a meal out of some of them).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and high end!”
Reviews.Author: lyndsey100
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this hotel. Me and my mom go shopping before christmas every year and always come back to the conrad hotel. Its perfect location and within walking distance to everything-shops, restaurants and it's connected to the north bridge mall. Mary's Cafe around the corner is a MUST. Amazing breakfast for around $6. A carriage ride at night is great also for seeing the christmas trees/lights. Conrad hotel also has a great pillow service. VERY clean and up to date rooms. Ipod dock, bose sound system, flat screen tv and dvd player. Not one complaint yet and have been there 4 times. If you're looking for a higher end hotel stay but still within budget, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: EYtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a business trip. The hotel is centrally located in Chicago on Rush Street. I was able to walk everywhere i needed to go which included Al's Italian Beef and Gino's East Pizza. The hotel is a $45 taxi ride from O'Hare Airport. Checkin is on the 5th floor lobby. The hotel is very nice and clean considering it is in an old building. My room was clean and a decent size. Bathroom was very roomy. The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. I slept very well. Internet was free. Unfortunately I did not get to use the gym or Spa. We had catered meals in the meeting rooms which were quite good. If the quality of the food was an indication of the restaurants then I wouldnt mind eating there. The staff at the front desk was very helpful and courteous. Checkin took me literally 45 seconds. If you are here on business this is definitely a great hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Civilized”
Reviews.Author: badger12311
Reviews.Content: Been here before & will come back. Very civilised, no riff raff. Good staff, rooms & food. Room service was quick and the food was hot. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Dealing with faulty keycards wasted so much of my time”
Reviews.Author: Vicky C
Reviews.Content: i just finally got into my hotel room after having to go to the front desk to get my key cards reprogramed for the 8th time this trip. i have spent too much of the few hours of personal time that i have on this business trip walking back and forth between the front desk and the hotel room. This issue has occurred every day that i have been here this week and the hotel has only now started to think that it is an issue the needs to be address by more than just a reprogramming of the key cards and yet another reminder to keep it away from anything that would demagnetize it. The rooms and nice and clean and the staff are friendly but the key card issue and how long it was allowed to go on for before someone thought to really look into, it is enough for me to think twice about recommending it to anyone else. the location is great but it isn't the only hotel in the area either. if you do stay here i hope they have the key card issues fixed so that you don't miss out on chicago as i did. i'm giving them and average because if it wasn't for the issues with the keycards it would actually be a higher rating. oh and the fact that i am on the 5th floor and can hear every bit of traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Small Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trve
Reviews.Content: Convenient location downtown with excellent staff. It would be nicer if there was free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great rates, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Melissa G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for 3 nights and had a great trip. We read countless reviews of Chicago hotels because it was our first visit to the city and went wit the Conrad based on reviews we read here. I'm very pleased that we chose the Conrad. The hotel was in the perfect location.
