We were just an elevator ride to great shopping and the stores on Michigan Ave. We could walk to many attractions, great restaurants and would pick this as the perfect spot. Rooms were quite nice. I wouldn't say they were huge or extremely fancy but they were clean, had a nice tv, robes, comfy bed, pillows, water bottle on the nightstand... Hotel staff were very helpful, nice and very efficient throughout our stay. My only negatives would be that it doesn't have a lot of "wow" in the lobby and the price of parking. It's very basic and when you enter from Rush Street, you basically come into a small room with an elevator. You need to go to the fifth floor to check in We didn't need a fancy lobby but I just expected it too be a little nicer. It would also be nice to not have to pay $40-51/night to park when paying for a hotel. Overall, I'd definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone looking to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorites in Chicago. Will definitely be back.”
Reviews.Author: Vinny516
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, quiet on the guest floors, service provided by all staff is excellent, all the things we look for in a hotel. We stay very busy when in Chicago and want a quiet, clean, well cared for hotel to return to at the end of a busy day/evening.

Reviews.Title: “In love with luxury”
Reviews.Author: Nurat Q
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the most luxurious hotel i've ever stayed in. The hotel is located in the heart of the Magnificent Miles, adjacent to the mall, surrounded by heavenly shopping centers and restaurants and close to the water.

Reviews.Title: “Top knotch hotel, service and location”
Reviews.Author: kelliepickhardt
Reviews.Content: We stayed with 5 of our family members over a long weekend. We are fellow hoteliers and I must say that their staff really went out of their way to take care of not just us but all of the guests. The rooms were imaculately clean, well appointed and very spacious for a downtown hotel. Location was wonderful for shopping, sightseeing and very convenient to public transit. Bottled water in your room and complimentary coffee in the lobby each morning were great touches. Concierge and front desk were extremely helpful with directions and recommendations. Our entire family had a great time and we will choose this hotel when we return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: BERNEY56
Reviews.Content: I arranged for 2 rooms for a one day business meeting combined with a weekend city vacation with spouses. The hotel was just great. Rooms were large, clean, well appointed with the expected high end linens and amenities. I appreciated the staff -- even the person vacuuming the lobby stopped and called the elevator when we arrived and waited until we were in the elevator before continuing. That is attention to detail. Everyone was professional and helpful. Can't describe how much we enjoyed staying at the Conrad. It was fun being able to shop at Nordstroms steps away from the Conrad Lobby -- which is connected to the Shops at North Bridge. Free internet is also a nice touch for an upscale hotel. (Competitors: Take note!) Its all in the details -- except the Terrace Bar -- its not the same service as elsewhere in the hotel. Breakfast was excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “We're coming!”
Reviews.Author: SW1819
Reviews.Content: I've booked my family for the Conrad in a few weeks. Aug 28 - Sept 2nd After a review of a number of hotels in Chicago, I am expecting a great stay. I'll let everyone know how it goes!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel -Good Location”
Reviews.Author: 06champs
Reviews.Content: We decided to book the Conrad for a trip that included 2 Cubs games and also wanted to visit the Taste of Chicago. It was a bit odd to check-in on the 5th floor of the hotel, but everything was very quick on check-in. We were aware that the Parking is very expensive(as it is everywhere in Chicago) Everyone at the hotel was very helpful on where to eat and to get to the Red Line Metro Stops. It was the first time we had taking the Metro to the Cubs games and it was a short 2 block walk to the station which was very secure with many places open even after the night game. We did take a Cab to the Taste as that was a bit of a walk. It was also very close to shopping as it's connected to the Nordstroms and we did a little shopping across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing lack of professionalism”
Reviews.Author: regular-traveller25
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with great expectations. I had family visiting from outside the country and wanted them to have a good experience in Chicago. Upon arriving to the hotel (at the exact time I indicated in my reservation) I was told Iâ€™ve been â€œdowngradedâ€� to a lesser quality room. I travel very often and never had this before. Moreover, I did not hear a single â€œIâ€™m sorryâ€�, it was like usual business. What bothered me the most was that the receptionist kept telling me â€œI will decrease the rate for youâ€� â€œwhat do you think, nice eh?â€� like he was doing me a favor!!!! They decreased the rate to that of the rooms they gave us of course (which is the legal thing to do, since I am sure is illegal to charge me for one room and give me a lesser value one for the same money). They did not care that I wanted higher level room independent of value. I did not know what to say, since this never happened to me before, also with family present did not want to start arguing. The rooms were nice (not as nice as I thought) and location is good, however be aware that they might not honor your reservation and not even apologize for this. That is enough for me not to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: chezdbirds
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a girls weekend in Chicago where we stayed at the Conrad. The location canâ€™t be beat, with so many shopping and dining options close by. Most notable is the level of service, which was outstanding from the minute we stepped from our cab. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. We we especially liked the little details such as the basket of slippers, the assortment of wine and drinking glasses, the remote caddy, and the nifty round power strip on the desk top that allowed us to charge 2 phones and a kindle with extra outlets to spare. How many times have you had to move the furniture and unplug a lamp in your hotel room so that you could charge your phone! Will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Super Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: Kristen0599
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad for my birthday weekend. Although I wish we would have upgraded to a suite, the city view king room wasn't bad. Ordered from the pillow menu and the relaxation pillow was wonderful along with the body pillow. Bathroom was very large and room in general comfortable. Location is ideal with a short walk thru the connected mall and you are right outside Michigan Ave. Price was very good and the best part is that internet was free. Believe it or not, a lot of the hotels in Chicago charge for internet. We chose to self park across the street and paid $40.00 for 2 days. We didn't have any issues other than it did take a while to actually find a spot in the parking garage however once parked it was easy to get to the hotel. Conrad was very clean and nice however we will stay somewhere else next time just to try something different.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Conrad! One of the best hotels I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: SALovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: The Conrad in Chicago is an excellent hotel. The location is excellent, the rooms are fantastic and they go out of their way to make you feel comfortable. There is even a complimentary pillow menu where you can choose a pillow which suits your requirements. Overall a pleasant stay, I will definately be coming back when I am next in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a great price...”
Reviews.Author: wolfwatcher2000
Reviews.Content: We liked the location, the room, the bose system for the TV, and the breakfast there. The only problem we had was the AC didn't cool like we thought it should....maintenance guy came up and did something to help it that night. Value: We paid $225 a night. (Nights of July 29-30). Some of the other places we were quoted $279 and up. For the amount of time we actually stayed in the room, you can't beat it for the convenience of everything around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrific room”
Reviews.Author: cookndad
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few days in Chicago and chose the Conrad based on ratings, location, and price. We were not disappointed. Fantastic location...close to shopping, restaurants, architectural rivers tours, etc. The parking is expensive, but apparently no more than the rest of Chicago. Very comfortable beds and roomy rooms. The shower heads could have been more powerful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat on the Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: Maconmerlyn
Reviews.Content: The jr suite was available at check-in for $10/night more...what a great deal. 16th floor, a long shared balcony overlooking the city, very spacious. Service was great, food was good at breakfast (only time we ate at hotel). Note that check-in is on the 5th floor which can make for long elevator waits from people coming and going. Would be my first choice to stay again when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: travelnomi
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is centrally located, near Magnificent Mile shops, lots of good eats and in walking distance to the train station and bus stops. The beds were super comfy, the shower was spacious and the waterflow---strong! The rooms are big, equipped with a flat screen tv and dvd player. If you leave your dvds behind, don't fret. There is a small but decent collection of flicks at the front desk for your viewing pleasure. There is a rooftop bar. I didn't take advantage of it but it seemed like a cool place to grab a drink or a small bite. The hotel is super clean, the staff were friendly and polite, and although not cheap, it was definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Service was excellent, great location, great views of the city”
Reviews.Author: lhayes083
Reviews.Content: This a great location in Chicago if you want to see the sights such as Millenium park, grant park, Navy Pier, shopping at Water Tower Place, State street, or go to one of the Theatres.There was a problem when we first arrived..The air conditioning had failed from a storm, which we found out shortly before arrival. When we got there we spoke with the general manager Mr. H. about the situation. Luckily it had just been fixed, but was still too early, 1/2 hr before check-in. Mr H. made sure we checked in early , upgraded us and sent a bottle of wine to the room. The view was great especially at nite. would definitly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: tnbookworm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked into the middle of Chicago, walking distance to everything we wanted to see. Our room was beautiful and spacious and we loved the soakage tub! The staff was attentive without being intrusive. The exercise facility was adequate and a hot tub/spa would have been nice. The terrace bar offered delicious and generous appetizers. Would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved it-Be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: msmrm19
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were very nice. All staff were pleasant and attentive. Location was perfect! I would highly recommend the hotel. The only issue was the elevator wait.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dogchase7053
Reviews.Content: We were able to reserve our room at The Conrad Chigaco at a discounted rate through getaroom.com and we were thrilled! This hotel is absolutely beautiful! The service was excellent, courteous, and helpful. The rooms were fabulous! The beds and pillows were amazingly comfortable. There are large flat screen tvs, iHome radio/alarm clock, 2 robes and 2 pairs of slippers provided, huge bath towels, beautiful glass shower, large bathroom, etc, etc, etc. The concierge was very helpful. There is a self-parking ramp or valet parking. One of the doorways to the Conrad Chicago leads directly to Michigan Ave. Once we were parked there was no need to get back in the car. Everythng you could ever want or need is within walking distance from the hotel, or there are many public transportation options available near the hotel. There is no question in my mind that I would return to the Conrad Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “A Blend of Professional, Classic and Trendy - and great Rooftop/Patio Lounge!”
Reviews.Author: missjae15
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Chicago has a unique rooftop/patio bar-lounge. When it's nice out, the place fills up with people that want to soak up the sun or have a meal or drink outside. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The rooms are very polished and the amenities are plush. The gym is ample and a lot of the equipment seems new. They serve Sangria in pitchers, if you like. One big plus is that it connects to a small mall with a food court and other shops, as well as a Nordstrom, should the weather not permit you to go outside (like when it poured rain the first day I was there.) I don't believe there is a pool or hot tub, however.

Reviews.Title: “Met every expectation....Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: hibeta
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nicely appointed, clean and fresh. Service at the front desk was excellent with fabulous assistance graciously provided to help select restaurants for dining. The room was very nice, as expected, and appeared to be like new. Great view from the 12th floor. Convenience to shopping and the Magnificent Mile was superb. We were able to walk nearly everywhere, including the Navy Pier. Overall, an absolutely delightful experience and well worth the price paid for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, the nicest room I've been in for under $300 + excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: eberger98
Reviews.Content: Took the family to Chicago for the weekend. Read thru a bunch of reviews and finally picked the Conrad. What a surprise when we arrived. Came with a Bose system, including DVD. 40" flat screen. Choice of pillow types, plush plush bedding - all top quality. Granite counter tops, large room and free WiFi (hotels actually charge for that in Chicago). Think it even had Apple TV, though I never tried to connect to it. The employees were all very helpful , and always happy to help. Made for an enjoyable day trips to the strip (right off Michigan) and allowed you to comfortably relax after 100 deg F days walking around town. Top Notch!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Superb ... you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: B0_C
Reviews.Content: Staying in the heart of Chicago for a couple of nights will cost a little extra, but it's worth it if you want to see the city in it's excellence. Getting the best/reasonable rate is the challenge and we further complicated our search because we have a small dog and needed to find a pet friendly hotel. Conrad Hilton was perfect. Very reasonable rate and great location for everything we wanted to do in Chicago. -- and more than pet friendly. More like pet accommodating. Great customer service and attention to detail. Room was excellent and comfortably hosted 3 adults, 1 teenager and one dog.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: ATLkams
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for a family reunion and came into the City for two nights...we were not dissapointed. The rooms are very large and comfortable and the hotel staff is great. The pillow menu looked wonderful but I liked the standard pillow so much, I felt no need to change. I do have a parking issue to resolve with the hotel-they charged us and we had to pay to get out of the garage-but I am sure I will not have a problem. Expect an update if I do. Over the years, we have stayed in quite a few downtown hotels and this is one I will definitely come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: loriel
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect place to stay for a recent business trip to Chicago. Rooms are gorgeous and easy to move around in, the hotel staff is friendly and helpful, the location is excellent. I recommend the Conrad and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lovvacations
Reviews.Content: My husband was staying for business and my daughter (3 years old) and I came along for fun. Location was perfect with wonderful shopping just steps out the door. There is even a mall connected to hotel. Anytime I asked staff questions they were nice and friendly, very knowledgeable. Only stayed one night but look forward to another stay soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: 2travelforever
Reviews.Content: Staff was great, all were polite and quick with fulfilling requests. Bed was amazing, best so far. We requested a coffee maker, they brought us a Keurig, that made coffee and tea, loved it. The room was smaller than I expected, but with so much to see in Chicago, we spent little time in it. Attached to Nordstrom and lots of stores. If you are Hilton gold or diamond, no executive suite or floor, for that, stay at the Drake, also a great Hilton property.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, clean, convenient hotel; we'll definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: miriamWynnewoodPA
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Hotel was just perfect for our traveling needs. Our king size bed suite featured a large bedroom with full bath (tub and shower), a separate living room area with a sofa bed and a small powder room as you enter the room. The room is perfect for 4 people. There is plenty of closet and drawer space if you choose to unpack. There is a coffee maker in the room, but there is also free coffee/tea each morning in the lobby area. The hotel is conveniently attached to Nordstroms and a small up-scale shopping mall. The concierge is very helpful and will spend as much time with you as needed. The front desk is helpful and friendly. The hotel is very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars is not enough”
Reviews.Author: whiteshadow
Reviews.Content: Yes, yes, as almost every review of this hotel indicates, the Conrad is a special property. Downtown " centrally located " means that it fronts Michigan Avenue. When you walk out the exit on the Michigan Avenue side (through the mall) one has access to the CTA buses that take you a few minutes south to the Water Tower Place, the Rush Street Area, the Gold Coast ( $$$$ ) residences, and all the shops in-between. Want to "head" north on Michigan Avenue to the river cruises, Wrigley Building, Symphony Hall, Art Institute, Archtecture walking tours, Museum Campus with the Field Museum, Planaterium, Acquarium, Soldier Field, Buddy Guys Club, Millenium Park, etc., then buses to these attractions are within a 1 (one) minute walk from the hotel. Get a $25 CTA pass for a week with the hotel as your base. More importantly, the hotel is SPOTLESS. It's really, really clean. No dustballs in corners, no stain-streaked glasses; no grubby garbage cans; nothing is overlooked. The room service meals (grouper/crab and everything else ) were cooked to perfection. In fact, the front desk actually called to insure that the room service meal was delivered on time, which it was!! I don't believe I have ever had that happen before. Now, here is the most amazing thing about our 5 night stay: my wife and I returned after a 4 hour walking food tasting tour and a 2 hour walk of the city on our own. In responding to a query from the front desk about " how was your day," my wife mentioned that her legs were causing her some discomfort/pain. Within two minutes of arriving in our room the front desk called and advised that they were sending from their pillow menu a special full body pillow to help my wife feel better. Within minutes the pillow arrived and, not only was the pillow delivered, but also a small bottle from the hotel containing a concentrated liquid for my wife to use in the bath ( I don't remember exactly what it was), as well as a bottle of organic tea was delivered. But that's not all: about 15 minutes later the sweetest lady from housekeeping ( I believe her name was Sheila ) knocked at the door and brought my wife a jar of epson salt; she mentioned that when the staff was unable to locate the epson salt in the hotel, another staff member ( Prisca, I believe was her name ) actually went to a drug store and bought the epson salt for my wife!!! That's right. Amazing. I tried my hardest to give Sheila a gratuity for her and Prisca and she refused it, telling us that we were "Hilton guests" and a gratuity would not be accepted. I believe that the young man who was responsible for the pillow and tea was Randy from the front desk. Also, a young lady, Jill Natale, went out of her way to assist my wife and I in so many areas where tourists such as us have many, many questions and seek assistance. I can understand why this hotel at the time of writing this review is ranked #3 for hotels in Chicago. I would be amazed if the service at any other hotel could match that which involved my wife. It is obvious that the management at this property knows what they are doing!! A big thanks. I would have written this immediately upon our return but I had misplaced the names of the above people who were so gracious to us.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, quiet, excellent service (but skip the breakfast package)”
Reviews.Author: dlmr1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couples getaway for two nights. The location is superb; just off of the middle of the Magnificent Mile. The rooms were great: clean, comfortable, and quiet. There was an HDTV, DVD player and a Bose speaker system. The bed and linens were great. Hotel service was excellent, in fact, a box with jewelry found after our departure was Fed-ex'd to our home immediately. The only disappointment was the Full American breakfast we had as part of the package. Each day, it took more than an hour in the dining room. The waitstaff were pleasant but distracted and clearly understaffed. They were even bussing their own tables. The food wasn't what I would expect from an upscale hotel restaurant. I would go elsewhere in Chicago for breakfast next time! Overall, the hotel was great, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to witness Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Larry M
Reviews.Content: My life is tied to Chicago for more than 60 years....once in a while it is just nice to stay in the downtown Chicago area. The Conrad Chicago was the hotel that I selected. Just west of Wrigley Building, connected to Nordstroms and within walking distance to all River North dining spots. Selected a package that included in and out parking with is a must. But once we parked, we left the car parked and taxied it to places that we just could not walk to. Continental Breakfast not really special. Rooftop bar is nice.. hotel people friendly and most professional. This is the spot you want to stay to have access to all of North Michigan Avenue and North River spots. Take a Water Taxi from the Wrigley building to Wacker and Madison or continue on to Chinatown for lunch and return...just $12 for couple. Ruth Chris for dinner outstanding. Texas de Brazil, the best...and The Blues Brothers Review at The Auditorum made for a great couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: lovetostaydowntown
Reviews.Content: We love to stay downtown Chicago and experience all the great things the city has to offer. We have stayed at the newer hotels and many of the old classics. By far the Conrad was the best hotel experience we have ever had downtown Chicago. The location was perfect, the service outstanding, the hotel itself very beautiful, and the rooms were very spacious, comfortable and CLEAN! We will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MST5110
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and very clean. The location was perfect- right in the action of Michigan Ave! The only downside I can comment on was the service in the restaurant... it was very slow. Other then that it was a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nearly flawless hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stano49
Reviews.Content: We typically don't spend this much on a hotel room, but we may in the future after staying at the Conrad. Everything was superb. My only tiny criticism is that they do not have much of a street presence. You take an elevator from a modest lobby up to the real lobby on the fifth floor, and then up again to your room. Other hotels like the Raddison have more elaborate street level grand lobbies. But in every other regard, this hotel was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: familyfromthemidwest
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel! It was quiet and clean - and the room and bathroom were both very large. The lobby is spacious, beautiful and directly connected to a high end mall, including Nordstroms. The lobby's location on the 5th floor is not a problem - it makes for a very quiet location in a busy city. Our room was near the elevator but we did not hear a sound. The beds were comfortable and the pillow menu was a nice addition! The staff was incredibly nice. We decided to go out for breakfast even though the restaurant looked very nice and the concierge kindly directed us to a very popular and busy restaurant - Yolk - a few blocks away and we were given priority seating, which great. Parking was typical for the city - expensive - but it was nice to have valet. I honestly can't say enough positive remarks about this hotel. Our last visit to Chicago cost about $100 more per night and was noisy and far less comfortable. The location is perfect - very close to great Chicago pizza, Saks and plenty of shopping! We would stay here again in a heartbeat and it won't hurt our wallet!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy379
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several hotels in Chicago and this is the best. Just finished a week trip with my family in Chicago at the Conrad. Staff was great and helpful. The room was roomy and extremely clean. Room was well-appointed with what you expect in this caliber hotel. Location was ideal near shopping, restaurants and water. We genuinely enjoyed our stay and will stay here again. I have small children and couldn't hear anyone else nor could they hear us. Plenty of food options nearby. You can practically walk everywhere you want to go. I always valet and they were always ready with my car when I wanted it. I'm sensitive to room cleanliness and this hotel far exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MichaelZLA
Reviews.Content: Can't say much that hasn't been said already. The rooms are very comfortable especially the bathrooms. Having both an indoor and outdoor bar option is also great. Best of all is the location and having the mall literally below the hotel and an elevator ride away is super convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A quick one night stay was not enough. Good location great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: besdogs3
Reviews.Content: I had a work event that took me to this hotel for one night. One night was not enough. I loved this place. The hotel is just beautiful. The room was amazing and the bathroom was so nice and plenty big. I felt like royalty at this location. I did not get to use much of the amenities at this location due to our work schedule, but the hotel was located in such a great area. We were so close to much shopping and places to eat. It was a little hairy getting to it, but that's just me - not from the city. Our entire group agreed that this was a fantastic place to stay. I would recommend it for business but for sure for pleasure as well. I plan on staying at this location later this summer for some fun. Service was top notch and not rude at all - which I have encountered in the city before. Well done and will for sure go back!!! I have been traveling a ton lately with my job and so far - this hotel has been the best for me!

Reviews.Title: “nice staff and great, central location”
Reviews.Author: texasaggiesig
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a trip without our 21 mo. old son for a few days away. Made reservations online and made note to concierge that we were celebrating my wife's graduation and we were surprised with a fruit plate and water with a nice congratulatory note. Staff very friendly. Bed was comfortable. Had a neat Bose stereo system in room (even connected to TV for surround sound) though we didn't use. Bathrooms huge with shower seperate from tub. Location was great, toward the southern end of Magnificent Mile, and only few blocks away from Navy Pier, few blocks from river and Millennium and Grant Parks. Would definitely recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: gwyneth51
Reviews.Content: My sister and I celebrated a birthday in Chicago and stayed at the Conrad. Great choice. Our suite was luxurious and comfortable. The service was excellent. We felt completely spoiled. The location of the hotel is perfect for Michigan Ave shopping excursions, as well as close proximity to restaurants and museums. I would highly recommend the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Great Price”
Reviews.Author: str8foward
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia at a great price. This hotel's location is located on the Magnificent mile right in the heart of all the shopping, close to lots of the 'tourist' attractions, walking distance from Grant Park, Millennium Park, etc. The room was exceptional! Great bed, free pillow menu to choose a specialty pillow, beautiful large bathroom, nice sized room. This hotel was great! The only downside I would say is that local calls are not free, and the hotel lobby is on the 5th floor, and so are the elevators to get to the rooms, so you always have to take 2 elevators to get to your room, you can never go straight from ground level to your room. Other than that this hotel is great! I would definitely stay here again! Very clean, elegant, huge television, greatly stocked in-room mini-bar(although highly overpriced), great rooftop restaurant with great drinks, awesome toiletries, helpful concierge(with discounts on attractions), helpful valet staff. Basically this hotel rocks! LOL I highly recommend staying here. Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “5 STAR Service makes Conrad a steal in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TexasMod76
Reviews.Content: Im not a review writer although I am a review reader lol.. I guess it's time to give back. This is the first situation I have been so inspired to give my two cents. The Conrad came up through AA Vacations as a 5 star hotel and it looked nice enough for it's prime location off Michigan Ave..well really Rush but right there. The price online ranges between 180-300 and in my opinion it's a steal. The service is amazing, staff friendly and the front desk is honestly the best. I got a small room upgrade to a better view which really made a difference, the rooms are modern and very clean. Internet is FREE. No extra service charges that everyone hates. Housekeeping is on the ball and beds, towels and rooms are kept up and you get free bottled water daily in your room. One strange fact is that the lobby is on the 5th floor which is somewhat inconvenient but not the biggest deal. We really enjoyed Chicago but on the last day I didnt feel too hot and decided to take the last flight the day we left. When I called the front desk about a late check-out, they were awesome and let me check out very late for only $78 and even offered me a comp gatorade to make me feel better. In this day and time hotels care less and less and charge more and more, the Conrad falls slightly short in my opinion as a 5 star hotel but considering it's priced like a 4 star and the service is clearly 5 star or better.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful and cozy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amy1016
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Conrad hotel for our ten year anniversary. We were very impressed by the staff as well as the look of our room. The pillows were heavenly! I had never been to such a comfortable hotel! We had a GREAT experience! The breakfast was yummy as well! We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: guinevere_J
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 11:00 am and were surprised to be accommodated for an early check-in. The hotel has an elevator that will take you to the North Bridge Mall as well as to Nordstrom. Location is perfect if you want to stroll along the Magnificent Mile. The lobby is lovely and quiet. I can confirm the earlier reviews that the nice and new elevators seemed to be motionless and noiseless. The beds are comfy and the room isn't cramped even if we have 2 beds. The bathroom is beautiful with nice toiletries, robes and slippers. The room and carpet don't show any age or dirt. My hubby felt like he's in our family room as he enjoyed the huge flat screen TV with HDTV programs and Bose speakers. We got a bed and breakfast package and were delighted with the attentive staff at the restaurant. On the second day, we opted to convert our free breakfast into room service and the gentleman that delivered the food cart was courteous and nice, opa! From check-in, phone inquiries and check-out, we were met by well-trained and friendly staff. We will definitely stay here again for luxurious accommodation at a reasonable price. I'm too glad that I made the last minute switch from the nearby Marriott (thanks to the not-so-good Tripadvisor reviews) to Conrad Chicago! I saved only $4/night but my stay came with free room wifi and breakfast which I would otherwise have paid plus impeccable service and topnotch accommodation. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious, we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: adutchgirl
Reviews.Content: The stay was wonderful, we felt very pampered and well taken care of. A delightful surprise was an impressive dessert plate brought to our room one evening, compliments of the Conrad. The location is great for river north activities (shopping, skyline tours, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience and we will stay again when in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Riley0927
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Conrad Hotel in Chicago. It was our first visit to the area. The front desk staff were welcoming and helpful answering questions. The concierge was very friendly and knowledgeable with answering questions regarding restaurants and tourist attractions. The housekeeping staff was outstanding and the rooms were cleaned well daily. We loved the location. It was near many of the things that we wanted to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Not what was advertised”
Reviews.Author: CouldBeBetter58290
Reviews.Content: I understand that you can't show every room view and that you select the best view to show customers when you want them to select a hotel, however as the view was the number one factor that was use to select the Conrad I was very disappointed. Overall the stay was good, the staff was friendly and helpful, however I do feel the cost was over priced.

Reviews.Title: “There's only #1 Conrad”
Reviews.Author: musegades
Reviews.Content: When you are looking for a wonderful hotel, with a great staff that has been with the hotel for years - choose the Conrad. Or if you are looking for location, location, location - choose The Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service - can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: cbm64
Reviews.Content: At no point during my stay at this hotel did I ever receive lousy service. Everybody from the front desk to the restaurant to the housekeeping staff was courteous & respectful. The hotel is immaculately kept. They have 24-hour room service, and are very prompt in responding. Room service was always on time (especially breakfast), and the bellmen were prompt in bringing up & taking down my luggage. Hotel's location is extremely convenient right on the Magnificent Mile adjacent to the North Bridge shopping center. And there's a CTA Red Line stop just a block or two away to take you to the museums, Wrigley Field, and U.S. Cellular Field.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: arch0072
Reviews.Content: Room was nice, staff was helpful, and overall experiance was right on. there is No other place to spend a great 4th of July weekend then Chicago and the Conrad made sure that our stay was uneventful. The room was up to date with all the nessecities that you would need for a romatic weekend in the city. The only thing that was missing was a pool to cool off after a hot summer day

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - Always a step ahead with great service”
Reviews.Author: Gailzs
Reviews.Content: This is our second time to stay at the Conrad. From the moment we arrived they were there to make our trip stand out as well as the city of Chicago. We checked in and we were asked if we would like a coffee pot delivered. I did not have to ask. Our luggage was delayed and they were on top of it. The concierge was also superb. Her name was Meg and she made great suggestions. We even ran into a small problem and she followed it through. Loved the beds and the amenities. It was great being connected to Nordstoms too! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeeLiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the July 4th holiday--the hotel is fabulous! It is in a great location, so we were able to walk to almost every place. Also, all the great shopping is right in this area. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous, and, of course, quite knowledgable about Chicago. Our room was comfortable with excellent amenities and great views of the city. All in all, a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OzandLilly
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Everyone was very helpful. Would definitely stay there again. I was disappointed because our room did not have a view, but we were only there to sleep and shower.

Reviews.Title: “Still providing a supreme hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: redeemed
Reviews.Content: Ws welcomed back for a third time to this hotel for a one night stay. Room was immaculate with wonderful toiletries and amenities. The roof bar has a great ambience and is a popular place. Breakfast was delicious and elegantly presented. Location is great. The hotel has detailed website that gives helpful and accurate directions for reaching it via public or private transportation. Look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MicheleK45
Reviews.Content: Great location to shopping and dining. Walked to Navy Pier, Water Tower and trolley tour stop. Staff very helpful answering questions about taxi's and distance to attractions. My teenage sons and I walked everywhere downtown and felt very safe. Hotel staff great. Room very clean and all our needs were taken care of. Used fitness room and was quite extensive - free weights, exercise machines and treadmills. Would defiinitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: satxsptsfan
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel to attend business meetings. It was extremely nice. The rooms were exceptionally clean and comfortable. It was also unusually quiet for a downtown hotel. I highly recommend staying here. It would be my intention to stay the next time I need a hotel in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED it and Will be Back”
Reviews.Author: marmitch2
Reviews.Content: What a Great Location and wonderful property. My husband and I were amazed how every staff member greeted us and was extremely helpful and courteous. It seemed very natural and not contrived. The rooms were lovely and the beds were terrific. We will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just About Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Clem2000
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to share my thoughts about the Conrad Chicago after our recent visit. My biggest trepidation was that it might be big Hilton lacking in any sort of character or personality best suited for conventioneers. It was just the opposite. The best way I can describe it is that I felt it was more of a European experience. It was elegant, without being stuffy or ostentatious. It was fun, but not loud and crass. Quiet, but not dull. And everything looked brand new. Not a sign of age. I'm lacking in any interior design sense, but I would like to say that good taste is in evidence without interruption from the lobby to the room. Great location in Chicago between Michigan and Rush. Hotel bar was perfect for a nightcap. Luis was terrific as our waiter each night. The rooftop Terrace bar was just about magical at night, sipping an after dinner drink among the skyscrapers and the stars. I doubt I'll look for another place to stay in Chicago from now on. The Conrad works for me. It's just right.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, and certainly not as nice as some other Conrads”
Reviews.Author: chadshiver
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Conrads in other cities (Tokyo, Brussels, etc), and was expecting a lot more than the Chicago property offered. Everything from the check-in procedure to the rooms to the service were mediocre, and something I'd expect from a mid-range/budget chain rather than the Conrad. The rooms were boxy (albeit with comfortable beds), the staff were really quite lackluster - for example, rather than interact with us in a lift, a member of staff played with his phone. On the plus side, they offer free wifi and the gym is okay. Not a great stay, and certainly not a luxury offering.

Reviews.Title: “better than a Ramada but not even close to the Peninsula”
Reviews.Author: WYSOKC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived early on a friday and knew we probably wouldn't get into our junior suite which we picked because of the "L" shaped layout on an inside corner with tons of windows as depicted on the hotel web site. When we dropped off our luggage, we were told we were upgraded to a executive suite. When we checked in later in the day, we were checked into a handicap accesable room which had a bedroom and an attached sitting room with a fold out couch which is not what we wanted. We called down but were told the hotel was full and we couldn't be moved. Later we discovered the phone didn't work next to the bed and to make a call, we had to go into the bathroom and that phone kept falling off the wall. The TV remote worked when it wanted to and a movie we rented had the sound so messed up it was like watching an overdubbed karate film from the 70's. Bose system and all. Then the chain came off the toilet plunger as we were departing to dinner the second night at a very bad time. Had to take the back of the toilet off and stick my entire arm in the toilet basin to get it to flush. I was not happy. Room service was VERY expensive after all the fees were added and drinks at the bar were nearly $15.00 each after a reasonable tip. $30.00 is simply too high for a scotch and a magarita unless you are in St. Lucia looking at the Pitons and not a kid screaming in a stroller getting his diaper changed in the bar. And the hotel has no pool and it was perfect swimming weather. There are just better options for the same money and far better options for a bit more jack. Keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely huge suite - great weekend value”
Reviews.Author: denany
Reviews.Content: Just completing a quick visit to Chicago with the kids. The hotel has a great location - Michigan avenue just north of the River. Our suite was a high floor tucked away in a corner and was huge with a huge bathroom and separate powder room. The suite is easily close to 600sq ft but feels much larger. The bedroom could easily accommodate two king beds instead of one and still a loveseat, a desk, etc. The bathroom was lovely as well. My kids were there Thrilled. In their minds, the only negative was the lack of a pool. The weekend rate made our stay a good value. Usually for quick trips with kids I stay in a Residence Inn, Embassy suite, etc. For this trip I wanted to feel like more a vacation for me as well. As my kids told me, "Mommy, whatever you paid extra for this hotel, it was worth it."

Reviews.Title: “Wow... nicer than home”
Reviews.Author: SFR40
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. Friendly, helpful staff. I was upgraded to a king suite which is bigger than the main floor of my house, with nicer electronics and a balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tswanson1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Conrad Chicago and we were so impressed with everything---the service, the room, food quality, etc! The beds were probably the most comfortable beds I have ever had at a hotel. It was also an added plus to have the hotel connected to the mall. We will definitely be back next time we visit Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Sublime”
Reviews.Author: NYDK
Reviews.Content: An amazing property with the most professional staff anywhere. Also, perfect location with respect to the shopping district, restaurants, and other sites. Conrad Chicago has been the benchmark against which I measure other luxury hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BtwBlackandWhite
Reviews.Content: Across the street from Nordstrom and right next to Michigan Ave, the location is perfectly in the middle of all the shopping and good restaurants. The guest rooms won't disappoint you, it's what you expect with a good tub and separate shower. I remembered the room I stayed in, the bathroom counter had a few small chips but it didn't not get in my way. Bed was large and very comfortable, even though it was one of the busiest areas in Chicago the guest room was very quiet at night. Staff members were friendly and helpful, they were able to provide me with a much needed sewing kit when I asked and hailed me a cab when it was storming outside. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “great value for a weekend stay. Really comfortable”
Reviews.Author: EricTheDude
Reviews.Content: A real haven in Chicago. It's worth spending the extra few dollars. Also try to book directl with hilton/conrad and use the standby upgrade on a Sunday as likelihood's high and definitely worth it. Stay was perfect. Service was really good, as in my professional life I'm used to a lot and high end hotac but when I travel for pleasure with a backpack I tend to be treated differently, but not at the Conrad. Word is bond.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently great”
Reviews.Author: imreading
Reviews.Content: Of the 30+ properties I have stayed at in Chicago over the last 5 years, this hotel rates at the top of the list. The location is connected to Nordstroms and a shopping mall between North Michigan Ave (Miracle Mile) and the start of Rush street. The standard rooms are super clean, glass showers, duvet bed covers and what always feels like new clean carpeting. Employee staff is great and a special note to the bartender Eddie who is very knowledgeable of the city, restaurants and always friendly conversation. He should be a valued employee This is a perfect hotel for business travelers and families with older children (no pool), great workout room and during the summer a rooftop bar and eating area. Comfortable, Clean and no disappointments with this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Chas073
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at the Conrad in Chicago and it is a better experience each time! First, the location is convenient to about everything you would want to see or visit in downtown Chicago. Our room was beautiful and spacious. The housekeeping staff was very sensitive to our schedule and needs. The front desk was consistently reponsive in a timely manner to our requests (we had a problem with the safe and engineering was there within less than ten minutes and it was resolved quickly). The concierge was extememely helpful in securing reservations and giving guidance on tours. We have stayed in many places and the Conrad will be our consistent first choice when we come back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful not windy !”
Reviews.Author: JANEP23
Reviews.Content: just back from a fantastic 3 night break to Chicago - excellent Hotel , superb location, best hotel bed I have ever slept in and complimentary aromotherapy pillows helped us sleep even better after the long flight. Wonderful large rooms on the 14th floor - travelled with another couple and they put us in neighbouring rooms which was really helpful. Loved the city, people were so friendly and it doesn't have the rushed feel of most other cities, would definately recommend for a city break and the Conrad was just perfect , roof terrace bar and restaurant had just re-opened and was ideal for pre- dinner drinks. only small drawback was not being able to arrange a later checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: KLD88
Reviews.Content: Booked a room here thru Expedia's unpublished rates. We just needed a place to stay as we were going to pull an "all nighter" in the city and didn't feel like the 30 min drive home. Was very pleased with the hotel, had a nice fresh, clean look and feel. Our room was super small and didn't have the greatest view but it is in a prime location. Just a short cab ride (or even walk) away to many of the great restaurants and bars the city has to offer. Check in was a breeze and the staff seemed friendly. We didn't dine at the restaurants, but the outside lounge looked swanky! I'd recommend this hotel especially for those who are visiting Chicago but try to get it at a good price! Not sure it's quite worth the $250/night it was going for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: LHinOC
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, and quiet - a perfect hotel stay. This is my third time staying at this property and it held up to previous stays. The staff is helpful and friendly and the outdoor patio area for relaxing any time of day is a wonderful oasis in the downtown area of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful in every category”
Reviews.Author: AZSusanPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Location is the best. Easy walk to restaurants and shopping. The rooms are spacious and the Fitness center is good. The hotel staff is remarkably attentive. Nice to be on the other side of Michigan Ave. Wonderful restaurants nearby and less than a mile stroll to Navy Pier, Millenium Park, Merchandise Mart, and 2 blocks to the A line train station. We stayed 4 nights and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Memorial Day”
Reviews.Author: timbuktu2u
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our one night stay at the Conrad & would return again. Very clean, updated, & comfortable. Loved the different pillow choices. Staff service was excellent & great location

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Mag Mile Shopping”
Reviews.Author: dave820
Reviews.Content: We found the Conrad to be a very comfortable hotel. At the deeply discounted rate we got, we were very please. The room looked brand new. The bed was extremely comfortable, service was rapid and pleasant. Access is via a fairly ugly lower lobby on Rush Street or via elevators in the Nordstrum anchored mall which leads right to Michigan Ave. Didn't like the hotel food prices so we just walked a block or so for anything we could want.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mskristencamp
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the Conrad right now. The service has been great and the location is right in the heart of it all. The room is small but exceptionally well laid out with a great tv and iPod radio. Cons: restaurant and room service are really expensive and the hotel room doesn't Have a coffee maker or refrigerator that you can use. Pros: hotel and rooms are clean fresh and luxurious. Bathroom has stand up shower and soaking tub with separate toilet area. Location is in the heart of it all. This hotel definitely gives you the most bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Passport53
Reviews.Content: You just can't go wrong with the Conrad. Rooms were updated, clean and comfortable. They offer a pillow menu which included a close match to my no-snoring pillow at home (wife was very appreciative). Location is great as well. Hotel is connected to mall so you can easily get over and do some eating and shopping You are also just blocks away from the Riverwalk, where many boat tours go out of, the Navy Pier, a must see touristy spot, Michigan Ave., which has great shopping and several must-eat-at restaurants. Service was amazing. Concierge services were outstanding. Ron at the front desk went out of his way to make sure that my family and I, who were new to Chicago, were taken care of. He provided great tips for us on places to eat and how to get to places that we wanted to go. When we returned from an outing he would always inquire to how things went and if we needed anything. Just a really great guy. Only bad thing about the Conrad is the buffet breakfast. Do not get the buffet. It is extremely expensive and the food is terrible. The eggs were dried out and disgusting. No good bread or pastry options and fruit selection was lacking. It might not have seemed as bad if it wasn't for the $20+ price tag. My suggestion is just order breakfast off the menu. Regardless of the breakfast, you can't go wrong with the Conrad!

Reviews.Title: “We picked the right place!”
Reviews.Author: JerriB
Reviews.Content: Convenient to all we wished to see. Staff helpful with directions and guidance to view city sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: GregNRose
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Chicago for her birthday this past weekend -- our first stay in the Windy City. After talking to friends and reading many reviews, I settled on the Conrad for our stay. This was definitely the right choice! The hotel was in a great location on the Magnificent Mile and just a short walk from the Navy Pier and many great restaurants. The entire staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was clean and nicely furnished and the shower was great. We ate breakfast in the dining room twice and everything was fresh and delicious. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Chicago and will definitely stay here again when we return!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel in the Heart of Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JoeS60795
Reviews.Content: Recently traveled on business and was a guest of the Conrad for five nights. Terrific staff, great sized rooms, clean and comfortable. Hotel is right on Michigan Avenue. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experiences Guaranteed”
Reviews.Author: mattcoats
Reviews.Content: The team at Conrad Chicago always goes out of the way to make sure myself and my guests are taken care of throughout our stay. Their knowledge of the city of Chicago is unparalleled and they always take a moment to acknowledge and appreciate our business. The rooms are well appointed and ultra luxurious, especially the suites. And last, but certainly not least, the bar and terrace have some of the finest servers and bartenders in the city. This is the only place I will stay in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: HKBW
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice, comfortable hotel. Staff is greatI have stayed here few times and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Spot, Quality and service”
Reviews.Author: OsvaldoMexico
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Chicago, For Business & Leisure has is close to Michigan Ave, and most of the attractions. Te room is perfect, the bed has a great quality & the pilllows menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: fengstro
Reviews.Content: We had their anniversary package which made the Conrad a good value. Staff was very helpful and pleasant. We asked for lots of advice about what to do and how to get there and they gave us good answers every time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near the Magnificent Mile.”
Reviews.Author: Travfour
Reviews.Content: I chose the Conrad over the hotel hosting the conference I attended in large part because the Conrad included wireless internet access. Many other hotels charged $10 or more to use their internet. The room was comfortable, bright and clean - and set up well for a business traveler. The service from the front desk and housekeeping was impeccable. I also enjoyed the fact the hotel was a couple blocks off of Michigan Ave - close but away from the bustle of shoppers and tourists. It was a little odd to have the lobby on the 5th floor and have to take two separate elevators to get to my room, but overall I had no complaints about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Joaquin78
Reviews.Content: It's an excellent choice for the price and the location of the hotel. You are in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the City - Business or Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: DRBY310
Reviews.Content: Business traveler M-F every week. Stayed at the Palmer House, JW Marriott, Marriott Mag Mile and the Residence Inn this year. By far the nicest stays have been at the Conrad. Have reservations through December and won't look back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't usually do business stay reviews but this one was great!”
Reviews.Author: bryandshan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before but usually only one night. I stayed 3 this time and everything was great. Very friendly front desk, smooth check in. Nice room with a great bed, lovely bathroom with nice shampoos and a real hair dryer. Service in the restaurant and bar was amazing. Remembered my name and my drink. Room service on on Wed am let me know it was raining and pointed out the umbrella. Fitness center is nice, includes towel and water is 24 hours and has weights, machines and cardio. Plus it has powerful AC. I used to stay at the Intercontinental but no more. Plus the Terrace restaurant us cool and it's connected via inside hallway to Nordstrom.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, CLEAN AND FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: itsmeac
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The location is perfect right on Michigan Ave. Walk out the door and shopping and food are right there. It's connected to the Nordstrom mall. Staff was friendly whenever I came in contact with them. For Chicago the room size is big than most.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: James6060
Reviews.Content: The services provided by this hotel were exceptional and it definitely provided good value for money. The hotel is centrally located to most attractions and to the shops and restaurants. The rooms were large, comfortable and well appointed. From the outside, the hotel doesn't look very appealing and at least from my room, the views were not great. However the pros definitely outweigh the cons and overall this is a excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BigCityTravels
Reviews.Content: I usually don't take the time to write reviews, but I was very impressed with my stay at the Conrad Chicago I wanted to share it with everyone. I recently travelled to Chicago, just for a spur of the moment get away. Never being to Chicago before I was a little nervous, but felt it was still worth the gamble to go alone. First, let me compliment the cleanliness of the hotel. The hotel was so nice and clean, I'd almost eat food off the floor. Secondly, I would like to compliment Jonathan, who worked the front desk. Jonathan was super friendly, extra nice and sweet, and always seemed to point me in the right direction when I needed to find a certain place. Jonathan, not to mention is super adorable, has a great smile, and has the biggest brown eyes I've ever seen. I'd come back time and time again if I knew he'd be working. All in all, the Conrad Chicago is a great hotel with a great location, and a great staff. Next time I come to Chicago, I'll be staying at the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Girls weekend made perfect with exceptional hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: OTBART1
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to the Conrad. I chose the hotel due to the wonderful reviews I read on tripadvisor website and was not disappointed. We were in town for a girls weekend, and OMG did we have a great time. The rooms were large, clean and organized. The bed was exceptionally comfortable with THE BEST PILLOWS!!!! I would like to recongize Aysa (concierge) for her expertise, friendliness and being patient with all of my questions before and during our stay. Yes if in Chicago you need to stay at the Conrad, the location was perfect with great restaurants near by... Bandera with live jazz and Purple Pig. We also went on the Chicago Food Planet Food Tour.. Near North side with great tour guides and walked all over the chicago neighborhoods tasting and having fun even if it was 45 degrees, raining and windy. Next time I will stay again at the Conrad Hotel. Thanks for making the girls weekend memorable!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great services”
Reviews.Author: Sweetdimsum
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at this hotel and would highly recommend this hotel for others to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Conrad Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Vaneh09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, clean and spacious. It is perfectly located for those looking to experience downtown Chicago. The staff was genuinely friendly and prompt with any and all requests. I would recommend staying here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Friendly Staff - Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Temptationgirl
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here when we came to Chicago for the Bob Seger concert, which was terrific. Our room was comfortable with plenty of amenities and a very nice plush bed. Unfortunately our first night was marred by a very loud group of 20 somethings who stayed out till late and woke us up in the middle of the night screaming and yelling in the hall. The following morning I checked with the hotel to see if they were staying for longer than just the one night and asked to switch rooms if possible. Ashley at the front desk was very kind and moved all our luggage to another room while we were out for the day. She also sent us a delivery of drinks and nuts to our room later that evening. We were very pleased to have such excellent pleasant service and an understanding attitude about the noise issue and to have the issue rectified so quickly and professionally. Thank you Ashley for helping make our trip truly enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Gold-standard hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravlAgain
Reviews.Content: I consider the Conrad Chicago to be my home-away-from-home in Chicago. It's my first-choice whenever I'm in town. Further, the Conrad Chicago is what I use as a yard-stick to measure other hotels around the world. They are just that good! First, the location cannot be beat - central to North Michigan Avenue and walking distance from much of the nicer things in Chicago. The only downside to this is that I do recall hearing some traffic noise on at least one past visit (i.e., sirens traveling down Michigan Avenue), but this is not significant enough to disturb most sleep. The hotel was formerly a Le Meridien, which means that it was built for luxury, and in fact the Conrad Chicago management has continued and kept up the property to very high standards. The amenities in the rooms are top-notch (Bose sound systems, high-quality bedding, etc., etc.). The rooms feel both elegant and comfortable. They are kept spotless by the housekeeping staff. The service within the hotel is exceptional. From the front desk staff, to room service staff, to waiters in the restaurants. When I've had any issues arise they have responded in a timely manner and follow-through to ensure that things are taken care of to your standards. The fitness center is well-cared-for, and sufficiently spacious. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, including clients, colleagues or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel in an ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: rdklomp
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome experience with the Conrad from beginning to end. They upgraded us to an executive suite with an awesome view of the city. My only negative would be the cost of parking (Valet $51 a day, self park $42 a day). Parking is at a premium in the city so you just have to bite the bullet some times.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: ladnick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I couldn't have been happier with our Conrad experience. As very seasoned travellers, we would put the atmosphere, and the friendliness of the staff,on a par with some of the best hotels in both North America and Europe.

Reviews.Title: “A downtown haven...where you want to be and how you want to be treated”
Reviews.Author: Jaewriter
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel for business. The price was fair, the location was superb and the service...from the pillow menu to the easy check in to the attendant who brought me bottled water while I was working out in the bright and airy fitness center...was first class. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: faculty1919
Reviews.Content: This hotel is is in an excellent location. The staff was excellent. I really enjoyed the bed in my suite. The pillows were VERY comfortable. I will probably be back a couple times this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: Hela1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Conrad hotel was excellent - the location, service, quality of rooms - it couldn't be any better! We chose the Conrad because we only had 2 nights in Chicago and wanted to be close to everything. The location was great- we could walk everywhere - to Lake Michigan, Navy Pier, Millenium Park, and of course the Magnificent Mile. Our room was huge, and so was the bathroom where all amenities were provided. The beds were the most comfortable hotel beds that I've ever experienced, the duvets were super soft, and we could also choose a special pillow from the "Pillow Menu". We were really impressed with the friendliness of the hotel staff. They were brilliant in recommending restaurants and making reservations for us, as well as advising on where to go for shopping and sightseeing. Nothing was too much trouble, they were really helpful. We can't wait to return to the Conrad and would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to a US tour”
Reviews.Author: ARH500
Reviews.Content: Great location on Magnificent Mile, good shopping and access to key Chicago attractions. Service was very good and always helpful. Concierge desk a bit confusing - sometimes at street level and sometimes at reception level. Rooms very quiet - just right to deal with jet lag.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal service, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: HappyBride9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our wedding weekend. We'd booked one of the nicer suites for the first few night but because rates went up, we switched the reservation to another room for the rest of our stay. Not only did the staff upgrade our original suite, they let us stay there the entire 5 days instead of making us switch rooms, without us even asking. In every other aspect, the staff was also amazing. They brought up things that people had left at the front desk for me, responded to every one of my numerous requests for chairs, champagne glasses, help with the TV, etc. When I got sick one night far past midnight, the staff helped me up to the room, brought me water bottles and offered to open the gift shop if I needed anything. The room itself was nice, though the shower door seemed to have an issue staying closed, which I'm sure they would have fixed but I already felt like I was asking a zillion things of them. Overall, definitely five star service! We also got free breakfast with out stay and the food was wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff always willing to assist”
Reviews.Author: RichardStillorgan
Reviews.Content: We were attending our eldest sons wedding in West Haven CT. We decided to extend this into our annual holiday by staying in Chicago at the beginning and Boston at the end of the trip. We arrived in Chicago on Saturday 9th April but our luggage did not arrive till Monday night and there was much uncertainty as to where our luggage actually was. A mixture of poorly trained Aer Lingus personnel and US Immigration bureaucracy and lack of common sense. Apart from no change of clothes, our luggage included wedding outfits and small presents/cards etc. Our first point of contact in The Conrad was Jonathan and he was both extremely helpful and understanding . He requested some of the basics from Housekeeping and advised us of nearest Walgreens etc. During the 3 days without luggage, Conrad staff offered help and assistance and Jonathan was especially helpful. In addition, the facilities and location were first class. This lessened the anxiety and concern until our luggage eventually arrived. Will definitely return to this hotel when next in Chicago (hopefully in the near future).

Reviews.Title: “Just Amazing”
Reviews.Author: shytown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night and wish it was a for more. Great effort by the hotel to make every aspect of the our hotel stay perfect. Friendly staff, wonderful and spacious rooms, and great location. Only complaint (if I were forced to come up with one) is that the lobby is on the fifth floor - but it really wasn't a big deal. If I can afford it in the future, I definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Looks Brand New”
Reviews.Author: LastFlightOut21
Reviews.Content: Hotel must have been recently renovated, everything looks new. We were greeted at the entrance by the valet who politely took our bags and parked our vehicle. Check in is on the 5th floor and we were greeted very pleasantly at the desk, check in was quick and easy and we were on our way to the 15th floor room without delay. Our room was a nice size, everything looked brand new and the flat screen tv was very nice coupled with a Bose sound system. The bathroom was also new looking and had a nice finish and accessories. We had breakfast the next morning in the hotel and service was quick and breakfast was very good. We did not go into the hotel bar but it looked very nicely done. The outside bar on the rooftop terrace was not open and we were told it would open in the middle of May. One thing that was very nice was the free coffee bar in bar in the morning. Our stay was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: KRH07
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the perfect location for shopping on the Miracle Mile. The hotel was quiet in that it did not have the street traffic that is common with hotels in a central area. However, if you are looking for excitement in the hotel, this place is not for you. The Terrace was closed, and the bar is relatively small. The room was nice. I slept like I was in a coma. The Bose sound system was nice, and the large flat screen made the movies fully enjoyable. The bathroom was gorgeous. You could spend hours in the shower. The buffet breakfast was adequate. It did not impress, but the fruit was fresh. It was standard fare: scrabbled eggs, link sausage, bacon, potatoes, and pancakes/waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Conrad Hotel- Chicago”
Reviews.Author: LauraK22
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Hotel is located close to everything on Chicago's Magnificent Mile. The staff was very accommodating and the rooms were very comfortable. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels”
Reviews.Author: JamikGalway
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Conrad for 8 nights with my husband. From initially checking in early the room was not ready but no problem as we wanted to see the sights.Luggage was in the room on our return. The room & views were spectacular. Huge bed with amazing pillows & these were the standard pillows! The room & bathroom were extremely clean - any extra requests were delivered immediately. From the reception staff to the maids all staff were so accommodating & friendly. Over the week there was some amount of rain - no problem in getting an umbrella for use which was so handy.The hotel is connected to a shopping centre by lift which for the shopaholics delivers. Did not eat in the hotel as really you are in the centre of everthing

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service in the middle of Chicago's finest shopping area”
Reviews.Author: halocanex
Reviews.Content: Although, the Conrad might not be the best value it definitely gives the full luxury experience. Friendly staff, clean rooms, great room service, connected to a Nordstroms.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: thezoo341
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great long weekend stay at the Conrad over the Easter weekend. As a Hilton Diamond member the hotel goes above expectations and provides a fantastic complementary hot breakfast. Rooms are modern and very clean. The location is great for shopping and site seeing. This is my second stay at this property and is now my go-to hotel in Chicago. Free wi-fi is a plus

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful first stay at Conrad Chicago for Easter weekend”
Reviews.Author: Big-Cats-Lover
Reviews.Content: I booked Easter weekend Thu-Sun back in January using Hilton's Any Weekend Anywhere rate for first quarter 2011 reservations prepaid for 1 king bed deluxe city view room. Valet parking $51/night, self-parking $38/night. I choose valet upon arrival since not that much more than self and services provided in case I needed in/out privileges just dial 0+3 digit ticket number for car waiting, but never did as either walked or used CTA trains. I also opted for estandby upgrade for deluxe suite and immediately told not available, but will give you both points and breakfast vouchers when you normally have to choose one for stay. Clerk asked if any guests and I had 2 for 2 separate nights so breakfast vouchers provided complementary for them as well. I also provided their names for key access and breakfast but never necessary as used my 2 keys and my last name for breakfast. The room I selected from echeckin #1107 was provided upon arrival, but room didn't have living room area I needed for my stay and thought from pictures would include and no clear view of Michigan avenue with buildings in the way. I called asking if upgrade available. I got called back quickly with junior suite #957 corner room normally $75 a night upgrade, but complimentary to me as Diamond member. Bell hop brought new keys to exchange quickly. This was what I needed with open living area and more roomy bed&desk area. I had a yoga instructor booked to come to my room so I knew we needed space for the intense workout and this room was ideal for such. Junior suite had window near desk and triple window over couch for direct view of street. 2 thermostats, one for bedroom area with air coming down on head of bed which I love to sleep to snuggled in pillows and covers and the other for living area. Large flat screen TV with Bose sound and iHome radio/Ipod player on nightstand. Like 7 HBO channels and large cable selection. Bose system provided radio and CD selection as well as TV. Really impressed with quietness of room at night but some noise during day as storage room across since end of hall, uber comfy bed and pillows and plenty of hot, soft water in shower and quickly on tap including sink. I do wish both shower and bathtub could have been both larger for accommodating two, but single filed just fine. More for man in shower and woman in tub than for both for either. Outstanding full American breakfast and buffet breakfast fully covered by vouchers. Outstanding selections available on menus. Expected so brought with me but couldn't use HDMI connection to TV in room 957 (upgrade) but noticed available on TV in original checkin room 1107. Friday morning, my friend from Indiana left room for breakfast and we returned with room cleaned and I left my MacBook Pro and IPad 2 out on desk and all there but cables put nicely out of the way. I like to tip $20 per night for maid service for upscale hotels, $10 otherwise. The only thing I struggled with during my stay was receiving wifi login instructions after I was in the room (had to request) and this access expired during my stay so had to request another set of login credentials on Sat. Also, oddly, first access allowed all 3: Apple Mac pro, IPad 2 and IPhone to use global services wifi and my first guest's iPod Thu night, but second access with phone call of credentials only allowed one connection so I chose IPad. Outstanding genuinely friendly and very professional upscale hospitality from all personnel I encountered from valet service and concierge at entrance, especially upon checkin and upgrade request quickly met, bell staff, maid staff and especially also restaurant staff. I received this response on the wifi/HDMI issue I replied to general manager's email for my stay prior to this review and he replied quickly with the following which makes sense for what I encountered. I said sorry, but I am a geek. "Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your comments. I can say I am a geek as it pertains to our in room technology and I want to improve it yesterday. That said we have started upgrading the TVâ€™s to handle apple and HDMI inputs. As well we are upping our bandwidth to 100mb soon and that should help high speed. I hope you will visit us again and contact me if I can be of assistance."

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: todd22Columbus_Oh
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel! Wonderful restaurants and shopping all within a few blocks. We went for a long weekend to see a concert. The hotel was clean, elegant and quiet. Large bathroom and really comfortable beds. The view was lousy, so it might be worth it to get a room with the Magnificient Mile view. The exercise room was pretty small, only a few treadmills and bikes so they filled up fast. Morning coffee is free in the lobby, but I can't get out of bed without coffee so we asked if we could get a coffeemaker in our room. It was there within the hour. The staff was very friendly. I'd love to go back in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: jazzywhiskers
Reviews.Content: I visited Chicago for the very first time this April and based all of my planning on tripadvisor reviews. As the reviews indicated, the Conrad was indeed an excellent choice of accommodation. The location was perfect, the service was friendly and efficient and the value for the money was excellent. The work out area was very nice and the consierge and doorman service was very good. The suite we had was spacious with a huge bathroom. The room and maid service was always very prompt and efficient. The negatives were that the street noise was a bit loud with lots of sirens but I use earplugs so it wasn't a huge problem. Also, we had a one bedroom corner suite which was lovely but the furnishings in the living area were a bit average (not worn - just a bit boring and bland). However, the suite was huge, very clean and had a large dining table where we enjoyed in room breakfast dining (which was included in our room price). Overall we thought the price for the room, especially when you factored in the free breakfasts, was excellent value given the amount of space we had.
