Another minor issue was that the window sills in our suite were quite high which detracted from the view. Finally, the hotel entrance is on a different level than the lobby. There was another entrance from Michigan Avenue through the adjacent mall but both entrances required two separate elevators (located a short distance from each other) to reach your room. Not a big deal but a bit of a nuisance when you were tired and just wanted to hurry back to your room to relax after a busy day of sight seeing. All in all, the positive aspects of the hotel far outweigh the few minor negataves. The Conrad easily met our expectations and we were very pleased with our choice and our stay. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ARob_77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great hotel to stay at while in the downtown Chicago Area. It is literally two blocks away from the Red Line and right on Miracle Mile. Everyone was great and the room was very nice. Tips: 1) Pay for parking with the hotel room, as it will save you some money. 2) Our room had very low water pressure. Not sure if all the rooms did, but just a warning. 3) The swimming pool is not worth the time, unless you have little kids. It is down the street and inside another hotel and wasn't that great. 4) Take advantage of the free coffee in the bar area that is provided every morning. 5) If given a choice, the Rush side is much quieter. We were in a room on the Michigan side, and for the ten minutes that we were there, it was non stop sirens. Once we moved to the Rush Street side we barely heard a thing. All in all this was a great hotel, with a great location and I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every catagory.”
Reviews.Author: craigster57
Reviews.Content: I booked three nights here, during a trade show, because it was $100 per night less expensive than the Hyatt who was hosting the show. I was pleasantly surprised to find out how much value I got at the Conrad. Great location to some awesome restaurants, sweet room and some of the friendliest staff that I have met in all of my travels. Great job Conrad!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, value for money”
Reviews.Author: bubbagump07
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. Front desk helpful and polite. Answered all questions with accuracy. Rooms were tastefully decorated. Some limitations exist, this is not a hotel that is built brand new. Its an old building. This means multiple elevators to get to street level. However other than this I liked my stay, they did a great job of taking care of me and my wife. I would also consider staying at Hotel INTERCONTINENTAL across the street, but only if they are in the same price range of about $155 to $175.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: Daisy1225
Reviews.Content: I am a female business traveler who travels to Chicago for business 6-7 times per year & always stay at the Conrad. The hotel is clean, modern & safe. I have always been treated well by staff from the front desk, to room service to front door. The hotel is above one of the nicest shopping malls on Michigan Ave and there are also many dining options very close to the hotel. Overall, all of my experiences at the Conrad have been excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: Golfman116
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a better experience! The hotel was in the perfect location for everything we wanted to do. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. Most importantly though, the staff was incredible! They were always kind and were more than willing to help when we had questions. They went above and beyond and I just had to make sure they received their praise!

Reviews.Title: “Suberb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maninomaha
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about the Conrad Chicago. The service is that of a 5 star hotel. The rooms are both quiet and absolutely immaculate. There is a 42â€� television hooked up to a Bose sound system. The bathroom is almost as big as the bedroom and there is a separate WC. The linens are amazing. Though the hotel rooms donâ€™t have much of a view, everything else more than compensates for that. I am hooked and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: SarTor89
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Conrad for a birthday celebration (during the Conrad's Spring Sale), and we were very happy that we chose this hotel. The staff were warm and welcoming, and honored our request for a non-smoking room on a high floor; the room nicely arranged and clean. The bed was very comfortable with crisp new sheets, and the TV and CD player were of high quality. Also, the Conrad is situated in an ideal location for shopping and restaurants (connected to Nordstrom and its mall). We walked to the Art Institute from the hotel, enjoying the spectacular architecture on the way. Also, there are many breakfast options around the corner from the hotel. The hotel bar appeared to be a fun place for a drink, filled with energetic and lively business travellers. No option for making hot beverage in the room, which would have been very welcome after a chilly night out on the town. Also, the bar frig standard to the room is not for personal use. However, apparently a personal frig can be requested. Yes, we would stay at the Conrad again.

Reviews.Title: “STOP! Look no further. Book your stay now.”
Reviews.Author: livs2laff
Reviews.Content: I have been planning my husband's surprise 50th birthday trip to Chicago (his hometown) for months. Since I had never been to the city before, I had no idea where to stay, but knew I wanted it to be special and unforgettable. After much consideration, I finally chose the Conrad Hotel based on family recommendations and the great online reviews the hotel has received. I hope my review here can help sway your decision, should you be in the same boat. Let's just say we were truly blown away in the Windy City! The entire experience was superb!! The Jr. Suite on the 15th floor was better than any weâ€™ve ever stayed in during our travels. They offer a great pillow menu so we opted for a 'Snore No More' type which worked wonders. The bathroom was to die for as was our large room and excellent views and made it a bit difficult for us to want to leave and venture out. The Concierge, Eloy, was in touch with me through email prior to our visit and did everything to ensure our stay would be memorable for this milestone occasion. As soon as we pulled up to the hotel, the doormen went out of their way to be helpful and courteous, as did the rest of the staff throughout our 4 night stay. No matter where we wanted to go or what we wanted to see, the staff was ready with suggestions and directions. I used the fitness facility during my stay and they had all the stuff I need to get a good sweat going (I used free weights and did a circuit). **I suggest reserving an Executive room or Jr. Suite and use your AAA discount if you have one. You can book through the automobile club online or through the Conrad Hotel Chicago site directly. Conrad has room upgrades that you can watch and be put on a list to get, if you prefer. Request a room on a higher floor when making reservations. All in all, we had zero complaints and numerous compliments to pay to the Conrad Hotel and will definitely stay again when we return to that beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: dorisinc
Reviews.Content: This property is a luxury hotel with great service. Dont let the luxury scare you, its affordable and well worth it. The location is perfect for working or shopping in the heart of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Best on the Mile”
Reviews.Author: coso333
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a top notch property. This was my second stay and I enjoyed this one even more than the first. I was upgraded to a one bedroom suite- if you make a reservation online and are offered an option to upgrade upon check-in, DO IT! For $49 extra, I was given this huge room on the 15th floor. There is nothing I can say that has not been said in previous reviews- this property is outstanding. The only reason I did not give it 4/5 for value is that they do not have a pool. Exercise room, however, is first rate. While running on a treadmill, a staff member was passing out cold water bottles. Combined with the front desk staff, this was among the best hospitality I've received.

Reviews.Title: “When in Chicago, we always stay at the Conrad.”
Reviews.Author: Scw1955
Reviews.Content: For value, location, luxary, and nearby self parking you can't beat the Conrad. You can walk through the attached mall to the Nordstrom garage (full in and out privileges) or you can walk through the mall to Michigan Ave. Great Near North restaurants are a short walking distance away as is the Theater District. Museums and Navy Pier are a short cab ride away. The rooms are well appointed, clean, and comfortable. The fitness center is large and well equipped (sorry no pool though).

Reviews.Title: “Conrad is always my place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bobgott
Reviews.Content: I frequently business trip to Chicago and always stay at the Conrad. Staff is very friendly and the stay is alway consistently nice with no surprised.

Reviews.Title: “excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: marymb
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is an excellent hotel. Rooms extremely clean. Classic yet modern. Very large bathroom and nice shampoos, etc. Mattresses and pillows outstanding. Staff wonderful from doormen to front desk to wait staff. Excellent location close to Michigan Avenue and connected to the shops at Northbridge which includes Nordstrom. Check out their special rate page on the website. We got a great rate. Would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Elegance”
Reviews.Author: happycat0965
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in the city for a nice weekend getaway. Lovely room with great amenities. Enjoyed picking a pillow from the menu of fragrance-infused pillows. Will stay again if we get the chance!

Reviews.Title: “Conrad chicago, a hotel worthy of her name!”
Reviews.Author: howdyhihoward
Reviews.Content: The front desk was very professional and friendly. The room was very spacious and clean, and with modern decorations. We could see the magnificent tribune tower from the balcony. The hotel is adjacent to the Nordstrom, and is just one block away from "Magnificent Miles". We went out for a dinner in the evening and strolled on the sidewalk of the "Magnificent Miles" for a while. The night view was so intriguing that we took quite a few videos. This is a marvelous hotel at probably the most valuable location of Chicago! Finally, kids were excited to watch all the different kinds of TV channels in the room. It was truly a relaxing night! Conrad Chicago is just awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Offerings”
Reviews.Author: seuss516
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure to spend a few nights including the weekend at this hotel - partly for business then over as a get away. This hotel was close to everything, offered a strong competitive rate for the room and the service was the best I expected. I can, without reservation, recommend this hotel for any business function or personal getaway. Private - yet in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: burndoc
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is a wonderful hotel in a great location. Staff is friendly and accomodating. The rooms are modern and spacious. Excellent fitness room. Will definitely return next time in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for luxury accomodation in River North”
Reviews.Author: dncatl01
Reviews.Content: The location is great, as it is very near the Redline terminal and close outstanding restaurants and shopping on Michigan Ave. The room itself was very up-to-date, with a huge marble bathroom--soaking tub and shower combo. Very comfortable, our king-sized bed was in a slightly small living space, but this was easily overlooked. The hotel has a restaurant, that we didn't try, and a pantry, which is handy for those of us who often forget essential items when traveling. We stayed on a AAA rate $165, which was a bargain for the overall level of accomodation,service, and location.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Brookiecreativegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Chicago and chose the Conrad Hotel. The rooms were beautiful and we loved the large bathroom and shower. Complimentary water in the rooms, plus great toiletries and extras like cotton swabs and mouthwash make you feel special. There is complementary tea and coffee in the bar in the morning plus a Sunday tribune if you want one. Complementary wireless everywhere. All that stuff adds up at other hotels, and it's nice to just check in and have everything you need at your finger tips. The hotel lobby is on the 5th floor and you can walk through an indoor connection to the Shops at Northbridge, which has a beautiful Nordstroms and tons of upscale shops. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: mddg43
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad Hilton for a business conference. I packed piles of work to do in the evening after the daylong meetings, plus a novel for the heck of it. I advise just bring a novel! The room was so comfortable and so relaxing, that I actually came home refreshed. You know it's relaxing when you find a "pillow menu" beside the bed! Lavender for relaxing, eucalyptus for colds, etc. One could choose from 8 or 9 special options. The bathroom was elegant and everything was spotless. This is being written by a picky traveler who travels with a little flashlight to look for bedbugs etc. The staff mood was amazing - upbeat, friendly and inquiring if my visit was going well. The chef at the restaurant whipped up an amazing and healthy salad for me that was not on the menu! I loved it and hope I have reason to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Sarahlouiselathwell
Reviews.Content: Location was the best, if you love shopping then look no further, the hotel is in the same building as shops such as Nordstroms, you just have to take the elevator down! The room was brilliant, beds were so confortable and it was immaculate. I spilt water on my laptop when I was staying in the conrad, I rang reception and told them what happened and they sent a handyman up immediately, who was really helpful, unscrewing the bottom and helping me try and dry it out! Brilliant service! The staff also helped us with directions, sight seeing advice etc... Food was also excellant. Highly Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: Hanna10_10
Reviews.Content: We were highly impressed with the quality and service of the Conrad. Check-in was super efficient and friendly. Our room was beautiful and spacious with one of the largest hotel bathrooms I have ever seen. Instead of a bathtub we had a spacious 5 feet by 3 feet shower. The beds were super comfy with excellent linens. Each of our two double beds came with four pillows and you can even order special pillows from their pillow menu. My husband ordered the "snore-no'more" pillow and I ordered the relaxation pillow. There is complimentary wifi and bottled water. There is also complimentary coffee and tea service in the lounge each morning. Housekeeping was excellent. There were a lot of business people staying at the hotel but it was also great for leisure travellers as well. The hotel is attached to the Shops at Northbridge so you can go shopping without having to go outside. Being one block off of Michigan Avenue it was quiet and yet super convenient to attractions either by walking of taking public transit. Even though we booked the Conrad through Hotwire, we were given a room on the 14th floor although most of our view was of a nearby hotel. We were very pleased with the Conrad and would highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Stop searching & just book it”
Reviews.Author: Ge0family
Reviews.Content: Beginning with the booking process (via phone) it was a positive experience. Upon arrival, the concierge found the restaurant info I asked for, presented the kids with a small gift & upon learning there was a birthday in our family group that day, arranged for complimentary cookies & milk to be sent to the room. The room itself was wonderful. Very clean and comfortable. All staff was very friendly & helpful. The hotel is very conveniently located - easy walking distance to shops, restaurants. Self park is directly across the street and that is attached to the shopping mall ( has the Lego store for any would-be master builders). We have allergies in the family & all down was removed before we arrived & we were placed in a room that had never had pets. Anyone can put up a building with rooms. The Conrad realizes great customer service will keep them filled. We won't be searching for a hotel on our next trip - will just book this one again.

Reviews.Title: “For chicago shopping trips we usually stay here”
Reviews.Author: orthobike_11
Reviews.Content: We drive into the city and find the self parking easy with in and out privileges. Shopping is in the same building including Nordstrom's, a favorite of mine. The rooms are superb, wife loves the bath rooms with the big soaking tubs.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clolry
Reviews.Content: Yeah, there's a phone in the bathroom... bose surround sound with the huge TV... free Wi-fi... stay here - you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Business Conference Success”
Reviews.Author: Sundvalls
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what customer service and quality of service is all about. I stayed in the hotel for a 2 day conference. Every aspect of my stay was perfect! Thank you to all the employees from the front desk, set-up conference team, food preparation and especially the individuals that took care of our meeting room. Great Job!

Reviews.Title: “Priceline Travelers Beware”
Reviews.Author: WestGang
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a recent Saturday night at the Conrad, visiting our son in Chicago. As I usually do when staying in downtown Chicago, I booked the room through Priceline. The hotel didn't seem overly busy or booked. But at check-in, we were told there were no more king bed rooms - just 2 doubles. When I asked again about this, I got kind of a smirk from the desk clerk who reiterated that was all that was available. Then we were given a room on the lowest available floor - and surprise, our view was of a brick wall 20 feet away of an adjoining building. The hotel was nice, well maintained, etc. As a general matter, our stay was a good one. However, more often than not we get the "Priceline" treatment (not accomodating reasonable requests, bad room locations, etc.) at higher end hotels - and the Conrad was no exception. It's clear the hotels don't realize it, but giving Priceline customers less consideration and treatment than a regular rack rate customer would receive is only telling me that I should not (and I won't ) stay at a Conrad again when I am booking a hotel direct. They have lost me as a potential future customer. If the Conrad isn't interested in having Priceline customers, they should simply stop accepting them (and their money) - or Priceline should stop booking its customers with that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCritic
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently and to Chicago annually for business. I chose the Conrad this time based on the TripAdvisor reviews and I am delighted that I did. I am pretty high maintenance and the Conrad exceeded every expectation. The rooms were outstanding and immaculate. The service was better than any experience including stays at the Ritz and Waldorf. The exercise facilities were top notch with the excellent Lifefitness equipment including a group of circuit machines and numerous free weights. From the complementary shoe shine to full breakfast for HHonors members, everything was just perfect. The location was also outstanding integrated into the Nordstrom shopping mall and right in the middle of the best shops on the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “phenomenal hotel”
Reviews.Author: yankskid1223
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Chicago at least 1 night during the weekend for the past 3 months. every time i choose a different hotel because i like variety and checking different places out. this is a great hotel friendly and helpful staff, beautiful and clean rooms, really couldn't find 1 thing to complain about even if i tried. even the price is good for being in one of the best areas of Chicago. everything is near the hotel clubs, restaurants,shopping, movie theaters....and i wont be looking around much now because this place has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Peaceful and relaxing in a high energy area”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMom4Comfort
Reviews.Content: "The beds were comfortable and there is a nice lobby," according to my 10 year old daughter. We had two rooms - one with two double beds, one with a king. The double bed room was larger than the king room. Also, while the king room had a soaking tub, the shower was a bit small. There was no tub in the double rooms, but the shower was more spacious. Both rooms were quiet. We did not opt for the city view so we were overlooking an office building, but that helped cut down on the city noise. Great amenities. Great location. Good fitness center. Parking, restaurant were both a bit pricy, but not more than you would expect for the area and the type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel and value”
Reviews.Author: st_ansgar_84-88
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last week for the first time based on a recommendation. This is an excellent hotel in an ideal location, and the service was superb. The price is also considerably lower than in other Miracle Mile hotels, but you get more for what you pay at this hotel. I recommend it hightly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location.”
Reviews.Author: Rickell
Reviews.Content: Love the Conrad. Next to Michigan for shopping and lots of restaurants nearby. Next to the historic Wrigley building. Service is always great too. Pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sheetboy
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Conrad and it will now be my first choice everytime in Chicago. Good location, very clean, freindly hotel with very friendly trying to please staff. Room was spacious and comfy - with an amazing bed & pillows. Sooo relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: busymomtraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived just around noon to discover we'd been booked into a double room and not a king. My husband being 6'3" does not fit well into a double bed! The gentleman on the front desk, Elroy ( I think that was his name--it could have been Elwood), said that he would do his best to accomodate us but the hotel was completely sold out for our 3 night stay. We moved into the double room hoping we could be moved. Sure enough, just around 6pm a king room became available. Elroy was absolutely amazing. He was always helpful and friendly throughout our entire stay. I have stayed at this hotel before and absolutely loved it. This is the only hotel I will stay at in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “An upscale weekend in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: lisnoe66
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and eager to help. Public areas and room were very clean. My teenage son especially enjoyed the large flatscreen television. Would stay there again. Only minor complaint was several light bulbs were burned out in the room. Wasn't a super big deal though since we were out of the room most of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Saltman347
Reviews.Content: I am staying in Chicago about once a month for business, and this is one of my favorite hotels. The location is great and the rooms are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, great staff so accomodating, best location.”
Reviews.Author: DecaturBrint
Reviews.Content: I love the Conrad, the rooms are larger than most hotels in the area, the bathrooms have separate shower and tub, with plenty of granite counter top space! We love the hotel restaurant for breakfast and the bar for a night cap. The staff is also great, so accomodating, we wanted theater tickets for the same night we arrived and had them within 5 minutes from the concierge. Not least of all the hotel is so convenient with Michigan Av on one side , Rush on the other, and Nordstrom's right there. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mpg1063
Reviews.Content: Excellent, very quiet hotel. Was there for St. Patricks day parade etc. Given the "festive" nature of that weekend it is usually hard to get some quiet time. Not at this hotel. I was on the ground floor (5th) and expected noise. I didn't complain about being on the ground floor since I only paid $80 per night (thank you priceline). I never heard another person. The room had what looked like a nice Bose sound system but it didn't work. If you drive and are on a budget there is a lot a couple of blocks away at Illinois and Columbus that is $23/day (surface lot kitty corner from the Embassy Suites).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: desi_frequent_flyer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situation in the heart of the Magnificent Mile, lot of tourist attractions, great restaurants and shopping with walking distance. The hotel itself is nice and new, rooms are spacious, toiletries and amenities are top notch. A first for me in all my travels : they have a pillow menu with a variety of different pillow options.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Calm above Michigan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: Midwest-71
Reviews.Content: I wish I could afford the Conrad more often. The hotel is a nice oasis above Michigan Avenue and a refuge compared to some of the other hotels with harried lobbies. Everything about it is quiet, from the lobby and bar, to the rooms and exercise facility. It's not a place with a lot of commotion or people watching, but that's the appeal. The rooms aren't over the top, but they are spacious with great beds and large well appointed bathrooms. If my Controller would clear it, it would be my permanent choice in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The stay was amazing. My billing nightmare began after checkout.”
Reviews.Author: PickyTravelerLa
Reviews.Content: I will start with the positive. A collegue and I were originally staying at a near by hotel. We decided to make a move due to the size of the hotel room. We checked into the Conrad. It was such a great choice. Great decor, amazing staff and the rooms were enormous. Spa tub, seperate shower - in a word... WONDERFUL. I loved the fact that they offered a complimentary pillow menu. You can choose the pillow that best suits your tastes. How great is that? This was extended stay, so they brought a complimentary mini-fridge to my room. That bathroom had tons of counterspace - which is imperative for makeup and hair care products. Now on to the negative side of my stay. At check out I had over $40 in mini-bar charges. I never even placed my hand on the handle of the mini-bar. At checkout I had this removed, but it was only removed from my invoice. Super long story short - I spent 3 days trying to sort out the bill. It has been a bit of a nightmare. My credit card was charged incorrectly then charged again because they miscalculated my number of nights at the hotel. I hate that the trip ended with the billing nightmare. If it weren't for that, this would have been a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “nel cuore di una vera "american city"”
Reviews.Author: bubboli
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 nights in this elegant hotel sited in the heart of one of the most important city of the USA. dispite the cold and the very low temperature (for our italian standards!) the city is really fascinable. the hotel is located in a perfect position to visit and city center and to make shopping (one of the best thing you can do in chicago!). it's just on the famous michigan avenue, the most famous for shopping, and also near the famous chicago tribune. the hotel is of high level, rooms are silent, big, with all the conforts. surely, one of the best hotel we are stayed. if you go to chicago and you love music, you have to go to listen jazz.... it has been really fanny for us!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Could LIVE here !”
Reviews.Author: Deroney
Reviews.Content: I stumbled onto the Conrad Chicago when searching for a new place to stay in Chicago during my annual trip to attend the Chicago Midwinter Dental meeting, and am I GLAD I did ! The Conrad is an establishment everyone should have the opportunity to experience! Everybody from the doorman , to the front desk ladies to the house keeping staff were as professional and accommodating as one could ask! All this culminating with a cheerful positive response to our late check out request ! Plus it's attached via internal walkways to Nordstroms and a very nice , brand new looking mall and food court! The wireless internet is FREE , the mattresses are incredible , and the work out area is nicely outfitted. What's not to like !? Highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Chicago at its Best!”
Reviews.Author: rob1225
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Conrad Chicago. We were greeted with helpful courteous staff, beginning with the bellmen at the curb, followed by a warm welcome at check-in. The attendant was professional and friendly - a winning combination! Our room was outstanding -- one of the nicest that we have ever encountered either domestically or internationally. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay -- and hated to leave! The location was excellent for the meeting we were attending -- along with many places of interest within walking distance. This was Chicago at its Best! This certainly goes on our list for places to recommend and return to in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Watergirl301
Reviews.Content: My sis-in-law and a couple of our friends traveled to Chicago for the 'O' show and spent two nights. Our arrival & checkin at the Conrad Hotel was flawless - quality contemporary decor. Accomodations are very comfortable, quiet, flat screen TV, robes/slippers, marble bathrooms, wonderful italian toiletries. We made reservations when Chicago was being hit by the big snow storm and wanted a hotel that was conveniently located to shopping and dining that would not require us to go outside in case there was inclement weather (during our stay the weather was great..in the 40's). This hotel fit the bill perfectly located right off Magnificant Mile and attached to a nice mall with Nordstroms/Louis Vuitton steps away. The staff was very professional and friendly. Lots of dining options in the area. Our last day there we had breakfast at the hotel...food was good - friends enjoyed the buffet and I ordered from the menu. Our stay was wonderful and will definitely select this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful as ALWAYS”
Reviews.Author: dcstarks
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Conrad Hilton in Chicago, IL for the past 6 or 7 years and that in itself should say what we think of the Conrad. The sevice and courtesy shown us has always been outstanding. THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: DublinExpert
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in various Chaicago hotels over the years and recently spend 3 nights on business at the Conrad Chicago, the rooms were very well apppointed with comfy beds, huge TV and soundsystem, Free WiFi, bottled water and plenty of toiletries. Staff were very professional and Luis in the restaurant deserved particular praise for his customer service skills. I will be returning on my next trip to chicago1

Reviews.Title: “Warmth in Wintry Chicago”
Reviews.Author: miamipickytravelers
Reviews.Content: New, pleasant and clean - great location with direct access to Michigan Ave and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Quality Close to all the action”
Reviews.Author: regggit
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel on a special deal with winter rates. We were pleasently surprised by how wonderful this hotel was. We were right on Rush Street one block from Michigan Avenue. The hotel is connected to the Nordstrom mall which allows easy access to a food court and to Michigan Avenue. The room was comfortable with a big tv, a Bose sound system and DVD palyer. They were prompt in bringing us the non-down pillows. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was able to regulate the temperautre. The bathroom was big and had lots of extra amenities such as qtips, mouthwash, and cotton pads. The hotel staff was very pleasent and happy to help when we had a question. The exercise equiptment did lack a good TV connection so bring your IPOD! We would highly reccommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - top shelf!”
Reviews.Author: frank53755
Reviews.Content: Stayed there duting a conference that was held at the Hyatt about three blocks away. I would give this hotel my top recommendation. I have stayed in hotels all over the world, and this is one of the best. I was upgraded to a exec king suite (Hilton Gold) and it was a fantastic room. Never heard a sound from other rooms. Super quiet, great bed, great bar and location. Highest recommendation - I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice while in Chicago....”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripFour
Reviews.Content: I often stay at the Conrad while on business in Chicago. I have stayed at this hotel 5-6 times over the last two years. The entrance/lobby is a little different as you enter from the street level and need to take an elevator up to the lobby. Service is always great and friendly when checking in. Rooms at the Conrad are updated, and the bathrooms are beautiful. I have found that some rooms are bigger than others, but all are well appointed. They have Bose sound system and large TV's. I love that they leave slippers that you take home with you. The beds have very comfortable bedding and I always sleep well. I have used room service, eaten in the restaurant, and also the bar. All are great and have good food with lots of choices. I really enjoy that the Conrad is connected to a mall and Nordstrom. If I ever need anything on business it is very easy to access stores. Great business hotel, and in a great location in Chicago. A little pricey depending on time of year you stay, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It was free for me!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan H
Reviews.Content: An airline had made us late for a flight so since we missed it we were staying in Chicago for the night. They said our hotel was free(I thought it was going to be crappy) and gave us directions. When I saw it I was just thinking we must be important to that airline(now remembering we payed thousands because it was to Japan then somewhere else. The room was free but anything else wasn't so we decided we would defiantly stay. It was just beautiful when we walked in and the staff was okay room and everything else was clean and had a good sleep before going on two airplanes for 1 day and a half with no sleep. Gotta say if I even come back I will think of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay was Perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chesbayjill
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. In the thick of things yet away from it all. Very quiet and restful and very well appointed. The perfect weekend getaway. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT again!”
Reviews.Author: atlantaallen96
Reviews.Content: After having a great experience previously at the Conrad Chicago, I decided to push ny luck and see if they could do it again this past week end.. They did it again. I had finally reached Diamond status with my HiltonHonors Points and eveb though they didn't have to, they upgraded my from a room to a suite at no charge and sent chocolat covered strawberries to the room to celebrate wife's brthday and valentines. What can I say....we love coming to the Conrad Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best accommodations Chicago has to offer”
Reviews.Author: PJK53
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff, consierge , and doormen were always friendly and helpful. We stayed the day after the big snow storm of 2011. The hotel was running smoothly, an amazing job had been performed to run normally. Rooms were spotless, loved the large bathroom with shower and tub. Our stay was very quiet, we didn't hear any hallway noise. A plus to be connected to Nordstroms and close enough to walk to Lawrey's and Eatt! We will definitely be staying again!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MaryMorton
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Chicago is a conveniently located, well-maintained facility. The decor is attractive and the rooms are spacious. I was particularly impressed with the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. I would definitely choose to stay at the Conrad again.

Reviews.Title: “This is it.”
Reviews.Author: cglovingood
Reviews.Content: We have never stayed here before. Great location. Connected to shopping. Never knew this hotel was even there. Great place to stay. Staff is very helpful and it is just a nice place. Rooms are very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great, clean, comfortable with class.”
Reviews.Author: peymane
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and been very happy every time. The staff are friendly, service is gerat, hotel is super clean and rooms are very comfortable, especially the Bose Sound System in the room.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is wonderful. The service and staff is excellent.”
Reviews.Author: cwanzo
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. Exceptional staff, service and the restaurant is unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location & great service.”
Reviews.Author: mob63
Reviews.Content: The Conrad in Chicago is perfectly placed above Nordstroms on Michigan Ave. The hotel is new, modern and spacious a great alternative to the Intercontinental across the street. Because of its smaller size, the service is more personable and the likelihood of waiting for breakfast or checking in is minimized. If you are on business or pleasure it is a great hotel to stay downtown, in the heart of the shopping area and fun night life.

Reviews.Title: “First choice when staying in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravel0914
Reviews.Content: I'm a Hilton Diamond member and travel quite often for work. Anytime I am heading to Chicago, I always check availability at the Conrad Chicago first. The location is EXCELLENT - they are located in the same building as the Nordstrom on Michigan Avenue - so you can easily get to all of the great shopping and restaurants on the Magnificent Mile. The Conrad also offers lots of little extras - at no charge - that you usually either don't get or have to pay for at nice hotels. The rooms have Bose surround sound, great flat panel TVs, separate shower and tub (and the tub is a GREAT, deep soaking tub), free wireless internet, in-room electronic safe, and they even offer a Pillow Menu, with complimentary aromatherapy pillow options. The beds have lots of pillows, but I will say one of the only down sides is that it's not the most comfortable bed I've slept on - still very nice, just a little too firm for my personal liking. For Gold/Diamond members who have the breakfast option, their breakfast is great - it's not a buffet, but rather you order from MANY options (like the things you would see on a buffet) and it's cooked to order and presented very nicely. I'm not a coffee drinker - but for those who are, make sure you either ask for a coffee pot at check in or you can come and have complimentary coffee and tea in their bar/lobby area in the mornings. The staff are all wonderful - very friendly at check in and GREAT bell service... always greeting us with a smile and very willing to help with whatever we might need (boxes, luggage, getting a cab, etc.). Rates can vary quite a bit throughout the year - sometimes, we can get a room for $120-140 a night (which is wonderful for a hotel like this) - but other times, rates jump to as much as $450 a night (which is a bummer since that means I have to find another place to stay in Chicago). Definitely a place I recommend and one I plan to stay at again when possible!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great value. Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cap1226
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night while downtown for a friend's birthday celebration. We got a discounted rate through the web. Very nice looking hotel. Cannot beat the location. It connects to the Nordstrom mall on Michigan Avenue. Did not dine there. Rooms very comfortable. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Pamxxxxxxxx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for a couples weekend. We booked advance rates online and got a VERY good deal so the value was definitely high for us. The great thing about this hotel is that it's connected to the North Bridge Mall (which includes a Nordstrom). Once we parked the car at the self park (saves some money over valet at the hotel), we never stepped foot outside other than to go to dinner that night. We went shopping at Nordstrom, ate lunch at the mall and then got spa services at the Nordtrom spa. And if you do want to venture outside, you are right on the Magnificent Mile. Aside from the mall aspect, it's a very classy hotel on its own. I would definitely stay here again and also recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: caramellokoala
Reviews.Content: I echo what has been said before and what will probably be said again after this review. The staff were amazing even down to the handyman/plumber with his bucket and plunger we met in the lift. He wished us a good day and I felt it was genuine. The hotels rated ahead of this one must go good because this was outstanding in every sense of the word and great value for money. All I can say is come see for yourself, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot say enough GOOD things”
Reviews.Author: stevenbrose
Reviews.Content: This is the first Conrad I have stayed at and now am unsure if I can stay at less in the future. This hotel was immaculately clean, stylishly decorated, and attentively staffed. If you're looking for a hotel in the Mag Mile area of Chicago, I highly recommend you try the Conrad Chicago. It always annoys me when properties change their attitude when they realize I'm a Diamond HHonors member as they should treat all guests with respect. This property had a great attitude even prior to check in when they realized my HHonors status. I cannot say enough good things about the staff at this property. The rooms were very spacious. I was upgraded to a corner king room. The room was a good size with VERY comfortable bedding. In addition to having the standard two drinking glasses set out by the ice bucket, they provided two tall glasses, two wine glasses, and a wine bottle opener. The bathroom was extremely large. It had a granite tub and a separate shower. The bathroom was stocked with quality bath products and a robe for use while at the property. A toilet was located in a separate water closet. A pleasant surprise was the free internet for all guests (not just Gold and Diamond HHonors members). It's been a while since I've seen a full service or luxury brand offer free internet as a benefit to guests. It seems that the more you pay for a hotel, the more their internet usually costs. This hotel was great. I suggest you give it a try next time you're in Chicago. I'm going to try the Conrad Miami next month.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Got2Travel113
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old daughter was born and raised in Southern California and had never seen snow falling from the sky. When presented with the opportunity to pick somewhere to go for the weekend, she chose Chicago because of the likelihood that it would snow in January. She was right! We chose to stay at the Conrad based on reviews on this website, and as usual, the reviewers got it right. The Conrad is a lovely hotel. The location is perfect. We didn't rent a car but taxis were always available right outside the front door, and the train station was about a 5 minute walk. The hotel room was immaculate and very well appointed. The rooms don't come with a coffee maker but I asked for one and they brought me one of those wonderful Kuerig machines that brews individual cups in a matter of seconds. The beds are wonderful with crisp, clean white linens. The bathroom is really beautiful and the toiletries top notch. Room service was prompt and the food was delicious. And the entire staff couldn't have been nicer. From the friendly doorman to the front desk employees to the housekeeping staff, everyone always had a smile and made us feel welcome. We had wonderful food while we were in town. Many different sources recommended Gino's East for Chicago style deep dish pizza and it was amazing! We went to the restaurant one day, and then had another pizza delivered to our hotel room the next day! That's how good it is. We also ate at a yummy casual lunch at Cosi's, the sandwich shop just across the street from the hotel. Since I ate so much pizza I decided to check out the fitness center. Both times I went it there was no one else there, but it was a really nice gym. There were several treadmills and ellipticals, machines and free weights. We loved Chicago and can't wait to visit again. When we do we'll definitely stay at the Conrad! It's a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room with amazing view”
Reviews.Author: itchyfooty
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is an excellent choice when staying in Chicago on business or for leisure. I stayed for 4 nights in (a very cold) December. Its location is very central and convenient for the Magnificent Mile. Parking proved a little problematic as the hotel car park was full when I arrived, so I had to park a couple of blocks away. I presume this was because I arrived Saturday evening a couple of weeks before Christmas; the shoppers also use the car park clearly! I ate in the restaurant a fair amount as I was on business. Evening meals were good, and the service was very attentive, albeit I was often one of two or three diners. Breakfast was busier and a lot more hit and miss, often it took a while to order toast/hot drinks and a couple of times what came was not what I ordered. The rooms are excellent - beautiful bathroom, very comfortable bed and an amazing view from the room of Michigan Avenue. Also a desk and working chair, as well as a lounging chair was provided, all of very good quality. Laundry was available and I was able to clean a whole suitcase's worth of clothes, essential! The service was excellent, well pressed and arrived promptly. Positives far outweigh any slight niggles mentioned above, so I would happily stay here again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad - comfortable room & above par service”
Reviews.Author: irishmama34
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many top-rated, expensive & exclusive hotels in Chicago. The Conrad gave us some of the best service we've experienced in Chicago. The room was comfortable and well-appointed and one of the cleanest - though the "view" was nothing to write home about (unless you enjoy looking into office windows within touching distance). However, closing the attractive drapes took care of that one bump in an otherwise smooth experience. If you require a view, request well ahead of your stay as there are very few rooms per floor with any kind of "view" and they are reserved early -- it's a city hotel surrounded by streets & tall buildings, so don't expect Lake or river views that many of the expensive hotels offer. The HUGE well lit granite bathroom was a spa experience with a separate deep tub, large shower stall, "water closet" with phone, and double sinks with ample counter space for both his & her toiletries, electric outlets & lighted magnifying makeup/shaving mirror. The bed was very comfortable and "pillow service" is offered with a choice of aroma therapy pillows. The hotel is connected to a Michigan Avenue shopping mall (including Nordstrom) which was a nice indoor walk in frigid weather. The hotel also provided hot chocolate around dinner time in the lobby (though it would have been even more appreciated if it was still available after dinner when we returned to the hotel numb from a frigid taxi ride) The front desk, concierge, bellman, doorman, and housekeeping staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. We were especially grateful to the front desk & security people who went above and beyond in helping to safely return a pouch of jewelry that we mistakenly left in the room safe. A quick phone call from the airport (when we discovered our mistake) took care of arranging a return the next day. All in all -- a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “THOROUGHLY DISGUSTED BY LACK OF ACCOUNTABILITY FOR STOLEN PROPERTY”
Reviews.Author: tommybah
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited Chicago in early November for a weekend of Chicago shopping and sightseeing...We found the Conrad-Chicago to be a typically appointed Conrad Hotel similar to several others we have had the pleasure of staying at not only for Business, but leisure travel....what we found shockingly disturbing, and quite frankly, appalling was the Conrad's (and Hilton's Corporate Executive Offices) complete lack of accountability or willingness to compensate us for the loss of STOLEN property from 1 of our 2 adjoining rooms....I am hopeful that reviewing my experience below at the Conrad Chicago will save others from countless hours of follow-up and property loss ..... One of our daughters decided to bring her $1800 Dell Lap-top computers along with her for the trip to complete her homework/projects....This computer was in one of her small tote bags that also contained shoes....A front desk attendant indicated a security tape of the lobby confirmed the bag was definately carried in by her at check in Friday Night, and I know it was definately in one of the rooms as late as Saturday afternoon... When we went to pack up on Sunday Morning, the bag with shoes and laptop was found to be missing...so after thoroughly checking every inch of both rooms, we reported the missing items and black bag to the front desk personal and they pleasanty said an investigation would take place...we were very appreciative and left to tour the SHed Aquarium...upon returning to the Hotel for a late check out I went back to the rooms to check one more time for the bag with no luck.....Unfortuntely we left the hotel with no laptop or bag with shoes but the Hotel front desk assured us that a investigation would be completed.... After returning to our home, my wife waited until Tuesday, and after no response from the Conrad Chicago, called to inquire about the investigation for the lost black bag with shoes and a laptop...Intitally the staff she spoke with were unaware of any such investigation, not giving up and getting increasingly frustrated my wife eventually was put on the line with the Hotel GM who repeatedly talked over her and essentially called her a liar by stating that there was no evidence that a black bag with shoes and a laptop was brought into or checked in to our room, AND HE THEN HUNG UP ON HER......UNBELIEVABLE !! At this point I became involved and wrote numerous emails to Conrad Staff who eventually FINALLY said they would complete a thorough investigation.....a few days later, "INCREDIBLY" after interviewing staff members and searching the Hotel, it was indicated to us that black bag with shoes (BUT NO LAPTOP) had been found under one of the beds in one of our rooms, and it was returned to us promptly...COME ON CONRAD -WHO ARE YOU TRYING TO KID HERE, it is OBVIOUS and does not take a genious to see the FACTS do not lie - there is some type of cover up going on by Hotel staff including the Hotel GM for a laptop that was stolen from us in our room at the Conrad.... ALMOST 3 MONTHS later we have yet to be compensated a single dime for theft of a $1800 Laptop computer that meant even more to our daughter as it had all of her school projects in progress on it ....and we spent over $2,000 at the Hotel for our 2 day stay....REAL NICE CUSTOMER TREATMENT...if you want that I suggest TRUMP Chicago up the street, my wife and I stayed there last month and had a truely 5 star experience!! I have resisted sharing my experience here as I typically like to take the high road and expected that a Hotel such as the Conrad would make this bad experience right promptly ....BUT THEY HAVE NOT, IN FACT THEY HAVE CONTINUED TO DRAG THIS SITUATION ON TERRIBLY, NOT TAKE ANY ACCOUNTABILTY OR ACCEPTANCE OF BLAME FOR OUR LOSS, AND MOST INFURIATING, they have INSULTED MY WIFE AND I ALONG THE WAY....

Reviews.Title: “Love the Conrad!”
Reviews.Author: mhsun
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, friendly staff, best location in the city and got it at a great rate. Awesome value for price. Will definitely be back! Thanks, Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: muratorhan
Reviews.Content: Great location. Direct access to the mall. Accross from Joe's, one of the best restaurants in town. Walking distance to Blue Chicago for great blues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Marieke17
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very quite. Our room over looked Michigan Ave and we were within walking distance of the Institute of Art and the Navy Pier. Enclosed over walk from hotel to mall next door with Nordstorms, LV, and lots of boutiques. Positive experience but would probably try somewhere different next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great in Summer and Great in Winter too!”
Reviews.Author: WarrenIrish
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent an evening in the city before heading out to the burbs. We've stayed at Hilton Hotel properties throughout the world and found this Conrad to be "special". The accomodations were very nice; the location to shopping and good restaurants couldn't be better; and the hotel personnel were just great! I think we've found a new home in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: thertzler1
Reviews.Content: This is a real Gem in the city of Chicago. With so many of the big names (Westin, Marriott, etc) having really taken a dive in recent years this hotel exceeds expectations. The lobby is beautiful, the staff is wonderful, and the rooms are big and well appointed. The bathrooms are brand new marble with a shower and tub (if that's your thing). It is located on Rush Street right by all the great restuarants and only a short walk from Michigan Ave. What amazed us even more is that they allow dogs, so we were able to bring out lab with us! We booked 2 ajoining rooms for a week as we await moving overseas and its been just great. I've stayed everywhere else in chicago and besides the Penninsula, this place is tops. The only slight knock would be the price of drinks int eh hotel bar ($14+) but there are so many options for dinner and drinks outside the hotel that its no big deal. Plus, I got a GREAT rate on hotels.com. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Conrad”
Reviews.Author: PNMTDoug
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful with spacious rooms that are nicely appointed. The bathrooms are wonderful! The location couldn't be better either- right in the center of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and consistent”
Reviews.Author: pswhitehead
Reviews.Content: I can always count on this hotel. The staff is very responsive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay at the Conrad Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Marbellaparis
Reviews.Content: I had another fantastic stay at the Conrad Chicago! My stay started off with a friendly, personable 'Welcome Back' greeting from Olga, she remembered me from my previous two stays. And then a delightful surprise - an upgrade to a suite! My very first upgrade to a suite! Now, that's some wonderful holiday cheer! The suite was truly lovely, living room, bedroom, large bathroom and fabulous views from the huge terrace overlooking Michigan Ave....I didn't even notice the cold December weather. I thought it was a really nice touch having complimentary hot chocolate in the lobby. It really added to the ambiance, holiday spirit. Definitely made it more festive. And it gave us a chance to meet and mingle a bit with some of the other hotel guests. Well, I enjoyed it and far more than I would have ever thought. As a Hilton Gold VIP, I received breakfast coupons. They have a HHonors breakfast on the menu. You can choose anything from a list - coffee, juice, toast, oatmeal, yogurt, fresh fruit (my ideal breakfast), plus - eggs, potatoes, pastries, cold cereal. For me, the breakfast was perfect. The location is excellent! Located at the Shops at North Bridge, which for a shopper like me, came in handy for a last minute Christmas gift. Didn't even have to put my coat on when I made a dash for Nordstrom. I really like that the Conrad Chicago uses Acca Kappa bath products. I love the White Moss scent. And as a female, I appreciate better quality bath products. With that said, I think this hotel is also a good fit for Bvlgari and L'Occitane bath products too. It would be really great if part of the amenities was a small loofah or a mesh sponge to use with the shower gel. The one thing missing for me, as I forgot to pack one. But good thing there is a Walgreens very close by. All in all, I had a spectacular time visiting with my friend in the Windy City. I look forward to my next visit to Chicago and the Conrad Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “great location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: cdfraser
Reviews.Content: We really liked Conrad Chicago. We went for a quick weekend Xmas shopping trip and the Conrad was perfect (connected to a small mall, which then connected to Michigan Avenue) -- close to everything...Hotel was clean, comfy, but not as nice as the previous Conrad I've stayed at...(the only other we've stayed at was in Indianapolis, which seems nicer). Still, loved this hotel, its atmosphere, and it's close proximity to shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding night in the lap of luxury at the Conrad Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JayBoiChi
Reviews.Content: From the time I was greeted by Ron at the front desk through checkout, we thoroughly enjoyed the luxury of the Conrad. Every staff member was exceptionally courteous. The room was very elegantly and stylishly appointed. It was our wedding night and we'd enjoyed a great dinner with friends and topped it off with a great stay at the Conrad. It was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “The Conrad is an Outstanding Facility, Great Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: amadonna
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the Conrad in Chicago. We were very pleased with the property and the location. I would certainly say this hotel is on par with other Conrad hotels we have enjoyed. We travel to Chicago frequently and have stayed at over a dozen hotels (including other Hilton properties and some of the landmark properties like the Drake and Palmer House). When we return, the Conrad will be our hotel of choice. It is situated in a great location at the Magnificient Mile, has a friendly staff and gorgeous suites.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great food, great location, in room movie not working.”
Reviews.Author: Christylove48
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with large rooms and a large bathroom. Hotel restaurant has great food and good service. The location is great for shopping and walking around the city. My only complaint is that my daughter and I rented an in room movie and watched three quarters of it only to have the screen go blank. We were told this had been happening and there was nothing that could be done to restart the movie. I asked for it to be removed from my bill and it was, however it would have been much better to let us know upon check in that problems existed with the movie system. We would not have invested the time watching a movie we might not see through to the end. Bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Can't ask for a better location”
Reviews.Author: Stuman348
Reviews.Content: You can check in, drop your coat in your room and shop for several hours at Nordstrom's and shops in the building. Michigan Avenue and outstanding restaurants are nearby. They now offer parking across the street with in and out privileges but you can park yourself. Also have a top of the line exercise room. All in all a great value and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: altavista23
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, fantastic value for money, best property we stayed in whilst in USA for 3 weeks. Location couldn't be any more central, particularly being so close to the Magnificent Mile. Staff were friendly, room was lovely and spacious and rate excellent (especially so close to Xmas). We would recommend this property to anyone travelling to Chicago. We stayed in hotels in the USA rated the same standard and well known brands and not one came close to the overall quality of this property.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: rrafay
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for New Year's. There was one surly woman at the front desk at our arrival but aside from that the stay was perfect. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable. The washroom is great. Service provided is top-notch and the location simply makes the hotel that much better. Parking is a bit steep, but Enterprise Rent-A-Car is across the street and we rented a car for one day and drove to the outlet malls. For the price, this hotel is vastly superior to anything else in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in a lot of Chicago hotels and the Conrad was one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: mrodino
Reviews.Content: Great location, and everything in the hotel looks brand new! The room was decent size and really comfortable! They have a pillow menu and you can select special pillows (including scent infused ones) that are promptly brought to your room. The bed and bedding were so comfortable I didn't want to leave in the morning. Hilton honors members get free breakfast and it wasn't a skimpy cold breakfast, it was a full hot breakfast, brought to your table! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch location, very helpful staff, wonderful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Principia
Reviews.Content: When booking this past summer, I lucked into a Christmas-in-July deal directly on the Conrad site that allowed us to lock in our room for $99 per night, which is an absolute *steal* for this hotel. The Conrad's front desk staff were friendly and extremely helpful from check-in all the way to check-out, assisting us with maps and directions and recommendations for activities for two tourists who were interested in experiencing Chicago as a living city rather than just checking off a list of landmarks visited. The location of the hotel is great not only for public transit access and walkability to the River North and downtown area, but also conveniently connected directly to The Shops at North Bridge, and very near some of the best restaurants in the city. The room was very spacious and well laid out, with a great view of the frescos on the Intercontinental across the street. The unexpected treat was the huge and luxurious bathroom, which featured not only a shower but a separate soaking tub, and all of the usual amenities plus such thoughtful details as a scale. The bed was delightfully comfortable. We didn't avail ourselves of the special pillows menu, but imagine that anyone who finds aromatherapy helpful when trying to relax after a long day would be very pleased to have those options available. The high-speed internet was easily accessible for guests and didn't put us through the rigamarole found at many hotels, where you have to go through a log-in process every time you try to access the Internet, but let us instead check in for 24 hours at a time. It was also included in the price of the room, which is often not the case even at better hotels, who sometimes charge nearly as much for Internet access as they do for parking. We had a great time here, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best start to our Route 66 trip”
Reviews.Author: Andymt
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our road trip of the mother road. We loved Chicago and we loved this hotel. It was a whirlwind stop but we could not fault the Conrad. Its location is superb - shops & restaurants literally on your door stop (on Magnificent Mile). Close to an L stop. Short walk to Navy Pier and sights of the city. We did an Chicago River Architecture Tour which was brill - we got to learn loads about the city. A must is cocktails up the John Hancock tower. The rooms were fab - very spacious and comfortable. It was just what we needed before we started our mammoth road trip. We were refreshed and ready to get Our Kicks on Route 66 after our stay at the Conrad Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel make me feel like I don't sell adhesive for a living....”
Reviews.Author: MarkSnellingMyInks
Reviews.Content: I'm a big Hilton guy...primarily staying at whatever Hilton property is the least expensive where I go (Hampton/Embassy/whatever). When I get the chance, and the rate is right, there is nothing I enjoy more than the opportunity to stay at The Conrad. The location couldn't be better for both business and social purposes. The hotel speaks for itself....it's just a great place to stay. The rooms are great...I enjoy having a real radio (Bose sound system) to listen to music in my room. There is nothing bad to say about the hotel, the rooms, and the amenities. What has always impressed me about The Conrad is the staff. They seem to enjoy what they do and are happy to go the extra mile for their customers. I'm in hotels every week and am used to some unhappy guy grunting at me when I walk in the door....it just doesn't work that way at The Conrad. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Its location makes this a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcarston
Reviews.Content: By itself, the Chicago Conrad is a nice hotel. Attractive, comfortable and friendly... but nothing special. What makes this hotel a great choice is its location. Right on Chicago's Magnificent Mile and attached to the Chicago Nordstrom's Department store and an indoor shopping mall. It is also a very short walk from numerous first class restaurants and night clubs. The lack of a swimming pool, however, was a disappointment to our children.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: lifesaver2009
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad for 4 nights with my wife. We were in town for shopping and this is a great location for just that. There were so many restaurants in the area and tons of stores. We parked across the street instead of valet parking, which is $51.00 VS the $38.00 per day in the ramp across the street. I got the junior suite for $175.00 per night. We arrived at 12:20 pm and were not sure if we could check in or if it was to early. They checked us in with no problem and were very nice. The whole staff was great throughout our staff. Housekeeping did a great job and we tipped $20.00 per day and it paid off with all the extra bottles of water left in our room each day and mints on our pillows and 2 coupons for a free large pizza and a local pizza pub, which was great. The room was ok, but i think it needs work. It just needs some good art work and the wood work in our room needed touch up. I'am not a hotel snob by any means. The bath/soak tub was great. If you request a bath butler it will cost $83.00 for him to prepare a bath for you with oils and salts. My wife passed on the due to the cost. You would think they would get much more business if they lowered the cost a bit. We had 5 drinks in the hotel lounge at a cost of $122.00. Lets just say we only did this once and found a great little pub close buy with way cheaper drinks. The room service prices were crazy. $23.00 for shrimp cocktail plus 18% tip and $5.00 service charge. We never ordered room service at these prices. Because of the high prices we ate elsewhere every night. Like i said it is a great location, but there are alos several other great hotels in the same area. I would not stay at the Conrad again due to the high drink and room service prices. It left a bad taste in my mouth. I know room service is a little more money but this was a little over done. One last thing, if you have a room facing Rush Street request something different. You will hear sirens all night long. There is a fire station 2 blocks away and for some reason always comme by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oh what a location! Right next to Rush & Mag Mile!”
Reviews.Author: FIUPANTHER
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Chicago and stayed at the Conrad. We have one down in Miami, Fl and knew the chain's name. Hotel is located right off of Rush Street and Mag. Mile. What does this mean? Restaurants, shops, bars, and things to do are right in front of you. Next to the hotel, you have Joe's Stone Crab (legendary Miami restaurant), Weber Grill, Giordanos Pizzeria, and many more. Keep walking about you can hit so many restaurants. You are in the HEART of all the shopping as well. Conrad has a cool concept because you can access the Nordstrom Mall area right next door. Service upon checking, help, and checkout was amazing. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and very nice. As for the Cons: I have been to other Conrads such as the one in Miami, FL and this one does not compare at all with the Miami location (decor, rooms). I would recommend that the hotels set more standards (decor, room style, etc). The Conrad name should not be tainted. His name should be reflected in everything about the hotel. I think if the hotel makes some adjustements to the room decor and furnishings - this would be an A Plus location!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Conrad has great location, service and views!!”
Reviews.Author: condohotelfan
Reviews.Content: Booked at the Conrad for our annual Christmas trip to Chicago and just returned. Great location on Rush Street and surrounded by great shopping and restaurants. We didn't spend much time at the Hotel so I would like to return when it's not snowing and we can enjoy the area more. Many guests were loaded with shopping bags and packages. So it's an easy walk to great shopping. (Nordstrom was directly across the street and I think the Hotel had a walkway or easy access to it.) It was snowing too hard and way too cold to explore the outdoor areas!! We were also enjoying a late night cocktail in the lobby bar when Larry Byrd and the Pacers checked in over the weekend. They were obviously in town to play the Bulls. I'm not a huge basketball fan but you can't miss that many tall guys walking thru the lobby...and anyone can recognize Larry Byrd. Security was tight and they were shuffled onto the elevator while the crowd in the bar applauded and cheered. But just a few minutes later Larry Byrd walks into the bar and took a table along the wall and was eventually joined by others. I thought then ... I like this place! Great beds, very quiet, extremely clean. And you never know who you will run into!!

Reviews.Title: “Premier upscale hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: alphagamma2005
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Conrad Chicago was thoroughly enjoyable - there is not a fault I can identify from start to finish. In our 3 nights there we enjoyed an excellent room, friendly and attentive service at all times and the location at the heart of North Michigan Avenue cannot be beaten (for those intending to shop during their stay there is the added benefit of direct link into the Shops at North Bridge - a nice way to keep warm in the cold winter months)! All in all a fantastic stay and would not hesitate in recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend. Wonderful Hotel. Excellent Service and Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: chitraveler44
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, great shopping within the Mall attached to the hotel for those Chicago extreme cold wintery days when you don't want to venture "the elements". Complimentary hot chocolate in the afternoon was a nice treat. Luxurious room; many amenities, wonderful city view.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacationlisa
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9:30am and were cheerfully allowed to check in. A king bed was reserved, but switching to 2 beds was no trouble either. Even though we were right next to the elevator, we never heard it or another guest. The room temperature was easily controlled. HDTV was perfect. We did the obligatory bedbug check, practically undressing both beds and the mattresses were clean as a whistle - in fact they could have been brand new they were so clean. The bathroom was bright and roomy. The towels were large, plentiful and plush. It was a great stay! Nice room, friendly service, good location.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Chicago Conrad was exquisite in every way.”
Reviews.Author: kandramiller1
Reviews.Content: It is my pleasure to comment on my stay at the Conrad Chicago. My work requires that I travel to Chicago monthly and I always stay at the Conrad. I am consistently treated with the utmost of courtesy and the accommodations are exquisite. The experience begins in the lobby, which is always elegantly decorated. The staff greet me by name, which makes me feel like I am a returning friend, not a nameless customer. The rooms are always immaculately clean and I love the comfort of the bed. It is my goal to purchase a mattress set that is used at the Hilton property for my own home. Thank you, also, for the plates of fruit. They are always a refreshing treat after a long day. I look forward to my stay in January. Happy Holidays to you and the staff at the Chicago Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location & excellent facilities.”
Reviews.Author: CKdingle
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four nights in Chicago, for the first time. The Conrad is located in an excellent spot, joined internally to a shopping mall including Nordstrom, Sephora, Lego, Bennetton, etc. There is a lovely Nordstrom cafe on the ground floor of the shopping mall for cheap breakfasts to go. The hotel has a lovely bar, which although expensive, did have lovely cocktails and was a very peaceful venue after a busy day's sightseeing. So much to see in Chicago and this hotel is perfectly located. Easy walking distance to the Water Tower, John Hancock Tower, Millenium Park, Chicago River, etc. Staff were very helpful and made you feel welcome from the moment you arrived, they even changed rooms so that our entire party could stay on the same floor near each other. Thanks for a wonderful trip, I hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot on Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: shawkel
Reviews.Content: The service is extraordinary and everyone is very polite. I like any hotel attached to a Nordstrom. It was easy to get in and out of, great access to Michigan Ave, etc. The first room they put us in smelled like cigarettes. Surprising! It's no smoking there. However, we called down to the desk and within 3 minutes had another hotel room and were moved up 10 floors to a room with a view for our "inconvenience." They were great. The gym was really nice too. If anything, I can say that the rooms aren't very big (big enough) and, I presume because my room was close to an elevator, you could hear doors slam every once in a while. That's it though - I would stay here again (2nd time staying actually) and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Clean, classy, and a delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hotelstayerBPH
Reviews.Content: Out hotel stay was excellent--and that should say something as I have stayed over 80 nights in Hiltons this year. We were upgraded to a King Deluxe Suite with a city view, where we also enjoyed a nice soaking tub and a very comfy king bed. They have a "pillow menu" that allows you to order complementary pillows that are scented or have different sizes. I ordered the relaxion/stress relieving pillow and my wife ordered the body pillow. The breakfast was the best I've had in a long time from a hotel. I would highly recommend staying here for business or for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - right on the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: HeyRayCa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property to meet our family for the Thanksgiving holiday. I'm sure we got a great deal because of the holiday week, and low volume of business travellers. Even at a higher price, the hotel would have been worth the stay, but for $135 a night, it was incredible, and because I am a Diamond Hilton Honors - wealso enjoyed a complementary, wonderful hot breakfast and platter of freshly cut fruit, made to order (I am so tired of the breakfast buffet at so many restaurants). Love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pdtravel1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while visiting family in Chicago. The Conrad is a beautiful hotel - quiet, luxurious, attentive staff, very good food, and very well located with direct access to Michigan Avenue -( through a nice warm mall!) Did I mention that I was able to sleep well in their comfortable bed? So great. I travel for work and stay in hotels weekly. Even with this all this hotel experience - the Conrad Hotel is impressive. I would recommend it to friends and family and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ikettin
Reviews.Content: I haï½„ a comfortable stay with this hotel. Clean room, excellent staff and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Location, Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Booktah
Reviews.Content: Swift and attentive front desk agents warmly welcomed our family despite the hectic weekend crowds lingering in the lobby. Both children were presented with stuffed toys and made to feel not just "allowed", but welcome! Roll away was already in our room and we were encouraged to order from the pillow bar. Ah-maze-ing!!! The most relaxing and comfortable overnight we have had with our two young children in a luxury hotel. Absolutely will stay again and recommend to others!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sue60218
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad Hilton for the first time over the Thanksgiving weekend and the experience was excellent. The hotel was in a perfect location for shopping, dining and an evening out. While I am a frequent Hilton stayer, this was my first experience at a Conrad Hilton and I would highly recommend this for anyone looking for a very upscale and convenient hotel in downtown Chicago. The bed was extremely comfortable, the room was quiet and we slept great! I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First time stay...can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: mjb201
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Conrad Chicago for an anniversary weekend and had a wonderful stay. The staff was very friendly, and we found the hotel and accomodations exceeded our expectations. I stay at a lot of Hilton properties across the country, and this was by far one of the best I have been to. Great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality and service for the price”
Reviews.Author: ckhusker83
