Reviews.Content: I would absolutely recommend the Conrad to anyone going to Chicago, whether it is business or pleasure. Their facilities are top-notch, and the amenities in the room are very nice. Large screen tv's, surround sound, and ipod docs in the rooms. The workout facility has plenty of room, and lots of options, whether it is free-weights or machines.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: DNotter
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at The Conrad Chicago before, both alone and with my wife. I was worried bringing a 5-year old this time because I wasn't sure she would do well at a higher-end hotel. From the moment we walked in, they treated her like royalty making her feel special. From the staff complimenting her outfit to the way people spoke to her like an adult, she felt very grown up. I appreciated that very much and I cetrainly be back, with or without my daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: ksf77
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room on Priceline. I am used to getting below 4 star quality rooms when you book with them. I was pleasantly surprised. First, you have to park across the street unless you want to valet park. It was kind of a pain. Parking is around $30 a day. When you check in, they automatically take a $100 per day deposit from the card you give them. They promptly put it back on the card once you leave (and you have incurred no charges). I had my 12 and 13 year olds with me. They ONLY had a king room. They offered a roll out bed for my son which was disappointing. The rooms are beautiful. Bathroom was the largest I've ever had before. My daughter was so excited since it was her bday weekend and I booked it to spoil her. We ordered room service. The food wasn't very good. The cheese pizza dough was so strange. The onion soup was ok...my breakfast was decent but I wouldn't order it again if I stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: afamily04
Reviews.Content: The hotel and lobby were very nice. The lobby was a few floors up and not on the street level which made it quiet and elegant. I liked that it was quiet and upscale. The rooms were clean and furnished nicely. Bathroom was very large. Hotel is connected to a mall where Nordstrom is located. Location close to Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: shakergrandma
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to a Christmas shopping weekend in Chicago, and thought the Conrad would be a good choice to stay, it is right next to Nordstroms on the Mag Mile. However, I was a little disappointed. Here are the pros and cons of our stay: Pros-- right off Michigan Ave. comfy beds lots of little amenities--ipod dock, large tv, etc good food in the restaurant friendly staff great tasting coffee in lobby very quiet rooms free internet Cons-- NO COFFEE MAKER IN ROOM very small room awkward bathroom layout small shower low water pressure horrible view from room I most likely would not stay again, there are too many other hotels. In room coffee is important to me, I don't want to get ready to go down to the lobby for a cup of coffee. Call me picky, but it's the Conrad for Pete's sake! Basically it wasn't quite elegant enough for me, it wasn't charming, romantic, or plush.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1788890
Reviews.Content: So glad we chose the Conrad this past weekend! The room was very chic; and the bathroom was large and luxurious. Great bed (scented pillows on request is a nice touch), and we couldn't believe how quiet it was. Fantastic location close to the best shopping and restaurants. Will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “clean, quiet, well appointed. perfect for shopping the miracle mile”
Reviews.Author: 941Cass
Reviews.Content: Outstanding. only complaint is the price of a glass of wine in the bar! ($15)

Reviews.Title: “Front desk and valet/bell staff was the best, they truly make the hotel what it is.”
Reviews.Author: rjsmom1117
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for a long weekend get away. The location is great it seems to be in the middle of everything. Most places are within walking distance to the hotel. The hotel is also connected to a shopping mall so that is also very nice. The hotel is very upscale but comfortable. The staff there is phenomenal. The front desk staff go out of their way to assist with anything including dinner reservations and can get you into just about any restaurant you want. The rooms are very nice, sheets and bed were very comfortable. Bathroom needs some updating/deep cleaning of shower and vents. That really needs to be addressed. Valet and bell staff were outstanding even helped pack a bag and gave some good food suggestions. Overall I would say its a good hotel and the best location if you want to be close to it all. If you have any questions feel free to ask. Oh and check out Chicago Greeters its a free service provided by the city (basically your very own free tour guide) it was the best part of the trip. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, nice rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: dottie dog
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a business stay as well as personal -- it's attached to the nordstrom shopping center by skybridge, easy parking if you need it, and great staff. Rooms are well appointed and well maintained (loved the pillow menu but didn't try it). Front desk staff were very helpful with even the smallest requests.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great location, high end product.”
Reviews.Author: amandaallen21
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of hotels and cleanliness means a lot to me. This hotel is very clean and the products; bedding, furniture, etc are high end. The location is great, right in the middle of it all and within 2 blocks of the Red Line.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: blbloom
Reviews.Content: I loved this location as you could actually go to Nordstorm's without going outside. I also liked the friendliness of the staff. Plus nice fitness center (for a hotel).

Reviews.Title: “What a hidden jewel”
Reviews.Author: bmbush05
Reviews.Content: From the arrival/check-in to dinner, shopping, relaxing, hightlife and check-out, our stay was perfect. The staff was wonderful and the facilities were top-notch. If you are coming to Chicago, I would highly recommend this "hidden gem" in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: travelingirl91
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Conrad while attending a tradeshow. Wonderful experience! Rooms were large, comfortable, and super clean. Great location, within walking distance to many restaurants/clubs. The staff was great and always greeted me by name. I will definitely stay here again during my next trip to Chicago. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area and looking for a central location with upscale amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: Dontheroad
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. A full service downtown hotel without all the usual added hassle and expense. Internet is free, AM coffee is available in the lobby (and is free) so you are not stuck making coffee in a tiny pot in a bathroom. TV's are huge with Bose system and there are 15 kinds of pillows available.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: cdotarmstrong
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad for 3 nights on business. The location is excellent, a few mins walk from the magnificent mile in downtown Chicago. The bedrooms are roomy with a very large bathroom including bath and stand alone shower. A 42 inch widescreen and Bose sound system are included in each room. The standard price when I stayed was 400 USD per night although the company I work for gets a corporate rate so it was a lot cheaper. Breakfast is a very formal affair (no buffet) and also very expensive. I had strawberry parfait, fruit and tea - all excellent but pricey. The hotel was very clean and the staff friendly. I would recommend this hotel for business but not for leisure. In summary I would say this is a top notch hotel in a great location and this is reflected in the price. It is certainly a case of you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but Not Conrad Service Level”
Reviews.Author: mtd856
Reviews.Content: When we arrived no Bellman and Doorman just directed us to the elevator up to registration. We have stayed at Conrads before and were barely out of the taxi when our luggage was already on its way. We were told we had a city vew. Our city view could be seen looking sideways out our window. Not what we expected. We didn't ask to move as we heard front desk on phone with another guest about the city view situation when we checked in and they were told the only option was the room they were already in... The insulation is terrible. I would assume that when you have a hotel in the middle of a busy city area you would have insulation for the accompanying noise. Not so. We heard every car horn, ambulance and fire engine for 4 nights. We were happy to go home to catch some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: m_lopez0714
Reviews.Content: Overall Great hotel and location! The hotel is located in a mall and had several dinning and shopping options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Service, Awesome pillows”
Reviews.Author: SpfldCardsFan
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful and very comfortable. We ordered off the pillow menu both nights and it was well worth it. The Cold and Flu pillow and Relaxation pillows smelled wonderful. We ordered room service for breakfast one more and they give you a time range to deliver. We choose 8:30-8:45 and they were a few minutes late (closer to 8:50) but they called to let us know that they were running late. Overall, the service and the room was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location/experience”
Reviews.Author: mdtravel_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, the workers were nice/accomendating/ excellent location to everything (less than $5 to get to anywhere downtown w/extra rider OR wonderful walking distance to everthing as well). It was worth every penny, my girlfriend was impressed and loved it. Oh the bed was very comfortable...knocked out...lol But I must say, the extra money I spent for a "city view" was NOT worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: dtown85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very excited to be staying at the Conrad, unfortunately, we would never stay in this hotel again. The rooms looked nice, but the closer you look there was mold in the bathroom and red stains that looked like dried blood near the sink. The room service cost was super high - costing us over $100 for 1 burger, 1 order of french toast, 2 pops and 2 desserts. In the middle of the night the pipes in our room made a very loud vibrating noise which kept us awake. We called the front desk and it took almost 40 minutes for someone to walk over to our room (we were on the 5th floor, same as the reception desk). They did nothing to fix it and the same thing continued the following night and anytime the room above us or to the right used their shower. The staff was friendly enough, but NOT helpful and they did nothing to try and make our stay better with all of the problems. There was not even a coffee pot in the room. Definitely would NOT stay here again for the price. NOT worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Understated Elegance - one of my all time favorites”
Reviews.Author: swimbikerunhike
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. Nothing over the top or grand, but every detail was perfect. Loved it. Shopping trip with adult daughter - we both thought it was one of the nicest rooms we'd ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Still Great, Though Service has been Uneven”
Reviews.Author: dagnytaggart
Reviews.Content: I visit Chicago on visit every six weeks or so. This year I've tended to rotate around between the Trump, the Conrad and the new Hotel Palomar, based on price and availability. I had occasion to stay at the Conrad twice in September, once at the beginning of the month and then on an award trip overnight third week of the month. I still like the hotel very much--beds are comfy, decor is nice. It's a very comfortable place to stay. A few observations: Early-month trip: When I checked in, they had a spread of fruit and water in the room with a card with someone else's name on it. Obviously, not my room. But, they let me stay and keep the stuff, which was nice. Ended up having to work late hours in the room and had occasion to order room service. Really excellent food. Even the fries were good in a unique way. Room service guy was great, very conscientious, though it took way too long. With those TVs, though, they need to update to HD. Put on a movie to keep me up while working and the no HD option really reduced the benefit of the $15 movie. Also, when I called about the fact that the lamps in the room would just randomly turn off, the response wasn't helpful. I called twice over my 3-day trip. Never was fixed. On the plus side, the front desk was able to extend my stay at the same rate when I had to stay another day, so that was nice. Late-month overnight: On the late month stay, I discovered that if you don't pay for a room, that have the tiniest room ever just waiting for you. Definitely too small by Chicago standards. Not even room in the bathroom for a separate shower stall. Kind of bummed by the fact that on a weekend when the hotel obviously wasn't full that I couldn't get even a normal room for the zillion points they charged. So, it's still among the top options in Chicago. Service has been up and down, so going to the Palomar for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: jjo
Reviews.Content: At the price I paid through Hotwire, this was a great deal. If you want to stay in the Mag Mile area, this is a good location and a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, always friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Mikedavecohen
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is in an excellent location, the rooms are pleasant, well furnished and spotless and the staff are pleasant and helpful. It will certainly be our first port of call on our return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & nice accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Robert20101025
Reviews.Content: Great location off Michigan Ave. Walking to distance to all shops, etc. Our standard room was nice, clean, & updated with large 42" plasma & Bose stereo system. Very comfortable bed. Never ate at the hotel b/c too many great restaurants to enjoy in walking distance so no comment there. Morning complementary coffee in the lobby was great and so was the late afternoon hot coco (some of the best I've ever had). Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: RNP1969
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Chicago for business and my normal hotels were booked. I saw a good rate at the Conrad and it was around the corner from where I normally stay so thought I'd give it a try. I was upgraded to a suite and the room was awesome. Extremely comfortable. Great bed with fantastic pillows. I never have been a fan of hotel pillows and these were great. I accidentally left my computer cord in the room and they had it for me at the front desk to swing by and pick up. Very easy. Overall great experience. I have a new favorite hotel in Chicago for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful value, great room”
Reviews.Author: Mark Gr.
Reviews.Content: This is our new favorite downtown Chicago hotel. Right near shopping and the red line, very comfortable rooms, nice bar, outstanding service all around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but somewhat disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jechho
Reviews.Content: As I had a terrific stay at Conrad Indianapolis some weeks ago, I was really looking forward to visiting its name brother in Chicago. Sadly, my expectations were not met. Upon arrival, we were given a hotel with a window that was impossible to shut properly. Ok, change of room. The room was nice enough, but only because we gotten a high floor room faced away from the Mich. Avenue. Some rooms are really close to the terrace restaurant /bar- those should probably be avoided at all costs. The concierge service was almost non-excisting. When we asked if they could book a food tour for us, the man at the concierge desk advised us to do it ourself online. Okay, why didnt I think of that in the first place? The fitness room was very Hampton Inn-style. No water bottles or cold towels, and the room was very hot and humid (where was the air con?). No permanent staff supervising the room. To our surprise, there were no turn down service. When I asked about this, I was told that this had to be ordered spesifically. However, the breakfast was truly amazing. I have never tasted a better omelet with potatoes. Loved that they had a HHonors breakfast menu option, never seen that before. The room itself was great too. Huge, with a lovely bathroom. No bathtub, though. Some channels on the TV were missing/not working, like Fox. When I asked about this, they could not give me an answer on why. Told me that they would send a technican - but I guess they forgot, All in all a good stay, but not a great one. I actually found Conrad Indianpolis a little bit better. The location is hard to beat, but then again there are a lot of nice hotels in the area. I got a great rate, and therefore choose to give this hotel a 4 star rating. If I had paid more than 300 dollars a night, I would probably have given it a 3 star overall rating.

Reviews.Title: “Major disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Shawn-HK
Reviews.Content: Location is great, friendly staff and rooms are large, but my first room had a strong smell of cleaning supplies. I switched rooms and when I plugged my computer in under the desk I saw how filthy it was (see photo). Unacceptable for a hotel of this category. I found another hotel in the area and checked out the following day.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jocdenver
Reviews.Content: Was in Chicago for the Chicago Marathon. Room was very nice, facing Michigan Blvd. Hotel has nice pool area lounge that Sunday night showing the football game. It was nice to relax there in the evening after the race. Location was great next to shopping and many restaurants in the area all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “What More Could You Ask For?"”
Reviews.Author: slatepencil
Reviews.Content: What a perfect stay at the Conrad! Terrific registration and concierge service, excellent housekeeping, quality rooms, very comfortable beds, and great location ON the Magnificent Mile! The free internet was an added bonus! Only two blocks to the Michigan Avenue Bridge and the architectural tours that should NOT be missed. Restaurants galore! Attached to Nordstrom's and oodles of shopping. The terrace lounge was still open and very relaxing. Breakfast at The Restaurant was superior! The parking package was very efficient. If you find anything wrong with this hotel, you're just being cranky! Why look elsewhere?

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, quiet and friendly”
Reviews.Author: vanessacondesa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after the marathon and it was a great place to relax and unwind. The location is unbeatable-- particularly if you want to get in some shopping on the Magnificent Mile. The staff was friendly, the food was good and the room was relaxing and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for mag mile shopping trip”
Reviews.Author: zgirl21
Reviews.Content: My 14-year-old daughter and I enjoyed our 3-night week-end stay at the Conrad. The LOCATION is great - at the end of mag mile/michigan avenue, connected to Nordstrom's. The ROOMS are big for this area, and the bathrooms are nice and spacious. Appreciated the separate door to the water closet. We took other readers' advice and upgraded to the city-view room in hopes of reduced street noise (these rooms do NOT face Mich Ave); while i don't have a comparison, i am a light sleeper and slept very soundly. The FITNESS CENTER was above average. If memory serves, there were 3 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, 3 stationary bikes, a few weight machines, and a full set of dumbells. I visited the FC at 8:30 a.m. on a Saturday and the only wait was for an elliptical. The complimentary aromatherapy pillows are a nice touch, and the eucalyptus offering helped with the travel-induced congestion. Also appreciated by both my teenager and me was the COMPLIMENTARY WIRELESS, to which we connected effortlessly. The hotel was at full capacity, but we did not have long waits for elevators as i have had at other area hotels. We did not try the restaurant or room $ervice. Had this been an adult-trip, the terrace looked like a perfect spot for a post-shopping cocktail. I have stayed at the marriott, wyndham, and embassy suites in the mag mile area, and i would say the conrad was the best of the 4, based on its location; the style, size and comfort of rooms; and overall value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: rtpatrick
Reviews.Content: Comfy beds, well appointed rooms, par for the course for the Conrad. Breakfast was delicious! Valet or self park in the lot right accross the street and walk to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed at in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Todd67-10
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service, great rooms! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “it was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: music-soul
Reviews.Content: there was a small prob with our reservation. the front desk staff (stephanie) handled it with class. we received an upgrade to a large suite, it was beautiful, comfortable and clean, best sleep ive had in awhile, bed was comfy. the staff continued to make us fee welcome for our stay. they recommened a restaurant fultons on the water, it was a little pricy but best steak i ever had.

Reviews.Title: “For those who want to soak in the tub...”
Reviews.Author: jujubean45
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Chicago for our first anniversary, and felt well-taken care of at the Conrad. We had requested a room with a city-view, but when I walked in was a little disappointed that there was a cement pillar blocking the view from one of the windows, not to mention the top of Nordstrom's right below us. Oh well, I thought. But my husband poked his head in the bathroom and calls me in, and we're both smiling--this is probably one of the biggest bathrooms I've seen. Glass shower, separate soak tub, spacious sinks, and a separate toilet room. Normally a budget traveler, I wouldn't dare touch a tub, but the Conrad keeps the place so clean I had no qualms soaking not just once but twice in it - what a treat for the pregnant lady! We were here during marathon weekend, and it was a special unexpected treat for me (a big runner) to watch mile 1 of the Chicago marathon right outside the Conrad. We had plans to hit Evanston that morning, but it was no trouble once the runners were gone to take the El (Grand on the Red line, conveniently two blocks down the street). We later visited the gym, which didn't have the most modern equipment, but it seems adequate enough. Beyond that, we also met one of the mini-bar attendants, who initially stopped by to check the cache, but graciously took the time to bring up a separate microwave, fridge, and extra bottles of water. I may not have liked the view that much (and probably wouldn't have paid extra for it), but hey, everything else made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED It!”
Reviews.Author: MickMick
Reviews.Content: My mother, sister and I traveled to Chicago for Memorial Day weekend. From the moment we stepped into the lobby, we were in awe of the beautiful and luxurious accommodations at the Conrad. First, the location is PRIME. We love Nordstrom so we were quite happy to see that the Nordstrom is right there. Second, the hotel is very clean. The room wasn't the least bit sketchy. There was no evidence of previous visitors. The floors and surfaces were dust and dirt-free. Third, the amenities - slippers, bath products were ample. I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Luxe and fabulous”
Reviews.Author: amylynnc
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is a gorgeous hotel with luxe amenities. My friend and I especially enjoyed having drinks on the outside terrace bar. Gorgeously appointed, spacious, fabulous bathroom!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: dseesel
Reviews.Content: Visited the Conrad during Marathon weekend...hard to find a good deal here or anywhere else but check it out when the city isn't quite as packed. Enjoyed the smaller scale of this very well-run hotel, where you never feel like you're part of a tourist throng despite the central location. Spacious, comfortable rooms -- with the one quibble that the duvets are awfully heavy and there ought to be the option of a lighter blanket and sheet. (Loved the pillow options, however.) Enjoyed the free coffee and newspapers, always treated well by the staff who were dealing with the special demands of having 40,000 runners go right by the front door on Sunday morning. Only major complaint: Because of the Marathon street closure, we ate breakfast in the hotel on Sunday morning, found the prices to be ridiculously high compared to the "gold standard" Sofitel breakfast. It didn't leave us with a great perception about the Conrad's value...we would look harder next time for a package including breakfast if available.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: RunnerAnya
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Chicago to run the Chicago marathon on 10/10/10. We arrived late at night and were greated with an excellent service from the concierage desk all the way to the room. Through out the stay the staff used my name while talking with me or any time I called the front desk. Since, I was new to the city the staff was able to provide me with great recommendations on the places to go visit and dine at. I also really liked hotel's mattresses and pillows! They were so comfortable I wanted to take them home. Also, the hotel allowed late check out since I ran the marathon and wanted to take a shower before I left the city. Well, I was running late due to traffic and the staff was able to extand the time even further. Which I thought it was really nice of them. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to get the Ritz-Carlton experince but not pay the price of one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Hotel, Great City”
Reviews.Author: JB64London
Reviews.Content: Hotel spot on. Staff excellent going the extra mile. Would recommend this hotel, with a good central location.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: virginiawanderer
Reviews.Content: I am quite fussy, and I have only good things to say about my recent stay. The Sofitel has met its match. Clean, quiet, and tasteful. Lovely touches like slippers, robe, free wifi and orchids in the hallway. Good strong coffee in the lounge in the morning. I note that a previous reviewer complained that the decor was boring brown. Sorry that they did not notice the taupe, cream, and silver colors as well, the chocolate leather chairs, and the grey velvet easy chair - to me it was elegant and soothing. The staff was professional, friendly, and accommodating. When I did not like the room I was given on check in because it faced an alley, they changed my room right away. When something broke in my room, they offered to send the maintenance person right away. Great location in the heart of downtown, where the architecture always knocks my socks off - right above Nordstroms, where the shopping is heavenly. Had a great meal with friends at the outdoor restaurant -so nice to be outside but away from traffic on the 5th floor. I was traveling alone to attend a conference over at the Sheraton and I felt very safe. I absolutely recommend this hotel - to me, it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ChicagolandSteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed a the Conrad for our 15th Anniversary. The manager sent up a nice note with chocolate strawberries, apricots, and other tasties, which was a very nice and unexpected touch. Very comfortable beds, excellent service, and you can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “ultra hip, trendy and chic”
Reviews.Author: lesliealikhan
Reviews.Content: great staff, incredible view, great service, modern building, modern rooms -- made us feel like movie stars!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: timmy16
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Conrad to celebrate our one year engagement anniversary and a birthday, the Conrad made this one of the best celebrations ever! We had an executive suite facing Michigan Ave that was spectacular-the room was just perfect! I had called in the day before and ordered some champagne and chocolate strawberries as a surprise to my fiance to be delivered right at 4:30 and they were right on time, it made the surprise perfect! Overall, the hotel is very nice and is a perfect location for just about anything you want to do in the city. You walk out the front door and you can shop, eat or go see just about any attraction you want to see in Chicago. In addition to that, the staff is top notch and they really go out of their way to make your stay perfect! We will definitally return to the Conrad and if you are looking for a great hotel-this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kathylynnwarren
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Chicago and really did not know where to begin. I started searching the internet and that helped alot. It was our 35th wedding anniversary and we wanted to stay somewhere special. The Conrad was the perfect place to celebrate. You are right in the middle of the magnificent mile and the hotel is connected to the mall. The service was great and when they found out it was our anniversary, they sent up a tray of chocolates. It was wonderful. Thanks again to Ayoko for her hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly, I was expecting more.”
Reviews.Author: msky123
Reviews.Content: Honrad Hilton is supposed to be top of the line. The best of the Hilton chain. Its named after Conrad hilton, for goodness sake. I spent 3 nights there. It was booked for me as part of a BA travel package, so i know I paid the full price. There was no breakfast included, which was a shame, but there are a lot of 7/11 stores around to get quick breakfast. The location of this hotel is very nice. Its located in the general hotel area and very close to N. Michigan avenue with all shoping and attractions. Its also about 10 minutes walk to John Hancock building and its 94th floow observatory. The staff was very nice and friendly, very respectful of my wishes not to be disturbed. With all the nice features that it has, there were a few negative parts. The hotel, annoyingly, is very brown. The floor, the walls, the decour.... everything. Brown. Its just dull. I know its supposed to be a hotel for grown ups, but put some colour into it. I was placed on 11th floor in a room facing an office building. you basically had to close the curtain after 8am if you want any privacy. The parking at $51/day has to be avoided at all cost. All they do is just stick it in the parking garage accross the street. So save your money and do that yourselves. You will save about $15/day.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST HOTEL in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: busymomtraveller
Reviews.Content: We had the most FABULOUS time at the Conrad. Both my husband and I have never had such an amazing experience at a hotel as we had there. What a way to celebrate our first anniversary! Every member of the staff, from the front desk (especially Carol for recommending two great restaurants for dinner), restaurant staff, bar staff (especially Sergio) and even the housekeeping staff were always friendly and smiling. I travel to Chicago twice a year for different trade shows, and now I will only stay at the Conrad. They truly go above and beyond in every aspect of their hotel. Our room was beautifully appointed, and most of all clean and comfortable. I would recommend the Conrad to anyone looking for a special hotel experience! It's truly a home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: CodeRN2
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago and the Conrad Chicago was recommended to us. What a truly wonderful hotel. Not only was the hotel in a prime area but the service was superior. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tsutton
Reviews.Content: I had a couple of free night certs for Hilton so we decided to spend a weekend in Chicago. Check in was quick and efficient and the hotel lobby was nice. Our room was small but it was what we had booked so I can't complain. I was hoping for a room upgrade being Hilton Diamond but was told that several wedding parties were staying at the hotel that weekend and nothing was available. All in all a nice hotel with a friendly professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel But Some Unwanted Guests”
Reviews.Author: na9101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad for 3 nights, from Sept 30 th Oct 3rd. Was travelling with the wife for our anniversary and stayed using Hilton Honors points. This was our 2nd time in Chicago and 1st time at the Conrad. Upon checking in (very late @ 2am due to flight delays), we were upgraded to a King City View room, #1736. We spent the night in that room, which looked good and the bed was comfortable. The next day, after going out for lunch and then a ballgame, we returned in the evening to find two HUGE spiders on our ceiling. Called down to the front desk to see if they had any other rooms available. The receptionist stated they were completely booked for the night but offered to place us in their 'last sell' room. As we had no other option and did not want to stay in our original room, we took this new room, #536. The room itself was fine... handicap accessible, which made the shower and bathroom wide and open. However, the bedroom directly faced the Terrace Bar, which was in operation from 11:30am-midnight. Closing the curtains relieved the problem of the patrons being able to see inside the room, but it didn't alleviate the noise coming from the bar's music system. The next day, we were moved to a 3rd room, #936. This was slightly larger than the 1st two rooms and we had no issues with this one. Would have been great if we had this room for our entire stay. Staying in 3 different rooms during our 3-night stay was not the ideal way to celebrate an anniversary trip. I will commend the Conrad's staff for being as helpful and accomodating as possible. As we were using points, they stated they could not refund any portion of them. But they did offer a complimentary lunch in the Restaurant, which was quite good. In the end, the stay was disappointing due to the pests in our 1st room and having to change rooms so many times. The hotel did it's best to fix things, but given all of the above, we will probably look to stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a very good price”
Reviews.Author: Larry096
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Hilton is a very nice hotel and if I had to summarize it in one word, it would be serene. It is in a great location on MIchigan Ave., but the presssure of people is removed the minute you walk into the lobby. My wife and I think it is was one of our best stays in Chicago and we liked just as well, if not better, then when we have stayed at the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but some bad rooms - AVOID rooms by the roof-top bar”
Reviews.Author: Consultant2468
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property - clean, good location, good services, not a five star and just about a four star. The major problem is much like the Phoenician in Scottsdale -- just like the Phoenciain has all of those horrible rooms in their "basement" area on the first floor where on the back side of the hallway, the rooms are dark because they are partially underground -- in the same manner, the Conrad has a number of rooms that are located by their roof-top bar. I stayed my first night in one -- Room 536 -- that was located literally right beside the bar. I could sit at the desk and the bar patrons were within 6 feet of me - just on the other side of the glass. Thank goodness the curtains were not lie the curtains in those Days Inn / Motel Six motels where the outside hallways are right next to the front window. But roof-top bars have become popular in Chicago and the Conrad needs this apparently. But if you have one of these rooms, your nights will be short. so unless you can live on 4-5 hours of sleep, try another hotel -- or ensure that the Conrad will guarantee you a room away from the bar. Bell service is fair, registration is on 5th floor, property is very clean, restaurant is good at least for breakfast and lunch (did not try for dinner).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but staff needs to receive some training”
Reviews.Author: ryanberry2
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that this hotel came recommended to me by the Trump Hotel when I was unwilling to pay $550 per night for one of their rooms. The Conrad is a good hotel and it is located in a great location if you're interested in shopping or sight-seeing downtown. Most of the staff was very helpful and consiterate however the stay was not without its complications which will keep me from staying there in the future. At $1,195 for three nights (by the time you pay taxes) you certainly want it right and they did not make it "right". The first issue was that after unpacking three suit cases I started to notice a faint but unpleasant smell. It took me a while to locate the issue but I eventually found a large plate of rotten strawberries encased in mold that had been overlooked by staff for sometime. I don't think it was housekeeping's fault as I found them in the food cabinet that was I was told his monitored by someone else but it was nasty and it hadn't been there for just a few days. They offered to move my room but we had just unpacked and after a very long trip I just decided to stay in the room as I was not looking to spend another hour packing, moving and unpacking. Later we tried to book a boat tour and a restaurant reservation through the "concierge" who was just the front desk guy sitting in as the concierge. He said that he could make those reservations and that they do that all of the time for guests. He told me that he would leave a note in my room related to the time of my dinner reservation the following night. We left for the day and came back at night to find there was no note, there was no voicemail and there was no reservation. I had to go to the front desk where they told me that seating was not available and that they were "sorry". Well, that's great but it sure would have been nice to know that I needed to make a reservation somewhere else rather than having to seak out the "no" answer after I had tipped the guy 5 bucks to make a phone call. I then asked them if they could suggest any other restaurants for the following evening but they said they were booked up. So I decided to call one of the restaurants myself and found that they had plenty of seating and to "pick whatever time I wanted" after 7pm. So, moral of the story...don't expect them to help you book anything and if you do, check behind them and don't bother tipping because it makes no difference. This is not what you expect from a $350 per night hotel! Oh, did I mention that I paid for the "Bed and Breakfast" package which they failed to recognize at check in and then I had to remind them of the package and go collect my "breakfast vouchers" which ended up not even covering my full breakfast.! Each day I spent about $15 bucks on breakfast for me and my wife even though Breakfast was suppose to be included. Little things like coffee for one person is $6 bucks! Again, I understand this kind of thing normally but when you're told that "Breakfast is included in the Bed and Breakfast package" then you shouldn't have to spend an extra $45 dollars over three days to get breakfast! So, is it a good hotel in terms of location and comfort, yes it is. Is it worth $300+ per night, no it's not. Does the staff need some serious training and maybe a visit to the Ritz or the Trump....definitely! Oh, and don't spend the extra money on the Romance package that comes with strawberries because you will likely have left over strawberries in your room when you get there....Have fun finding them!

Reviews.Title: “Went the extra miles”
Reviews.Author: seamus62
Reviews.Content: We had a recent trip to Chicago for a special celebration. Because of the unique reasons for the trip and my being a person who uses a wheelchair, I had a good number of special requests. All of the personnel I had contact or dealings with, from management on down to housekeeping, went the extra mile, or more, to make it an absolutely delightful stay. Couldn't have asked for anything better.

Reviews.Title: “Windy city,great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmigoWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 night, visited before and as always a great hotel. There for the a trade show and a few days sight seeing. Room very good ,clean and well equiped, restaurant prices high and,for me, food not ideal, better places within walking distance (try the Grand Luxe Cafe for breakfast you will not be disappointed). Hotel is in great location, good staff and friendly,efficient service. House keeping in particular is first class. Ideal for city visits. Will be back ther in two uears time if all goes well.

Reviews.Title: “Big city luxury- hometown friendliness”
Reviews.Author: pegteam
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my sisters and only wish we could have stayed longer!!! We had made too many plans and did not have enough time to just hang out in the hotel. Loved the cozy inviting look and feel of the inside bar but the terrace bar was FABULOUS! The evening turned chilly but people were bundled up on cozy blankets watching a movie on a big screen! Reminded me of going to a drive in movie!!!! I regretted we had dinner plans because we could have stayed there all night!!!! Room was beautiful- decorated in classy neutrals and the bathroom was huge! Staff was sincere and friendly...no snooty factor at all! LOved it! LOved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: KnowsHotels39
Reviews.Content: Beautifully designed hotel located within the Nordstrom shopping complex and an entrance onto Michigan Avenue. Although a large Hilton family hotel, it has a certain boutique feel. The 5th floor terrace is perfect for evening cocktails. The recent introduction of complimentary high speed internet is an added benefit, and the Hilton Honors breakfast is a great value. Outstanding valet staff ! Front desk personnel were genuinely friendly and knowledgeable, but the breakfast servers were the most surprisingly attentive and accomplished of all. Bartenders on the outdoor terrace were nice people who could carry on an intelligent conversation without being intrusive and made excellent cocktails. The terrace servers were not quite up to that level. Overall, the hotel is a great find. Valet parking is expensive, but typical for the location. The room rates tend to run high, but this is also typical of the location. There is value, however, in joining the Honors program.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: lloydiant
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms but very noisy...could hear sounds all night coming from both outside and inside the hotel itself. Room was dark and mini bar was not stocked daily. Terrace bar was very relaxing and the host was very friendly and remembered our names throughout our stay. Staff was not overly helpful. I asked for an upgrade and was told that it was not an option. I later overheard guests celebrating the fact that they were going to be upgraded to a larger room...the desk clerk could have at least kept my name in the event a larger room became available. The desk clerk also told me there was a continental breakfast every morning...unfortunately the only item available was coffee...no food. Petty complaints and overall it was a good experience and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Seamlessly comfortable experience”
Reviews.Author: NJTraveller_10
Reviews.Content: Like a great restaurant where you never notice all the effort that goes into making your meal pleasant and so you can focus on your dining experience, the Conrad does the hotel equivalent. Everything as it should be: pleasant knowledgable staff, comfortable room, and conveniently located. Had a deluxe room which was spotless, and a huge bathroom with tub and separate shower. The breakfast in their dining room was one of the best ever - not inexpensive, but a real gourmet quality meal prepared to order.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: wyyzgyy
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Palmer House when I travel to Chicago because its closer to my office. But when Palmer was booked solid, I got to experience the treat of staying at the Conrad. My visit was short so I was only able to take advantage of what the room had to offer - which was plenty of upscale furnishings and fine touches of comfort. The TV + Bose sound system was so great I stayed up all night watching movies! The bathroom was stylish and roomy. The bathtub was so inviting, I even indulged in a rare bath. I busted out the slippers and threw on the robe and milked the experience for all it had. Here's hoping to a sold out Palmer House in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay of all time”
Reviews.Author: KSF45632
Reviews.Content: We used my boyfriend's Hilton Honor's Rewards points to book this room. We tried to get a suite but we were informed there wasn't one available - but they would add in the comments that we would like one. Needless to say, they put us in the terrace suite that is not even available to the public. We had excellent service our whole stay. The restaurant on the terrace has a confusing menu so we didn't eat there, but it looked like a great place! Free botttled water and complimentary pillow menus for guests was a great touch. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & Safe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blacksadegirl
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived I continually encountered pleasant and helpful staff. I was upgraded to a single suite which was gorgeous. The rooms are very clean and overall, the hotel is well maintained. It is a very nice hotel for a stay in Chicago. I really liked the fact that it was attached to a mall and Nordstrom. I ordered a tomato salad and calamari from the hotel restaurant and enjoyed my meal in the outdoor restaurant. I was surprised to find out that this Conrad did not have an executive lounge and the breakfast area was under renovation. Although they provided vouchers for breakfast the items which were covered by it were minimal. As well, there was no late afternoon/evening snacks (one of my favourites in the other Conrad hotels I have stayed in!).

Reviews.Title: “beautiful suite for our wedding night”
Reviews.Author: jackiechamplain
Reviews.Content: Clean, large room with well-appointed bathroom. We liked the pillow menu as well. Room service food was good and delivered promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cenobia_Gilchrist
Reviews.Content: The hotel has recently been renovated and is quite elegant and tasteful. The bedroom and bathroom were both well appointed, clean and fresh. The staff was very helpful. Room service was prompt and very well done. I will always stay at the Conrad when I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and fantastic accommodations make for a fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: newyorker4ever2010
Reviews.Content: To begin with, the Conrad is in the most amazing location. It's situated in a very fashionable part of town and part of a high end mall. Self-parking is conveniently located across the street and is connected to the mall/ hotel so you don't even have to go outside. In addition, the Chicago Architecture Boat Tour is only a five minute walk away. The Conrad itself is luxurious and contemporary in feel. I absolutely loved he 500 thread count Pratesi sheets and pillow menu. My husband loved the 42" plasma TV along with a Bose sound system. Service was impeccable. Free wi fi, a top notch gym and free fresh coffee and tea (in the morning) seal the deal making this one of the best places to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: canmac2
Reviews.Content: As a first time visitor to Chicago and the Conrad, we would highly recommend the Conrad. Staff, Concierge and Wait Staff were superb. Guest rooms extremely clean and very comfortable. Could not ask for a better location, close to restaurants and shopping as well as easy walking distance to Chicago River.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia M
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Chicago has the best bathroom I've ever seen in a hotel! The corner room we had was spacious, very well lighted including reading lights, and had plenty of storage. The front desk staff and breakfast servers were very friendly. The breakfast was fabulous and the red-skinned potatoes with sweet onions were the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had. Great hotel, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel right in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: KYPAUL99
Reviews.Content: We had a reunion in Chicago and the 25+ of us who stayed at the Conrad felt it was a great location, terrific service and an excellent overall experience. We had a reduced "group rate" which also made the stay quite reasonable, especially for a hotel with this level of service. Only complaint was the drinks at the 5th floor outside bar area were overpriced, even by Chiacago standards.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and Service Oriented”
Reviews.Author: Blindcreek
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights and 4 days at the Conrad. The hotel have lovely appointments. The rooms are very comfortable. We love the amenities i.e., Bose Sound System, dock for my ipod, big screen tv, the exceptionally comfortable bed and pillows. Good pillows are hard to find. The front desk staff were so helpful with dinner arrangements. The location on Rush and Grande was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “great city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnpears
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Conrad for 5 nights with my wife and friends and was genuinely impressed with the quality of this city centre hotel; it's location makes an excellent base for exploring the city, being right on Michigan avenue. The shopping mall beneath the hotel is a cool feature too. Our rooms were on the 10th floor and were huge; the bed was one of the best I've slept in anywhere. hotel services were great, unobtrusive but very friendly and helpful. The rooftop terrace is a great place to meet before hitting the town in the evenings and again the staff are helpful, the service is quick and the range of food and drink was good.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: weemacs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here midweek and really enjoyed the short stay. The room was spacious and you got a slight wow feeling as you entered the room. Very comfortable bed and all the extras in the right place. I needed to have my suit pressed late at night for an early morning meeting and they did it in extra quick time. Breakfast in the room service was efficient and good quality. I was disappointed to not have more nights here. The only drawback I could find was that access by car is at the back of the building and from North Michigan drive through the Nordstrom gallery. The reception is at the fifth floor. It does work because there are staff at the car entrance but a bit tortuous from the street. Guidance needed and only apparently one lift but as we were only there briefly there may be other ways in. Whilst I have explained this in detail its a great place to stay and the access is only a minor issue and the rooms and staff more than make up for the lack of prominence

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location, Overall a Wonderful Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: mirax40
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Conrad Chicago. It is nice to know that they offer a discount for state employees! Most hotels in the area do not offer this option. It was a great discount compared to what I found on expedia, travelocity etc... I booked the hotel directly from the Conrad website. The hotel is conveniently located in the Magnificent Mile area of Chicago. Plenty to do and see within a short walking distance from the Conrad. The room was big and roomy, they offer different types of pillows and even brought me a fan on request. There is a train depot 1.5 blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - A MUST STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: 334traveler334
Reviews.Content: I always begin my reviews by saying that I stay in hotels EVERY week for business and travel all over the eastern part of the US. I by chance happened to make a reservation at the Conrad from Hilton.com where I make all my reservations. The price was reasonable and the location was great for my meeting. From the moment I walked in to the day I departed, I was amazed by the service and the quality of the Conrad. I had an amazing room and the room was always clean. The bed was very comfortable and the resturant was great. It is well worth the price and I would suggest it to ANYONE that is going to Chicago. I was so impressed that I got a room at the Conrad Hotel in Miami just because of the quality of hotel I saw while in Chicago. Way to go HILTON. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location; well-managed property”
Reviews.Author: houston_tx_trvller
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently (Platinum on Starwood and Hilton). My husband and i had a great experience with the Conrad. In terms of overall quality I'd compare it to a nice Westin -- not quite in same league as a St Regis or Four Seasons, but still a lovely property. Rooms were clean and quiet; no noise in hallways or adjacent rooms. Room was decent size although not huge. The bathroom was very spacious, with separate room for WC, separate tub and shower. Great Bose stereo equipment. Staff was attentive, friendly, and well-trained. Excellent location; attached to Nordstrom's via skybridge. Short walk to the lake shore trail, to Michigan Ave shops, restaurants, etc. No complaints at all -- would return.

Reviews.Title: “great!”
Reviews.Author: Wright861
Reviews.Content: My sister and I enjoyed a wonderful weekend getaway at the Conrad. The hotel is beautiful. The beds were plush- and the pillow menu is a lovely touch. As a Hilton gold member we were upgraded to a cityview room, which was nice- but the best benefit was the wonderful breakfast we enjoyed in the dining room the next morning. The location was perfect for shopping- the Conrad elevator by Nordstrom was so convenient. We had a wonderful sushi dinner at OYSY, a short walk from the Conrad. Will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Private club feel, all the city at your fingertips”
Reviews.Author: Italophilekpj
Reviews.Content: I loved the feeling that when you step off the elevator into the 5th floor lobby, you are entering a quiet, private club hotel. It's right above a mall, with the Magnificent Mile laid out at your feet, but still manages to feel exclusive. The room was spotless. The bathroom had a separate glass shower and deep soaking tub. The desk was professional and helpful. The decor was sophisticated. And it was QUIET. The fitness room was well outfitted and clean. Very nice. Loved the little extras like complementary shoe shine. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for sure”
Reviews.Author: SantoNewHaven_Ct
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, well kept, and attentive staff. This is an excellent hotel. it is convenient to most central attractions, excellent shopping and fantastic restaurants. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing place with excellent workout facility and restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: TimHart84
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Conrad probably 10 times and have had consistently excellent experiences with great, comfortable rooms and very good service,

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable hotel bed ever!!”
Reviews.Author: scooteratl
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Conrad while she was relocating to the city. I can only say that it doesn't get better than this! The room was large and luxurious. They give you a pillow menu that is to die for!. The cooling system in the room was excellent and ultra quiet. Bath room was large and amenities plentiful. We had breakfast each morning in the dining room and there were lots of choices and the food was great. The only problem we had was with room service food. The service was good, the food was not. So I would not recommend ordering the in room dining. I would definitely stay at this Conrad hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the luxury and attention to detail!”
Reviews.Author: KYfamily5
Reviews.Content: My 8 year old son and I stayed at the Conrad this past weekend for a special birthday trip for him. The Conrad absolutely made our stay phenomenal with great attentiveness and luxury! The level of service that we received was entirely unexpected in this economy, and it was such a pleasure. I was concerned about security, driving into downtown Chicago and parking by myself with my son, but it was perfectly fine. We utilized the hotel parking garage (Northbridge?) and although pricy ($38 per day, with in-and-out priveledges), it was very safe, clean, and convenient. It was a great first impression. When we checked in we were greeted by wonderful staff who 'oohed and aahed' over my son and his birthday trip, and even gave him a cute little stuffed cow. He thought that was great! Our room was SO very nice - from the HUGE tv with a larger than normal channel selection (my son's favorite) to the extreme cleanliness. It truly could not have been more comfortable. It was also obvious that it had been freshly painted, and the furnishings and decor seemed brand new. The beds were very luxurious, and the bathroom absolutely beautiful. I did miss an in-room coffee maker, but the quality of the complimentary coffee service in the bar was worth getting dressed and going downstairs every morning. On my son's birthday night we got back to the room and had a surprise amenity waiting for us - birthday milk and cookies! That was such a wonderful, personal, attention to detail that continues to be one of our favorite memories from the weekend. Check out and getting out of the parking garage went very smoothly, although we were sad to go. It was about an hour south of Chicago that I realized a big problem - I had left a number of credit cards and my checkbook in the room safe! I tried not to panic, and immediately called the hotel. I was forwarded to the Security office and the officer handled the situation with sensitivity and finesse. I am very grateful for his empathy and problem solving, and he was able to retrieve my items and recommended shipping them to me. He facilitated this process smoothly, with multiple phone calls back to me, and took steps to assure me as to the items' security. Again, I am bowled over by the level of service and luxury at the Conrad and I cannot wait to come back again! I continue to rave about the hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible stay, incredible service!”
Reviews.Author: mck9982
Reviews.Content: I took my wife for a stay at the Conrad on 8/28/2010 as a last luxury getaway before our baby is born. In a nutshell it was one of the best experiences I have ever had at a hotel. We absolutely love the Conrad hotel (it is a beautiful upscale property, the layout is perfect and the location can not be beat) and it is a truly an upscale luxury hotel, but what really made our stay was the service we received. Due to my job (as well as my wife and my love for travel) I have had the opportunity to stay at some of the nicest hotels around the world. I also spend about 150 nights a year at hilton owned properties and think that the service I received this past Saturday at the Conrad was above and beyond everything else I have received - ever. The staffs willingness to meet my requests (a room upgrade upgrade, a late night candlelit dessert on the terrace) and the desire to make my stay a truly special night for my wife was above and beyond my expectations. We also loved lunch at the 5th floor terrace restaurant. It is really a beautiful setting. I completely recommend this hotel and can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: Beentheredonethat777
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is a wonderful hotel! The staff made our stay there absolutely excellent, from the stuffed toy gift for our toddler to the room amenities. The staff was helpful, curteous and very pleasant - every single employee we encountered greeted us. Our room was spotless - not so much as a fingerprint in sight. The bed was very comfortable and the pillows some of the best I have ever slept on. Very nice room views as well! We didn't try any of the hotel restaurants or room service - very expensive and too many other great restaurants within just a few blocks. They are in an excellent location just off Michigan Ave. Most stops are within walking distance and there is a (free) Navy Pier trolley shuttle with a pick-up on hotel's intersection. The only problem we encountered was the wireless internet. It worked just fine in the conference rooms & business center, but we had almost no signal in the regular hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rvavan
Reviews.Content: We booked our one night stay using airline miles even though my husband is a Hilton Honors member and travels quite frequently. I was a little concerned about the room quality since most hotels don't favor 3rd party bookings. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and the Chicago trip was a last minute decision. We drove into town and utilized the self-park garage located across the street from the Rush Street entrance. The Chicago Conrad is located above the Nordstrom shopping center. When entering from Rush Street you take a elevator up to the lobby which is located on the 5th floor. The Terrace Restaurant is located right off the lobby on the 5th floor. I was under the impression it was a roof-top area which it is but it's above the sky-bridge building above Rush Street not the actual hotel roof-top. Check-in was quick and efficient. The young lady at the front desk was helpful answering questions and provided us a shopping map with restaurant locations. She also validated our parking which is $38 daily for self-park with in and out privileges. Valet is available at a different rate. We were assigned to a room on the 12th floor which turned out to be a handicap accessible room. There is no soaking tub in the bathroom or a separate room for the toilet. The shower is extra large with a unsightly shower curtain. This is what I was afraid of using airline miles to book the room (hotel staff was aware we are HH Members) My husband called the front desk and requested a room with a soaking tub. The hotel was able to accommodate our request. A bellman quickly appeared with a set of keycards to our new room located on the 8th floor. Overall the room was nice but nothing WOW. The service was good but nothing extraordinary (no one acknowledged our anniversary). I wasn't disappointed but wasn't impressed at the same time. The best thing about this hotel is the location. Great shopping, great city, great restaurants all within a few steps. We have stayed at the Conrad Indianapolis a number of times and the Chicago Conrad just can't compare to the luxurious rooms, amenities, and service they offer. Chicago has no pool, no spa (Spa Nordstrom available), no turn-down service. The Indy rooms are better appointed (although smaller than Chicago) and they have the best turn-down service I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Overall: very, very good stay but a couple areas need some improvement”
Reviews.Author: malawimike
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite nice. The sleep quality is stellar. Nice sized room, and the bathroom (with separate shower and bathtub) was quite big. There is a Bose brand stereo/DVD player in the room with a nice flat screen TV. Rooms have free internet (nice bonus!). The hotel is clean and pristine in just about every way (beautiful orchids all around). Two things to mention that were not good and kept me from giving a perfect score: the rooms don't have a coffee maker for coffee or tea service. I suppose they want you to order the way over-priced coffee or tea from room service. They do have coffee / tea available in the lobby in the morning, but if you like to have a cup while you are getting ready in the morning you are outta luck. One morning they had run out of black tea (they only had decaf and green teas) and I asked the hostess to restock some black tea. She seemed really put out that I had asked for this. They just need to put an ample supply out there and have some easily available to restock it. Another morning the hot water had cooled to just a bit over luke warm. Of course all of this would be for not if they just did what every other hotel in America does and put a coffee maker in the room. The second problem was brought up by other reviews: some of the staff (not all, by any stretch, but some) are pretty snooty and you almost feel like they are looking down their nose at you. Just because you are The Conrad doesn't mean you can't be friendly. I really recommend that management consider doing some training to staff on friendliness and welcoming rather than acting like they are better than the rest of the hotels in town.

Reviews.Title: “Overall impressed....”
Reviews.Author: samhou99
Reviews.Content: I pricelined a last minute weekend trip to chicago and got the Conrad hotel...hadnt really heard of the Chicago property but saw good reviews. Overall the hotel was excellent; staff very professional and room was immaculate and very well appointed. it is just off michigan avenue though the entrance is beneath the street which is a little unsavory. I was very impressed with the Terrace lounge. They didnt have anything i really wanted on the menu so I asked them to make a special sandwich for me which was delicious and not expensive to boot...would def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tmccuistion
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Conrad for our first wedding anniversary. I had read good reviews on Tripadvisor and the price was reasonable. We were very impressed with the accommodations. The room was very nice and clean. On the day of our arrival they sent us up some chocolate covered strawberries for our anniversary! So thoughtful!! Also, when I called down to request forks so that we eat our cake topper they sent up a silver tray as well. The service was above and beyond! Also, the Terrace bar on the rooftop is very nice. Great place to sit and have a drink. We didn't eat there but the food smelled GREAT and the presentation was nice. The location was nice, right on Michigan avenue. Whenever we go back to Chicago we will definitely return to the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: atlantaallen96
Reviews.Content: All I can say is outstanding. From the room to the service to the terrace bar, we thoroughly enjoyed all. For the money, the best room I have ever stayed in. I'm used to paying well over $350/night for much less of a room. Great location too. My wife and her girlfriends will stay at the Conrad for the next girl's trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property in the Heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: lpaquette80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautful place to stay. The service was great and the location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but customer service lacked”
Reviews.Author: RunnerGirl44
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night and the room was very nice and this would be the reason I would return. However at 2:30AM out phone started ringing with one ring intervals every few minutes. We called to the front desk and she mentioned that we may have a voice mail so she connected me to the VM system. There were no voice mails. The issue continued on. We had to be up very early for a flight so this caused for a very disappointing night of sleep. Upon check out we were asked, "how was your stay". I told the front desk rep what had happened and he said "ok I will have someone check that phone". How that helps me I have no idea. He did not apologize and simply ignored my complaint and asked me if I wanted a bill printed. I thought this was unacceptable as a means to resolve a very bad night of sleep. I would recommend the hotel based on the most other areas, but this obviously left a very bad taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in August, 2010 on two business trips to Chicago. I'd have previously good experiences at the Conrad, and the hotel did not disappoint on this trip. The hotel was excellent in all respects, and it remains a hotel I look forward to staying in. On the first stay, I was initially assigned to a room that wasn't to my liking (a bit close to the elevators and without a view); when I asked if another room was available, the front desk staff member graciously assigned me to a room with a much better view, far from the elevators. Even though I would have understood if a better room wasn't available, I appreciated this highly responsive service. On the second stay, I was upgraded (thanks to my Hilton HHonors status) to a huge suite with an amazing balcony overlooking Michigan Ave. Wow! The room quality at the Conrad is very high -- enormous bathrooms with a shower and deep-soaking tub. Awesome robes. Slippers! Comfortable, adjustable desk chair. Nice working area. Flexible lighting. Ample plugs. Large closets. Amazingly comfortable beds -- the sort that make it very, very difficult to get out of, no matter how important the meeting! The window coverings also have a luxurious feel, and they block the light. There are lots of other thoughtful touches, from the map of running routes from the hotel to the complimentary shoe shines. My dining experiences were acceptable. I had breakfast at the restaurant. Service was very nice, although a little on the slow side. Coffee was delicious. My fruit plate was tasty. Room service was prompt, which I appreciated; food quality was OK (I've had equally good room service at far less expensive hotels with much, much cheaper room service). I do hope the Conrad keeps up with facility needs. While there was nothing beat up enough to be disgusting, there's some "rough around the edges" elements that need to be taken care of -- baseboards and door frames that are chipped, a couple of wood surfaces on the furniture in the room that are starting to peel, etc. Nothing anything big in the scheme of things (as, overall, the hotel has an elegant, classic design), but if the Conrad wants to live-up to its 5-star billing in every respect, it should watch these things -- those are details that other 5-star properties (Ritz, etc.) don't wait until the next major renovation to fix. None affected the quality of my stay, however -- and most people probably wouldn't notice them (I tend to be a bit of an eagle-eye for that stuff thanks to the amount of time I spent in hotels). Overall, this is a great hotel. It's on the smaller side (for Chicago), and it's typically very quiet and elegant feeling. These are great touches considering its location -- it is surrounded by some HUGE hotels with very noisy, active lobby spaces. I think it's a gem in Chicago -- it rarely is hugely more expensive than surrounding hotels and offers a service and room experience that is vastly superior to its competition in the area. You should stay here -- just don't give the secret away to too many people.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel; Perfect Location; Great Service”
Reviews.Author: amy99si
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Chicago, so of course I read tons of reviews on hotels before I picked the Conrad. The location is the first thing that sold me. It connects to Nordstroms and a mall. It's also right in the center of all the sightseeing in the city. It's surrounded by superb restaurants. Everything seemed to be in walking distance for us. Once we checked into the Conrad the experience became even better. The hotel is gorgeous, the rooms are clean and up to date with flat screen t.v. and the most comfortable bed. The restaurant was delicious and the patio bar was a fun experience. Everyone working there was always incredibly nice and helpful. We could not have asked for a better experience. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. Thanks Conrad for an amazing experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable luxurious downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: DawnMCol
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very plush right downtown with acess to restaurants, shopping and site seeing. The ammenities are great and I found this to be a very comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel that truly is dog friendly!”
Reviews.Author: RenegadeRanch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited Chicago. We drove from California with our two dogs and had to contend with finding pet friendly hotels. Most had restrictions of size, less than 25 lbs. We had our 2 dogs, one 75 lbs and the other was 5 lbs. We simply went on the dog-friendly.com site and found the Conrad Hotel for Chicago. They were wonderful to our pets. The doorman, the front desk, you name it. We felt special everyday we walked them outside to do their jobs. And there is a dog park just a block over so you can take your little one or big one there. The Conrad Hotel made our stay in downtown Chicago the highlight of our 3 week trip. Thanks Conrad Hotel! The only drawback is the cost of the valet parking, daily was $51 but the overall daily rate of the hotel was a great price for its location downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The Conrad Chicago is an exceptional Chicago hotel that has fabulous service and a spectacular Michigan Avenue location!”
Reviews.Author: Neville_Sarkari
Reviews.Content: This was my third or fourth time staying at the Conrad. It is the only place I stay when I travel to Chicago. The conference I was attending was at a different hotel but I prefered to stay at the Conrad and walk 10-15 minutes each way, each day. The Conrad has spectacular service that has never let me down. It is far better than the rest of the Hilton chain, perhaps due to it's European roots. In addition, the food at both the main restaurant and the terrace (outdoor) is spectacular. I did not eat breakfast there this trip, but I have in the past and it is a treat. I did get room service for dinner once on this trip and it was excellent. The rooms are superb. I usually upgrade but the cost is still quite reasonable. Materials and decor are great and very luxurious. Daily maid service was excellent as expected. The location of the hotel is superb. You can get into the shopping on Michigan Avenue with ease (without going outside!) or walk to the Chicago River/Wacker Dr area in about 5-7 minutes. Lots of great restaurants within an easy walk. Overall, I won't stay anywhere else in Chicago as long as the Conrad continues this excellent level of service and luxury comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Accomodations in the heart of Chicago, IL”
Reviews.Author: BobBell80
Reviews.Content: Rooms were ultra clean and the bathroom was better than a million dollar mansions bathroom. Very nice and be prepared to pay for this experience

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous stay at Chicago Conrad”
Reviews.Author: edavison
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel and they even upgraded us to a 2 room suite this visit. It is my favorite hotel in the city. I always look forward to being pampered and sleeping in their outstanding beds.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and very good value for an upscale hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pecksfarmsup
Reviews.Content: Our room was large, the bathrooms spacious, and beautiful. The staff were very accomodating, and the location is great for shopping and sightseeing in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Rooms, Super Clean, Not A Big Property...What's Not To Love!”
Reviews.Author: Chablis28
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! Not a screaming busy typical 800+ room convention hotel. If you haven't figured it out yet, small properties like the Chicago Conrad, treat individual liesure travelers better than the big places who care more about large busienss and convention travel groups. I like that the reception is 5 floors above the street giving it a nice quiet exclusive vibe. The rooms are extremely well layed out so that you feel tucked away from the hallway. Immaculately clean. Friendly helpfull staff. Free coffee in the morning. Free bottled water in the room, which you need after a walk on Mich Ave. Big bathrooms with classy touches like high quality towels & wash clothes. The beds and pillows are almost the equal of our highend stuff at home. Loved the little dimmer lights in the ceiling above each pillow so one spouse can read while the other sleeps. Nicely furnished room with comphy sitting chair and foot stool. This place is quiet and a relaxing retreat when Michigan ave sidewalk crowd is getting to you just duck upstairs to the Conrad. I'd recommend a room that doesn't front Michigan ave as those rooms might be a little less peaceful because of the busy street below. Our room faced north toward the Hancock building and had no street below it. Not a single negative. Great!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Chicago Hotel A Little Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jbb1210
Reviews.Content: Although the location, was fabulous, the hotel itself left a bit to be desired. As a Diamond VIP HH member, we expect better-than-outstanding. This hotel was slightly above average in ameneties and service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-good location”
Reviews.Author: kikivancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad on a short long weekend trip to Chicago on our travel agents recommendation. The rooms were great, clean, big, modern. Service was also excellent. Nice bar in the lobby and rooftop deck. Excellent fitness room, sparkling clean with very few people using it. Best of all was the location, right in the middle of the Miracle Mile on Michigan Avenue which was great for walking. Took the AIA architectural boat tour, I highly recommend it but you need to book ahead online.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But Not Up to Conrad International Standards”
Reviews.Author: MacVol
Reviews.Content: My stay did not start well. I got off the airport shuttle with four (4) bags, while the Bell/Door personnel did nothing. Even the shuttle driver remarked how rude the door staff were (the evening door staff, as it turned out, were much friendlier).
