The following is a run-down of the "other-than-goods" for this property: --Check in was efficient, although there was no acknowledgement of my status and no welcome back. --The "city view" room was a partially obscured view of an air conditioning complex and other nearby buildings. --My breakfast vouchers were ignominiously shoved under my door whilst I slept. --Fitness facilities are adequate, but nothing special. Standard Hiltons have better. --Breakfast in the bar area was, service wise, pandemonium. A Taiwanese student group tied up the restaurant for private morning functions. However, the food quality was great, as was the coffee. --There were two rubber bands on the floor, in the hallway of the 15th floor, which convinced me that the housekeeping staff is lackadaisical about their responsibilities. Now for the "Goods": --Room size is terrific. Plenty of area to feel comfortable. --Bathroom. Fantastic. Shower, tub, scale, and separate toilet. Bath amenities were replenished regularly. --Room amenities! iPod docking station, Bose Sound System, Flat Screen TV, and complimentary internet. --Eddie the Server in the Lounge! Excellent, personal service. --French Fries. Some of the best I have had. All-in-all, the Conrad is a nice, decent hotel. I would stay there again, but I do not think it is in the same class as the Peninsula or the Four Seasons. In fact, the Chicago Conrad is no where near the same class as the Bangkok or Tokyo Conrads--not even close. The Chicago Conrad lacks an Executive Lounge, and the majority of the staff could probably use some training on how to provide a higher level of service. Being able to do the "little things" (e.g., vacuum carpets, specially welcome loyal Hilton Guests, and display a little more courtesy/friendliness) would go a long way to elevating this hotel to the class it in which it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in an awesome city”
Reviews.Author: Dodnof
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in July 2010. Got a great deal through priceline so I think I got a steal on what the usual rate is. Parking was expensive but that's pretty much Chicago. $40 a day to self park in the garage across the street. It is a 3 minute walk to Michigan Ave and you're a 5 - 10 minute cab ride to most anything in downtown Chicago so location is great. It gets kind of noisy at night with sirens but again, thats downtown Chicago. The outdoor patio bar is awesome. It has a great view of downtown since it is a few stories above the street. Rooms were beautiful with very modern asthetics, flat panel television and granite in the bathrooms. If I got the same rate as I got last time I'd definitely stay here again. Very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: cchday
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to river, shopping and fabulous restaurants. Beautiful rooms and big bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location! A bit pricey but worth it”
Reviews.Author: gomeyer
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Conrad. The room was gorgeous and spacious especially the bathroom which had a huge tub and separate shower!! The room was equipped with loads of nice amenties including robes and slippers. The bed was incredibly comfortable. The staff was extremely nice and accomodating. I wish we had more time to spend at the lovely terrace bar. My only complaint was that we really weren't in the room or at the hotel much so we didn't get to enjoy all the Conrad had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireTravelman33
Reviews.Content: Very good location, just off North Michigan Avenue and Magnificent Mile. It's also just round the corner from Joe's Seafood & Steak House which is a bit of an institution (need to book) or alternatively it's not far from Sullivan's or Fleming's who also do great steaks. We didn't eat in the hotel but it had a nice restaurant on the terrace which seemed popular during the day for working lunch. The ethos of the hotel seems to be low key but luxury - staff are very polite and helpful. We had a standard room which wasn't huge but perfectly fine. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: ScreamyFrassy
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this hotel! Yes, the mini-bar and Rendez-vous/Terrace drinks are way expensive, but given the high-end nature of this hotel, not overpriced. Beautiful room, bathroom, TV, comfy bed, central location, etc. I could go on! I would definately stay here again. Staff were friendly and heplful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, but the rooms had ALOT of noise”
Reviews.Author: travelkrissy
Reviews.Content: This is a very friendly, nice hotel on Michigan Ave. They were super nice to upgrade us to a suite. However, we overlooked the Terrace bar.... and till ALL hours of the night we could NOT sleep. The music and people talking was soo LOUD. I would not stay anywhere near that part of the hotel again..... Later, I was thinking..... ya thanks for the upgrade to a nicer room, but one that was SOOO Loud with music and people chatting and laughing till 2am or longer... UGH!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and perks”
Reviews.Author: thelowest
Reviews.Content: Its a Conrad, so you know its nice. I got a great rate, the rooms have cool features like Bose Sound, DVD player, special pillows, etc. and they take care of you. The rooms are modern and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Dev51
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I would stay here every time I visit Chicago. The rooms are spacious. I stayed at other hotels but this was by far the best. The beds were super comfortable and the bathroom was really spacious and nice. The Terrace was nice for late night drinks on the roof top. The location is perfect. There are two elevators where you can either go to shopping on Michigan Ave or have great dining options on Rush St. There is a Walgreens next door which is convenient if you forgot anything at home. The breakfast was great. Overall, a great place to stay for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!”
Reviews.Author: dianerose
Reviews.Content: I simply cannot say enough about our fabulous 1 night stay to celebrate our Anniversary! The room seemed extra large and was very state of the art! The robes, the slippers, the large flat screened TV with Bose speakers, I pod charger and the list goes on and on. We will definitely return for another stay! It was in a great location ...walkable to so many of the important Chicago sights. I highly recommend this classy and welcoming hotel. It is simply the Best!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: DigitalHelix
Reviews.Content: We came to Chicago to take in a concert and enjoy some time away. Having never stayed a Conrad, I wasn't sure what to expect. First, the staff - top notch, way above expectations. Upon arriving, we were unsure how to get to the concert. The staff immediately offered to help. After we took our bags upstairs, a knock on the door revealed printed travel times/prices, directions to Metra along with walking and taxi times and costs. Every day we were surprised at how helpful and pleasant the entire staff behaved - from the front desk to the cleaning crew - a truly great team. As a matter of fact, the only detraction was the absence of a pool. Fitness room was well stocked with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “I wish the Conrad Chicago was available everywhere we travel.”
Reviews.Author: Jones95070
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and accommodating staff. Comfortably appointed rooms with great mattresses and pillows. Surprisingly large rooms for a city hotel. Rooms and public areas were very clean. Really appreciated the lit, magnified mirror, the upscale toiletry products and the hair dryer that wasn't mounted on the wall. The hotel restaurant offers a wonderful breakfast menu--every meal we tried was loved by the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cvjblosser
Reviews.Content: Great downtown hotel! Beautiful rooms, Bose system, seperate shower/tub, comfortable beds! Sunday night, movie night out on the Terrace was a blast! Morning breakfast service and food was a great final touch! all in the heart of Chicago, highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Delivered as promised”
Reviews.Author: pine1144
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at the Conrad Chicago and was very happy with the accomodations. Friendly staff at the front desk greeted me with "welcome back" when I came in from work each day. Location is excellent, with easy access to shopping, siteseeing and good restaurants. Rooms were nicely furnished with a large screen TV and updated bathrooms. Toiletries were top shelf, I actually liked the shampoo and conditioner. Reasonably priced as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Rooms/Bathrooms with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bentley26Z
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Conrad after visiting the great shops in the Nordstrom building. Don't worry, there is an alternate entrance on Rush St. for those not wanting to walk all over a mall to find a hotel. Once we arrived, we were immediately checked in with free continental breakfast coupons (Thanks!) and given our room keys. The rooms was excellent, but the bathroom...WOW! They had complementary pillow service and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The ONLY reason why I give The Conrad this rating is because they do not have a pool onsite, but other than that, once you go Conrad, you never go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, friendly service, outstanding location on the Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: mrjones72
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife, who was 8 months pregnant at the time, and my toddler son over the 4th of July weekend. Check-in was quick and the front desk staff was very friendly. I asked for a king room instead of a double-bed room, which is all that was available at the time of reservation. They switched me without any problem. The room itself was clean, modern and fairly spacious. The bathroom was pretty large and the amenities were great. We had a view of the magnificent mile as well as a slice of the lake, which was nice. I requested extra pillows for my wife and they asked if I wanted any specialty pillows, such as a body pillow, which my wife was very happy about. I requested a rollaway for my son and it came right away and it was pretty comfortable. The only drawback to my brief stay was that the rollaway bed fram was very dusty. Housekeeping needs to do a better job of making sure they wipe down the headboard and frame before bringing it to the room. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay and the location was great for exploring Navy Pier, the Mag Mile, and other downtown attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with AC issues”
Reviews.Author: ogieone
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Conrad Chiago as part of a long weekend leisurely visit to the Windy City. I have stayed at the Conrad Indianapolis last year on a business trip and absolutely loved it, so I decided to let my wife enjoy a stay there as well. We were welcomed warmly as a Hiltons Honors Member and checked-in briskly. Even the other couple we went with was welcomed warmly despite not being a Hilton Honors member. Since we checked in late, we asked for a close pizza place to eat at and were given a few options along with some personal recommendations, which turned out to be very useful. We had a drink at the rooftop bar and the drinks were good, even if a little slow (I think they forgot about our order). The breakfast menu was very good (if a bit pricey), though the breakfast coupons we receieved for being HH gold helped quite a bit. The food for breakfast was very good each morning, as was the service. The rooms were clean and quite comfortable. That is, besides the AC, which would not get the room cool enough. It turns out that the hallways were colder than the rooms, prompting many jokes about sleeping in the hallway. With that said, everything else with the room was PERFECT! The maid service was very good as was the laundry service, which I had to use due to underpacking for the trip. All-in-all, I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely consider staying there when I return to Chicago in the future!

Reviews.Title: “A delightful experience”
Reviews.Author: Vicki44124
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed every minute from our beautiful room and the attentive staff to the evenings spent at the terrace bar.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad stay was exceptional”
Reviews.Author: bbaurer
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at the Conrad for a quick get away on my own. I loved the location (connected to Nordstroms) and the outside bar area. My room was gorgeous (it helped that they upgraded me upon check-in) Everyone was extremely pleasant. I would definitely recommend a stay at the Conrad

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: M11Stephen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The rooms were incredible, luxurious, large, well decorated, and clean. The bathroom was probably the nicest bathroom I have ever seen. The beds were incredibly comfy and the sheets were the nicest sheets I have ever touched. The room was well insulated from noise in the hallway or adjoining rooms. I didn't hear anyone in the hallway or others rooms during the night. I felt like I was the only one on the floor. The only negative aspect of my experience was that I could hear sirens and car horns all night outside however this is totally out of the hotels control. I would definitely recommend this incredible hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: kfeigel
Reviews.Content: I travel almost full time for work, so when I am traveling for leisure I want to feel like I am on vacation. The staff was friendly and helpful, the accomodations were upscale, and the breakfast was fabulous. This would definitely be someplace I would visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Much more than expected, really great service and rooms..”
Reviews.Author: Shannonle
Reviews.Content: Separate baths and showers, separate toilet room, full closets, decent toiletries, good restaurant/bar, giant television..what more could one want??

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lcschicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with a wedding group so received a discounted rate, but it was luxurious and finely appointed. Great staff, great room.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - will stay at Conrad again when in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: kaijan
Reviews.Content: Helpfulness, friendliness, and engagement of all employees I meet were fabulous. The room and the bathroom were great. Location in the middle of Chicago perfect! I liked the open terrace at the 5th floor (actually the reception, directly above the shopping mall) best. The atmosphere was so relaxing and enjoyable...!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, surroundings and confort”
Reviews.Author: fdumler
Reviews.Content: Very nice physical facility, excellent front desk, clean plush rooms, great location, very helpful and attentive porters.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Chicago for fun”
Reviews.Author: knb-texas
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend and had a great time. Central location makes it easy to walk anywhere in the downtown region. Only a half block from the Miracle Mile Shopping and can be accessed from the hotel. Staff was most helpful, room was very comfortable. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: garrgirl
Reviews.Content: I reviewed a lot of hotels on Trip Advisor to find the best one for our Chicago stay. I was thrilled with everything about this hotel. We had 2 connecting rooms. They are beautiful and clean. Amenities are great (fitness room, etc). High Class property. Great location! Service and information was delivered with a smile. I would defintely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Conrad Chicago"”
Reviews.Author: DWilson73
Reviews.Content: What a great location! We particularly enjoyed The Terrace Restaurant/Bar!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Hankmax
Reviews.Content: The Conrad has a great central location; and the facilities are top-notch. The rooms are very modern and comfortable; the fitness faciity nice- but a bit under-sized; and the staff very friendly and customer-oriented. There were even a few very nice surprises, such as after returning from a run down to the lakeshore and back, upon my return to the lobby, the bellman had bottled water on ice and a clean towel for me when I walked in the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Classy and in the middle of so many fun things”
Reviews.Author: designdiva1
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Chicago quite a bit and I would have to say that the location of this hotel is really great. It is clean, new and very nice. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Big Ballin' Stay”
Reviews.Author: dmjenn02
Reviews.Content: The Conrad was by far the best hotel I've ever stayed with. The bellmen were my first impression, where we were greeted by a Serbian fellow who was great. They held our bikes in a backroom right next to where you come off the elevator, ready at our leisure. The location is a little north of most of the sites we visited(Art Institue, Intelligentsia, Millenium Park), but if you're traveling by 'L' then you'll really have no problem, as it's located right next to the red line. My second time in chicago and I thought being 1+ miles away from everywhere would get annoying, but there's a lot to do right next to the hotel and walking around chicago is anything but annoying. The area is gorgeous, especially in June. The Billy Goat Tavern is known for being one of the best burgers in chicago, and is located almost directly next to the hotel. The rooms were unbelievable. Complimentary wi-fi, complimentary robe, complimentary pillow menu, bose surround sound system with huge flat-screen hd-tv including a dvd player. BRING MOVIES... you'll wanna watch them. From what we understood, this was the most basic room they had to offer and from the bathroom to the bed, we loved our stay. The only downside, was that the room view was the terrace restaurant they have, so we had to keep the windows shut the whole time or we'd be looking at people sitting on couches drinking and dining on a terrace not 2 feet from the window. Request to not have this room if a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for a weekend getaway in downtown Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: nomad-caravan
Reviews.Content: Great location and layout, spacious and clean room, with great view! Close to many weekend hot spots! Minutes away from Navy Pier, Riverwalk, Magnificent Mile, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly service with clean spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: MrThallid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our First Anniversary. They surprised us with a tray of chocolate covered treats when we came back to the room late on Friday. The staff was very helpful with directions to nearby restaurants and attractions. The bar, restaurant, and the Terrace were very comfortable and offered nice selections. My only gripe would be that I requested "City View" and the room looked out to the office building right next door.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - never disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lightangel
Reviews.Content: I have to travel to Chicago every month. I have stayed at most all of the hotels around Michigan avenue. There are a bunch of great ones, but I will always stay at the Conrad when I can. Location is wonderful, food is great quality ( coffee is incredible) and the service is wonderful. I travel a ton for business, if I could duplicate the experience I always have at the Chicago Conrad everywhere else that I visit, I would be a happy traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly employees, great location - wish I could go back tomorow”
Reviews.Author: rarlen52
Reviews.Content: Located just off Michigan ave and less than a mile from Navy Pier with tons of places to see and eat. We especially enjoyed that their was a self park just across from the hotel entrance. I highly recommend this location!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and service throughout our stay”
Reviews.Author: dschultetravel
Reviews.Content: The service and staff we were always friendly,helpful and went out the their way to assist. This hotel is definitely one that will be considered for future stays in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Service - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: samusolf
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fantastic, from check-in to check-out. The staff is friendly and accommodating; the service is first-class. Even with my preschooler, they were patient and entertaining for her. The only disparaging thing about the location and quality of sleep is that the CFD station is blocks away. If you're not a light sleeper, though - not a problem. I would highly recommend staying at the Conrad if you have the opportunity to.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Chicago Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: litt1etree
Reviews.Content: All the staff was incredibly helpful and knowledgeable. The location is well placed, close to great restaurants, shopping, and points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “High quality in all aspects.”
Reviews.Author: Connie359
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay and surpassed all my needs. Only stayed one night but the room was wonderful and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience ever in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust60
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for a quick weekend and was able to secure a room at the Conrad. This particular weekend had several large conventions as well as the Stanley Cup playoffs and all the hotels were booked! Despite the crush of people, the front desk were very helpful and accommodating. We were given one of the terrace suites in the hotel, it was gorgeous and the terrace view is fantastic. Also, if you're interested in getting a deep dish pizza they have a courtesy card for Lou Manalti's where you can get a free appetizer or dessert. Do not pass up on the cookie pizza!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with my 9-year old”
Reviews.Author: tjrnhawk
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. Even though the Conrad did not have a pool, it offered swimming for us at a Hilton sister property down the street. Got a great rate about two months out and really enjoyed a quality luxury stay. My son was very impressed as well.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Luxury in River North!”
Reviews.Author: LushnLife
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at the Conrad, the rooms were spectacular in size, amenities, luxury. Great location close to everything and very helpful staff. The food was good too!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular accommodations in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: flama62
Reviews.Content: This was a first-class hotel with excellent customer service. The rooms are very comfortable and the rates we got through Travelocity were an unbelievable value. The location enabled us to walk to shopping, restaurants, and the subway. When we go back to Chicago, we will definitely stay at the Conrad Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great first experience with Conrad”
Reviews.Author: MAL019S
Reviews.Content: This was my first Conrad experience, but more than likely, will not be my last. Th e staff was excellent from the first word; everyone from the front desk, to the restaurant's to house keeping staff were very friendly and helpful. The workout facility was great as it was not your usual, small universal gym and an elliptical. My girlfriend and I very much enjoyed th estay and will stay there again when we make it back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back, will definitely stay at the Conrad!”
Reviews.Author: GinaG10
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Conrad. It won't be our last. There is nothing to not like about it (well, except maybe the parking fee, but that's Chicago for you). A pillow menu!? Never heard of such a thing, and forgot to use it, but wow, order up any pillow at no extra charge. Scented, no-snore, allergy free, etc. And the outdoor lounge/restaurant... great food and drinks. I mean really, really good. Sits right over Rush Street five floors up! Roomy rooms, huge bathroom, nice lobby, and extremely convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “This is the "best" Hilton has?”
Reviews.Author: TopShelfTravel
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is billed as the top of the Hilton brand. Frankly, I've stayed in nicer Doubletrees. There is nothing noteworthy or interesting about this hotel. It's pretty, sure, but just a basic room in a basic building. The service was nothing stellar, taking two elevators to the room was annoying, and the room itself was nothing noteworthy. The shower heads are pathetic. Having to walk somewhere to get coffee in the morning unless you want to be gouged at the lobby restaurant was really angering. There are slippers in each room - but not a coffee maker? There wasn't really anything wrong with the place - but there are MANY better options for lower prices. Don't get taken in by the name brand.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: oshkoshtraveler61
Reviews.Content: On our recent visit to Chicago for the National Restaurant Association convention we stayed at the Conrad. Every single aspect of our stay was perfect. In all my years of travel for business and leisure, no hotel has achieved the level of perfection as the Conrad in Chicago. If you're looking for a great hotel, the Conrad is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: IlliniFan02
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Conrad Chicago over the weekend and thought it was an excellent hotel. We would definitely go back. Pros: -Just steps from the heart of Michigan Ave, the location is awesome -The room was very nice, with one of the most comfortable beds we've ever slept in -the bathroom was huge and the shower was awesome -the flat screen TV with Bose stereo and speakers in the room was pretty cool -The Hotel had an outdoor terrace which was a great place to have drinks -Great service from everyone we encountered -Self parking is easy and convenient (but expensive) Cons: -Expensive, but that's true for most nice hotels in the city

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: billgoodlatte
Reviews.Content: As HiltonHHonors Diamond VIPs who have stayed in Hilton properties all over the world, my wife and I were very excited to have reservations at our very first Conrad. But we were very disappointed. At check in we asked for a room with a view and were told there were none. So for 4 days and 3 nights we looked at an office building filled with people looking back at us and had to keep our drapes closed at all times. We were not greeted as Diamond VIPs, upgraded in any way or even given breakfast vouchers. On the second day I asked for vouchers and was given them with no instructions as to how they could be used until on our last day when we were told by our server. Our sleeping room was very small and the bottled water was never replaced. Our bill was for $971.46 and we would not stay again or recommend the Conrad to family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, hotel was hosiptal staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Naysa82
Reviews.Content: I loved the room. It was very beautiful and the staff was tremendously friendly!!! I would definitely love to come back to this hotel if I am in the Chicago area.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate place to stay for business travel”
Reviews.Author: rcb0509
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Conrad Chicago weekly for over a year now on my business travel and I must say that the Conrad is the best hotel I've stayed at in all my business travels. The staff at the Conrad anticipates your every need and have always gone out of their ways to provide excellent service. As an example, during my earlier stay at the hotel, I mentioned to the restaurant hostess that I wasn't feeling well when I picked-up my breakfast and that I will just be working from my room. About an hour later, I received a knocked on my door with a delivery of a pot of hot tea! That really made my day. As a diamond member of the Hilton Honors Group, they always put me up in executive suites - something I've never experienced with a Starwood properties, even though I'm a platinum member. Being a business traveller, who is on the road for almost 250 days in the year, I came to expect good service from hotels that I stayed at and the Conrad has definitely exceed my expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Best value on the mile!”
Reviews.Author: txbigh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other hotels in the area and by far the Conrad is the best. The rooms are superior and have the best bedding I have seen so far in any hotel. For those who must have health facilities, the Conrad has a good selection of fixed machines, free weights and cardio equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, elegant, you are made to feel special...”
Reviews.Author: JBatts
Reviews.Content: Positives: The bathroom was amazing, service was better than most other hotels, nice touch with the free "special" pillow that you could order, and Hilton honors members get free breakfast; and the Bose speakers with the flat screen TV were terrific. Negative: None -- room was a little small, but not so small that we were uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Roxy_Roo_80
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite and were thouroughly satisfied with our room. Bose stereos, flat screen tvs, luxurious bathroom and comfortable beds!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LHBK
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago meeting some friends from out-of-state. The hotel was located in a very convenient spot for us. Service was excellent. Enjoyed our stay. Self parked across the street. While a convenient location, there were no in and out privileges. Apparently this is changing soon. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A glass half empty kind of place”
Reviews.Author: Mark-choosy-chappy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a tough one to make a judgement on. The room was very comfortable, we got an upgrade to a Junior Suite but my overall takeaway was it comes just short of the mark. You need two elevators to get to the room, the service at breakfast was breathtakingly sloppy and there is something about the lay-out that left me feeling empty - soulless is the word that my wife suggested. Lots of deal making in the lobby, at most times of the day, probabaly tells you whether this is the place for you or not. It did the job for one night, but no more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a long weekend!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisH3040
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this lovely hotel. The location is ideal for seeing the sights of downtown Chicago. Located one block off of the Magnificient Mile, with a bridge directly into Nordstrom, this is a great place for shoppers to stay. It is, however, not just for shoppers. We found several great restaurants nearby (Rosebud's Steakhouse and Benny's Chop House were absolutely our favorites!), it was an easy walk to the Theater District and just a bit further to Millenium Park and the Bean. We would recommend the easy- to-navigate train system or the always available taxi cabs for a visit to the Sears (oops!), Willis Tower. We also walked to Navy Pier and the Chicago River Boat Tour. The hotel staff was very accomodating. They were able to provide recommendation for dinner that met our needs, although we used TripAdvisor for the final decisions. We were asked prior to our arrival of any special requests we would like in the room, including fluffy down pillows at no extra charge. The free, in room wi-fi was a treat as was the flat screen plasma with a Bose surround sound system. The bathroom was stocked with quality toiletries, a magnifying mirror, a huge tub with seperate shower (didn't care for the clear glass doors), and a seperate toilet area. I loved the drawers in the bathroom that allowed us to put our toiletries out of sight and not all over the counter. One downside was there was only one sink on a very large slab that could've easily had two sinks. Difficult, but not impossible, to share with two people getting ready in the morning. The hotel also provided a newpaper and bathrobes during our stay. We will definitely return here for any future visits to Chi-town.

Reviews.Title: “Leaves a bit to be desired”
Reviews.Author: AuroraMom
Reviews.Content: Reading others reviews, it is obvious there is an "A" and "B" team as far as service goes. The front staff while polite were distant, as English was not their first language and they all spoke the same Eastern European one, they seemed more interested in chatting with each other, than taking care of guests. They also ignored us and avoided eye contact when we attempted to ask questions. However the bell staff and the one woman at the front whose first language WAS English were very friendly and helpful and asked if we needed help. We were told this hotel was the "top of the line" for the Hilton chain. Then why were the towels so crappy??? What do they give to dry off at the moderate Hiltons now? Paper towels?? The robes were plush, thank goodness so that was a treat. They give a "pillow menu" , how about a "towel menu" for guests that actually use the shower or bath?? Our room looked at the side of a building, so no view. The room was very nicely appointed and the bed was comfortable, the location is fantastic for sure. Just think they need to improve a bit, to live up to their claims.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Location”
Reviews.Author: Marbellaparis
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, location. I received an executive room and it was quite spacious- wonderful. There is a Bose. The bathroom was large with separate shower, tub - for me this is ideal. What I truly LOVE, LOVE, LOVE is the Conrad Chicago uses Acca Kappa White Moss bath products - Excellent!!! As a Gold, I received breakfast coupons. There is a section on the menu for Hilton Honors.....it was great. Coffee, juice, toast, fresh fruit, big bowl of yogurt...perfect breakfast for me. Restaurants, shopping, Michigan Ave at your door step. I look forward to staying at the Conrad Chicago next month. Hopefully, the weather will be great to check out the outdoor bar. Rendez-Vous is a good place for drinks after work. The Bar at the Peninsula and Roof at theWit are also excellent for drinks and near by.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff is very friendly and...”
Reviews.Author: eddie1510
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very friendly and respectful. The location of the hotel is perfect, many stores and restaurants within walking distance. The rooms are very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: mmorrisey
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! The location was great and the hotel staff was wonderful. The room was spacious and nicely appointed and the bathroom was large (three women got ready without a problem). One side of the hotel is on Rush Street, but the other side goes to the mall that houses Nordstrom's and goes out to Michigan Ave. and the Magnificent Mile!! I would stay here again in a heart beat. I loved this place!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel, perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: njd003
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here Saturday to Sunday for a quick downtown overnighter. First time at this hotel. It exceeded our expectations, and they were high. Great location on the "south end" of the Mag Mile. Service was excllent. Hotel is very nice, classy. Stayed in a Junior Suite that was huge. Great bathroom, nice sitting room, nice bedroom area too. Our view from the 16th floor looked out over Michigan Ave. Terrace would have been great if summer. Hotel is attached to the Shops at Northbridge. Planning to stay here again, would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel stay...as usual”
Reviews.Author: Danandbrad
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Conrad for 5 nights on business. The Conrad is always my first choice of Chicago hotels and this trip did not disappoint. After not traveling to Chicago for over a year, I was thrilled to return to the Conrad. My arrival night was Super Bowl Sunday and I arrivied just in time for the game after a 3 hour delay at the airport. The staff was great as usual, especially the front door staff who were great all week. And it was a joy to watch the game on the 42" TV with Bose surround sound. As a Diamond member, I was upgraded to a corner executive room with a wall of windows on both exterior walls, one facing Michigan Avenue. Even with all of these windows, the room was pretty quiet with little street noise. I sleep better at the Conrad then at any other hotel I have ever stayed at due to the very comfortable bed and pillows. Several nights I had to work and the desk was roomy. The desk chair was not the most comfortable for long periods but worked fine. I also had to remove the desk lamp shade for the best light, but no big deal. A couple small things I loved about the room and something any decent hotel should have (but not all do) is a safe large enough for a laptop computer and power outlets near the bed to charge the cell phone. I could go on and on about the overall experience but I think the best compliment to the hotel is the fact that I traveled with a co-worker this trip. She had never stayed at the Conrad. She loved her room also and fell in love with the hotel. We have another trip planned for late March and the first question she asked is "can we stay at the Conrad again!" One final comment, the hotel's River North location is near perfect as well, close to great restaurants, shopping and transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Chicago Venue”
Reviews.Author: Cheeezhead
Reviews.Content: I came here looking for a good business hotel, and this one fit the bill. A bit cold and overly businessy (prefer things that make me feel a bit more at home), but basically very good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: orangeeater
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Conrad was a great place to stay. It has a beautiful outdoor bar.lounge which is a perfect and romantic place for cocktails in the summer.. in fact this is one of the main draws. The rooms are clean and comfortable.. and the guests are all well dressed and upscale which adds to the ambiance of the Conrad. Not the cheapest hotel but if you have the money, it is a great place to stay! Only downside is Starbucks is not in the attached mall so if it is winter, you have to go out in the cold for coffee

Reviews.Title: “I felt discriminated against while staying here”
Reviews.Author: dakid23
Reviews.Content: Took my aunt to Chicago for her B-day and stayed at this hotel. The staff was really stuck up and treated me with no respect. We came home at 11 30 pm after watching a basketball game and my bed broke. I called the front desk and ask them if they could please move me to another room and they said NO! Some one would be up there to fix the bed the guy showed up 12 30 AM. The location is great and the hotel is nice but there are plenty of other hotels to stay at in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: MGreulich
Reviews.Content: The Conrad was a great hotel ... good location at the south end of Michigan Ave. It was connected to Nordstrom, which includes a casual food court. The service was great, room was very clean and the bathroom was amazing! It was large with a huge shower and all of the amenities. There was a bar in the hotel, which had pricey drinks, but that is to be expected I guess. Overall, a very good stay! And, they allow for late check out.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Tredpositive
Reviews.Content: Spotless room, luxurious crisp bed linens , wonderful large flat screen hdtv with fab bose sound system, large spacious well laid out bathroom with amenities, what more does any traveler need? Ok, add friendly and fast valet luggage and parking service, beautiful spacish lobby on 5th floor with stylish cozy bar and restaurants, free great fitness center and as Hilton Honors members you receive free breakfast coupons upon check-in. The breakfast comes with hot egg selection, although sides such as bacon or sausage are extra, but mixed berries, potatoes, bread/pastry selection, etc are included, definitely huge delicious well served meal. Need a refrigerator, they will deliver to your room at no additional charge. Chicago weather no bother, walk across enclosed bridge to The Shops At North Bridge Mall that Nordstrom anchors with lots of other stores and plenty of eateries to choose from. Conrad Chicago is conveniently located in the middle of Mag Mile with State Street and Millenium Park across from Art Museum, of course more shopping all within walking distance, or short cab ride. Plenty of restaurants and bars surrounding the Conrad in all directions. Enjoy...

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with stay at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: Wright861
Reviews.Content: We booked the Conrad for 2 nights. We were looking for an upscale modern hotel. We read the reviews on TripAdvisor and feel the Conrad was a good choice for what we were looking for. Great location off Michigan Avenue for shopping and restaurants. We are Hilton Gold members and did receive a room upgrade to city view, as well as a fabulous breakfast in their lovely (but otherwise pricey) restaurant. The room was small, although the bathroom was very nice and spacious- soaking tub and separate shower, door to divide toilet from bath area. The decor throughout the room and hotel was modern and good quality. The hotel was very nice, just as we expected. No pool, just to note, which we would have used. My husband used the workout facility and was pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Nochmar
Reviews.Content: This is my second time here in two months; both stays were great. The rooms are very nice and very clean. The staff is terrific and always attentive. My only concern would be there never seems to be anyone at the concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel that delivers on the details”
Reviews.Author: Cocowheats
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Chicago Hilton and I was very impressed overall in terms of value (I got a great AAA rate both times). The hotel is in an excellent location and I loved all the extra amenities provided in the room (the slippers, free bottled water, complete dental kit, Bose speakers with a 50" flat screen TV). The last time that I stayed, my room seemed smaller, but overall, I think that the rooms do run a little small because of the huge bathroom, but that is fine by me, since I love the separated tub and shower. The biggest disappointment though is that as a Gold Honors member, I am usually upgraded to an executive room or better at other Hilton properties, but since there is no executive floor, I just got an upgrade to a "City View" which I guess means I can look down onto Michigan Ave. and across the street at the Intercontinental. As far as service goes, the bellman was extremely helpful and very friendly when I arrived, but I had a completely different experience with checking in. I can't quite put my finger on it, but the lady checking me in seemed bored and it was pretty impersonal. I guess I am just used to be greeted with big smile and a little bit more conversation about why I am in town, etc. by the person at the front desk, especially if they can see that I have stayed at the hotel before and that I am a gold member. I'm being nit-picky right now, but overall I am happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Wilmot33317
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad Chicago for three nights while attending a conference at the Marriott next door. It has no 'concierge' floor - I was assigned a room on the top floor and was given Hilton Hhonors breakfast vouchers. I thought the room was large and comfortable. The king-sized bed was oh so comfortable and I loved the big bathtub, the separate shower, and WC for the toilet. Housekeeping kept my room spotless and the concierge was very helpful with dinner reservations (try Shaw's Crab House over Joe's which is closer) even when I needed to change them. I met the GM on the way to the business center and commented about his helpful, friendly staff. I will definitely stay at the Conrad Chicago again. It's on my list of favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Jammop
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, comfortable, and very quiet and have large working desks and a spacious bathroom with separate stall shower and toilet area (much like what you find at a Ritz Carlton). Highly recommend for business travelers--central location and rooms are very conducive to working. For leisure travelers, the hotel is connected to the Nordstrom mall and central to all tourist spots. And, love those Conrad slippers!

Reviews.Title: “A Plus Hotel, Conrads Never Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: SKara
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel. The rooms are huge, including a luxurious bathroom. It is clean and service is first rate. Breakfast was excellent (and complimentary for Hilton Honors members). Hotel is in a good location, and is connected to a mall, which I imagine would be a great asset in the Chicago winter. Next time I go to Chicago, I will stay here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Chicago is a very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Shell-TA
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a two night stay at this hotel, as we were in town for a college visit with our son. The hotel itself is beautifully furnished. Everything was extremely clean. The staff at this hotel could not have been any nicer. Every person we encountered went out of their way to answer our questions and help in any way possible. We had a deluxe room with two double beds. The only drawback at all was that the beds had pillowtop mattresses that tended to dip down on the edge so that you had to try to sleep more towards the middle or it felt like you were rolling off the ede of the bed. If both people were rather large, it could be a little uncomfortable. The pillows were comfortable and they give you a lot of them. The TV was just great - a flat screen that was at least 42" or maybe more, and the BOSE sound system was awesome. The bathroom was spacious with separate spaces for the toilet and sink areas. The location of this hotel can't be beat. It's right in the heart of everything and was very convenient for shopping, sightseeing and restaurants. We were very pleased with the Conrad and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lululouise
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a six day business trip in Chicago and stayed at the Conrad Hotel. Attached to Nordstrom, it's the perfect location. The staff were wonderful. Very kind and extremely professional. I enjoyed the peaceful nights and the pillow menu (a must). I loved the complimentary slippers and bottled water, especially after working all day. Great for business, but I wouldn't recommend it for families with little kids. This hotel is now on my favorites list. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AZTraveler100
Reviews.Content: The Conrad was everything I expected and more. The staff were all friendly, efficient and professional. Rooms were new, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and the soaking tub a nice end to a chilly day in the city. The bed was extremely comfortable and the pillow menu - great! I tried the Relaxation pillow and loved it! It is rare to find a luxury hotel that does not charge for internet access - good job Conrad!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: ben1233
Reviews.Content: The Conrad has it all. What more can be said? From the quiet atmosphere, to the rooftop lounge, to the large rooms our stay was top-notch. Even better, they'll validate your parking for a discount which, when compared to other hotels, is a raging bargain. Make sure to ask about it at the front desk. Also, another tip would be to use the elevators (that I think) face Rush St. Using the one inside the shopping center can take a long time. I got a deal for my stay at the Conrad this summer, but would be willing to pay full price next time! I highly recommend the Conrad, it's light-years beyond the nearby InterContinenal.

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS A VERY RELAXING, ENJOYABLE EXPERIENCE.”
Reviews.Author: Leanne044
Reviews.Content: The Service was great. Upon arrival we were greeted at the entrance with lots of help with luggage. There was no wait at the check-in desk with plenty of pleasant service. There were 3 of us staying overnight; we had 2 Double beds. The room was very comfortable with a big screen TV, plenty of storage, and large shower and separate commode area. It was very up-to-date. The Concierge gave us great information to sights and shopping. Thumbs up to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: eddietheeagleeye
Reviews.Content: Nice and quiet place to stay. Great rate from the internet, and central location

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Hotel--great property!”
Reviews.Author: gallenrcrm
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new rooms renovation, excellent service, very friendly staff. I would stay there again in a minute. Great job Hilton!!

Reviews.Title: “What a City Hotel Should Be”
Reviews.Author: ChiTownVisitor
Reviews.Content: The Conrad has everything a city hotel should have. Great location in downtown Chicago, a roof top bar and lounge, wonderful room and the most comfortable beds and very pleasant service. You couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Well-run, and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JHarris48
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Chicago at the Conrad. We tried to use TripAdvisor to help us choose a Hilton property for our stay. I think the Conrad was the right choice and would concur with the positive reviews by others. The room was very attractive, spacious, and modern. The service was superb. We ate in the restaurant every morning and it went quite well. We tried the bar, including an afternoon tea, and the staff did a super job. The Conrad is actually part of a shopping mall anchored by Nordstrom's, so if shopping is your interest, Nordstrom's and the Miracle mile is at your doorstep. For us, we preferred to take the river architecture tour and see the other sites. The departure for the river tour was two blocks away, the red line subway (for Wrigley) was also two blocks away. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel -- Would Definitely Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: roban13
Reviews.Content: The Conrad was wonderful. I used my Hilton points to stay for one night before I had to check out the following day and go across the street to the Chicago Marriott where my conference was being held. I much preferred the Conrad over the Marriott. The king-bed room I had was huge and had great amenities. It had those great snuggly robes and slippers for guest's use. I especially enjoyed using the immaculately clean soaking tub (which was right next to the glassed in shower) after an afternoon of bike riding along Lake Michigan. The room was very clean upon arrival. It had a large desk, comfortable lounge chair and ottoman, a very large flat screen t.v., bose sound system, a DVD player and an alarm clock/docking station next to the bed for your Ipod. I was on a lower floor (6th) and occasionally you could hear the El train rumble by, but I only noticed it occasionally when I was awake (did not bother my sleep at all). It is in a great location. I didn't try any of the restaurants in the hotel so I can't comment on those. The fitness center was adequate. It had less cardio eqiupment than I thought it would for a hotel that size (I think 8-9 pieces?) and their weight equipment could use some updating. All in all a great stay and I would definitely book into this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny... (wheelchair guest)”
Reviews.Author: Love_Chocolate_71
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week in Chicago. We had our yearly "girls vacation"......Mom, my sister and I. My mom being in a wheelchair, required my search for a hotel to be very thorough and a bit demanding. We wanted GREAT location, 5 star category, and spacious wheelchair accesible rooms with a Walk-In shower. I was suprised to find out that one should NOT asume that a 5 star hotel will have these types of rooms. Some just don't (Westin). We got a great deal ($220-$240 a night). Eventhough the rate didn't include any meals at all, we all agreed that it was worth every penny. The service was wonderful, beginning with Bell Boys, then Front Desk, Then restaurant Staff (great food by the way), the housekeeping staff...just about anyone I can remember was courteus, very considerate with my mom ( and us) The concierge gave is good tips on where to Dine (for all budgets) and the best recomendation was the Architectural River Tour (Chicago Line). We saw other companies offered it, which mostly departed from Navy Pier, but this one has it's harbor on a separate location. The boats were better, the guide was awesome, and the price included Starbucks coffee, muffins and cookies. Make sure to take a cap or hat and sunblock, since the 90 min tour is on a completely uncovered deck, so you can appreciate the buildings. The rooms were much larger than your average double room. Eventhough I was hoping for 2 queen beds, we got 2 full size beds. The bathroom was extremely acomodating, we were able to actually "wheel" my mom into the shower...which had a fold-in bench for her to sit on, hooked to the wall (VERY convenient). We had room service twice, when my sister could not get her body moving without her coffee. The actually send you the french press and press it right there, so the coffee is as fresh as can be. They have a very lively bar by the main lobby, which is mostly populated by business collegues (this is not your typical family friendly hotel). On the same floor , a beautiful Terrace overlooking downtown Chicago (Main Lobby is on the 5th floor) with a limited but very creative menu offering a variety of "tapa-like" appetizers that range from asian cuisine to eclectic dishes that were nothing but exquisite. We tried The Terrace once too, and we left very satisfied both with the amount of food and the quality/taste. Considering it is a 5 star hotel, the prices on the menus (Main Restaurant inside, Terrace and the Bar) are considerably high. You can have a delicious breakfast consisting of eggs / omelette , toast, juice & coffee which will be in the neighborhood of the 25 - 30 dlls. The PLUS of this hotel is, ...if you don't want to spend all of your per diem on meals, COSI is right across the street where they have 2 or 3 VERY decent choices for breakfats, Quiche, Croissants and excellent coffee. We also discovered (halfway through our stay!) that there is a passage that connects the hotel directly to a mall, where NORDSTROMS is, and in it, the Nordstroms Cafe, which will serve you a very good breakfast (simple fruit or bagel or as complex as a delicious Veggie Omelette) for aprox. $10.00 So...you have all the choices right there. The location is another plus. It is within walking distance of the best Malls, Miracle Mile, Navy Pier (which I do not recommend unless you like shopping for "I Love Chicago" T-Shirts and Key Rings), a dozen or more of the best restaurants in downtown Chicago, and many more attractions. A cab ride to the financial district or the Theatre Disctrict is no longer than 10 minutes, and will cost you around $5 - $7 dlls at the most. I am an extremely light sleeper and I can asure anyone that the rooms are soundproof and they start on the 5th floor, so all the rooms are quite far from the street noises. The only one thing we complained about was the extremely cold temperature they keep the lobby and hallways at (around 55 - 60 F) and the bath towels (to thin and rough). I will be writing a separate review for the points of interest, with comments on Wheelchair accesibility, surrounding neighborhoods , dining and museums. We would definatelly go back to this hotel. I hope this is helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel if You Can Afford It”
Reviews.Author: kcalmole
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel that I would not stay at under normal conditons cause it is SO expensive but we had a deal that worked for 3 of us sharing. The decor was fantastic, Bose stereo system, beautiful bathroom, plush linens etc. Hotel was well located in Chicago to get around to everything and in fact is adjacent/attached to a very nice MI. Avenue mall. No breakfast was included in our rate and we were so busy in town we did not use most of the services in the hotel so I cannot comment on these. But location and plushness of this hotel made it a wonderful stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in the city!”
Reviews.Author: Wired111
Reviews.Content: To start with the Conrad is a wonderful hotel in a great location near everything that makes downtown Chicago great. Okay itâ€™s not cheap (I just paid $248 per night which is awesome for that property), valet parking is not cheap but the hotel makes up for it with its great staff, wonderful service, and fantastic terrace bar. I travel 150+ nights per year and always look forward to my stays at the Conrad. PS the beds are super comfortable and it was a very quiet during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “EVerything was great until....”
Reviews.Author: silvercal10
Reviews.Content: I got a bill for $285 because they side I cleaned out the mini-bar. Every last thing. ABSOLUTELY ABSURD! I didn't even know where the mini-bar was in the room! After calling to dispute the charges, they said they wouldn't reverse it. I'm very well traveled and I've never had such an absurd accusation. I'd stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 * Beyond our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Tobocop
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at the Conrad Chicago, everthing about the hotel was excellent. Wonderful room and service from all the staff was first class. Great view from our room. The hotels location is great, right in the centre of the magnificent mile. A wonderful stay in an amazing city was made perfect by our stay at the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “EVERYTHING THAT GLITTERS IS NOT GOLD”
Reviews.Author: chivaliea
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go to the Conrad for our anniversary, After a lot of looking we decided on the Conrad for our three day stay. First of all we were not informed about the extra hundred dollar a day policy until we called to check on our reservations. The parking fees are wat to expensive!!! The room was very nice and clean, however, everything else was horrible. Room sevice sucked, I ordered a soda with my meal and I kid you not, it took them twenty four hours to get it to me. My husband called three times finally asking to speak with the manager. He informed us that my soft drink would be up with my next meal, well, I ordered lunch the next dat and still no soda!!! My husband called again and the manager stated that he would have the soda up to me if he had to walk over to the restaurant and get it him self. To my amazement I finally had my soda after twenty four hours of waiting. Needless to say, For the rest of my staff I refused to order anything else from the hotel. One the first day my husband and I decided to take a nap when we heard someone tugging on or room door, I was so scared. It was a staff person trying to get into the room. She never identified herself until my husband ask who she was. This person was very rude and I was very angry. She finally informed us that she was there to check the mini bar. We called and spoke to the manager and he assured us that he would talk to this person. We had to call down to the front desk to have them remind room service to come to our room to take all the dishes away. When the staff person got there she still left some dirty dishes in the room. Upon us leaving I decided to fill out that how was your stay cards, I also sent a letter to the general manager of the hotel.It's been almost four weeks since our stay and I still have not heard anything! For all the money we spent at the Conrad you would think the service would be a lot better. With all the problems we had to deal with it kind of took away from our eleven year anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business hotel in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: KLDESQ
Reviews.Content: There aren't very many Conrad hotels in the USA and that is honestly a shame as they are very valid competition to the other high end hotels of other chains (i.e. JW Marriott, Westin, etc.). This particular hotel is a very fine business hotel. I was upgraded to a Jr. Suite, which is basically one large room in a sort of L shape. By big city standards my room was huge, complete with a Bose 321 DVD system and high def TV WITH HD programming. The bathroom was also a highlight as it was huge and had a large walk in shower in addition to a big tub. The Conrad Chicago has a very unique service (no additoinal charge) as they present you with a "pillow menu". I choose several different pillows (relaxation, clod and flu and magnetic) and they were cool. The magnetic probably the worst of the lot but the relaxation was wonderful. Their location is terrific. It is one block off Michigan Ave and on Rush very near to Ontario. It is connected to a mall (by big city standards). You can easily walk to the Loop. There are a ton of restaurants within walking distance as well. The valet parking is a rip off though as it is $51/night. There are cheaper parking alternatives in the neighborhood. Thankfully I work for a company that is OK with that sort of parking expense so it was more convenient to park at the hotel. They have a little outdoor bistro type restaurant on the fifth floor. It is in a great setting and the food is terrific. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Faux Art Deco?”
Reviews.Author: BrianDiana
Reviews.Content: Despite being a longtime Hilton visitor, this was the first time I have stayed in a Conrad. Because of a number of meetings and a private dining requirement, I was booked into a suite on the 17th floor. The room was very spacious with all the facilities necessary and the service from friendly check-in to waiters and concierge could not be faulted. It was and expensive stay but the value for money was there...a big tick in my box. Try as I might, I couldn't work out how old the hotel was. There was a definite art deco feel to everything with the main colour being sort of beige. The lifts (elevators) were straight out of Gotham City and appeared to be designed to give out as little possible interior light as indeed were most of the public areas. I'm still not sure whether the hotel was designed as a "1930's Experience" or if indeed it was from the 1930's... In any event, most impressed and would certainly visit again if on business...if not with the assistance of night vision goggles.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gisela67
Reviews.Content: My birthday wish this year was to visit the city of Chicago. I always check out TripAdvisor before I book any hotels, but my friend suggested the Conrad Chicago. We paid extra for a city view (about $50.00 more a night) which was a waste of money. Don't pay extra for a city view. The hotel was very clean and the staff extremely helpful. It was very quiet inside the hotel, but we could hear the traffic noise from the roads. We were on the 7th floor. The bed was extremely comfortable. I have read on TripAdvisor before that the towels at the Conrad are not very soft. True!!! They are very rough actually. They should invest in some new towels. Loved the shower gel and lotion they provided! My friend suggested to eat at the hotel restaurant for breakfast. The food is overpriced and it wasn't very tasty. My suggestion: spend your money elsewhere. There are plenty of Starbucks around the city. Yum! I would definitely stay at the Conrad Chicago again. It was a very pleasant and relaxing experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: N_and_R
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Conrad Chicago for the first time. I was attending a conference at the Marriott across the street. I'm glad I stayed at Conrad instead. The facilities are very well maintained. The service is great. As long as it is possible to find a good rate, I would not mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting room service”
Reviews.Author: Encanna
Reviews.Content: Do you imagine getting there for the first time and overlooking the room, that was supposed to be ready, with used towels and the mouthwash opened and used? what about when they left the towel for the floor (the foot towel) to dry my face? what about the slippers that, although being still in the bag, had all the sole broken and left tiny plastic parts over the way to the garbage (all over the room, de facto). i didn't realise that would happen to me until i saw paris hilton on tv and then i knew god is great and he did it to us for being such an idiots to go to a company that has been able to create her. shame on us, actually!

Reviews.Title: “First time at Conrad - awesome!”
Reviews.Author: jackmilwaukee
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel and completely worth what we paid for it, considering it really wasn't that much more expensive than lower-end hotels in the area. Great service, clean/large rooms, excellent location and a really cool restaurant. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “First stay at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: dfwmw
Reviews.Content: My only other experience of a Conrad was at the one in Dublin about 10 years ago or so. The Chicago facility was a pleasant reminder of just what a fine product the Conrad brand is. Location was excellent, decor subdued and tasteful, service friendly and (generally) helpful. My only complaint was that the staff did not seem terribly responsive to my noting that the lock on the door of my room seemed defective. Someone was apparently sent to look at it, but I never received any feedback explaining the problem or why it was not fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate hotel”
Reviews.Author: KK
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. The rooms and bathrooms were awesome. The hotel had a cool bar but I never grabbed a drink there. The front desk was always very friendly and helpful. The hotel was in a great location- just one block from all the shops on Michigan Ave. I used points for my 2 night weekend stay but would definitely spend the money to stay there again because I'm sure any other nearby hotels, like the Marriott, would be a big let down.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: KCinKY
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location on magnificent mile. The Conrad connects to the Nordstrom mall. Everyone we came into contact with from the bellman to the Concierge were top notch professionals. The rooms were luxurious and spotless. Great flatscreen TV. If I had to find one thing that was not absolutely perfect it would be the mattress. The linens and pillows were great, but the mattress was not the best. The pillow menu was fun. The rooftop terrace was lovely and was the place to be in the evening. Free high speed internet.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, and I didn't even get there”
Reviews.Author: NancyKay
Reviews.Content: I have called their sales department THREE times, and have gotten voice mail every time, and no return call, over a period of two weeks. I was hoping to stay in a Terrace suite, which I was told by reservations, (and the number was given to me by the reservationist,) have to be booked over the phone, not online. After three messages left, and no response, I can only assume they don't need my business. I'm surprised at such rude treatment at what I thought was a nice establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: JeanaF
Reviews.Content: My three sons and I decided to spend 2009 Easter weekend in Chicago and ended up at Conrad Hilton. Great price through Hotwire. The room was clean, big, quiet. The lobby was up a few floors (5?) and this made it very private. Small hotel, small bar area, one restaurant that I saw. Excellent location and connected by skyway/elevator to some seriously good shopping. I wish they would have had a computer available in lobby for confirming and printing airline departure tix. Coffee in the morning in the bar. If you want more, you can order it from adjoining restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “like being a President - a diamond member's treat”
Reviews.Author: renefromamsterdam
Reviews.Content: we booked this as HiltonHonors (diamond) reward stay, and we were extremely pleasantly surprised that - because all executive rooms were booked - they double or triple upgraded us to the Presidential Suite !!! WOW. what a suite it was indeed. Location of hotel also excellent; lot's of stuff at walking distance. Parking indeed expensive, but it's expensive everywhere downtown chicago. Breakfast was - although the food itself was great - the only poor point of this hotel: it seemed disorganised and there was constantly a line of people "wating to be seated" although there were empty seats abundantly available; one person taking care of that and she did other things in between as well; also we had to wait like 20 minutes for our coffee and then it came twice; i.e. don't go for breakfast if you are in a hurry. But again, this is truly a great hotel and next time we'll go there again, also as paying customer!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: SoTravelHappy
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. I walked to shops and fun Chicago eateries and didn't need to spend lots of money on transportation. The rooms are luxurious and classy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, especially for shopping Michigan Ave.”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Fan-10101
Reviews.Content: Some of the negatives of the Conrad are also things that make it nice. By this I mean that it's right smack in the middle of all of the Michgan Ave. shopping action, but it's a little hard to find if you are driving---which makes for a quiet stay---no busy lobby or packed bar. Just classy, upscale elegance. Like the property itself, the rooms are decorated nicely, but on the small side. We had a standard room, which had a view of a nearby office building. If you want to see the lake, you'll need to spring for one of the more expensive rooms and make sure you tell the check in person that you desire a good view. The food in the restaurant is good and the service is too, though breakfast can be a little pricey. Try the cheeseburger from room service. You won't be disappointed. The hotel is connected by elevator to the adjacent mall. The elevator drops you right next to the entrance to Nordstroms. Again, if you are walking to the hotel, it can be a little hard to find. If you are looking for a quiet luxury hotel just steps from great shopping, then this is it.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: metsjerseygirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, and in a nice location. The room was fairly clean except for a robe in the closet that had red stains on the inside of it, and in the desk drawer there was a comment card left from 4 months prior! I guess the housekeeper did not clean nor look at the drawer since! The front desk service was average.

Reviews.Title: “what's not to love”
Reviews.Author: Byrondad
Reviews.Content: The location is fab...right next to Nordstrom (my mothership...) The staff is lovely and the rooms are comfy and inviting. Cool, relaxing colors and cushy furniture..Love the deep soaking tub. Ridiculously great burgers from Room Service (doing a personal survey of best RS burgers) and the Conrad is in my top 3...Nothing beats a midnight burger in your jammies! We've stayed here at least 6x and never had a bump...good views, great staff, zero problems. GET HERE NOW! We're coming back in Nov for the MAGMILE LIGHT FESTIVAL and with our corner suite we'll have a perfect view of the Parade. We booked early and got asuper rate. Skip the in-house restaurant, go across the street to COSI for great coffee and breakfast :)

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Conrad-Everything as expected”
Reviews.Author: spudpicker1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my son on the weekend of May 16th. Check-in was quick and very pleasant.My room was on the 6th floor,cityview. Both of our rooms were identical. The entryway to the room was spacious. The room had a large (50"?)flatscreen TV, desk with comfortable leather chair, easy chair with ottoman and a dresser with 3 drawers for storage. For the life of me, I cannot understand why this hotel does not have wifi, just old fashioned wire hookup.There was a good sized closet equipped with a large Conrad shopping bag to carry home your souvenirs. The closet was also eqipped with slippers, cloth laundry bags and an umbrella for use during inclement weather. Because of the hotels proximity to a firehouse, the area can be loud at times I never did hear anything from other rooms or hallways the 2 nights I stayed and there was a convention in town, so I was quite impressed with the quietness. The bathroom was "Kohler" branded with luxurious marble countertops and floors, a tub, and glass enclosed shower. Toiletries were Italian, but also included Q-tips, flossing sticks, mouthwash and a toothbrush with a very small tube of Colgate toothpaste included. The toilet was seperated by a door from the bathroom. The towels were very thin and worn as mentioned by others. The hotel had a bar with around 12 barstools and tables and easy chairs to accomodate another 28-30 patrons. There were more tables and easy chairs in the area surrounding the lounge entrance. The bartender and his assistant were very good at their jobs and pleasant to boot. I only used the restaurant for breakfast. I was given vouchers for a free Continental breakfast. The vouchers were worth $14.00 and could be used as credit for any item on the menu. I opted for the American breakfast which consisted of eggs, potatoes, a meat item, toast, juice and coffee or tea. The price was $19.00. The portions were on the small side and I would have definitely opted for another restaurant if I didn't have the vouchers. Onlike some other comments about the staff, I was very happy with the service I received from my waiter and waitress. The hotel itself is in a great area for shopping, and a 20 minute walk to the waterfront. It is also a 5 minute walk to the C.T.A. Redline, which is great for traveling to the friendly confines of Wrigley Field or connecting to other train lines. My ride coming into the city from ORD on Friday evening was about a 35 minute ride and $45.00 +tip. On Sunday morning, the ride took about 25 minutes and cost me $36.00 + tip. Having Diamond status in the Hilton Honors program, the only thing I was slightly disappointed about was the lack of an executive lounge. But I knew this going in. Overall, the hotel was everything I expected. Because of the lack of an executive lounge, I will probably try the Drake Hotel the next time I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid experience”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Conrad Hotel a few times, for both business and leisure. This trip, in May, 2009, was for leisure (a long weekend in Chicago). Given that I keep returning, I obviously like the hotel. The rooms are well-appointed, the decor is on the luxe end without being ostentatious, the fitness center is awesome, and the location -- right on Michigan Avenue, with the car entrance on Rush -- cannot be beat for easy access to downtown Chicago and beyond (the subway is only a block away). This latest stay offered another solid experience. The hotel does position itself as a high-end property, and it mostly fits the bill. The concierge service is always excellent, and there are several thoughtful amenities [slippers, plush robes, fantastic AV in the room (including DVD & CD player at no additional charge), huge bathrooms, luxe bathroom products, umbrella, complimentary shoe shine, fabric laundry bags, etc.]. The bell service is always very nice. The property seems to cater to an older, but not ancient, crowd, so it does feel like a retreat from the hustle and bustle of Michigan Ave., and because the hotel is smaller than most of the properties on Michigan, the lobby lacks some of the craziness of the big hotels. I think the only areas where the hotel misses the mark a bit are in some of the detail work other luxe properties (like Ritz and Four Seasons, which the hotel positions itself as competing against) get 100% correct. For instance, the ATM in the lobby wasn't reading cards, but the staff didn't know it; turndown service was forgotten in our room one night; the hotel's newsletter in our room, detailing movies shown on its terrace during the summer and fall, was very old and featuered the 2008, rather than 2009, schedule. Also, I attempted to order a simple room service breakfast one morning (some pastries and coffee), and I was told that the wait would be one hour because the kitchen was overwhelmed (I appreciated the honesty, but an hour for coffee and a croissant?). Most of my stays have been with a pretty great rate, so I haven't minded these small things, but if I was paying the rack rate for the hotel I'd been more sensitive to some of these things. Overall, this is a VERY nice hotel with a good (sometimes exceptional) staff and a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - a little tired in places”
Reviews.Author: aussiepax
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights on business, with my wife. 8th floor room : neat enough , but some of the room fittings were a bit tired and in need of an update. Bathroom was better and up to 4 - 5 star standard. Wide screen TV OK. Towels were nasty, cheap and scratchy as correctly advised by another reviewer ! Hotel breakfast was poor value. Nearby delis and markets are your best bet ( Jewel Osco market and Fox & Obel within walking distance). Fitness centre air con wasn't on when my wife used it at 0500 - had to request it. Good location on lower end of magnificent mile. Entry a bit weird through nordstom mall - if you have luggage , certainly enter via Nth Rush Street . BTW if you need real coffee try Lavazza cafe on E Ohio, and Bice restaurant on E Ontario for a good Italian meal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelFriend200
Reviews.Content: Everything (but the minibar champagne) was amazing! The front desk staff allowed us to check in at 9am...9AM!!!!! without charging anything extra. The rooms were very nicely appointed and very clean! Large TV, Bose DVD surround stereo, bathrobes and slippers, separate soaking tub and stand-alone shower, huge desk, complimentary bottled water (rare these days) and not only did they grant our request for late checkout the next day, but they also held our bags for us until almost 7pm that night while we went shopping and out to dinner! There really is nothing I would change...except the champagne in the minibar was gross...too dry!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel,great service and location”
Reviews.Author: snillor
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Chicago, the stay at the Conrad was excellent. Good service from attentive staff, very nice room( upgraded to suite). Overall very nice certainly would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Billyphx
