Reviews.Content: I just left the Conrad Chicago and have nothing but good things to say. We used Hilton points to stay there but paid $35/night to upgrade to a junior suite. We were in room 1519. I would reccomend people ask for an odd numbered room so that they will have a view looking north on Michigan Ave. Our room was very modern with 2 large HD/flat panel tv and Bose 3 speaker sound system. 4 big windows that actually open. The bed lineds were very nice, the towels were OK. The room was clean and the bath room had a seperate shower and tub. Marble everywhere. Robes, slippers, etc. The work out room was good with different machines and some free weights. There are clean towels in the workout room too. We never ate in the hotel so I can't comment on the food or the prices. There is a Starbucks across the street (Michigan) and an Espresso bar attached to the Nordstrom that is on the ground floor of the hotel. It was very nice to have the little mall right under the hotel. The location of the hotel could not be better. We were walking distance to everything. Every kind of shopping or dinning experience you could possibly want was within 2 miles. Over all the hotel had a boutique feel to it even though it is part of the hilton chain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel great location, but needs refreshing”
Reviews.Author: mdbasile
Reviews.Content: We were a work group and had a nice stay at the Conrad, but felt the rooms were a little tired. Not so much updating as a deeper claning. I know 2 of us were in suites, and they clearly had hosted some parties and one could really sort of feel that - hard to explain. Other than that - the staff was helpful and the prices were quite good. So all-in-all a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: SJ_TRAVELLERLondon
Reviews.Content: First time in Chicago and we picked a great Hotel! Right in the centre of Michigan Ave, and a Mall attached to the Hotel. The Conrad is a 5* boutique Hotel, but the rooms are very large, Bathrooms are very clean and the staff are extremely friendly!. Will deffinately return as it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreenLNR
Reviews.Content: The towels seemed old and quite rough. The location is perfect. They are very skimpy when it comes to the bathroom amenities. Nice clean rooms. Very slow breakfast service. The best thing about the hotel would be the concierge desk with the most helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “high quality big-box hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoboesque
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is over a smart shopping mall just north of downtown, in the shopping district. It's a good quality hotel, with service to match - the staff are well-trained and friendly, and generally efficient. The check-in was helpful, the housekeeping and concierge staff dealt with some of my dumb questions with tact, and the bellboys did a good job with good grace. The room was large and well decorated. There was a huge TV with DVD player (and a good range of free-to-loan DVDs at the concierge desk), played through a small Bose sound system with CD capability. There was also an ipod player, which made my teenage daughter very happy. The beds were large and comfortable (maybe slightly soft, but for some that might be a plus), and the window opened (a little) so you can sleep in fresh air. The bathroom was large and well-lit. The internet worked well, on both LAN (hooray!) and wireless, and was free, which is increasingly and annoyingly rare in good hotels. So expectations were high! The negatives? No bathtub. I like to soak and read a book before I go to bed, especially on a leisure trip. Humph. No tea/coffee in the room - I like to be able to make tea when I travel, and carry my own supplies of my favourites... they went unused on this trip. And you have to take two elevators to get to street level as the lobby's on level 5, so "just popping out" for something is a more major exercise. Parking is in the public garage opposite, and even with a hotel discount it's expensive. But there were all, I guess, part of the hotel's service proposition, and it was, overall, a good one. I had two complaints that could have been better handled. First, on one of the days, housekeeping forgot to make up the room, and we had to remind them as we went out for dinner in the evening. Secondly, and more seriously, I need to keep hard copy of final bills for my tax records, and, for the first time EVER (I spend over 100 nights a year in hotels, and have done for years)... let me repeat, for the first time EVER - the front desk couldn't issue me a final bill - they asked my to call some 1800 number to get a copy sent! That didn't make it a bad stay, but it did make it an administratively inconvenient one. But generally, assuming you can get a good rate (we paid about US$250 for a twin-bed room), it is a good value, high quality hotel. It doesn't have the charm or "special something" of an independent hotel, but it's pretty good. Just don't expect a receipt...!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family treat!”
Reviews.Author: mommabear1999
Reviews.Content: We had a schedule change and stayed one night instead of two. This was a WONDERFUL hotel! Most of the staff were polite and helpful. The lobby and rooms were spotless and beautiful. Our room was very comfortable- great bed,comfy chairs. Our daughter loved the bath and phone in the private restroom. Mary's Cafe had a reasonable and tasty breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for someone who never cared for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Laurel99
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 night at Conrad Chicago for business and was impressed. This is place is really nice with all the things you want and need in a hotel. They even have an umbrella in the closet which proved very useful. For the HH members they offer a free breakfast that was a little disappointing; you have too choices, the pastry plate or the french toast plate. Both days I chose the pastry and it was good, but I would have preferred more choices, however, it was free so I am not complaining. The TV is excellent with lots of channels and HBO. The Internet is also free, which is nice. The room was large, clean and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom was great with tub and shower and really nice toiletries. The location is also great, next door to a mall and many restaurants. The hotel staff was very professional and accommodating. I will surely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for someone never been to a Conrad, bad for those been to Conrad Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: ORDnHKG
Reviews.Content: Given I had just stayed at the Conrad Hong Kong two months ago, I understand not all Conrad are the same like Hilton, in this case, this particular Conrad property has a sharp contrast to others. For someone that is Hilton Gold or Diamond, this property definately does NOT worth the extra cost to stay, as you will get very basic treatment compare to Conrad Hong Kong. No exec. lounge is the first down side, plus you will only get a continental breakfest coupon. I know for a fact that even if Conrad Hong Kong has no exec. floor rooms available for upgrade, you will still get a buffet breakfest at the restaurant, but this does not apply to Conrad Chicago. I did however still manage an "upgrade" to a city view room. City View room is not much of a city view, basically it is the view looking north on rush street, most of the view is blocked by the next door Marriott, as it is much taller than Conrad, you only get some view on the left side for some residential and commercial buildings, no landmarks like Sears Tower or Water Tower. I would strongly suggest for those not to pay extra $40 for the city view room, not worth it at all. I found that my room is not that much different than a nicer Hilton, with the exception of large flat screen HDTV, comes with Bose surround sound. Bathroom is like other conrads, with separate tub and shower, plus another door to a separate toilet. I found that it is very odd for the deep tub, but very narrow, it would be a problem for a slightly bigger person to take a bath. Bath towels are really thin. Also there is no TV to watch while you are taking a bath like Conrad Hong Kong. Turn down service is available but missing all the little touches, no slippers put next to the bed, no chocolates, no fold out one corner of the comforter to invite you to bed. However, an extra two bottles of water were put on the night stand. The most important thing, missing the signature conrad toy ! I went downstairs and ask the front desk, it is a cow for Conrad Chicago, but it is only available on request, also no plastic duck next to the bath tub like in Conrad Hong Kong. Basically the only upside for this Conrad is even you are at the cheapest room, you will still get the upscale ACCA KAPPA bath amenities instead of in Conrad Hong Kong, unless you stay in exec.floor rooms, you will only get some unknown conrad brand bath products. The continental breakfest only consist of a croissant and two danish, no cold cuts. Even though it is suppose to come with juice and tea or coffee. I asked for a OJ, but no one ever come back if I want tea or coffer later.

Reviews.Title: “A good bet on the Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: DCBuffalo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad Chicago for two nights during a business trip in March. This hotel is in a very convenient location above the North Bridge shopping complex, and is close to Michigan Ave. and the Loop. It's hard to find bad things about this hotel's accommodations, other than nit-picking that the towels were a bit rough! The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and quiet, the beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are clean with plenty of hot water. I did not try the hotel bar or restaurant, or the internet access (used my wireless broadband instead), so I can't comment to their value; but if you're simply looking for a base of operations for a business trip, this hotel is a very safe bet!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: cliffcheek
Reviews.Content: Took my fiance to the Conrad for a romantic weekend and was totally blow away by the level of service. First the Christmas decorations in the lobby were beautiful, worth hanging out in the lobby and starring at the christmas tree. Conceige made reservations for us at Brazass Steakhouse($$$$) which is a meatlovers dream. The room was very nice, large LCD tv, bose stereo and a hug soaking tube. We didn't get to order from the bath/pillow menu but I heard that is very good. The fitness center was up to date, very clean. I recommend this hotel to anyone that wants a true luxury getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Concierge Service at the Conrad Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: mhsun
Reviews.Content: I enjoy the city of Chicago for many reasons, but Iâ€™ve always had a difficult time finding a place to stay in the city. Iâ€™ve tried a variety of the supposed â€œluxury hotelsâ€� in the area over the years, with varying results ranging from mildly annoying to wildly disappointing. The Conrad Chicago embodies quite the opposite phenomenon. The hotel is piled to the roof with the most courteous staff, luxurious rooms and services, and lovely away-from-home amenities that make it a welcome (and welcoming) destination. I was fortunate to stay at the Conrad Chicago hotel last fall, on a â€œgirls weekend," and found it to be an entirely refreshing change from the run of the mill luxury hotel experience Iâ€™ve had elsewhere. Regardless of size, the Conrad Chicago was very much like a boutique hotel- where every request was catered to thoroughly and efficiently. I never would have associated the Hilton name with such extraordinary luxury, based on my previous experience with the chain, until my stay at the Conrad Chicago. The member of the staff who deserves the highest praise, though, is Peter from the concierge desk. Through both travel and my work, I have dealt with, literally, dozens of different concierges in a wide array of settings and I have never encountered anyone more gracious, attentive, thorough, courteous, professional and accommodating than he is. Make no mistake- the differentiator in making our stay an extraordinary one was Peter. He was so key in our joy of experiencing Chicago- in helping us source event tickets, making recommendations and giving advice not only about the city of Chicago, but about the surrounding area and even other destinations we were continuing on to! His assistance proved invaluable during our stay (and beyond!) and made our Chicago experience one we will never, ever forget! I can most certainly guarantee that the next time Iâ€™m in Chicago, I will be staying at the Conrad Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “I Shall Return!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ale1212
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night at this Conrad during the AHR Expo. Like other Conrads I have stayed at, in Hong Kong and in Tokyo, the Chicago Conrad is as plush and sleek as you can get. I got the show rate, which is probably still more than what others have paid via several web sites. The location is superb, within easy walking distance of the many restaurants of the heart of Chicago's River District and Magnificent Mile behind it. It's prime real estate here and there is so much within a 5 minute walk. The room is sleek, modern and comfortable. The bed is a Serta, wish I remembered the model, with plush pillows, soft sheets and a warm comforter. I slept soundly, the most important aspect of a room. The room was vast, with a 42in. Philips LCD TV, Bose sound system, iPod clock radio, thoughtful work desk, and nice touches such a robe, slippers, and, and, and - free one day Internet!!! The hotel web site pictures are spot-on accurate. The bathroom is marvelous. Excellent toiletries, towels, HOT water and nice countertop accessories. It's chic luxury without the overpriced rate. The only hotel services I used was the concierge. I was with eight colleagues, and we wantend to dine at a very popular steak restaurant. Ken, the concierge, suggested it might be to crowded and suggested another. He called my first choice anyway, and he was put on hold for 5 minutes, after which i agreed to try his suggestion. He called and got us a table. We walked two blocks and met a man who was waiting for us. Ken was The Man who made our night!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Even at Twice the Price”
Reviews.Author: winter-schminter
Reviews.Content: This hotel was assigned to us for $95 a night ($115 after taxes) as the 4.5 star option on Hotwire. I would have been willing to pay twice as much for this room. We arrived at 10 and Olga at the front desk allowed us to check in 6 hours early. When we got into the room we were surprised by how large it was. The bathroom was even large (especially for a Chicago hotel room.) We booked a non-smoking king which left plenty of room for moving around. The linens were plush, the tv and radio were very nice. Overall the little extra one expects for a 4+ star hotel were there....except an in-room coffee maker. The staff are probably what made this stay a little better than expected. As already mentioned, Olga at the front desk was helpful at check-in and again when we were charged for a min-bar item we did not use. The bell-men and parking attendents were extremely helpful, friendly, and always willing to go the extra step with directions or eating suggestions. The location of this hotel is one block off Michigan and next to the Marriott. It was an easy walk to any of the attractions on Michigan Ave. and less than a $5 cab ride to Millenium Station. I highly recommend staying there if you get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BABunny
Reviews.Content: Fabulous Hotel. We stay here a lot. My Husband on business and I shop and Spa.!! The rooms are roomy, extremely clean, calmly decorated and the pillow menu is a big bonus. The room rates are a bit more than the average but well worth it. The staff are very attentive and the room service is quick. The central location is just excellent. There is a great little shop in the reception area and never fails to let us down on all those items you forget to take with you. The hotel is connected on to the side a large Mall with Nordstrom. Nordstrom Spa is separate to the department store in this Mall and the Spa is in my top 5 for service and treatments. The service between treatments is minimal but still very very good. On my last stay I hurt my back slipping on the sidewalk in Michigan Ave and the staff were excellent in helping get me and my bags upstairs, running baths and calling me every few hours to see if I needed anything. Excellent, just excellent. If you like New York but canâ€™t cope with the dirty streets and the crowds. Chicago is just what youâ€™ll need as a second choice. Very under rated city. Loads to do locally for everyone from Older people to young families and children.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan_01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Conrad Chicago for 3 nights during the election (wow, what a time to be in Chicago!) and we absolutely loved the hotel. We arrived a little early and were concerned that a room may not be available for us at that time but our request for a king room was met with no problems. The man at reception was very pleasant, and helpful. He asked us if it was our first time visiting Chicago and we told him it was, despite having passed through O'Hare Airport endless times! He seemed very keen to help us in any way and gave us maps and directions to anywhere we wanted to go, and any advice that we needed. Our room was lovely. It was spacious, modern and very clean. The plasma tv was fabulous and the bed was very comfortable. We didn't have a view to speak of but that didn't bother us, as we hadn't booked a particular view anyway. The bathroom was great with a seperate shower which we're a fan of. We like hotels that are modern, and have clean lines and unfussy decor so the Conrad was just to our taste. The turndown service was very nice, with the obligatory chocolates! A huge draw for this hotel is its location- right on Michigan Avenue, attached to The Shops at North Bridge mall which was very handy. It was about a 10 minute walk to John Hancock Building, 20 minutes to Sears Tower, 15 minutes to Grant Park (at a leisurely pace) and less than 5 minutes away from many of the boat tours that go along the river and Lake Michigan, along with Wrigley Building and Tribune Tower. It was absolutely perfect. We even found when we took the free trolley back from Navy Pier, that it stops almost exactly at the front of the hotel! We didn't eat in the hotel at all because there was so much choice in terms of cafes and restaurants right on the doorstep. The room service menu did look a little pricey but I would say no more than other hotels in the same rating. When the hotel really came into its own for us was on the day we were due to check out. We were up early as we were due to fly to Houston that morning and we found an envelope pushed under our door. Our travel agent had faxed the hotel to tell them that American Airlines had changed our flight to one about 8 hours later and to let us know immediately. Not only did they do that, but they extended our check out time for a few hours to make up for the inconvenience. We thought it was very good of the hotel to do that, especially as the inconvenience was nothing to do with them. We made sure we told them at check out how grateful we were and they gave us the impression that nothing was too much trouble for them. We absolutely loved Chicago (it ranks right up there as one of our favourite places) and we're sure that our perfect stay in Conrad Chicago, was a big contributing factor to that.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a great Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: IntegrityTravel
Reviews.Content: AC POWER Suite, had power at the desk, and some at the night stands, but still found myself running an extension cord to get the laptop to the bed. BATHROOM Spacious, clean, had a bathtub and walk-in shower. Plenty of nice smelling toiletries. BEDDING Comfortable, clean. CLEANLINESS Found the whole suite to be very clean. INTERNET Internet had average connection speeds. LOBBY Welcoming, with easy access to the Nordstrom stores. PARKING Expensive, even for Chicago, valet parking and self park in a mall across the street. Had to circle several times to find a self park spot. STAFF Very nice, not rude at all. Front desk staff was very accomodating. TELEVISION Widescreen large LCD with decent digital channel selections

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: sfcvacations
Reviews.Content: Wow, is this placed overpriced. It is a clean Hotel. The rooms are a bit above average but way over priced. Not much to offer but the room. The dining is very very expensive. Breakfast $25.00-$38.00 for a typical meal, $18.00 for a pot of coffee from room service. Very few ammenities as well. This place is trying to be something it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanne M
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week, election week. Arrived early in the am and the room was ready for checkin. The personnel at registration were personable, friendly and helpful throughout the stay. The room was located on the 17th floor. I had some requests for the room which were honored. The room was clean and spacious and included numerous amenities such as an umbrella, slippers, robe, toothbrush, toothpaste, fingernail file, q tips, etc. You get the point. Coffee pot, available on request, for the room. Complimentary coffee, tea, water, and newspapers (multiple), in the lounge, add a nice touch. Daily bed turn down included water, filled ice bucket, replacement of any used towels, and music. A couple of minor maintenance problems were promptly addressed, including day light savings clock setting and rest room problem. Centrally located and an easy walk to restaurants, bars, entertainment, shopping. I don't understand complaints in other reviews. Have stayed at numerous hotels and the Conrad rates with the best. John from Ct.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: shvtraveler
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond member-- My room was a priceline.com bid. I thought the Conrad was first class experience. Staff was very friendly, room was extremely nice. Would I stay here again and pay the normal $300 night for the room, answer is yes !!

Reviews.Title: “OK Experience”
Reviews.Author: trvl4funAustin_Tx
Reviews.Content: First off I choose to stay at Hilton properties which is why I am a diamond member. This hotel leaves a lot to be desired. Checked into the hotel and received room on 11th floor. Total of 2 adults and 2 children for 1 king bed. After contacting the front desk, moved to room 1501. I thought my weekend getaway was off to a good start, was I wrong. In getting ready for bed that night, after a long day of travel, there was no turn down service. I unfolded the let out couch for the kids but there was no sheets and no extra sheets in the room. Called front desk to ask for sheets and turn down service. I received a set of sheets about 20 minutes later that were just dropped off for me to make the bed. Called front desk again to inquire about turn down service and assistance in making the bed. Housekeeping came to room about 15 minutes later and made the pull out and left 1 bottle of water, that was the extent of turn down. Friday housekeeping did not empty my trash, I had to roam the halls for a trash can, none to be found. I ended up having to take the dirty diapers to the restroom in the lobby this day and the following day. Housekeeping for whatever reasoon did not empty my trash. Went to the restaurant on the 2nd day and the service of the male waiter was terrible. He never came back to table to see if anything was needed, ie refills, asked for things and never received them. The food was average. Again that night, no turn down service, called the desk and they sent someone up, she came with a scoop of ice and 2 bottles of water this time. That was the extent of turn down. The pull out was never put away the whole stay at this hotel. Saturday breakfast was terrible yet again, service and food, after paying $21 for OJ I would have liked a refill or 2. Trash in room not emptied again. We did get turn down that night. Sunday, restaurant-took long time to receive order, then when it came it had hair in it. Displeased with the entire experience, not the friendliest staff.

Reviews.Title: “Geuss I expected too much”
Reviews.Author: eoetourhost
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Conrad. For Hiltons top of the line it just doesn't measure up. It compares favorably to a Westin (almost) but just doesn't deliver the luxury. For instance, my room let all the street noise in from Rush Street. Window open or closed, it sounded the same. Breakfast was woefully understaffed and took about an hour. Towels are Holiday Inn thin and rough. They could do so much better. If you get a good price, it is a nice small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A view on the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: SunseekersMN
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to spend the weekend in downtown Chicago for shopping and we found this Conrad hotel well located close to everything downtown and of a size that doesn't make you feel lost in the Convention world. We have had this feeling when staying at larger hotels in the past. Our Suite has view on Michigan avenue with a bit of the Lake at the end. Staff was very professional, pleasant and friendly making us feel very comfortable. Internet is free n the rooms and I am making my review from there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Conrad!”
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Chicago is a modern, stylish hotel geared towards business travelers, but the leisure traveler (me) should also be pleased. I picked this hotel based on the many other positive TripAdvisor reviews. In terms of location, the Conrad has a lot going for it: it's located near the southern end of the Magnificent Mile, two blocks from the Grand (Red line) station. This makes it a short walk from many of Chicago's attractions such as Navy Pier, Millennium Park, the Art Institute, and the John Hancock Tower. Wrigley Field is a short train ride away. In the immediate area surrounding the hotel there are a large number of restaurants, both formal and casual, as well as numerous places to grab a cup of coffee. While not as chic as a W, the rooms were smartly decorated and in nice condition. The Conrad definitely says "business first." The bed was not as overly plush as a Heavenly Bed, but still quite comfortable. As you might expect, hotel offers nightly turn-down service. The staff--front desk, concierge, housekeeping, bell desk--were extremely friendly and helpful. I shared an elevator ride with a man who I believed to be the manager and even though I was in full tourist dress mode (t-shirt & shorts) he never gave me "the look." After all, I'm paying the same rate a businessperson pays! My only complaint has to do with hotel access. The hotel's entrance is on actually on Rush St. with the lobby on the 5th floor. If your room is above the 8th floor, you must take a second elevator to get to your floor. While it's possible to enter the hotel from Michigan Ave. you must walk through the mall (The Shops at North Bridge) and take an elevator up to the 5th floor. This made it a bit awkward, especially when the mall elevator was out of service. If I ever find myself back in Chicago, I would most definitely stay at the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JOD1501
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel - lovely rooms and friendly staff. The Concierge was extremely helpful. The Rush Street entrance is under refurb, but is not a cause for concern as there is another entrance to use which is more direct anyway (and leads onto the Mircale Mile for all that shopping!). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sk_ayers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of September and found this hotel more than met our expectations. We loved the luxurious rooms, the Molton Brown toiletries and most of all the huge wide screen TVs with surround sound in the rooms. The rooms were spacious with bath and shower in the king rooms and large walk in shower only in the twin doubles (our party had one of each type). The staff couldn't have been more helpful; the concierge in particular did everything they could to make our stay a memorable one. The restaurants they recommended for us were spot on and gave us some fabulous eating experiences. The Conrad is also conveniently situated within a large mall so you can go shopping without even going outside. You walk out through the mall and you are right on Michigan Avenue, the Magnificent Mile. The rooms were quiet with no street noise despite this and offered quite good views. It is in a fabulous location and is a wonderful hotel with excellent staff and facilities. I would definitely recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: drabs
Reviews.Content: The hotel was doing some construction at the front entrance when we stayed, so you had to go through some random jerryrigged hallyways to get up to the sky lobby on the 5th floor, but it wasn't a big deal. I'm sure it's easier to get to the sky lobby when they're not under construction, but just be aware that's how the hotel is designed. The staff is nice though the concierge recommended a touristy italian place down the street instead of listening to our preference for a young, fun, non-touristy type dinner. The rooms are nice and the bathrooms are pretty large. There's a nice gym and the sky lobby connects to the Nordstoms at the mall. Parking is $48/night, but that's probably standard for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, overpriced food”
Reviews.Author: Migizi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in July with my wife, using points (so I don't know what the room rate was like). Overall very nice hotel, no complaints about the room or facilities. But the restaurant is ridiculously, laughably overpriced. Details... GOOD: --Rooms are nicely appointed and very clean and well kept. --Bathroom was luxurious --Service was excellent, they did turn-down which was nice --Our room had music and some other nice features --Common areas are nice, although the street-level lobby is under construction. Other than that, the common spaces were comfortable. --Location is great - right off the Mag Mile, can easily be reached from the red line as well. BAD: --The food at the restaurant (we did a lunch and a breakfast) was OK. Lunch (out on their deck) was good, breakfast (inside the restaurant) was mediocre. Both, particularly the breakfast, were absurdly overpriced. As an example, I paid 5 dollars for a glass of coke. For mediocre food, I expect better pricing. This hotel really needs 2 review. I'd give the hotel OTHER than the restaurant 4 to 5 stars (on the TripAdvisor scale). The restaurant deserves 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Conrad Chicago”
Reviews.Author: greenbeltdan
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was a bit concerned reading some earlier reviews, but once you get through the war zone that is the Rush Street entrance under construction, the Conrad is pure bliss. The rooms are a very decent size for a big city, the bathrooms are enormous, and the service is impeccable. You can't beat the location, and the fact that we were an elevator ride away from Nordstrom and the excellent Nordstrom Cafe (very child friendly) meant we could eat meals there instead of the extremely expensive hotel restaurant. My wife also left a pair of gold and diamond earrings in one of the hotel drawers, and when she realized it and called the hotel several days later, they had found the earrings and FedEx'ed it back to us at no charge. Touches like that win my loyalty and I'd stay at the Conrad again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good second choice”
Reviews.Author: 4states
Reviews.Content: We weren't able to get a reservation at our favourite Chicago hotel so decided to give this a try and it makes a good alternative. The rooms were well appointed but on the small side. Everything was clean, however the one thing we hated was the smoking area at breakfast which polluted the entire breakfast area and also the Reception.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Conrad Chicago”
Reviews.Author: cztravellover
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Hilton was fabulous. We stayed there August 12 - 16 for my birthday. I booked the hotel on Hotwire for a rate of $145 per night. Getting the Hotwire price truly meant getting a five star hotel for a three star price. I asked if we could get a room with a view of the city, but they indicated that it would cost an extra $40 per night. I declined figuring that we could use that money towards dinners out. One entrance is on Rush Street and the other entrance is on Michigan Ave. in the heart of the retail district of the Magnificent Mile so the location is hard to beat. We were on the 12th floor (the hotel sits atop a high end shopping center and the lobby is on the 5th floor) and our room was pure luxury and the service excellent. There is a large plasma TV in each room and the shower is big enough for four people. Once I returned home I noticed that I left a few small pieces of clothing in the dresser drawer. I called the hotel and they sent the items to me via Fedex at no charge. We did not eat at the hotel due to prices, but there are many great places to eat within a few blocks. We went to the West Egg for breakfast nearby. Its a wonderful little place with great food at reasonable prices. A nice way to start the day. I would highly recommend this hotel if you can get a Hotwire or Priceline price.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline winning bid on 4* NMA area Friday night $90”
Reviews.Author: tamaralea
Reviews.Content: This was a very good value through Priceline. Hotel is very difficult to find, as the entrance (appears to be under construction) is on Rush Street. My Garmin couldn't get satellite reception on the way in so I had to rely on an old -fashioned map. Parking is located in the Nordstrom lot, which is also on Rush St. We used the self-park option which was $29 for up to a 24 hour period. All the neighboring lots appeared to be $38 if parking overnight. I requested 2 queen beds and a coffee-maker. I got the queen beds. I'm thinking coffee-makers don't exist. The rooms were clean and a little larger than most hotel rooms. The bathroom was much larger than average. The t.v. was gigantic by hotel-room standards. View on 8th floor was just o.k., but we weren't in the room much. Housekeeping was terrific, replacing a comforter that one of my kids managed to get dirty. One concierge was great and another was pretty poor, telling us there was no place we could go for dinner at 6pm, as all the restaurants would be full. Both Fri. and Sat. night, we were able to walk right in and be seated at two different restaurants at 6pm (may be a sign of the bad economy or could be my taste in restaurants). I don't think anyone should pay $300 to stay here, but $200 would be reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Should not be a Conrad”
Reviews.Author: ajwkmills
Reviews.Content: I will start off by saying that I am a Hilton Honors Diamond Member and have stayed at other Conrads and so I review this Conrad from that perspective. The Conrad in Chicago used to be a Le Meridian and they have changed nothing from those days it seems. They are in the process of remodeling but at present it is still the same. The rooms, bits and pieces are a bit tired, the shower had a couple of cracked tiles and seemed quite frankly a bit dirty. The service is OK, the concierge is the best part of the hotels service, quick attentive, knowledgeable. Many of these small things you would forgive if it were just a Hilton, but not a Conrad and the prices they charge. The staff at this hotel need to go and spend a few days at the Singapore Conrad and learn how a Conrad should be run. Until then it is a tarted up Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than we expected”
Reviews.Author: jeannedelor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen because the room rate was less than other similarly rated hotels on the Miracle Mile. We had low expectations and we were pleasantly surprised. The street level lobby was under construction, which was not a good first impression, but it explained the lower room rate. We were very happy with the size and cleanliness of the room, the friendliness of the staff, and the location. We did not eat in the restaurants. There is a Corner Bakery nearby that has a very good, inexpensive breakfast menu.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but would not pay full price”
Reviews.Author: CindyandMarty
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic. Right on Michigan Ave. and close to shopping and restaurants. We stayed at the Conrad from 7/13 through 7/16. Our room rate was $149 a night through Hotwire. For the price we paid, we really enjoyed the hotel. But if I had to ever pay full price (about $300 a night), I would stay elsewhere. About a week before we arrived, I called the hotel to request a King room since the room we were given by Hotwire was a Double. We were told that they could not even put the request in and that it could only be made when we arrived at check in. Never had a hotel say that they couldnâ€™t even put in the request. At check-in, I requested a King room. The reaction I got: â€œLet me checkâ€¦you booked through Hotwireâ€¦we donâ€™t have any Kings available.â€� Her answer/reaction made me wonder whether she was lying about availability or if she didnâ€™t want to give us a King room since we booked through Hotwire. We were put in a room on the 8th floor. I think it was either room 826 or 829. Well the room was decent but the view was HORRIBLE. Our view consisted of the rooftop of the smaller building next door littered with trash and beer bottles and the taller office building next to that. We could literally see into the conference rooms and the cubes and the employees on their headsets. The room was very spacious. Beds were nice and comfy. Bose system and the plasma/LCD TV was nice. However, the remote to the Bose system didnâ€™t work. This controlled all the sound/volume for the music and the TV. I left a note with housekeep the next day wrapped around the remote. They took the remote to get it fixed. But they never brought it back for the remainder of our stay. Kind of annoying when you have to keep getting up to change the volume when watching TV or listening to music. Turndown service was nice. They leave bottles of water, filled the ice bucket and turn on the jazz music. But be careful with the water bottles. The first night we came back after dinner, I almost took a sip out of one of the bottles only to see that it had already been open (the seal ring thing was broken). I put it level on the table next to the other bottle of water and sure enough, it looks like someone had already taken a sip or two out of it. Housekeeping was really good. Always there early during the day to clean the room. We ate dinner one night at the terrace. The food and drinks were okay but the prices were outrageous. In the end, for the price that we paid, it was a good hotel. But for people who are paying full price, customer service, rooms and attention to detail need to be a lot better than what we received. Lastly, I really did feel like we didnâ€™t get as great of service since we booked through Hotwire. But Conrad should not discriminate based on how much someone paid for their room.

Reviews.Title: “need coffee”
Reviews.Author: jajones42
Reviews.Content: for $300 per night should be a coffee pot in the room instead of the plasma tv.staff helpful. beds amazing.entrance construction a pain.convenient for the steely dan concert just 4 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “If it's not a bargain, don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: Colmac
Reviews.Content: As a regular visitor to Chicago and regular Hilton user, I have to say that unless you are quoted less than $300 per night then you can get better value from hotels in the same chain only a block or two away. Don't get me wrong, this is a beautiful hotel in a fantastic location. There is a contemporary boutique feel to the decor throughout and the rooms are spacious enough and have fantastic 42" flat screen TV's There are nice little touches like the nightly turndown service and there is a roof top bar that really is a plus point in the summer and a superb fitness centre. However, there are too many little annoyances that make this only a good rather than the great hotel it could and should be. Firstly: - This is a pet friendly hotel and as someone who is not a dog lover, sharing an elevator ride with two dogs each the size of a Hummer was not a pleasant experience!. Secondly: - Apparently, the Hilton group have only recently acquired this property and it seems as though they are still ironing out the kinks. The staff don't appear to be all on the same page They are typical of my experience with the Hilton group - friendly, hard working and eager to please, but at the rooftop bar for example, I was charged three different prices by three different people for the same drinks, on the same night!. Thirdly; - There is some blatant price gouging here - particularly the business centre (minimum charge $17!) and breakfast (the bed & breakfast rate only gives you money towards the full cost of breakfast!) They even begrudge you a free cup of coffee after 8am - you have to request a coffeemaker in your room - I did, twice by e-mail and suprise, suprise no coffeemaker when I got there!. I seriously think they must have made a deal with the owner of the coffeeshop across the road as there were long lines of Conrad guests every morning that I was there!. All in all this is not a particularly tourist or business friendly hotel and I don't know who exactly they are aiming at for their Clientele. If you must use Hilton, try the Homewood Suites on the next block

Reviews.Title: “Great Upscale Hotel in the heart of Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: soon2bjweave
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a romantic weekend and we had great service. The separate shower and bathtub was great for relaxing and the bed was simply heavenly. We really appreciated the updated touches in the hotel and being connected to the mall. It was a little confusing figuring out how to get in the hotel late at night, but once we figured it out it was smooth sailing! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay at a great, clean, modern hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Almost a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: ski fanatic
Reviews.Content: Very nice room although on the small side if you don't count the bathroom. Very large flat screen TV. The bathroom was as big as the rest of the room and had nice shower stall and stand alone tub. Great location right off Michigan Ave. and connected to Nordstrom store. Bed was very comfortable and the room was very quiet. The not perfect part: I couldn't access the internet on the first night either through the LAN or wireless, 2nd night it was ok. When I plugged in the iron it blew a fuse and all but one light went out. It took about 15 minutes for someone to answer the phone but they sent someone right up. Re-plugged in the iron and the fuse blew again. Luckily I had the guy stick around and he reset the fuse again. After that all worked well. I would stay here again but probably not my first choice in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Visit to the Conrad Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ottawa0191
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I recently stayed at the Conrad Chicago for 4 nights. We were in Chicago for a short vacation, and wanted to ensure that our accomodations would be top notch and were willing to pay for that. The hotel location is very good, but so is the Marriot next door, Hyatt down the street, and Intercontinental across the street. However, on arrival the entire lobby / street entrance was undergoing construction, and you have to walk through a less than appealing maze to get to the actual reception, of course there was no mention of this prior to arrival. A very bright note of the stay was the concierge service throughout. Nothing less than excellent. The room itself was unfinished, with receptacle wall plates missing where contractors must have assumed that the curtain was going to hide them. The rooms have large Flat Screen TVs and Bose sound systems as advertised, but to go to all of the trouble, to put the flat screen, etc., in the room, then leave all of the cables, plug in, wires for same in plain view, makes appearance cheap and look "thrown together." Housekeeping could use improvements - the bathroom was not vacuumed or swept during stay, when the bed is turned down perhaps there is a better place for the bedspread and pillow besides next to the bed on the floor. Maybe closet shelf? No fresh soap in the bathroom - used same small little bar throughout, and bare essentials - shampoo, conditioner, nothing more - definitely not indicative of a high end hotel chain. At night there was one bottle of water placed by the bed when two of us were staying there - cheap? Check out - receptionist was alone, with a long line up and wait, I asked him if he was understaffed due to the length of wait and check out line up, and no apology, just a flippant response that no he was not understaffed, one person was showing someone a room, and someone was at lunch. I would think staff lunches would be scheduled a little later than noon considering that is checkout time. Definitely did not feel welcome at check out, was not asked how stay was or safe journey or anything. I have been doing extensive travel all over the Middle East, Mediterranean the last year, and wanted a very special experience for my spouse and I now that we are reunited, and this was anything but. I have stayed in many 4 and 5 star hotels, and Conrad Chicago is mediocre at best, and considering the room rate poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel & good location”
Reviews.Author: profpat
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here because we were attending a wedding in the city. So, we made a little "weekend" of it by staying overnight downtown simple to avoid driving back to the burbs on a holiday weekend. The bed was comfy, bathroom clean and pretty with marble counters, crystal holders with cotton balls etc. It was also very quiet. The next morning, we walked a few blocks to Dunkin Donuts and noticed plenty of breakfast places (Cosi etc) nearby. It was a great location and pleasant stay. We were in room 815 and had a nice view of the hancock building. The windows open up, if you wanted fresh air or something. There is some minor construction going on the street level lobby, resulting in walking around some barricades to get to the elevator. It's no inconvenience, nor is there any noise involved. But, the desk on that level is empty (nice photo op for us!) so you check in at the main lobby one floor up. Checkout was a breeze. They slip the bill under your door at night and you just dial zero the next morning, leaving your key cards in the room. Simple!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Conrad”
Reviews.Author: toronto55
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 days this year which was long enough to truly assess the hotel.We've stayed at the Burnham & the Drake but the Conrad wins hands-down.The one improvement we noted this year over our week-long stay in '07 was the restaurant; finally they deliver good food AND good service (prices still lofty,though). The one drawback was one of the front desk staff had very poor English skills to the point we had to speak with another desk staffer.We had a terrace suite which consists of the traditional bath,but a bedroom large enough to have a true seating area PLUS a large livingroom PLUS an outdoor terrace measuring about 14x16 feet PLUS a 2-piece powder room. This allowed us to entertain business associates comfortably.Wife appreciated having two sets of closets to stuff with shopping from Michigan Ave,State St & Armitage Ave! The Conrad is not inexpensive & is not all things to all travellers.For a business couple like us though, we'll happily re-book the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, fantastic staff and awesome rooms”
Reviews.Author: baloobear
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here the one night but what a fantastic hotel - rooms are large and with all the mod cons, staff were brilliant and looked after any need you had. Concierge was knowledgable and happy to help with anything you needed. Will definately head back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location”
Reviews.Author: Suburbanite05
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 1 night for our anniversary, a Friday night. Stay was May 9-10, 2008. Hotel was booked through Priceline with a winning bid of $119, with taxes/fees = $145.21. Rated 4 star hotel. Very Nice hotel. Located near beginning of Magnificent mile/Michigan Ave. Just a couple minutes from the river. The entrance on Rush street is the main entrance. There is also an entrance off Michigan Avenue but it is shared with North Bridge Mall. The elevator to the hotel is to the left of Nordstrom on the main level off the Michigan Ave entrance. The hotel is on the 5th floor of this building along with the main lobby. Levels 1-4 are for shopping. Checkin was uneventful with our priceline reservation. I was asked if we wanted to upgrade our room. I declined â€“ more on this later. Standard room with king size bed was clean, everything was in good repair, nice paintings/framed photos, neutral painted walls, no worn furniture, bed was comfortable, clean sheets, quiet at night. Tub and shower worked well. Nothing to complain about. Awesome large-screen tv on the wall. There are 2 remotes for the tv â€“ one to turn it on and the other to turn on the Bose surround sound system to hear it. Refridgerator has refreshements/snacks for sale. Really no room for anything you want to put in there. Warning label states if you remove anything you will be instantly charged. The room has wine glasses, which was a nice surprise, since I brought a bottle of wine with me, and I used the corkscrew in the room to open the bottle. Hotel has a nice looking bar and attached restaurant both of which we didnâ€™t use. Besides, there are many great places to eat nearby which would be cheaper than the hotel. Nice separate seating area next to the bar with a piano. We took a taxi to Gehaâ€™s CafÃ© for dinner which is a fondue restaurant. For Saturday morning, I walked to Tempo CafÃ© ( 6 East Chestnut / Corner of Chestnut and State street ) which was about a 10-15 min walk. Itâ€™s a nice place for breakfast. Ordered takeout to bring back to hotel - spent $26 for waffles/strawberries; 3 eggs which came with hashbrowns, bacon and toast; 2 freshly squeezed orange juices. The hotel restaurantâ€™s breakfast menu is outrageously expensive. We shopped for about 1.5 hours Saturday morning on Michigan Ave. before we checked out at 11:30am. I should have asked about the upgrade at checkin since it was for our anniversary but I didnâ€™t and this troubled me. So I asked about it at checkout. The receptionist told me they do upgrade your room if you want but you have to pay for the difference in price. However, if it is â€œslowâ€� they might upgrade for a special occasion or if you want to try a different category of room for free â€“ but itâ€™s their discretion. Live and learn. The hotel did seem a little slow.? Iâ€™ll definitely ask next time. Great hotel. Great location. No complaints. I would stay here again but only if we won it through priceline for a weekend getaway for us parents married with children. Use the difference in money for shopping and eating/drinking. As for parking â€“ we drove in from the suburbs. I parked at the Millenium park garages, specifically the East Monroe Garage â€“ for $20 per 24 hours. Park near the Randolf street exits. I only noticed escalators going up. I had to take the stairs going down. I did not see and any down escalators. Walk to the hotel from here is about 15-20 mins in decent weather with light luggage which we did with 1 roll-along. I would say itâ€™s about a 1 mile walk. I have more than 10 photos which can be viewed at: http://www.flickr.com/photos/cum-grano-salis/sets/72157605004761580/

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: msu17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Conrad in early May, and we both agree that it was the nicest hotel we have ever stayed in. We booked a King deluxe room for $159 on Hotwire. Before the trip I called the front desk to make several requests: high floor, view of Michigan Ave, and a 12:30 p.m. check-in. All requests were met very conscientiously. The hotel is centrally located between Rush and Michigan at Grand Ave. It begins on the 5th floor of a very nice shopping center anchored by Nordstrom. The lobby is very simple and beautiful. The staff was friendly and efficient. The room was cleaned and also turned down every day, and the maids left jazz music on the radio for us when we returned at night. Our room was very clean and well decorated (see pictures). The bed was so comfortable...we did not want to climb out of it in the morning! The bedding was soft and the pillows were plush. The carpet was thick and soft, not worn out at all. The TV is huge, and is complimented by a Bose surround sound stereo. There is a nice mini bar but we didn't use it. The in-room chair and ottoman were comfy, and the desk chair was great. Free high-speed internet was a nice touch. The bathroom was spacious and clean, with a great shower, separate tub, marble sink, and Molton Brown amenities. Last but not least was a great view of Michigan Avenue and the Hancock Center. We cannot say enough about the Conrad. If we had spent full price ($365) for our room, I suppose we could have nitpicked a little, but we were blown away by the value, location, and overall quality of the hotel. We are already talking about coming back to the Conrad someday...hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “A great long weekend at the Conrad!”
Reviews.Author: DuckSausage
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Conrad Chicago for our 1 year anniversary. Lovely accomodations with an excellent location for all the city of Chicago has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Property”
Reviews.Author: OutofRange331
Reviews.Content: What a lovely property. The lobby is tastefully decorated with fragrant, fresh flowers and understated details. The staff is very kind, helpful and extremely accommodating. The concierge booked some tickets for us to see "Second City e.t.c." and then offered (unsolicited) dinner suggestions in the area surrounding the theater, which was awfully nice. When we checked out, they offered to print our boarding passes for our flight, which allowed us to avoid any extra running around. The rooms - they were HUGE with big, comfy beds and gigantic bathrooms that include a relaxing soaking tub and a stand-in shower. The flat panel TV and Bose speakers were a nice touch, but the TV is not HD (not a big deal, just an observation). There were some areas that could use a touch up (nicked walls & bubbling wallpaper, which I assume is due to every day wear-and-tear), but nothing that compromised the beauty of the property. This is a lovely, understated hotel that I would book again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toonarmyusa
Reviews.Content: A decent sized room with good amenities for the business traveller - in the centre of all the action in downtown Chicago, just off Michigan Avenue. It wasn't cheap $375.00 per night, but the hotel is very nicely appointed, with great staff at check in. The hotel didn't have a Spa, but the concierge booked me a massage therapist for my room after a day of meetings. I'd stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Leah81London
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had the luck of booking this fantastic hotel for a get away over New Years. The hotel was stunning, the room was hugh and full of lovely Molten Brown goodies that they happily replenish. The bed was comfy and huge. The room was turned down as though it was ready for a new arrival every day. The only couple of points I would raise is simply, the cost of the eating in the hotel or drinking in the hotel, it can be expensive. But then it is a FANTASTIC hotel done to a very high standard in the heart of Dwontown Chicago so this should not be to surprising. Its Location could not be better especially for first time visitors to the CIty. Its in the middle on the "Magnificent Mile" Chicago's Madison Avneue. In short book this hotel and enjoy. I have read the previous reveiws and seen their photo's reffernce dodgy furniture but PLEASE be asssured upon my visit there was simply no sign of anything other than a wounderful hotel that was welcoming and had a very luxurious feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: sailingaway1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Conrad Hotel for 4 nights at the end of March and really enjoyed our stay. We found the rooms to be a generous size with a large flat screen TV, spacious bathroom and modern dÃ©cor. The rooms also offered bathrobes, slippers, and turn down service each night. The hotel location was excellent, one block off Michigan Ave. and it is attached to the North Bridge Mall which has a Nordstrom and other fantastic shops. The fitness center was above average with free weights, nautilus equipments and 7 cardio machines (treadmill, stationary bike, etc.). The only disappointments about the hotel: there werenâ€™t any vending machines available to purchase a cold drink or snack, there werenâ€™t coffee pots in the room and the restaurant serving breakfast had incredibly poor service with extremely high prices. That being said, we will definitely consider staying at the Conrad again when we return to Chicago

Reviews.Title: “I really like this hotal”
Reviews.Author: erock1974
Reviews.Content: Great location, right on the Mile. Practically inside of Nordstrom. Nice lobby, great rooms, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Dear Conrad - Thanks for an Amazing St. Patty's Week!”
Reviews.Author: Engineer911
Reviews.Content: First off, I must say that this the first time I've been motivated to take the time to write a review on this site - but please note that I am a seasoned traveler and I spend at least 200 nights a year in hotels across the USA on business. On this trip to Chicago, I had the pleasure to be on vacation for a change and took my other half with me for a week to the Conrad to celebrate St. Patrick's Day (and 6 other days around it!). Before arrival, I spent a good amount of time reading reviews on TripAdvisor from others who have stayed at the Conrad to try and make sure this was the best place to spend my valuable points. Yes, I used my points, I paid for 6 nights at the Conrad using no money whatsoever. I am a Diamond member with Hilton Honors, and I try to stay exclusively within that family of brands. So I was a bit concerned because I didn't know if I would be treated as well as the average "cash" customer, let alone if I would receive the usual upgrades and benefits (i.e. Breakfast vouchers) that I receive when I travel on business. However, I was told by my travel agent that it'd be a good idea for me to call the hotel ahead of time and make it known that I wanted an upgrade, that it was for a vacation, that I'm a Diamond member, yadda yadda. I called one week ahead of time and got the name of the desk agent I spoke to, and he said he would note in the account that I called and would put me down for an upgrade. I also called 3 days ahead, did the same thing, and again the night before (when they pull room assignments). So let's get to what happened at check in... We arrived at the hotel after a long and unenjoyable train ride from O'Hare (that's an entirely different story), and at the moment we walked up to the entrance on the street level we were greeted promptly by a doorman who took all of our bags, without even asking, and directed us to the 5th floor where the lobby was located. At the front desk, we were again treated wonderfully, and I was immediately informed I'd been upgraded to a Jr. Suite. Now, in terms of upgrades, that's multiple room classes. A Jr. Suite has a separate living and bedroom, each with their own 42" plasma television. Upon getting my room keys and portfolio handed to me, I asked if it contained my breakfast coupons, and, much to my surprise, I was told "they will be delivered by hand to your room this evening." It should be noted at this point that even for a paying customer with Diamond or other status at Hilton, the standard is for *either* a room upgrade *or* breakfast coupons. I found this to be a great surprise. We arrived at our room on the 15th floor to find a beautiful, clean suite, with living room and bedroom. The living room portion had a plasma television and a small sitting area with a couch and table and couple of chairs. The room also had a window looking out to Michigan Avenue. There was also a small bar alcove with a mini-bar fridge in it as well as an electronic user-configurable safe. The bedroom area had another plasma television, and was a very large open space with a king sized bed and tons of windows which practically wrapped halfway around the room. There was a Bose stereo system under the television which had great sound and was used as the sound source for watching TV as well as getting radio stations. There was also a desk with internet connection. Wireless internet was free, although we did not use it. The bathroom was very large as well. There was a large shower and separate deep soaking tub. Amenities were great, including two robes, plenty of large towels, Molton Brown shampoos/soaps/etc, and even an umbrella in the closet. (I'll get to the umbrella's significance later). Each evening when we returned from being out and about, we found the bed to be made up, turned down, and the stereo was turned on and playing smooth Jazz music. This was a great touch. Turndown service also provided us with bottles of water by the bed each night. On the first night we arrived, we noticed that there was no refrigerator or microwave which we could use for leftovers (so many amazing restaurants!). We called the front desk, requested these two items, and by the time we returned from dinner, they were both installed in the room. On the subject of services to our room, I have to say that room service worked almost like ninjas - each night we went to sleep, we never put the "do not disturb up" yet never experienced the dreaded early morning wake up call in person of someone opening the door and yelling "room service." No one ever even knocked on the door. Yet whether we left the room at 8am or at 5pm for a while, the room was always made up when we would return. Let's get to the meals situation. Clearly we wanted to make use of the breakfast coupons we received. Their breakfast vouchers are for a Continental Breakfast, including taxes, not including gratuity naturally. Their value is $14.00. Yes, that's the price of the Continental Breakfast that includes a couple small pastries and some juice and coffee. Now, you can upgrade your breakfast to an American Breakfast for another $5.00, or to a Chicago Breakfast (comes with pancakes and a NY Strip steak) for another $12.00. Clearly one can see why having the extra $14.00 makes breakfast not quite so rediculously priced. Were it not for the coupons, I highly doubt we would have been eating at the lobby restaurant. But as for food quality, it was great. The kitchen was good at making certain items in certain ways to our liking, the coffee was very good, and juice was fresh. Portion sizes on the meals were good. Service on the other hand, as other reviewers have indicated, left something to be desired at times. Out of the week we were there and the handful of times we ate breakfast there, sometimes the service was very good and other times not so much. In short, unless you are either able to fully expense your breakfast or have a breakfast coupon, there are much more affordable options located right there at the mall in the food court or at any number of nearby places to eat. We'd like to make special mention about the bartender at the lobby bar, he was exceptional. The day we checked in, we were so happy to have finally arrived that we threw care to the wind knowing how expensive the drinks would be and ordered a few from the lobby bar. We did not return to the lobby bar again until the last night, 5 nights later, and the bartender remembered both of our drinks to the letter. Something else I really appreciated in the Conrad was their Concierge service. At check-in, we asked him to give us all the information we needed on where to go and what to see for the St. Patrick's Day festivities. He was very helpful, printed out maps and even lists of bars and restaurants. On the last night we were there, I had wanted to do something special for my girlfriend and I called the Concierge while I was out and about and told him that I wanted him to take the bottle of champagne I'd purchased and stashed in a cabinet and have it put in a bucket of ice and have two glasses ready for me by a certain time when we would be arriving back to the room that night. Just as requested, this was done, no charge, no hassle. He also coordinated a surprise carriage ride around town (Noble Horse Carriage Co). I guess it's relevant to state the down-sides of the hotel. Sure, the Conrad is not perfect. Here is the list of problems we saw. 1) They are (as others have stated) stingy with giving out more shampoo, conditioner, body wash, soap etc. during your stay. It isn't replaced everyday as I would have liked to see. However, it was never empty either, or I would imagine it would have been replaced, and I am 100% sure that had I at any point called the front desk to ask for more of anything they would have delivered it instantly. 2) Breakfast prices are too high, and the level of service for breakfast is inconsistent. 3) The price of drinks in the lobby bar is also too high (+/- $15 each), but I can admit the service was very good. There are lots more I could say about the Conrad but this review is already too long I'm sure. I'll end it by saying why the umbrella was significant and how it sealed the deal for me knowing it was truly a great hotel. During our stay, the weather changed from 50 degrees and sunny to 30 while raining and snowing. On the last day, we ventured out and decided to take with us the hotel-supplied Conrad branded umbrella. From my experience, anything hotel-supplied that isn't shampoo is usually going to end up on your bill later unless you leave it in the room. We went out for dinner and walked around for a bit, and somehow between the two of us, we misplaced the umbrella somewhere. Unable to find it, I immediately panicked thinking that I was going to surely end up being charged an unreasonable fee for this stupid umbrella a couple of weeks after check-out. I called the front desk from my cell phone and I said that I was the guest staying in suite 1519 and that I wasn't sure how I did it, but I'd managed to lose the umbrella that we'd taken out of the room. The response from the desk clerk was "it's raining outside, if you tell me where you are, I can have another brought to you." I about fell out of my chair laughing. I explained that I'd lost it, didn't need another one, and she said she would note the account not to charge me for the umbrella. I just checked my card online and the charges I put on my card were just run through today - without the umbrella. The Conrad did an amazing job of giving us a wonderful week away from home in a fabulous city. There is no better location in my book, we were right at Michigan Avenue and just a few blocks north of the River. Any minor issues were far outweighed by the overall experience and service that we received. And for anyone who is debating between the Conrad and the Drake, do what we did - stay at the Conrad and visit the Drake for a meal and/or drinks to get the nostalgia for a couple hours without having to stay in an ancient tiny room. I almost feel like we cheated somehow considering that our airfare was all free (miles) and we only had a $170 bill for meals and drinks charged to the room over a week. There is no doubt in our minds that we would return to this hotel again. And again!

Reviews.Title: “One Hot Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tablerockin
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Sofitel but thought we would try the Conrad for a change. I don't think I would rate this hotel over the Sofitel but it was still 1st class. But I do think the service was better at the Conrad. We arrived at the hotel just before the restaurant closed and soon we were the only table left. Normally service goes down hill then but our waiter Eric was the best. Even when I kept ordering my after dinner ports. The meal may not have been The Chop House but it was still very good. The bar was ok, no Crown Reserve. They did have the Cask 16 at $24 a drink, ouch. The room service was very quick. Our room was very clean and the maids replace everything including the ashtrays during their visits. The only fault we could find was the temperature on the 14th floor. It was so hot that we had our window open the whole time with the heat turned completely off. Which wasn't so bad since my wife smokes. The temp on the 5th where the lobby, bar, and restaurant was fine. We enjoyed the hotel enough that we will be back in Sept. One last thing, if you like a cheap fantastic breakfast. Go to the West Egg, only a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “I thought Conrad was upmarket from Hilton...?”
Reviews.Author: cazzo72
Reviews.Content: This place feels like a Holiday Inn that's been dressed up a little. It's not as nice as your average Hilton, let alone the posh Conrad brand. If you are expecting something like the Conrad Tokyo, this place will sorely disappoint you and you're better off booking the Sofitel or the Peninsula. If you're looking for a hotel with basic business services and in a good location this will do the trick.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel this is not”
Reviews.Author: Travel038
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week and I was looking forward to a stay at a top class hotel. I was shocked and disapointed with my stay, Here are some of my gripes - Room had a broken phone and broken lightbulb - Breakfast service was slow and impolite - Hotel rationed shampoo (one bottle for two people sharing and did not refill a bottle that was less than half full). - We also shared a bar of soap. I was so disappointed with this hotel, I paid for a premium hotel and got a very disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Must of been adopted”
Reviews.Author: TravelBoulder
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised this hotel is part of the Conrad chain. I stayed at the Conrad Tokyo, which was outstanding, and Conrad Hong Kong, dated, but a classic. The Conrad Chicago definitely has some pros; PROS Nice location, with easy access to Michigan Ave. A beautiful lobby. Refurbished rooms have 42'' screen TV's Bath tub, although mine was visibly dirty Bed, pillows, linens are great CONS Room I had 1205 was small. I was told it was an upgrade since I'm a Diamond Member. When I asked about breakfast, I was told I could have either a room upgrade or a credit of $14 for breakfast. I took the room upgrade. They did send a $14 certificate up to my room, which was a very nice gesture. Heating/Cooling system is antiquated/terrible. Final words; If you are used to Four Seasons or Park Hyatt then you may be disappointed. Otherwise, it is a nice option, but not of same caliber as overseas Conrads I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gingergirl69
Reviews.Content: The Conrad was wonderful. So convenient to everything. I can't see what others were complaining about being on the 5th floor. One quick elevator off of Rush. The lobby is beautiful. The room itself was comfortable and not overly large but for two people ( I was in town on business and brought my sister to shop) was great. Know this though-if you want the tub and seperate shower(which was really nice to have to warm your bones) you have to book a King bed not two doubles. I had no view but I could care less as when I wasn't on business I was shopping. I'm sure a room with a view would have made it all the better but then again same if it was July- February is very cold but comprable to Toronto so who cares. What else... the fact it is attached to Nordstroms and the Mall was excellent. You could walk to the Water Tower Place and all the great shopping on the Mag Mile. The shopping was amazing!! Hotel staff were very friendly and helpfull. Loved the slippers to take home and the Motlen Brown products and they had no problem bringing up extras. I agree with other travellers that the Room service is really expensive. Breakfast 'American' 2 eggs bacon toast and coffee and a fruit smoothee( amazing for breakfast) with tip and hotel charges $49.00- this is for one person!! I feel bad expensing to my company. Tip-if you are travelling and paying for yourself Mary's Cafe is good food Eggs Pancakes and Coffee under 10.00. or the Nordstrom Cafe is really lovely and they are very attentive free coffee refills. Best of all no going outside into the cold and snow. All & all I woud reccomend this hotel for sure. If i could get a great rate I would stay here again for sure. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: emberito
Reviews.Content: I must say I was disappointed with my stay in the Conrad Chicago. I chose the Conrad because (1) the brand has such a good reputation and I've been impressed with their Miami location; and (2) the stellar reviews on this website. Let me start by sharing the good. The lobby is beautifully appointed with fresh flowers, a dramatic bar area, a stunning front desk, and attractive furniture. The location is outstanding. You are close to the subway, theaters, restaurants, attractions, spas, etc. The rooms have great linens, a pillow menu which is fun to try, a large flat screen tv, nice sound system, and a large bathroom. The fitness center on the 11th floor is well equipped for cardio or strength training. All this sounds good, right?...why would I be disappointed? you may ask. Well, first off, do not expect them to accommodate your requests for room type. Usually when I stay at Hilton's I get upgraded because I am a diamond preferred member of Hilton...not this time. They did not upgrade my room or even honor my request for a high floored room. In fact, the lady gave me a room in the section of the hotel that had not been updated, it was small, and had a view of a building in front of me. It was on the second floor of the building. I did get a breakfast coupon but beware that does not give you a free breakfast but a $14 credit which barely gets you coffee and orange juice at their prices. A modest breakfast for two was $48.00!!! I could have gotten the same or better from a breakfast joint in the mall below for 1/4 that price. The food was good but not great. I was shocked when the bill arrived. The service was poor...they were understaffed and did not regularly attend to customers for refills or clearing plates. My floor was not looking good. The carpeting was worn out, stained badly in one location, and the room was showing its age. While this would be acceptable in a Hampton or Double tree, for the prices you pay at the Conrad, it really is unacceptable. I blame the management here. The Conrad Miami does have its act together--Chicago could learn a lesson or two. I think this hotel is over hyped..not bad but not great--we might have been better off somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: JKBOPB
Reviews.Content: Found this great hotel, while searching for a quick getaway. Needed to stay in Chicago on Valentine's Day due to back to back play and concert. Easy to make reservations, very quick and friendly, I suggest you call the hotel directly. Great, modern room. Very, very clean. One of the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in. Came back from our play that night to find lights turned down low, BOSE music system on, turn down service. Room had huge HD-TV and IPod station. Marble bathroom is great...has a great deep soaking tub, separate shower....both with unending hot water! Previous comments mentioned rough towels, we agree, but their complimentary robes make that up! Had dinner at their restaurant aptly named "The Restaurant at Conrad". Our best friends were already there dining and our waiter, Reggie, was fantastic! He pulled up another table and made us feel very welcome and was extremely friendly. Great food, good martinis. Make sure to ask for Reggie! Front desk staff very polite and professional. Park your car directly across from hotel entrance, hotel will validate your ticket for a big discount. Highly recommend if you are planning a trip to Chicago, steps to Mag Mile, great restaurants and shopping. We had a wonderful evening, definitely will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “loved the conrad!”
Reviews.Author: lazcano2001
Reviews.Content: Ok, so first trip to chicago and I was a litlle worried about the hotel and the location, finally I decided on the CONRAD and wath a good experience i had, I booked a king deluxe room on the 6th floor, view was not amazing but that was the only coplaint i could had, room is nice, bath was all appliances and good size, good plasma tv, free internet, we asked one day for breaksfast and amazing food! so overall and for the price aroufn 220 It was a great surprise, the locating was very good a few blocks from everything and very quiet hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - amazing bed!”
Reviews.Author: jnwln
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel we were upgraded upon check in to a huge corner room. The hotel is spotlessly clean with large marble bathrooms and by far the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The Bose sound system and huge plasma tv in the rooms are great too. My only complaint is that the hotels dining room and bar are a bit grim, they have no windows and are very dark and small. The service in the dining room at breakfast time is arrogant also, we were on a bed and breakfast rate but found out at check in that this actually meant that we had a $45 credit between 2 of us for the dining room. Only prob with this is that the menu is really expensive and if you want a healthy option like fruit or granola you'll end up over your budget very quickly. I think if I was to return I would just have breakfast in food court of the shopping mall connected to the hotel. Apart from that compalint I would have to say that overall the hotel was great, great location and great standard of accomodation and loads of restaurants, shops and bars within walking distance. Michigan Avenue is on the doorstep so its perfect base for exploring from.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnFt_Lauderdale_FL
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Conrad, before and after the Meridian. I travel extensively on business throughout the country and always look forward to the Conrad in Chicago at least twice a year. Wonderful staff, the best doormen, great rooms and service.
