Especially in the winter, when you can shop without going out to Michigan Avenue! I am a single woman and have always been treated beautifully by the staff! Highly recommend and I am picky!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations, dining, environment”
Reviews.Author: sailor602
Reviews.Content: Room ammenities were complete and absolutely luxurious. The Bose sound system that completes the large flatscreen TV is wonderful to wake up to, and the staff leaves the radio playing jazz for when you return at the end of the day. Restaurants have plenty of choices and the bars are complete and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: haygoods
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Conrad was fantastic! The staff was very friendly from the moment we walked in, and got us checked in early so we could drop our bags and get out to see the city. The rooms were nicely appointed, with a big comfy bed and a 42" flat screen (but strangely, no hi-def signal to feed it?). The concierge was helpful in finding us a Saturday dinner reservation during one of the busiest weekends of the year. And for wandering around downtown (both River North and the Loop), there aren't many better locations to choose from. Highly recommended!! If/when we come back to Chicago, we're definitely staying at the Conrad again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Vogel1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad Chicago for 3 days in August (on our way to Alaska) and tremendously enjoyed our stay. Chicago is a wonderful city and the hotel was great too. The room was nice and the beds wonderful. Staff friendly. Breakfast was not included but there are plenty of delis and bakeries close by so this is not an issue. The conrad has a nice roofterrace which serves great cocktails. The location is very good as from here you can walk to most of the key sights. Fortunately my husband was able to get a room using a corporate rate from his company so the fact that we felt like we had a bit of a deal helped in our enjoyment. Don't forget to make a boat trip with the Chicago Architecture Foundation or do one of their other tours. It was one of the highlights of our 3 day stay in Chicago. We also rented bikes in Milennium park and viewed the city by bike which was great too. Lunch at the terrace of Wolensky and Dinner at Bin36 were great too. Have a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Really clean”
Reviews.Author: Adelaide017
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying at The Conrad in Chicago and loved the location. The hotel itself is so clean and tidy and the rooms have all the ammenites but my oh my the staff are so unfriendly. We sat at the bar on several occasions and the bar staff never once tried to strick up conversation and looked so miserable. The concierge was in in a league of his own though, very helpful and friendly.. make him you new best bud if you intend staying at this hotel. Overall a nice place to come home to at the end of a busy day. Sally Woodhams Surrey England

Reviews.Title: “Conrad is Top Notch - We Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: wvchick
Reviews.Content: Wow! The Conrad is first class all the way. The room was spacious. It had a wonderful flat screen plasma TV and a Bose sound system. The beds were so comfortable! The staff was accomidating. The even had turndown service every night and left slippers by the bed side. The BEST thing about our room was the walk in shower. It was the most WONDERFUL shower I've ever experienced. My first shower must have been at least 30 minutes. I was the cleanest tourist in Chicago that weekend because I'd take a shower whenver I could. The soaps, shampoos and lotions were terrific too! It's a bit weird to get to. The hotel is on the 6th floor of a shopping center off Michigan Ave. That made for some great spur of the moment shopping trips! The patio is a wonderful place for drinks. Breakfast in the restaurant is quite good too. Oh...there's free Internet access from the room too...almost unheard of nowdays. We'd stay here again for the right price. It was really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay but not wowed”
Reviews.Author: bluedevil
Reviews.Content: I just spend this past weekend (Oct. 5 - 7) at the Conrad in Chicago with my girlfriend. I think it's a very nice hotel in a great location. The deluxe room we got had the 42" Plasma and was very nice. I do agree that the furniture seemed a little simple, if not a little cheap for the type of hotel it was. It wasn't bad, just looked a littel Ikea'ish to me. The bathroom was great. It was huge, nice amenities, etc. However, I agree with the reviewer below that the bathroom towels were thin and cheap feeling. Not a huge deal, but it just seemed weird that a hotel of this caliber would have those towels. Kind of like the furniture comment. I am one of those that isn't a huge fan of having to take one elevator to the lobby, and then another to my room, but not a big deal. I didn't try the restaurants but did have breakfast from room service on Sunday morning. That rocked. Very good. If it is indicative of the rest of the food, then the food is very good. The outdoor bar/terrace area looked great. I wanted to spend time there but our schedule wouldn't allow us. Overall, I think the Conrad was a very nice hotel and I was happy with our stay there. The room was very nice, but there were little things that didn't blow me away as I might have expected from a hotel of this caliber. However, with that being said, I would stay there in a second on a future trip to Chicago. I did like it a lot (despite what you might think from the above).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jzstldc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Conrad this past weekend for a 2 night getaway and we could not have picked a more perfect hotel. I am a gold Hilton HHonors member and used points for our trip. We arrived very early Friday morning (8 AM) and we assumed they could hold our luggage until check-in time came but immediately they said they had a room ready for us. So it couldn't have started any better. Then we went up to the room and found an amazing room. It had a 42 inch plasma TV with a Bose sound system, very nice/soft king bed, great bathroom with a large soaking tub, large shower and a separate toilet room. We knew we made a good choice already at this point. The location couldn't get any better as it is basically right on Michigan Avenue. The lobby is on the 5th floor and in order to get to ground level there are 2 elevators which can be taken. One goes to the Rush Street entrance where the bellmen can hail a cab or point one in the right direction. The other goes directly into the attached mall which goes right out on the Magnificent Mile. There couldn't be a better, or more convenient, location in my opinion in the whole city of Chicago. We didn't dine in the restaurant but we heard good things from other customers. We had drinks at both the Rondez-vous bar and the terrace and the service was excellent both places. Since this is luxury hotel plus it is in the middle of the heart of Chicago, yes the prices are fairly expensive but that was expected. They also provided nuts and other munchies at no additional cost while we had out drinks. The maid service was excellent and we received turn-down service each night and they brought additional bottles of water which was a nice touch. The gift shop was fairly small but was nice. They probably figure that because it is in the heart of one of the world's best shopping districts they didn't need a huge gift shop! The front desk printed out our airline tickets and held our luggage when we needed so we could continue to tour the city before needing to leave for the airport. Overall we had no complaints about the Conrad. It was definitely one of the nicest hotels we have stayed at and we will definitely stay here on our next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not much wrong, not much right”
Reviews.Author: shortmo
Reviews.Content: There's nothing really wrong with the Conrad; it simply isn't very special. The rooms are large, with luxurious appointments like fabulously comfortable beds with 500-count linens, plasma TVs, etc. But the decor was dull, and the carpet looked very tired. Our bathroom had a spacious shower, but no tub, and the water pressure was disappointing. The Molton and Brown shampoos and soaps were lovely, but the towels, while oversized, were rather thin and stiff. The biggest disappointment of all was the public areas. Off the street is a tiny lower lobby. You have to go up five floors to get to the real lobby, but it just isn't very impressive. It just doesn't feel like a 5-star hotel. If you can get a good enough rate, the location is terrific, but don't go here looking for the kind of place that sets the tone for pampering when you walk in the door...which is what one expects to find in a 5-star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: bdw1989
Reviews.Content: I was using a certificate from Hilton Corporate due to a stay that was terrible to say the least at another property. As soon as I walked I was greeted with a wonderful smile by the whole staff. I was upgraded to the Executive Suite due to being Diamond. I didn't think they were going to do this considering the stay was free. Talk about a GREAT room! Situated on the 17th floor in the corner I could see all the way down Michigan Avenue and in all directions. The room service was also great. I will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed with Hilton's "Luxury" Brand”
Reviews.Author: Courtesy_Flush
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for the Conrad. I used a large chunk of my HHonors points to stay here during a conference so that my husband and I could enjoy a luxury hotel. We were not impressed! The service was, by far, the most disappointing aspect. The room was small had nice decorations, a huge flat screen TV, and nice BOSE sound system. The bed is terrible; my husband complained of back pain after the first night. The tub is the bathroom is tiny; we never used it. The Molton Brown tolietries were nothing special. I was beyond irritated when I had to call housekeeping to bring us a new set of tolietries because no one bothered to replace them after two days. Then, it took over a half hour and a second phone call for the tolietries to arrive. This process was repeated a second time, a few days later. This is unacceptable in a luxury hotel. At a regular Hilton, the tolietries are replaced everyday, used or not. The Terrace Bar was great the first night. We loved the view of all the skyscrapers nearby. On our last night, we received awful service. We were ignored for 20 minutes after my husband finished his drink. We finally got fed up and told the hostess our room number and left. Again, just unacceptable given the "atmosphere" of the hotel. I ran into another problem at the business center while I was trying to print up tickets for a show. The mouse on the computer didn't work, rendering the computer useless. We called for help, but no one came since the business center is farmed out to another company. No one at the front desk seemed to care that we might have missed our show. Luckily, a manager let us use her computer to print the tickets, but we still have to resovle the issue of getting the initial $16 internet charge refunded. What a pain! I would not stay here again the next time I come to Chicago. I would rather be at the regular Hilton on the executive floor where we can get complimentary breakfast and turndown service that actually includes chocolate- what a concept!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Clean, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoDon30
Reviews.Content: I travel often for business and stay at 4-5 star hotels as well as the usual Marriott Courtyard or Hilton Hotels. This Hotel was great. I reserved the King Executive which had windows facing Michigan Avenue as well as on the adjacent wall. We could not believe how quiet the room was-- no noise from Michigan Avenue or other guests, etc. Amazingly and wonderfully quiet hotel room. The room was well appointed, huge, and immaculate. (Any hotel that puts stark white comforters on the beds has confidence in its cleanliness and I always take that as a good sign.) The big surprise at this hotel was the dining. I almost never dine at the restaurants in a hotel at which I am staying. (usually too many great other options in a city) We had a case of the munchies upon checking in so we ordered appetizers via room service. Service was quick, sharp, and the food was very good. The next day, we had lunch at the 5th floor rooftop garden restaurant (outdoors) which has a fabulous view and again, was amazingly quiet given the location of this hotel. The food was FANTASTIC. We only ordered Maine lobster roll sandwiches so we were't expecting an amazing culinary experience....SURPRISE! The presentation was lovely and the lobster roll came on a platter with several "samplers"--- soup, cabbage slaw, homemade chips, and a sinful chocolate mouse cake. I've had lobster rolls in dozens of places up and down the eastern seaboard and I'll tell you that this was the best, most flavorful, and freshest I've had. The whole dining experience greatly exceeded my expectations. I would say that this hotel is a gem in the city and recommend it without reservation of any kind. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kenn_P
Reviews.Content: The Conrad was a refreshing change from the ordinary business class hotel. It was upscale without being stiflingly opulent, and the staff were professional without being curt; helpful without being overly friendly. The furniture and furnishings were modern, warm and inviting. The huge flat screen television that met me when I entered the room certainly was a nice touch. Even nicer touches included consistent turn down services from almost invisible and unobstrusive staff members, with niceties left. The Conrad doesnt come cheap, but that is to be expected with the class of service provided. Other colleagues of mine stayed at lesser offerings and complained about huge convention crowds, impersonal service and banal, usual business class rooms. I had the opportunity to sample what I have come to expect from Hilton hotels, and one of this category: true hospitality and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever........”
Reviews.Author: africanqueen2
Reviews.Content: My Hubby and I stayed at the Conrad Chicago, last weekend for a weekend getaway from the kids. This was one of the best hotels ever.... The room was fabulous. The beds, and pillows were awesome. The 42 inch flat screen tv, the marble bathroom, and a host of other amenities can't be touched. It was not cheat but well worth every penny. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: I_Love_Traveling_26
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! I never write reviews, but felt compelled to do so after my stay here. I stayed at this hotel for a company retreat that lasted four days. During our stay here, I was blown away by the service. The front desk was so pleasant and helpful, Swank (who supplied the equipment for our meeting), were also amazingly quick and helpful. Our rooms were beautiful, the Terrace provided a lovely view of this gorgeous city, and the location was perfection. The meeting space was very nice with a nice view as well, and the food offered on the catering menu received rave reviews! I could not have been more pleased with our stay. I look forward to coming back, and I highly recommend a stay here while visiting Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SandDragon
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms for two nights at the Conrad during our road trip visit to the US. The street entrance is a few floors below the reception lobby which can also be accessed through the shopping mall it is attached to or perched upon. I am not a huge fan of this layout but after a few trips to the mall for various things found its only drawback was while checking in and out with luggage transfers. Check-in was a breeze which was great because first impressions of hotels are so important. Our rooms were lovely and the extra bed requested was already in place - something of a first and much appreciated. The staff were very helpful with various tourisrty requests and the location of the hotel for accessing various tourist attractions was excellent. Having the shopping mall attached opened up a range of cheaper breakfast options (as breakfast was not included in our rate). We did have one dinner to celebrate my sons birthday at the hotel and it was very nice. (Actually, the reason we ate at the hotel was that we couldn't get into the Twin Anchors for ribs due to an excessive wait-time.) The rooms were very comfortable and above average in size. Nice big plasma TVs and a very modern bathroom. Vaket parking was more expensive than most other hotels we stayed at in the US - but it does appear that Chicago has a few parking issues. All in all the hotel was very comfortable, much as you would expect of a Conrad and we were very happy with the location from a tourist's perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan58
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in this hotel and were very pleased with the experience. As described in previous reviews. the room was very comfortable with the huge televison and bathroom being particularly outstanding. Service was excellent overall (I especially liked the bottle of water at my bedside with the turn down service). The door and bellmen/women were particularly pleasant and helpful and the concierge was friendly and knowledgeable. We had completely satisfactory (though overpriced) drinks in the bar but didn't eat at the restaurant. The health club was fine and the equipment was well maintained. While there were only three treadmills and two elipitical steppers, I never had to wait for a machine although it might be a different story in the dead of a Chicago winter! One minor quibble--I like to have coffee first thing in the morning and there was no in-room coffee maker. The restaurant offered free coffee "to-go" but only before eight AM. This is a very, very comfortable, attractive hotel in a wonderful location. Chicago is an expensive city but we felt that we got a reasonable value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: charles7
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal (135 USD a night through Travelocity) at the Conrad Chicago. The hotel is really great: room was very nice, modern, beds are comfortable, bathroom was huge, and the location is one of the best you can find in Chicago. Absolutely recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of its lofty ranking”
Reviews.Author: JJNOLA
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is among the best hotels in Chicago and with some minor tweaking could be the very best value in town, if not the top-ranked property. We did encounter some minor problems with staff, as noted by other reviewers. Upon checking in, we were sent to an occupied room. The front desk clerk simply wrote the wrong room on our key envelope (1211 vs 1112, I think) and it was a simple mistake. The guest already in the occupied room was good humored about it, luckily! I also found the concierge to be quite aloof and would agree with other postings about the Terrace restaurant. The one time we went out to have a drink, I felt like we were intruding. Finally, there are noise issues between rooms. Twice we had to call security in the middle of the night because folks from the wedding party next door were still in a mood to celebrate! :-( HOWEVER, a couple of little issues can't take away from the fact that the hotel is gorgeous. Beautiful marble lobby, quick connections to the mall and street (albeit with a bad two-elevator system), perfect Chicago location and stunning guest rooms. Our bathroom was huge and very clean, the bed was comfortable and we really liked the plasma TV with Bose sound system (which may be one reason the TV next door was so loud at times). Overall, would stay at the Conrad again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel with a number of glitches”
Reviews.Author: ibeplato
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently as part of a large group in town for a business meeting. Here is my review. This is a luxury hotel, and they treat guests like they are staying at a luxury hotel. Let me start by describing the room, it had a large plasma television with a Bose surround-sound home theater system, an iHome iPod-capable clock radio, a large glass shower stall, and a large tub with whirlpool jets. Other amenities included a bathroom scale, high-end soaps/shampoos, and complementary Internet and bottled water. Turn-down service is provided at night, when I got back to my room each evening i was greeted by soft music on the Bose system, slippers, and they even put the shower mat out for the next morning (or nighttime shower). Rooms have wired and wireless Internet, comfy chairs, super plush beds with down comforters and pillow top mattresses, and super plush towels and bathroom rugs. Wake-up calls are taken and made by real human beings. Even the housekeeping staff refers to you by name. The location is also fantastic, it is connected to a shopping mall featuring a Nordstroms. The heart of Chicago's entertainment/dining district is a short walk, including the Navy Pier which is about 10 minutes away by foot. There is a restaurant in the hotel which we didn't visit, as well as outdoor and indoor bars, both of which featured a nice selection of drinks, but very slow service. But this hotel wasn't perfect. The Internet service was troublesome, twice I called the front desk, each time they transfered my call to GuestTek which provides the hotel's Internet service. Each time it took 10-15 minutes with a tech support person to get the service enabled. Apparently it wouldn't recognize the room that I was in. When I checked out I noticed that the hotel had charged me $20 for these calls, which they promptly removed from my bill. Others in our group had the same issues. I also had a problem with my room key, it usually took 5-10 tries before it worked. I tried a new room key but had the same result. The front desk personnel told me they'd have maintenance look at the lock, but I had the same trouble throughout my stay. The cold-water in the bathroom ran at a quarter of the volume of the hot, so if you weren't careful you could easily burn yourself (something I learned the hard way the first night). So overall I'd give this hotel very high marks for luxury and customer service, but they need to address the bugs to make it perfect.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL FOR EVERYONE”
Reviews.Author: ABIGAIL6
Reviews.Content: My stayed at this hotel in Chicago, 2 adults and 2 teenage boys and loved this hotel. Pretty much everything about this hotel was perfect. Every amenity you could ask for was there; 42" flatscreen TV with Bose sound, robes, slippers, turn-down service with bottled water, and who doesn't love a telephone in your bathroom. The staff was accommodating. They installed an XBOX 360 in our room with three games at no charge. My boys were very excited about that. They have a special room service menu for young people. We ordered Chicken fingers with fries which came quickly on a silver platter and with all the condiments and only cost $8.00 plus service charge. My fifteen year old son loved it. I checked out the exercise room which looked like a full gym with cardio machines, life cycle machines and other weight machines which looked great. I didn 't use the machines since I was too tired from walking in the city. The location is great too.... near all the great shopping such as Nordstrom's. My husband and I have stayed at the Waldorf Astoria, but feel that this hotel was better than that. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Five Star, Terrace Restaurant Manager terrible”
Reviews.Author: mktozd
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and nice infrastructure. The river north area is full of great restaurants and the north bridge area is great for out of towners. The decor is lovely and a nice hold-over from when this was a Le Meridian. While the Conrad aspires to be in the top tier along with the Peninsula, the Four Seasons, the Ritz and Park Hyatt, it falls short. We and dinner at the Terrace Restarant outside the other day and were initially impressed with the setting and the selection. While the prices were similar to the Peninsula, we figured that it was a nice day and worth a try. Wow, were we ever disappointed. First off, we were told that we could have a seat but only stay until 7. OK, thats fine and we sat down. The waitress made a point to ask if anything was wrong, so that she could make it right. When we indicated that our glasses of champagne were not very full ($20 per glass), she consulted with the manager and then another manager (a heavier fellow in a dark suit). She came back and said that was the standard puor and that she would be glad to bring us additional glasses. What bothers me is not the outcome, but the fact that the management is not service focused. At a Four Seasons or the Peninsula, this would never happen and if we expressed any displeasure, it would be made right. At the Conrad, the Terrace manager just ignored it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Miracle Mile experience!”
Reviews.Author: MrFrump
Reviews.Content: Pretty much everything about this hotel was perfect. Pricey, but you really do get what you pay for. Every amenity you could ask for was there; 42" flatscreen TV with Bose sound, robes, slippers, turn-down service with bottled water, plenty of space, incredibly comfortable bed, nicely stocked lounge downstairs, and the list could go on and on . The thing that stuck out the most was the immaculate condition of our room and the attention to detail the cleaning staff had. Beyond that, every staff member we spoke to was extremely nice. Only complaint -it's kind of a pain to enter the hotel via Michigan Ave, you have to go through a mall.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad is a good choice in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JJTOH
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad for two nights as part of a family gathering. My experience echoed the prior review: nicely appointed room of average size, and a very nice large bathroom with separate shower and tub, large counter, and nice amenities. Burned-out light bulbs apparently continue to be a problem. I did not eat at the restaurant during my stay, but room service was courteous and prompt, and the pick-up of the used dishes, often a problem at hotels, was within a few minutes from my call. Prices at the restaurant seem high, but this is Chicago and it's an easy walk to plenty of other places. Finding the hotel entrance was a little confusing because of the mall. Tip: the suites here are not all that expensive as far as suites go. Try to get one, particularly one with a terrace: a little noisy with sirens, but the terrace is huge and the views are spectacular. But even the suites without terraces are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad is Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: JacksonSilkwood
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton HHonors member which led me to the Conrad Chicago. I had never heard of Conrad's before but after my Chicago experience I will be looking for them on my future trips wherever I go. The rooms and common areas were all very classy and the staff were excellent. I had already read about the lobby being on the 5th floor and having to use two elevators, and I also expected the food to be expensive so I had prepared myself for that as well. There was a cafe next door where we got breakfast and there are about 1,000,000 options for lunch and dinner within walking distance so that wasn't a big deal. The location is excellent with close proximity to the river, Magnificent Mile, and Millenium and Grant Parks (short/cheap cab ride or ride on the CTA). If you're able to pay a little extra and want to get a lot in return, stay here. I talked with a few other guests in the bar who had stayed at Four Seasons, Westin, etc. and there were adamant about the fact that the Conrad is the best of all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liketotravel067
Reviews.Content: The Conrad was in a great location right off the Magnificent mile. It's connected to a mall with Nordstrom's. Also convenient were all the top restaurants in the North River area. The hotel was within walking distance of the Navy Pier. The rooms were terrific with flat screen 42" TV's and Bose Surround Sound DVD players. The bathrooms were huge with a large shower, and great toiletries. Turndown service was nice. As previous reviewers have noted, there is a second elevator needed to reach the main lobby, but more and more urban hotels are doing that for security reasons. The only complaint was the price of the food and bar menu, but this hotel caters to businesspeople who are on expense accounts, or other large groups where cost is not a concern. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “kudos to Conrad”
Reviews.Author: artglass36
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night in May for a meeting. This hotel is an excellent choice for all. I would stay here anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Comfy_Couch
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad for two nights during a business conference and found it to be an excellent hotel. The room was immaculate and spacious, had a huge bathroom with separate tub, shower and commode areas, large flat-screen TV with bose sound system, and a very comfortable bed. Food was somewhat expensive ($48 for breakfast for one!) but there are many other options nearby. The staff was courteous and helpful. I will definitely return the next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel were you can really sleep well”
Reviews.Author: blueBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at the this hotel and I can tell that I really enjoy it. First of all thanks to all the the members from TA because of them and the reviews they wrote I select this hotel in particular. I travel a lot and in the last hotels I stayed I had had problems to sleep well because of different noises, at this hotel I slept like a queen the 5 nights I stayed there and thatÂ´s my friends is priceless. At last I had the chance to know Mr Peter Strandquist the chief concierge who is the best concierge I ever met, so if you had the chance to stay at the Conrad Chicago just ask for Peter and he will help you out with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SL227
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad Chicago for 7 nights in May 2007 and absolutely love the hotel. The location is great, one block off of Michigant Ave., close enough to the Magnificent Mile without the noises, and 2 or 3 blocks north of the river. We were able to walk to the John Hancock building, the Art Institute, Nave Pier and State Street in the Loop. A $12 cab fare took us to the Museum Campus. It has plenty of restaurants nearby within walking distance (love the Grand Lux Cafe on Michigan Ave.). It's also next to the relatively new North Bridge mall with Nordstrom as the anchor. The hotel is accessable on Michigan Ave. through the mall. The hotel staff is very courteous and check-in was very quick. We stayed on the 7th floor and the room is very clean with a spacious bathroom (separate bath and shower). The room has a 42-inch flat panel TV and an IPOD dock. The bed is very comfortable. The hotel also provides slippers and a bathrobe. We paid $219 per night. If we go back to Chicago, we would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Issues at the Conrad Chicago”
Reviews.Author: edanddebra
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights for a business conference. The food was pretty good. And they had these really good mints that I couldn't resist. The room was very comfortable and the bed was great. But I was annoyed by many issues. First, their internet went down for a couple of hour when I was there on a break from the conference. It wouldn't have been big deal except I needed to do some business while it was down. Second, the internet wasn't available in the conference rooms. I suppose the conference I attended would have had to pay extra for it. Third, The chair in the room was too low for the desk so I was in an awkward position while using my computer which gave me a back ache later. Fourth, on the second night my key didn't work. So I asked for a new one which also didn't work. So I asked for another one and the same thing happened. Thankfully the front desk asked a security guy to meet me up at my room so I didn't have to go back down to the lobby a third time. Then he came back a little later to tell me I was in the wrong room, which I wasn't. Finally, he came back with the right key. Fifth, the TV had one remote control for changing the channels and a different one for the volume. Sixth, they didn't have the comedy channel. Much cheaper hotels do. If this hotel didn't cost so much money all of these things would be minor inconveniences, but I would expect more for what I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Gerrard1
Reviews.Content: Chose Conrad primarily for location as we were only in Chicago for two nights and wanted somewhere central. What an outstanding hotel! Location is perfect - right on North Michigan (Miracle Mile) above a good mall and a simple walk to every major attraction. Stayed in suite with it's own terrace - space was huge and the view absolutely stunning. Decor great, bathroom enormous with soaking tub and double shower. 42" plasma tv, Bose sound, great bedding, bathrobes, superbly comfy armchairs, even an umbrella for rainy days etc, etc, I could go on and on! All staff throughout our stay were great, nothing was too much trouble. Front of house guys at Rush Street entry were the most welcoming we have come across. We travel regularly and this was by far the nicest city centre hotel we have stayed in - to the point we are now going to try other Conrad hotels. For anyone considering visiting Chicago I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough - we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: manuselk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Conrad for a week on business, and have to say it was an excellent choice. The rooms are spacious, with a very nice bathroom with separate shower cubicle and large bath. They are tastefully if rather boringly decorated (American hotels really like beige!), and the large television was nice, especially for watching sports or adult movies. The hotel is ideally situated, just above Nordstrom on the Mag Mile, and has a pleasant lobby area. Staff are helpful and friendly. The gym is one of the best hotel gyms I have been too with a good range of equipment. Views from the room are not the best in Chicago. Rooms have an ironing board, iron and an umbrella, which was very useful as the weather wasn't great when I was there (snowstorms in April) I have two gripes: one is with the wireless internet access. This had a tendency to switch on and off, which is annoying when you are downloading a report. The second one is that there were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. There is, however, a good coffee bar at Nordstrom, so you can pop out to get a coffee. Breakfast in the hotel, though overpriced, is very nice. A better value option is the Corner Bakery which is only 5 minutes walk and is excellent. Overall, this hotel represents excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: jrcanning
Reviews.Content: First time at this hotel. Rooms are spacious and beautiful. Staff is priofessional and very helpful. Hotel couldn't have a better location. This is a true "5 star" hotel, yest very low-key and not stuffy. It's not cheap, but an excellent value. I'm handicapped, and the handicap rooms are perfect-the best I've found so far. Overall, and extremely pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “First Class!”
Reviews.Author: nolan88
Reviews.Content: The decor, accomodations, and staff were all first class. Very comfy beds and a fantastic location. We were very happy with this faciltiy in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bend-over backwards staff”
Reviews.Author: IncurableTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference a few weeks ago for one night. This is a very nice property, quietly tucked off Michigan Avenue. Pros: It was nice to escape from the chaos of the city to a very calm, relaxing place. I liked that the Conrad didn't seem like a gigantic conference hotel like some of its neighbors with conventioneers all over. Not much of a scene like the Peninsula, but the bar area was busy enough. The room: nice, though if you looked closely you could see a few shortcuts taken in putting it together. The tub was super and the water pressure amazing. A deep soaking tub that actually filled rapidly! Good Molton Brown toiletries. But the best was the staff. Everyone was super professional, extra friendly and went out of their way to help. Cons: As I said there were a few shortcuts in the room (no convenient outlets to the bed; when you soaked in the tub you looked at the raw underside of the sink area, etc. No view, but that wasn't so important. I'm definitely recommending the Conrad to friends who want to be near Michigan Ave but away from the crowds around Oak St.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TrippinCowboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend March 23-26 to catch the Flames @ Blackhawks game on Sunday. Flew in to ORD around Noon, got to hotel at 12:50, checked in early no problem. Friendly front desk lady lend my buddy a cell phone charger as he forgot it back home. Request high floor, assigned room was on 11th Floor (mid floor as hotel is level 5-17 in the building.) next to the elevator, I was dreading for a bit but noise from hallway was non-existent. Huge and spotless double-double room has plasma TV and Bose 3-2-1 system. Resolution sucked on the TV though as it's just a regular SD feed, no HD. Slippers are my favorite amenity in a hotel room when travelling, I have a morbid fear of walking around barefeet no matter how clean a room is. Asian hotels always have them no matter how cheap, same cannot be said about North America even with the upscale ones. Robes are of course pretty standard in a Conrad. Bathroom has no tub, which suits us just fine. Giant tiled standing shower and granite vanity with seperate lavatory. Pretty standard Conrad. Showerhead could use more pressure in rain mode. Had to have it on massage mode to get any pressure. Molton Brown amenities are nice. Towels felt thin & cheap though there were plenty of them. In-room safe is quite small but fit my 12" laptop fine, the built-in outlet for charging is also very handy. The safe however isn't bolted down though and is just connected by the power cord to the minibar cabinet. And the hotel doesn't have card key security in the elevators so it posed a minor concern for me to leave valuables in the safe. Evening turndown service offered complementary mini-Evian waters, nice touch. Linens & Beds are excellent and we slept in every night as it was so comfy. our room overlooked the back of another building and noise from the NMA was non-existent. Our friends over at the Westin however had a suite with a glorious view of NMA and heard sirens blaring by every night. Sucks to be them. HVAC is perfect. Hotel rooms always tend to be too cold/too hot. Not at the Conrad. It was perfectly comfortable with the dial at 70F Housekeeping was topnotch. We're slobs when on the road for hockey road trips and the room is always spotless when we come back. No one ever disturbed us when we had the DND sign on the door 'til we woke up and left at noon everyday, yet the room's always ready when we come back around 5 for a shower before dinner after some shopping and sightseeing. Had a bottle of VOSS water from the room, nothing special, but the bottle was cool looking. Wireless AND Wired High speed internet is free, but both are painfully slow even with good signal on the wireless. But it got my work done. Don't try to download anything major though or you'll be sitting there for an hour. Did not eat at the hotel nor ordered room service. Went downstairs to level 4 (the mall's food court, must take hotel elevator to level 5 the lobby first then transfer into the mall elevator) and ate at Tuscany, the Italian fast food place that served restaurant style pasta in a fast food setting with fast food prices. Quite decent and the price is very agreeable. Only pet peeve is the 3 elevator system to navigate if you're unfamiliar with it, I was fine but our friends from the Westin got lost when they came to visit. Requested late checkout and was given 2PM without a fuss on Monday as I had a 6PM flight out of O'Hare. Excellent front desk girl did it with a smile. Fitness centre was 5 steps from our room next to the elevator, very convenient and huge. Complementary green apples and all the hand towels you can use are a nice touch. LOCATION. This cannot be stressed enough. Smack in the middle of the Mag Mile (NMA), right across from the Intercontinental if you enter through the Nordstrom mall. Walking distance to anywhere. We walked to the Water Tower, Hancock Building, Navy Pier, the Loop, ESPN Zone, Hard Rock Hotel, The Trump Tower under construction, Walgreen's at the Realtor Building, and the Macy's next to the Westin where our friends are staying. The only time we took a cab was to & from ORD and the Shedd Aquarium/Field Museum and the United Center for the game. Weather & Others: It was raining on the Friday, bloody cold on the Saturday and absolutely gorgeous on Sunday and Monday. Had a great time all weekend though even with the bad weather to start. Wished we could've stayed longer. Everyone we met were very friendly, which is more than I could say for LA, there's just something about the midwest that feels so much like home. The streets are surprisingly clean in a city of almost 3 million. Other than the traffic problems, I left the Windy City throughly impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: manktripguy
Reviews.Content: Check-in staff were very pleasant and professional. In fact, I didn't encounter one staff member who made me feel unwelcome. Felt very welcome upon arrival. Concierge was quick to offer assistance out of the taxi and to help with baggage if needed. The lobby was not huge, however it was cozy. The terrace looks like it would be a great place to sit and have a drink in the spring and summer. There is a gift shop in the lobby, however I'm sure prices are high. There is a Walgreens not to far from the hotel. As a HHonors Diamond member, I was upgraded to a king suite overlooking Michigan Ave. What a wonderful room! Everything was very clean and in good working order. Appreciated the large-screen plasma tvs and Bose Surround Sound System. I really appeciated how thick the walls were in this hotel .. I could not hear anyone from the rooms next to mine. The bathroom was also very nice and incredibly clean. Deep soaking tub was very nice and just what I needed after a day on the town. The bathroom was stocked with great amenities! Room service was fast and efficient and the food was very tasty. Internet service was reliable (both wired and wireless are free). Fitness center looked very nice, however I did not get a chance to use it. It was nice being able to walk next door to the shopping complex (restaurants are located on the top level). Stopped at the concierege desk to ask for tickets to a show in town, however he was busy with another couple. One of the front desk staff immediately came over and asked if I needed assistance. The location is nice .. just a quick walk to the Magnificient Mile, Water Tower Place/John Hancock Buidling, Macy's, etc. The Chicago Marriott Magnificent Mile Hotel and Intercontinental Chicago are across the street. I would definately stay at this hotel again, in fact I plan to make it my prefered hotel when in town. HHonors members have good chances of getting upgrades, especially on the weekends. The only downfall to this hotel (just like other 4-5 star hotels in the area) is the price often exceeds my budget. Tip: Check the Chicago Conrad hotel website and click on "specials" on the bar at the top of the page. I booked a weekend package that included a $100 credit toward incidentals and only payed about $50 more for the package .. thus I received about $50 to spend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: applefan
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels I've stayed at in the U.S. My husband and I stayed here over the New Years holiday and we really enjoyed our stay. We got a very reasonable rate on the hotel website. The rooms are absolutely stunning with fantastic amenities. The location cannot possibly be better. My husband actually started not feeling well during the trip and spent one whole day in the hotel room sleeping but it was the most comfortable room if you have to stay in it for 24 hours! The only thing that kept me from rating it with a 5-star is its staff. I've had numerous problems with them. The shoes that were sent to be shined didn't return at the requested time (not even within HOURS!). Newspapers weren't delivered as promised. There were other issues I had with them but I think I blocked it out of my head and can't remember any right now. Despite that, i'd still stay here on my next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: kristina925m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a trip to Chicago at the last minute and quickly chose the Conrad, not really knowing it's location. We were pleasantly surprised to find it was almost right on Michigan Ave. (It's connect to Nordstroms right in the heart of downtown. ) Great for shopping. The hotel itself was fabulous. The staff was extremely helpful in giving suggestions for shows and restaurants. I recommend going to Joe's that's right across the street from the hotel. Everyone was raving about it . . .but we couldn't get a reservation. The room was wonderful and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. It had a very warm and inviting atmosphere. My husband loved the workout room. I highly recommend the Conrad!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Checky
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently and found this hotel to be one of the best I've stayed at. The room was very large. The bathroom was huge. The 42 inch flat panel tv was nice (although contrary to other reviews - it is not HD). The only annoying thing I found was that it wasn't easy getting to the lobby of the hotel itself. If you park in the garage ($29 with hotel voucher), you have to take one elevator from the garage to the shopping mall. Then you have to take another elevator from the mall to the hotel. Ordinarily you wouldn't think it would be a big deal but apparently, this is the only elevator that goes to the hotel so it takes awhile. That is the only complaint I have - the hotel was absolutely fantastic. If you're debating whether to stay here, take the plunge - you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Modern Room”
Reviews.Author: warm_weather_seeker
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to stay at the Conrad Chicago for our anniversary. The second we walked in, we were immediately won over by the look and feel of the room. White luxurous bedding on the King bed, plasma t.v./ subroofer/ surround sound speakers (my boyfriend was more impressed than me, as I reminded him that we didn't come to Chicago for the hotel room) very large bathroom w/ tub and separate stand-in shower, granite countertops, his/ her robes and slippers. The view wasn't great, but we were on the 6th floor and not really high enough to see anything but the side of the building next to us. Not a large room by any means, but again . . . we didn't go to the city for the hotel room. It was the prefect size for the amount of time we were actually in the room. We got a great rate on it ($140 at hotels.com) but I think the going rate is usually closer to mid $200's. I've stayed in quite a few hotels in the downtown area and none have ever impressed me more than this one. We will definitely be staying there again on our next trip into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: Cianadoll
Reviews.Content: This was a weekend trip for my friends and I. We booked a couple of rooms and asked in advanced for the reservations to be connected in some way. Our rooms were right next to one another as requested. As it was almost everyone's first time to Chicago, we had to do a bit of cold-searching for a hotel. And, our choice was next to perfect. I had an amazing time during my first visit to Chicago and it was largely due to this hotel. The customer service was AMAZING. Everyone was extremely nice and helpful. One of our rooms ordered late night room service and raved about how they felt they had ordered a 5 star lunch because it was as fresh as having ordered food at 2 pm, and delicious. My friend suggested they had a full-staff at 3 am because the food came up quickly too. In another of our rooms, housekeeping had accidentally discarded a CD when replacing the CD player with an iPod dock. The concierge had the exact CD purchased and ready at check-out from the neighboring record store. Our rate included complimentary breakfast which was fantastic! Everything was freshly made in their kitchen too. An added bonus was that the hotel is attached to a mall. Therefore, you don't need to leave the building to get a pair of shoes, a coffee, or a some other type of trinket. I was beyond pleased with this hotel and would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to hang out”
Reviews.Author: BarefootTom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chicago Conrad January 18-20, 2007. We found it to be a friendly, European-style hotel in the middle of a very busy area. In fact, the only drawback was that there were some sirens in the middle of the night, but that's to be expected in a large city. The hotel is connected to an enclosed mall, which is very convenient in the winter. There is an excellent spa in the mall (the hotel has no spa) and lots of good dining choices. We ate three meals in the hotel dining room and while costly, the food was outstanding. The lounge staff was friendly and accommodating. We took the Conrad directory from the room and went carefully through it on the flight home. If all the Conrads are this great, we will be giving Hilton a lot of business in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Chris19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for New Years eve weekend. This is an excellent hotel in an excellent location. Hotel is very tastefully decorated and warmly welcoming. The rooms had the best electronics I've ever seen. Loved that they had a soaking tub and a spacious shower stall. The hotel restaurant seemed to be empty everytime we walked by, so we avoided it too. Ate at Joe's across the street - excellent seafood. And you can shop til you drop without going outside! Nordstroms and four story mall is attached. Lots of good "food on the run" places in there. Loved Chicago - loved the Conrad. I will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinSunshine
Reviews.Content: LOVED IT! Loved it, Loved it. The hotel was outstanding, extremely clean (this is very important to me). I have stayed at several 5 star hotels in Chicago and this is the best (hands down). You won't be disappointed. In fact when I go to Chicago I only will be staying at the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenandChris
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Conrad for 4 nights just before Thanksgiving. We had a corner room overlooking N Michigan Av and the Tribune Building. To say this is a 5 star hotel is to damn this place with faint praise - it is wonderful. The staff were unbelievably helpful. The standard of the room was superb - HD plasma screens, luxury bedlinens, iPod radio, huge bathroom. Location is unbeatable - right in the heart of everything - watched the whole Light Festival parade from the window. Breakfasts were excellent - no help yourself buffet here - with full and attentive table service. Would have no hesitation recommending or staying again in this hotel - 5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “If Only There Was Attention To Detail”
Reviews.Author: countessjc
Reviews.Content: The Front Desk staff were exceptional. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite that was very clean and comfortable. We had a huge balcony overlooking the city and in the distance, we could see the Lake. Unfortunately, when we entered the hotel, the carpet in the downstairs entry level was filthy and it gave a poor impression The doormen and women, however, wer most polite and welcoming. The restaurant was a terible disappointment in all respects and I would avoid it. The breakfast buffet was closed earlier than advertised on our first day. The service was slow and for the price, the breakfast was absolutely unremarkable. We had to ask repeatedly for various items and waited long periods of time to receive them. While eating, someone came and removed the flowers fom our table without even a word. The flowers were already dead. On the second morning of our stay, we opted for the breakfast buffet which was very sparse and poorly replenished. For $12 + it didn't even rival a Hampton Inn. It would seem that training and competent supervision is sorely needed in the restaurant. Housekeepers did the basics, but didn't resupply amenities-another failure of supervision. I had requested assistance with a dinner reservation, expecting that a call from the Conrad might guarantee a good table. On the contrary, we had a terrible table. I suspect that the hotel hasn't made an effort to gain favor with the upscale restaurants in town. If all of the staff were as accomodating and well trained as the front desk staff, it would be a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Enjoyed the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: Boiler0896
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Conrad November 7-9 while he attended business meetings several blocks away. We found the Conrad to be an excellent hotel both in facilities and service. The valet parking and the check-in and check-out process went very smoothly and the hotel personnel were efficient and cordial. Our room was on the 8th floor with a view up Rush Street to the north. We had requested a renovated room (a good idea) and the room was very nice with a really comfy bed and a beautiful large bathroom with excellent toiletries. The bathroom also had a large tub and a separate shower which I thought was a nice touch. Another plus was the 42" flat panel TV and the Bose music system. The hotel is in a great location - within walking distance of terrific shopping on the Magnificent Mile and is directly connected to the Westfield Shopping Center. In fact, the hotel sits right on top of it! There are lots of restaurants nearby too. The concierge was very helpful and made reservations for us at Shaw's Crab House - just a short walk away. We had an excellent dinner with great service. The restaurant in the hotel looked nice, but there never seemed to be many diners there. The lobby bar was usually busy and was quite pleasant. I'm hard pressed to think of any negatives - the only one might be that the floor that our room was on (8th) also had some banquet rooms and the smell of whatever they served for lunch lingered in the hallway and our room long after lunch was over - a bit off putting for me. I would suggest requesting a higher floor if you don't want to smell lunch all afternoon! We felt it was a bit pricey, but would definitely stay at the Conrad again!

Reviews.Title: “Made the Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Todde
Reviews.Content: This hotel really helped make our weekend in Chicago first class. We thought the rooms, service, and location were great. Our group had 2 rooms on the 11th floor and were able to check-in very quickly when we arrived at 1 on a Friday afternoon. I understand that this floor has been recently renovated and the rooms were large, smartly furnished and super quiet. The beds were luxurious and the bathrooms very large. The north-facing room had a beautiful view up Michigan Avenue at "Big John" and even a small piece of the lake. Unfortunately, the south-facing room was 15' from an office building. We were too busy enjoying Chicago to utilize the hotel's restaurant/bar or fitness facilities, so we can't comment on them. However, all other encounters with the staff and public areas were a pleasure. The concierge was very helpful directing us to the perfect breakfast cafe and several other obscure treasures. A call to the front desk was immediately answered with another room key. And the doorman "owns" that little piece of Chicago. The location was central to all of our activities. It took us a few minutes to walk south to the river tour boats, and another 5 to the Chicago Art Institute Museum and the big parks. While we could walk north to the Water Tower area in 10 minutes. The whole area in between was filled with great restaurants, shops and safe neighborhoods. The Conrad served as our our peacful and posh weekend retreat from all the excitement the area offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable hotel, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Alexandrina
Reviews.Content: This was a first visit to Chicago. Loved everything about the city, the people, the restraunts. There is loads to see and do. We paid full rate for 2 rooms for 4 nights. The rooms are comfortable, good size with great bathrooms. Seperate bathtub and shower. There are a number of first class hotels closeby which I will consider for the next visit. This is based on value for money. I don't mind paying when everything lives up to expectation but a number of things fell short on this visit My room was not ready till 4pm. Luggage was delivered to the wrong room. My partner called the hotel to be told there was no one of my name registered. He argued I was in the hotel but the staff told him I was not there.this happened on 2 occassions!! Pretty serious shortcoming in service from a security point of view not to mention the confusion it could have caused in a relationship!!!! The duty manager sent a plate of cheese and biscuits and two bottles of water!! by way of an apology. I felt very disatisfied with how this was handled. The concierge was first class as was room service. Pity about the shortcomings but if you pay full price you should receive full value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Wanger1969
Reviews.Content: This hotel was spectacular. Upon arrival, we were able to park across the street in the parking ramp. Easy, and convenient, which isn't always the case in downtown Chicago. Finding the hotel is not complicated. If you enter the shopping mall, there are signs and elevators that get you right to it. It was nice having the shopping and dining below us. It made it very convenient for meals and when we were too exhausted to go anywhere. The rooms are decadent. I love the decor, the colors, the bathroom. I have ZERO complaints about everything. Of course, we got a great Hotwire rate, so the chances of staying here again are slim, as I'm a bargain shopper. If you have the opportunity, stay here. The staff is wonderful, the rooms are wonderful. You can't miss here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: DCAMichael
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad for business (4-nights). Very comfortable and stylish property. Every want/need was taken care of. Good location. Kudos to Jose the doorman/bellman!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Try--but still a Hilton, the Park Hyatt got it right!”
Reviews.Author: Armorstud
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is the upscale version for Hilton and the Park Hyatt is the upscale version for the Hyatt. Well the Hyatt got it right in Chicago and the Hilton did not. I stayed here when it was the Le Meridian Hotel. The hotel rooms are still the same as the Le Meridian Hotel but lacks the customer service. The rooms were clean and they have an evening turn down like the Ritz. They also provide L'Occitane lotion in the rooms. The Location is great and the price is good. I paid $230 a night. Anyway the biggest complaint for me is the customer service. Most of the staff don't know much about Chicago and good luck getting the concierge service. It appeared like the Hotel was understaffed. I never see anyone eat at the hotel restaurant. The gym is nice for a hotel. I would stay there again because of the value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Conrad.”
Reviews.Author: scdaren
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad for a single night to attend a nearby conference. This was my first trip to Chicage. The rooms were excellent, exactly what I would expect from an upscale Hilton brand. Check-in and check-out was quick and easy, the room was modern, clean, and the bed was very comfortable. Bathrooms were well-equipped with nice towels. The staff was friendly and top-notch at all times. I would gladly recommend and return to the Conrad Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Great Price”
Reviews.Author: travgal
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, elegant, modern room, perfect location. Stayed at the Conrad with 3 other girls. We got two adjoining rooms. The bathrooms were huge with large soaking tubs, granite showers, double sink vanity with granite tops. Large flat screen tvs, white, fluffy duvets. And then to be located just above the Nordstrom!?!? What else can a girl ask for? We enjoyed a couple of breakfasts and a late night snack via room service which tasted good and was prompt. Service from all employees was courteous and efficient. Can you tell we enjoyed the place? We only paid $185 per room per night which seemed like a bargain to me. FYI.... Made the reservations through central reservations. They said that they could not guarantee the adjoining rooms but would add it as a request. I called the front desk the day before arrival to see if there was any way to ensure the adjoining rooms. Stephanie said no problem, she would take care of making sure we had them and we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: JMS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad July 30-August 2 with my partner during the heat wave of '06. The price for the Hilton "Bounceback" promotion was under $200 and included breakfast. Most of the other hotels in the area were over $200 just for the room. Although the room had no view, it was large and comfortable with good air conditioning. The bathroom had a very deep "soaking" tub and a separate shower. The staff was attractive, and the concierge was very helpful. Unlike other hotels in the area, there were no tour groups staying at the Conrad so the hotel was quiet and peaceful. The central location is great for shopping or sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Patchy service”
Reviews.Author: Ashten
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via priceline and only paid 65 pounds per night! (About 130 US Dollar before tax) which i have to say is very cheap so consequently we were very happy with the hotel. However if i had paid the rack rate of 375 US i dont think i would have been happy with the service levels and im british !(we dont generally get good service) The location is fab and i thought the room was great - incredibly comfy bed, huge plasma screen, good choice of films etc. Breakfast was delicious and the breakfast wait staff and bell hops were good but housekeeping got our pillow request wrong twice and it took them 40 mins to get me a plug adaptor. We loved Chicago and if we ever came back would consider satying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not typical Conrad”
Reviews.Author: dakine94110
Reviews.Content: Miserable service; 45 minutes to receive luggage in room; had finished buffet breakfast BEFORE waiter ever showed up with options, coffee, etc; rooms have NO VIEW, no tub, no coffee maker; 'had to ask at breakfast for Diamond Elite VIP certs that SHOULD HAVE BEEN GIVEN AT CHECK IN. This is NOT typical CONRAD luxury or service, and as a Hilton Diamond Elite Member I expected more. The Embassy Suites on N Columbus surpassed the Conrad in every aspect I mentioned; service, room amenities, great view of Navy Pier and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Newtraveler
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 3 day stay at the Conrad, a Hilton property. In November, 2005 it was converted from Le Meridien to this lovely hotel. The room we stayed in had been completely remodeled. Although it looked out over Michigan Ave it was very quiet and didn't get any sounds from the other rooms. As previously mentioned plasma tv, Bose sound system, comfy beds, new granite bathroom with separate shower from tub. The staff was great. When I checked in the front desk person actually helped me with my bags to the room and pointed out the direct access to Nordstrom's, the Terrace Bar on the 5th floor outside, the cute bar (where we had some nice appetizer's) and the other restaurant (my husband had breakfast there and found it very expensive). The concierge was very helpful as were all of the rest of the staff. I read that this property was recently sold again so I don't know if it will remain a Hilton property but I would definately stay here given the price was right. We had a coporate rate of $165. A great deal and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Luxury and Super Service!”
Reviews.Author: traveljack1
Reviews.Content: Booked the Conrad via the Five Star Alliance website for 225.00 per nite and the hotel later said they could not beat this price since I checked the hotel after booking online to make sure it wasnt cheaper. Anyway...the Conrad did not dissappoint. My girlfriend and I were traveling to Chicago for a girls weekend away over the Labor Day weekend. The point of the trip was to relax in affordable luxury and to enjoy some good old fashioned shopping. We were pleased to be greeted by Stephanie with warm smiles even after 11pm on a busy Friday nite. After reading several reviews about the property on TA and noting that folks had a tough time locating the entrance we decided to catch a cab from the metro (totaling about 4.50) and the cab took us right to the Rush street lobby door. I do however get the confusion on the entrance to hotel since the main lobby is really on the 5th floor if you enter from the mall side off Michigan and on the 1st floor if you enter from Rush Street. There was not a wait at check-in and we walked right up to the desk. Stephanie checked us in and though we asked about the view she told us it was limited but that the room had been renovated. She was right...the room had all of the luxury of a 4 Seasons or even a couple of Ritz properties as far as I am concerned. The beds were turned down with soft music playing, a hand written welcome note next to Christofle silver neatly placed next to a generous bowl of fresh fruit, two bottles of cool VOSS water , a full ice bucket and even two small bottles of evian on either side of nite stand with the beds turned down waiting for our arrival. I was floored! There were two large fluffy terry robes with matching slippers and hi-thread count sheets, about 4-5 fluffy pillows, and the lightest but quite comfy euro style duvet ever! The bathroom had no tub( so not as relaxing as it could have been) but had a separate water closet(toilet area) and all marble and granite everything. Molton Brown bath products and beautiful crystal glasses, bath tumblers and soap dishes. There was a very large flat screen TV (about 42") with a Bose home theatre setup that was phenomenal for listening to relaxing music as well as watching a late nite movie. We could not hear any outside noises from the ground...though we were on the 16th floor, we also couldnt hear any voices from the hall or anywhere else either. Stephanie was right about the view, but I think I only looked out of the window twice to check on the weather in the morning so the view did not matter at all. The bathroom light blew out and the sink had a slow drain but after a call to report this, both issues were resolved on our return to the room in the evening. There was an honor bar, but we did not need to use it since there was plenty of welcome fruit for noshing. We did use the room service for late nite sandwiches ( Classic Club and an Angus Burger ) Both sandwiches delicious and served hot and beautifully but with only one flaw. I requested Blue Cheese and Bacon and both had be be brought separately later as they were not placed on the burger. Once all ingredients got together though there were fabulous. Room service charges not bad at 35.00 for everything including two soft drinks. We had vouchers for complimentary Continental breakfast or you could use it to subtract 12.00 from your meal...the omelet, thick toast, and home fries were cooked to order and delicous and cost 14.00 so this was a reasonable upgrade for 2.00! My girlfriend and I were greeted by name by the hotel staff during our entire stay and I just dont know how they do that, but we felt welcome and appreciated for staying in their hotel...that is quite rare these days! Checkout went very smoothly and Stephanie was on again to make sure we knew where and how to leave our luggage for pick up later as we were not leaving Chicago to late in the evening and had much more shopping to do. This was a wonderful weekend and my stay at the Conrad just made it better. For maximum comfort I would make sure I was in a renovated room. I would definetly stay at the Conrad again! Very, very nice! ps. After arriving home I realized I had left a CD in the theatre system. I called back to inquire if it had been turned it. The person who answered the phone took my name and home phone number and called me back in less than 15 minutes saying that she had indeed located it would send it to me via FEDEX in 2-3 days on them! (To me this is SUPERSTAR service)..I shall return to the Conrad!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on the Magnificant Mile”
Reviews.Author: Davidwatts
Reviews.Content: Great location a block off Michigan Ave. connected to the North Bridge Mall (this feature would be most useful in winter). Two blocks from the Grand Street station on the Red line (especially handy for getting to Wrgley Field). Renovation is in process (no noticable noise) in conversion of the property to a Conrad (apparently it was previously a Le Meridan). Renovated rooms are great, with VERY comfy beds, nice furnishings and bathrooms with seperate shower and tubs and a seperate enclosure for the commode (this is stanadrd in other Conrad's I've been in). Staff was unfailingly polite, but no more efficient than a standard big city hotel. Has a nice workout room. One negative experience: Breakfast service was inexcusably slow. The resturant was not even crowded. Also, no buffet was offered to help mitigate this problem. After I complained, they offered to remove the charges for brakfast, but since it was already included in my rate, it didn't help. BOTTOM LINE: Rooms are worth paying some premium, especially if there will be more than one person in the room. However, there are a plethora of hotels within a few blocks of this, so be sure to check around for rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Dependable, Quick Services”
Reviews.Author: TheWindyCity
Reviews.Content: We booked a Romance Package for August 26, 2006, celebrating our 25th Anniversary. Our stay was very pleasant, very smooth. Every request I put in prior to our arrival was taken care of without any delay or missed communication. Early check-in, late check out, bottle of champagne awaiting our arrival, upper floor city view, remodeled room, breakfast the next day in the hotel. All met very smoothly. I guess you have to experience the bad hotels to appreciate hotels such as the Conrad, and I do have some horror stories, even from the best hotels in Chicago. The Conrad gets it done, very simply put. Our room was recently remodeled since it was previously the Le Meridian. It has a plasma TV (picture quality doesn't do it justice, seems like a bad cable signal) and also a Bose CD/DVD player, so you can bring your own selections for your stay. The bed was very comfortable, and the pillows fresh. The room was very quiet, meaning you did not hear any other guests, or plumbing noises from other bathrooms. The bathroom is really great. The deep soaking tub is large enough for two, as is the separate shower with a double headed shower fixture, and a ton of pressure for both the tub and the shower. There is a separate toilet room within the bathroom. Room service was nice, with an afternoon snack taking about 35 minutes to be delivered. At night, the champagne popped unexpectedly when I removed the safety retainer from the above the cork, causing the bottle to tip, knocking over a water glass, which shattered on the rug. A call to the Guest Services for a vacuum, along with a request for additional washclothes forgotten during the turn-down service, got a nice young man up with a vacuum in 4 minutes to vacuum up the glass. He even remembered the washclothes. Very impressive, quick service. So, I would highly recommend the Conrad Chicago to you if you want an attentive, professionally staffed hotel where you can leave any details to the staff, and it will be assuredly taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Super Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ms._Kanga
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Conrad and had a terrific experience! I booked my room directly through the Conrad website ($230 per night). Since I drove from Wisconsin, I arrived in the late evening and was immediately greeted by Bryan, the friendliest and most helpful doorman ever! He and Joseph (valet) never failed to greet me upon my return to the hotel or make sure that I knew where I was going when I was leaving. Upon check in, I asked to change my room to one with 2 double beds and this was no problem at all to the front desk staff. I stayed on the 16th floor which gave me a superb view of the thunderstorm the next night and the basketball courts on the adjoining Marriot. Street noise levels acceptable given that the Conrad is just off Michigan Ave in the heart of downtown Chicago. Room was spacious and obviously newly renovated (door stuck a little on the threshold!), but very clean and comfortable. Nice plasma TV and Bose sound system. I particularly liked that the maid staff at turn down left the radio on softly to greet you. Loved the shower - no more walking over slippery tile to get to the towels - but could use more water pressure. Molton Brown toiletries were a nice touch. Ate breakfast in the restaurant on the 5th floor. Food was ok but pricey. Alejandro was an attentive server each morning which I really appreciated. Overall, the Conrad is a pleasing experience. Clean, comfortable and above all friendly and cooperative staff. I disagree with a previous reviewer who thought it was not kid friendly. Even though I didn't have my kids with me, I thought the hotel was certainly suitable enough for them to enquire about their Kids package (my kids are 2 and 4 years old) when I checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Happy but a few dings.”
Reviews.Author: Mslia
Reviews.Content: We paid $185 per night which was a good price compared to similar hotels on those dates. Most others were over $200. We had originally booked at Hotel 71, but reviewers on Tripadvisor said that it was under construction, noisy etc. This Conrad had converted from Le Meridien over 6 months prior but there were still some aspects which were incomplete. When the cab dropped us off we could not figure out the lobby. There was no one at the Rush street entrance desk and the bellman did not inform us that the lobby is on the 5th floor. Weird. I wish I could remember the guy's name who checked us in because he was super. Friendly and attentive. We overheard the man checking in ahead of us being told his room was not ready and he would have to wait, so we were expecting the same. The desk guy told us not only could we go right up to our room, we were getting one of the newly renovated ones. Sweet. Very nice, new modern decor. Every detail was perfectly taken care of, from the wood encased ice bucket to the fancy wastebaskets. No view. Had to keep the drapes closed or the people in the offices across the street could look in. I looked around for the room directory, the book that tells where the gym is, the restaurants, bar hours etc. and found none. (asked about it later and were told there wasn't one yet due to the changeover.) Mini bar was computerized so we could not put our cold drinks in it or our dinner leftovers later. No coffee maker. When we left for dinner we asked if we could have the minibar fridge emptied. The response was no, because we would be charged for every item! We could have had an empty fridge brought up for $20. We didn't. The ice machine on our floor had an out of order sign for the 4 days we were there so we went to other floors to get ice. What we really liked about the Conrad were its excellent location, walking distance to great restaurants, the river and only 2 blocks from the red line subway station. There is an outdoor lounge on the fifth floor that is phenomenal. The city views and lovely sunset cocktails were to die for. One night they even showed a film. There are many chairs and tables in addition to the bar as well as canopy "beds". Just dreamy. The staff was so great. On the day we left we needed a late checkout and it was no problem. This time a young woman helped me. I had forgotten to print out my Southwest boarding passes the day before and asked where there was a business center where I could and the lady at the desk did if for me! The last, weirdest thing was again, the lack of coffee maker. The Conrad guide to their properties stated that all Conrads feature in room coffee makers and the checkout survey asked if we had used the coffee maker. On other floors I saw coffee packets on the maid's carts. When we passed through the lobby to depart we asked the staff if there were not supposed to be coffee makers. One gal appeared about to say yes, but the guy who checked us in gave her a look and said no. I suspect that as they remodel they are removing the coffee makers. Odd. All in all I would really reccommend this hotel because it is central, attractive and comfortable and a pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey1023
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from Chicago this morning and I had to go ahead and write this review in a little bit of spare time. Just to sum it up, this hotel is amazing. The staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. They went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and provided us with tips to getting around and what stores we just couldn't miss. The location was great, right near Michigan Ave, Grand Ave and Rush st. The only problem we had was when we got to the hotel they gave us a room that had a king bed instead of the two doubles. We called down to the front desk and they had someone come up within 5 minutes to bring us to a different room. Our first room on the 6th floor was very nice, the radio was playing soft music and the bathroom had a shower and a deep bath that I very much wished I could have used.
