We moved up to the 16th floor for no extra charge and that was also a very nice room. A huge plasma screen TV, complimentary fruit platters and Evion water, Issues of GQ, VOGUE, and helpful travel magazines were on the nightstands and a letter addressed to us welcoming my family and wishing us a nice vacation. The beds were fabulous and I got the best sleep I have gotten in months! The bathroom was spacious and the shower was superb! No deep bath, but that was ok. The view was beyond nice, to one side was Michigan Ave and the other side was Rush st. The window opened a tiny bit so that we could look out, but not far enough so that any of the kids could fall out (good thinking on their part!). We walked everywhere only taking the subway twice and the cab to the airport and the hotel was very easily accessible. There is a Westfield mall that is connected to the hotel that has a giant Nordstroms, a lego store, Forever 21, A sports store, Hugo Boss, Sephora, a food court with a cute Chocolate lounge. We got the room at a GREAT rate since we were there for a business meeting, but when we go back to Chicago we will definitly try and stay at the Conrad!

Reviews.Title: “Country Comes to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Chicago with my daughter and son-in-law to see King Tut. My sister from Baton Rouge met us. We were all delighted with the Conrad. The lobby was beautiful. The staff was all very friendly and helpful - Victor found our lost luggage, the concierge was super, the bell men were attentive and always friendly. The bar tender was awsome. The rooms were lovely expecially the spacious bathroom. The personal touches were a very plesant surprise. A very nice place with a super location central to everything, walking and bus. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here ”
Reviews.Author: BigCityChick
Reviews.Content: Well, this used to be a Le Meridian Hotel, and it has changed for the worse. We kept having to remind them we booked a package, because we were being over-charged separately for everything, when it should have been included. We were supposed to have champagne in the room upon arrival, and did not. Two phone calls and three hours later, it finally showed up. We tried to have a drink in the bar, and even though we were the ONLY people there, three servers/bartenders came and went, talking to each other, not one of them acknowledging us. After ten minutes we left the hotel and went down the street for a drink. And don't bother to pay extra for "City View"; because you may get the view we had from only the sixth floor, looking across the street directly into a plain brick wall - that is all we could see. Oh yes, the valet lost his cell phone in someone's car, and called me at home today to see if we found it. He wanted me to call him back at home. Nice of the hotel to give out our personal information to the staff, huh? For the money, stay at any other hotel in Chicago with the same price-point and it will be much much better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: tablefor5
Reviews.Content: We were so pleasantly surprised by this hotel! We got into Chicago a night earlier than we'd planned, and couldn't get a room at the Sheraton, where we had a reservation to stay the rest of the week. We made an online reservation at the Conrad hotel without seeing a picture of it, and when we arrived in Chicago we were amazed at how wonderful this hotel was. We have two small daughters, 2 and 4, and the staff was wonderful with them, even sending up milk and cookies to our room the first night. After our first night, we cancelled our reservations at the Sheraton because we loved the Conrad so much. It's attached to a great mall (with a Lego store for our girls to play in!) and the location of this hotel is as perfect as you could as for - right by the Chicago River on Michigan Avenue, across the street from the Chicago Tribune Building and a block from the Wrigley Building. A perfect experience, and everyone from the front desk to the bell desk to the room service employees were fantastic. We never expected to have such a great time at a hotel that LOOKED like it'd be TOO nice for us to stay in with our little ones! AND, a great price! We payed almost $150 less per NIGHT than we would have paid at the Sheraton!!! The Conrad was great, and saved us a ton of money! Any time we return we'll ONLY stay at the Conrad!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ”
Reviews.Author: 123thomas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights, July 4-7. Victor upgraded our room to have a view at no charge. Our smoking room (requested) had no hint of smoke. Room was very nice and clean. Big beautiful bathroom, everything you could ask for and more. Staff very helpful and courteous.. Great location. I called hotel direct and booked room for 167.00 a night. Robes, slippers, turn down service, bottled water were provided. First time to Chicago, and first time staying at a Conrad. My husband and I were both very pleased and had a great trip. This is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definately coming back”
Reviews.Author: KBMS
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel room using the Conrad hotel's website for a "net-only" advertised price. For its location and the time of year(summer, Friday night) I felt $150.00 was a steal (normally $375). I was nervous that I would have been stuck with a dingy, room since I had paid so little. Well I was relieved to find the room was immaculate. The King size deluxe room was beautiful. The bathroom was just as terrific. Attention to detail was above all my expectations. All of the staff from the concierge to the doorman were helpful and super friendly. The hotel aura didn't feel pretentious at all. The staff were always willing to help make your stay superior. We called down to schedule a late check-out which was no problem. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. The lobby area was comfortable-contemporary. The terrace was just as relaxing. Within walking distance to the Mag. mile, and great places to eat. Short inexpensive cab rides (ave. $10.00) to museums and area attractions. I was so happy with my stay I look forward to coming back. I am sure you will be just as satisfied with your stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Conrad was wonderful. This hotel is so beautifully decorated and my room was very luxurious. One of the very best parts of my stay was the central location of the Conrad to almost everything of interest in Chicago. I was able to walk to Millinium Park, The Art Institute, all the shops South on Michigan Avenue and I was able to walk North to Oak Street, the historical Water Tower and more great shops along the way. Another very important observation was that the staff is so friendly and accomodating . Makes an out of towner feel very welcome

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Delivers Far More Than It Promises.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from three nights at the Conrad, and I can say with complete confidence that this was the single best hotel stay I have ever had anywhere at any time. Having read the reviews carefully, and done my homework about the place I was a bit leery about the "tired" and "worn" comments that I had seen there. Those worries were entirely unfounded. The room I had (on the fifth floor just opposite the elevators) felt brand new. The bed was incredible. The bathroom was nothing short of astounding in its size and the amenities it offered. Conrad's website doesn't show many pictures of what you are likely to get in their rooms, and that gave me a bit of pause when it came time to book; but this is one hotel that delivers far, far more than its description or pictures promises. A big part of a perfect hotel stay is the attentiveness of the staff, and here the Conrad delivered in spades. Even the bell hops were able to provide solid advice on restaurants, shops and other opportunities available in the neighborhood. The conceirge was able to manage all things with a single phone call -- including handing me tickets to the King Tut exhibit that allowed me to jump the line and walk right in. Superb. In terms of location, the Conrad is exceptional. One entrance opens on Rush Street where taxis can be had easily. The other opens into the Westfield NorthBridge mall and then out onto Michigan Avenue and the Mag Mile. Literally, the showiest and best that Chicago has to offer is right outside the door. Perhaps my only criticism is one that is true of all high end hotels: everything is just breathtakingly expensive. Two glasses of wine plus tip easily topped out at twenty-five dollars. Wine plus a very nice dessert of fresh berries out on their stunning terrace (try to snag a couch or one of the beds if you can) pushed forty dollars. I understand that this is how hotels manage to make their bottom line, but it often feels mercenary to me to soak the guests so relentlessly. Finally, a tip to all those who would stay at this amazing hotel: call their reservations line personally. Do not rely on their website or one of the discounters for the best possible rate. By calling seven days before my arrival, I was able to secure a rate of $180 per night (that's less than half the going rate, and only marginally more than some three star properties in the area are charging). When in Chicago, for me, the Conrad is the only place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderfull time! The staff was the best.”
Reviews.Author: RStrasser
Reviews.Content: I travel for work all the time and decided to swing by Chicago for a few days vacation after meetings in Northbrook. I have to say the Conrad staff has it down on customer service. I canâ€™t find one thing about my stay that was less than 5 stars. They went out of their way to treat us like the royal family. We wanted to see the King TUT exhibit at the last minuteâ€¦no problem, the concierge had â€œany timeâ€� VIP tickets right there. We zipped past all the lines right in to the exhibit. Boat rides, restaurant advice, anything you needed they could help. The outdoor lounge was relaxing to have a drink at after a long day sightseeing, the tenderloin appetizer was to die for. We had breakfast in the dining room every morning, great fresh coffee made table side, fresh orange juice, excellent eggs benedict, crispy bacon, very attentive wait staff that actually volunteered to turn down the music a bit because they thought it was going to bother us . WOW! Our suite was very nice with huge bath towels and every amenity you could think of. We had the best time! I canâ€™t wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: doodahdave
Reviews.Content: As a travel professional, I practically live in hotels, and I was very impressed with the staff at the Conrad Chicago. From my first contract with the bellman, everyone was universally helpful and friendly without being patronizing. Our corner suite had a great view of the John Hancock Building and if we looked farther north we could see Lake Michigan. The furnishings were a bit worn, but the bed was wonderful and the bathroom, very large and well-designed. The staff did a great job of taking care of my family (we used Hilton Honors reward vouchers to pay for the rooms) and the next time I stay in downtown Chicago, I hope to stay at the Conrad Hilton. (Also being connected to Nordstrom's and the shoppng mall was very convenient.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Conrad!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad Feb. 3-5 and it was excellent. Room was very nice and clean, and the cleaning staff always made sure we had what we needed. The doormen were beyond great, always helping in any way they could. They even made arrangements to have a sedan drive us to the airport for just a little more than a cab would have cost. The concierge was also very helpful and printed out our bording passes ahead of time for us. The whole staff at the hotel was very friendly and eager to help in any way. They haven't even had time to change over to the Conrad amenities yet, but I still found the stay excellent and will definitely go back! Yes, you have to change elevators to get to your room, but I just didn't find that to be a big deal. Great staff, great rooms, great location, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Flag Change Not at All Smooth”
Reviews.Author: Anabasis
Reviews.Content: I live in Chicago and have frequent occasion to recommend hotels to friends and business acquaintances. We recently put up a candidate (and his family) we were recruiting for our company at the Conrad. We had had good luck with this hotel when it was a Le Meridien. It was a disappointment for all concerned as a Conrad. On the plus side, our guests were able to check in early with no problem and they generally liked their room. On the downsideâ€¦ They learned after the fact that all rooms with two beds have no bath tub (only a shower). Our guests moved to a room with a bath tub and found hairs in it, which they had to clean themselves. When the coffee bar had no caffeinated coffee and our guests asked for some, they were told it would be delivered immediately. When they called 30 minutes later the front desk admitted that they had â€œforgotten.â€� While the concierge and doorman were quite helpful, our guests told us that the front desk personnel were sullen and unresponsive. Our guests were generally under whelmed by one of the â€œfive best hotels in Chicago.â€� Conrad has a long way to go to compete with the Four Seasons, Peninsula and Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “One of Chicago's BEST!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been in the travel industry for 13 plus years and have traveled extensively and the Conrad Chicago is one of the best hotels I've stayed at... Throughout my stay I was impressed with the quality of service provided. All the staff, from the front desk to room service treated me like I was a V.I.P. I would recommend the Conrad Chicago to anyone who is lokoing for simply the best. They are doing a fantastic job.

Reviews.Title: “The Conrad Was A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: VegasCanuck
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Hilton recently took over this property from the failed Meridian Hotel. It seems that the Conrad has inherited a hotel property that just doesn't work. The entrance is very difficult to find. There are only two elevators to take you up to the lobby. As a result, there was often a line waiting for them. The same problem affects the guest room elevators located beyond the registration area. If you go in and out of the hotel more than a couple of times during your stay, you will find the poor elevator layout annoying. The King room is what I would consider small compared to other Chicago hotels. Although I like modern design, the room was quite stark and cold. It was also showing quite a bit of wear and tear. The bathroom was the best part. Has anyone from management tried to sit in the chair and work at the desk? It was the most uncomfortable set-up I've experienced. The views are non-existent for most of the rooms. In a city with amazing vistas, this was disappointing. I saw a couple walking the halls with management trying to find a room that was acceptable to them. Room service breakfast was a highlight of our stay. Excellent food and high quality presentation. Sorry I couldn't write a better review. Would I stay here again? No. Chicago has some incredible hotels and this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Eponine66
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Le Meridien Hotel which has been renamed THE CONRAD CHICAGO (part of the Hilton Family of hotels) from November 10 -- 13, 2005. This hotel is wonderful! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Check in was very easy. The lobby is located on the fifth floor and easy to access. The location can't be beat! With Norstroms attached it makes for easy access to many shops. The room was large and clean. We had a superior room with two doubles. The view wasn't great (7th floor) but I wasn't there for the views. We asked for more towels and it was immediately brought up to our room. The hotel is within walking distance to many great shops on North Michigan Ave as well as many attractions. Do not hestitate to stay here! You will enjoy it.
